cx2lA8HZpCePHiMHp8GnWw.text: Food: 3.5 stars Overall experience: 4 stars (why not)  DW rocks because: - diverse bread basket - portions are large (I recommend the jerk fried calamari appetizer, also heard the truffle mac & cheese is good as well) - waitstaff is awesome & friendly - parking is not a problem  Food only gets 3.5 stars because most of the menu items sound super tasty and/or semi exotic, but when it comes out, it's missing that certain oomph.  For example, the bowtie chicken pasta sounded good on paper, tasted alright, but it could have been spectacular.  I don't recommend getting the full calamari for 2 people - it was a mistake and too much calamari.  The full size is good for 4+, the half probably good for 2-3 people.  I would probably go to this place a handful of times a year.

3qw4s6qXKSoZsex6wwDZew.text: DW Bistro! I always have a great time when I come. I have always wanted to do their sunday brunch, so that is in the making. The wait time is always reasonable and they are very apologetic but who can blame them... DW is the best! Their drinks and bar tenders are delightful and I am not lying when I say everything on their menu is fantastic.   My favorite is their Jerk Chicken, and their Turkey burger!!! Always quality, great prices, and phenomenal food. Their chopped salad is also so amazing, its like deconstructed with the most perfect elements and portions. Their drink selection however is incredible. I love their mimosas, and weird mixed drink varieties.  However... on Sundays everyone is so rude and it's like a fire hazard. I had called around 11:30 AM to take my sister to brunch and they said no problem. Then I was faced with a confusing ass line then told to go to the front door where I was greeted by a super rude guy in a captain america outfit who told me they weren't taking anymore guests for the next 1.5-2 hours..... WHY COULDN'T THEY TELL ME THAT ON THE PHONE? SO RUDE.

cCCCgaHY0d8QZb9Ve8EkNg.text: We ended up here for brunch. Having read about how busy it can be, I was gladly surprised to find the wait to only be about 5 minutes.   This restaurant is casual but bright and trendy. It's the perfect brunch vibe, especially if you are here for the bottomless mimosas.  We ordered the jerk chicken and waffles and the chocolate chip pancakes. The pancakes were good. They were very fluffy, but the real star was the chicken and waffle dish. The chicken is incredible. It's so different than any jerk chicken or fried chicken I have ever had. The jerk flavors permeate the breading, and the flavors perfectly pair the with the waffle. It's a big dish, and I was stuffed.   I will definitely be back, and I am excited for their new location and concept to open.

O-T1zlF8KJOR0LiJYJjOig.text: DW is one of the spots higher on our list when we are looking for Sunday brunch. We always plan on getting there at least 15 minutes early and getting the first seating to avoid the terrible wait time. The food is good, tho sometimes inconsistent. On our most recent visit, I ordered the New Mexican Slow Cooked Pork Bowl and it came out cold and bland, completely different from the last time I ordered it. (Maybe just an off day - nothing to fault them for as I've had it before and it is really tasty!) We also ordered our favorite brunch appetizers... The Flautas and the Pastry Basket - both so yummy! Service is great - very friendly and they always keep my pomegranate ice tea full! We'll be back again DW!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Hash
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican Slow-Cooked Pork Bowl
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry Basket - we can never finish it, but always take them home for a yummy snack!

JqttxNhcXM1vDViJHhCRdw.text: We went here based on all the great reviews. Seriously, Yelp has proven over and over to be so unreliable. Boy, were we disappointed with all three entrees we ordered. The short ribs, the curry and the pork shoulder dishes all lack flavors. The positive things about this place are the interior design is gorgeous and the food were very beautifully plated with flowers. Unfortunately, they missed the most important thing, flavors! We took 3/4 of the food home and went to Glaciers supermarket to get a pepperoni and sausage pizza to eat because we were still hungry after spending over $70 at DW Bistro.

efFoyz8AYL6uoFTB2Hnm9w.text: Food is great but a little overpriced. The customer service was mediocre and the ambience was nice. Good vibes but just a little taken back with the quantity of food and the price of it.

sssItX7WH9zY-tx84mEggg.text: I was so disappointed in this place. I went here for lunch with a friend and our waiter was extremely rude, which just kind of kills the entire point of going out and having lunch with a friend.   The food was ok, nothing to rave about.  I wouldn't recommend it and I won't be back.   The only good thing about this place from my experience, is the very personable host.

gzN3QY25nYkX9_ejMYOjag.text: Over priced, small portions. It is tasty, but we got the shortrib smothered sweet potatoes, and half of the meet was a blob of fat.. Service was ok , the guy kept looking out the window..(it was raining).. when he was talking to us, taking our order... This establishment just not for me, but I heard brunch is better...

LasUCFDXVZpBglSVwXHsWQ.text: Adrian took really solid, professional service for us. Recommended a seasonal IPA and I loved it. My girlfriend loved her DW margarita, I hustled a few sips. The turkey sliders were great, that chutney was so good!

pM-NCN1eUIL_SisMBl8RIQ.text: The food here is absolutely incredible, we felt like it was a fluke the first time we came, but after 3 visits, it is consistently more than impressive!  The environment is ok, it's an artsy unique feel, it's cool but for some reason doesn't feel congruent. The staff is ok, hosts have always been nice, wait staff is either really service oriented, nor non-chalant.  BUT, the food makes up for any other short coming!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This guys is crazy!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flower at each table
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frontal

V4DVCmsMvK_PATXiW9XVkw.text: Hands down, one of the best restaurants in Vegas. I've had the New Mexico chile bowl probably 5 times now and it never disappoints. The staff is super friendly and conversational.

YTd4sd-QYVlKAtf3RbayYg.text: Brought my mom here for brunch to celebrate her birthday and we had an amazing experience. Vidal took wonderful care of us and was unbelievably attentive. He made us feel welcome from the get go and answered every single one of our questions. He even gave us a quick history of how DW Bistro came to be! He recommended his favorite dishes and the crowd favorites. The food was great and the environment was awesome. And it was all made better thanks to Vidal's amazing customer service. Thank you!

ANTvMxBoP3CpPqnOe31HnQ.text: I came here for brunch on Saturday morning and I had such a great experience. Everyone was so nice from the moment we walked in the door and the food was unbelievable. I ordered eggs Benedict, as I do at every brunch restaurant, and the eggs were perfectly cooked. Vidal was the most AMAZING server. You would have thought we were his only table. He was so on top of everything, especially the refills for bottomless mimosas, which I appreciated! We will definitely be visiting again soon.

lbeVJ69AIUsVEdQ5b7e3uQ.text: Awesome-Food!         Awesome-Staff!                 Awesome-Time!  Jamaican fried chicken, green chili cheeseburger, Curry bowl or fish of the day-more than awesome!

KFwfLqsRxaAwkJXsvUZ9Yw.text: I highly recommend this place. Great service great location great food. The only complaint is I ordered a vodka tea only to be charged $11 for the vodka and $4 for the tea... maybe consider making it one set price $12 drinks appeal more than $15

K2dHSqAE32xAb7BYnh3WWQ.text: Oh how I LOVE this place!! Hands down, the best local brunch in Vegas.  The menu is fantastic and every time I go for brunch, we always order the scones for the table.  My favorite brunch item is the chicken and waffles, but I have also had the pancakes, french toast, eggs benedict, and when I have gone for the lunch hour, their curry, salads, and sandwiches are wonderful.  I honestly can say I have never had a bad meal here!  Everything is gourmet, exciting, flavorful, and way above the average restaurant menu setting.  The chefs play with flavor and spices and everything comes together deliciously.  Bottomless mimosas are a must, but the Bloody Mary's spicy bite and fancy toppings of bacon, olives, and a pickle are a better choice for those who avoid champagne in the mornings.  The staff is fantastic, attentive, and so friendly!  They are always hosting fun party themed brunch hours and are really a joy to be around.   The decor is great, bright, fun, inviting, playful, and super chic. A perfect spot for lunch with a group of girls!   I would suggest DW to almost anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cupcakes and roses

FJIcQ4C4k_iM1cQ7EqBG6g.text: Sloppy. What's with the attitude? Marginally friendly - perhaps a bit shy. How about training the staff? A bit pretentious in the order taking - "I have a ... for you..." Just give it to me straight.  I hadn't been here in a while and became very disenchanted with he presentation. The bread was a bit exposed to air and not on the mark. The butter must have been prepared a day or 2 earlier - supposed to have flavor (had the color) but completely flavorless.  Now the entree. Lamb chops were 'ok', but not 'out of this world'. Certainly nothing I'd return for. The potatoes and vegetables served were tepid. The potato texture reminded me of kindergarten glue. Just awful - inedible.  So I looked around at the crowd and it's possible this place is living off its previous reputation. For me, the gild is off the lily.

5OSEvH5ngXAxrYfbfEsE6Q.text: We wanted to try DW's brunch and went around noon it was packed but the wait was only 25 minutes. Once we were seated I opted for the bottomless mimosas for $22, great deal if you ask me. I thought the menu would have more options but I chose to have their breakfast sandwich. The sandwich I chose came with jalapeno bacon and potatoes. When it came out it was drowned in hollandaise sauce and barely any potatoes, I was a little disappointed in the serving size and the flavors. The best part of DW was the server he was absolutely amazing and was helpful. I don't think we will be coming back anytime soon.

_wHoEgxXp5zyZb-S_pSrCA.text: I had such high hopes for DW. Read all of the great reviews, love Caribbean food, thought this would be a win. Unfortunately, not even close. Out of 4 of us, 1 was happy. I ordered the jerk pork hash. Had to send it back because it was cold. Got it back lukewarm with my over easy egg hard. Half of the pork was fat and inedible. The oatmeal ordered was cold. The salmon on the eggs benedict was barely seared and was sent back to cook thoroughly. The jerk chicken and waffles was tasty. The service was mediocre at best. We had to wave someone down for refills, ask for the check, and they were pretty slow about it. It was busy and very noisy. Disappointed that it didn't live up to the hype.

Ld9rBHp2hGrTzur6n8SvBQ.text: I had an awesome brunch here. The place itself is modern and chic. Think Crate & Barrel and Ikea. There's also an outdoor patio area that is dog-friendly. The service was great. Attentive and friendly.  The food was awesome. And the portions were huge! The New Mexican-style omelet was so delicious with the right amount of spicy. The chocolate chip pancakes were moist and fluffy and HUGE. For $8, I was expecting a much smaller portion. And the syrup that came with them was quite tasty. It was more than just a maple syrup.  My only complaint was the $12 bellinis. They weren't on the menu, so we didn't realize the price ahead of time. Very delicious. But we each had two... And we definitely weren't expecting them to cost more than the entrees. Not necessarily an unusual price for a drink in Vegas, but still.  Drink prices aside, the atmosphere here is great. It's the perfect spot for a classy, but chill brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes and New Mexican chili omelet

4yVEa8QdpWfAqBoZdSXFQw.text: Decor, atmosphere & service is excellent. Good and different variety on the menu. Be careful of the level of spiciness of the food. I had the veggie burger. I couldn't eat it as a burger, the portobello mushroom was too thick and it just fell apart. It was tasty non the less. I'd like to come back & try something else on the menu. It's a little over priced.

gRabPEk6z2cYfapFnddu1A.text: The food was great and I can't wait to go there again. Had dinner and the presentation was beautiful with edible flowers.  The food was locally grown and very fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was braised short ribs over fresh vegetables.

UgAe5HJMbyubYkj2xJfdGQ.text: I own the Laser Hair Removal Salon in the plaza (ivy laser salon) and I have the pleasure of eating here everyday. I joke with the staff that they have drugs in the food because I'm addicted. The owner Dalton, the manager Rudy and the main bartender, Eric are all amazing!  Now to the food: My favorite appetizer is the signature salad with goat cheese (a lot of it!) and caramelized pecans (so delish!!!) My fav entre is either the braised short ribs with the mash or the turkey burger with the mango chutney. They're both so well-seasoned. My mouth is watering just typing this.  My fave dessert is hands-down the carrot cake. In fact, I ordered a whole cake for my grand opening and all my guests were hooked! My fav drink is the pomegranate iced tea (I dont drink alchy but they have an amazing bar menu too!)  overall its an amazing restaurant with an amazing vibe and an even amazing menu!   Being originally from LA, I'm very well-versed in these types of spots.  I highly recommend it for any time of the day.. including an amazing weekend brunch... but get there early, the line becomes super long!

tNcElbVcvG-M0bUvqaeEHQ.text: We came here during lunch after searching for Jamaican food in Yelp. It was our first time coming here and the place is absolutely gorgeous. I ordered the Jamaican Chicken Curry. It was absolutely delicious filled with lots of fresh veggies! We ordered the turkey burger with sweet potato fries, in addition two two slices of cake. It was a red velvet cake with a berry sauce on the side and white chocolate shavings. The other piece of cake was an absolutely delicious carrot cake that ended up being my favorite of the two! The decor and atmosphere add to the great experience when dining here. Will definitely return and recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch

Pec3DMYk8t6QCAzUfnfG-A.text: Place is awesome ,servers are really friendly the food is really good (especially the corn and goat cheese ) and the alcoholic beverages are amazing!

EkYF0kkY0vYA5iHCbrfsYQ.text: By far my favorite restaurant in town and I love that it's a neighborhood spot instead of on the Strip.  Brunch is amazing!  Be prepared for a wait for brunch but trust me, it's completely worth it.  In particular, my standouts are the eggs benedict, the chilaquiles, the vegetable curry, and especially the BLT.  The BLT comes with jalapeno bacon and sweet potato fries with a side of chipotle aioli all of which are divine!  $20 bottomless mimosas are a nice offering as well.  Dinner time is also delicious, my favorite being the couscous salad with jerk-seared ahi.  White chocolate carrot cake for dessert will not disappoint.  Service is consistent and the staff is very attentive.  Love the modern decor as well.

x4TUGD3seGQy79F3MFOrWQ.text: So I've never had a bad experience here.  Food is consistent and excellent.  Portions are generous.  Try the slow cooked pork bowl with the eggs over rice.  Wow, like tantric sex for my tastebuds.    Love coming for brunch as well.  Bottomless mimosas can be dangerous but oh so much fun.

QPLCZIt7Z7oRfFSQTbzZ_Q.text: I'm reviewing this restaurant all the way from San Francisco because- its just that good. I moved from Vegas four months ago and have missed DW every single Sunday brunch since.  The service is insane good. The owners are super involved and recognize return patrons- so refreshing! The food- even better if its possible- chicken and waffles are THE BEST I've ever had. Bottomless mimosas, and spicy bloody Mary's are cherries on top.  I travel a lot. This is one of my favorite restaurants in the country.

_X9jQ-qFo-lTBpDZ6c07Wg.text: Talk about trying little of everything. GOD BLESS fellow yelpers in life! It was Suzy H birthday so rounded up few yelpers too go out and celebrate. Most of us was the first time or least for me it was so went in with open mind open palate! Did I need both for my first visit. Thankfully with other yelpers all on the same page got too try little of everything. The apps ohh my gosh between all of us just about order the whole menu and the kitchen sink. Talk about some amazing apps from the jerk oven roasted baby back ribs, jerked fried calamari, pesto torte, and couscous salad with seared ahi. The SIZE is no JOKE at DW Bistro! It not just about the size but the quality of the food without doubt stood out for me. The baby back ribs could have order whole slab be totally in rib heaven. The meat just fell off the bone, moist, and flavor had nice jerk hint citrus flavor then later get the spice kick in. Jerk calamari might look different (hell of dark) but that from the jerk seasoning tasted awesome. Pesto torte fan of the creamy goat cheese with the seasonings in it! It not so thick goat cheese but creamy enough that places perfect spread on flatbread crackers (out of the two the lavosh is the only way too go)! Talk about lot of cheese it felt like effiel tower of cheese! Couscous salad like fact that it was cooked al dente, nice mix of vegetables and seasoning in it, and the seared ahi on top was nice compliment too the dish. Every single plate looked cool. Nice clean plate, not overdone with the decorations, great portion, and let the food stand out by itself.  My entree ordered the jamaican curry chicken bowl. Talk about monster bowl. It was enough too feed two. Plus after all the apps had it was more then daunting too think about eating the whole bowl. The curry sauce itself was da bomb. It had nice curry seasoning throughout the whole dish. LOVE love the fact that it had so many different vegetables. All nice size cut vegetables that after sauteing everything can still distinguish each vegetable eating in the bowl. The chicken was cooked perfect nice moist decent portion in it. Break it down more vegetables then chicken. Am all good with that ratio. If your in the mood of chicken bowl or bowl DW is the way too go.  CORNBREAD........It deserve whole paragraph by itself!!! Not many places in Vegas been that has good True cornbread. DW heads and toes has the best cornbread. The crust is divine, hot and moist inside, again talk about monster portion, and the honey butter that the key. Sooooo Good!   The service was fabulous! Our waiter was on top of it all night. I had too leave early for hockey game. He was more then happy too ring up just my check. Rest of the yelp gang stayed for desserts. The decor is very modern with one artists work through out the restaurant. Someplace so close too my house never realize why it taking me this long too find it. Happy able too find DW on top of fact helping celebrating Suzy H birthday icing on the cake!!! Sure plan on coming back again.

lmpA8Wx4eLX4W31OqwAHHQ.text: DW BISTRO!! I love this place.. I used to live right behind the old location and went all the time when I could just walk over. I usually go for the jerk chicken and waffles, they are so good!! Be aware that they do have a spicy kick.. they are always cooked to perfection. The new location is nice and located in The Gramercy, it's a perfect place to spend a weekend brunch outing. Another one of my favorites here is the pork bowl, now that thing is spicy.. if you love spice this is a much try or even if you are just feeling adventurous.. I can handle spicy foods pretty well but this thing has me sweating and my eyes watering they serve it with flour tortillas I suggest getting an extra tortilla or two to go along with it cause you'll probably need it to balance out the spice. Their cocktails are great and the pomegranate ice tea is also delicious. DW is a must try and a great local hidden gem to discover.

El0HtVPUBXkjFtIFNO0aPA.text: I paid for things that I didn't order or consume. Fine. Confusion. I get it. But when the owner came to me and acted like a child???? Wow. Now i paid. Did not want a refund. I was disrespected and not pulled aside to a private place where the situation could be discussed.

vFi-idGFMZZJahw8tiaSHg.text: I was invited to DW Bistro for lunch without knowing about the restaurant and immediately was impressed by the atmosphere and setup.  I asked my buddy for a recommendation and he told me to try the DW Turkey Burger.  At first,  I thought I could get a turkey burger anywhere and I wanted to try something new,  but I took his recommendation.  When the meals came out,  the presentation was on point and the turkey burger sure didn't look like a traditional one.  It came with a nicely baked bun,  Turkey cooked to perfection and a seasoning or topping that I couldn't explain in words.  I truly can't wait to go back as there were a lot of items on the menu that I would love to try.    Tip-We went to lunch at 11:45 because my friend knew that it gets packed during lunch time. Try to arrive at or before noon to beat the lunch crowd,  but if you have to wait,  it is well worth it.

8BpkOYBKJby986rFgATDTw.text: Items selected:  Sticky Bun and White Chocolate Blueberry Scone with House Jam and Butter Challah French toast with fresh strawberries Jerk fried chicken & waffles served with DW signature maple syrup; breast of chicken atop light and crispy waffles sprinkled with orange zest Carrot Cake Coffee  Owned and operated by Bryce Krausman and Dalton Wilson, DW Bistro had been on my list of places to dine in Las Vegas for two years but with my visits largely limited to the strip or around Christmas when they graciously give their employees much needed time off it was not until my fateful interview trip that I finally made it to the Spring Valley restaurant, arriving just after the restaurant opened after an early morning flight from Phoenix.  Large and airy with light spilling into the room to match the bright attitudes of the service team I was seated almost immediately on arriving at a table in back per my request and after perusing the menu decided to do what I often do with a menu so tempting; over order.  Coffee in hand and copious refills to follow my meal started off with a pair of pastries including a tender sticky bun and an unfortunately slightly dry scone that livened up slightly with a touch of butter and jam and moving right along my main plates would arrive shortly thereafter, each proving larger than anticipated.  From the smoky chicken atop a crisp yet pliable waffle and onward to the dense egg-bread topped with fresh berries and bathed in fruit-tinged syrup it would be hard to decide which dish I preferred as both were good but neither were 'best of genre' but unable to resist the signature carrot cake (not gifted to me as many have claimed on their first visit) I must say that this dish truly is special - one of those rare situations where reinterpreting a classic shines a whole new light on the dish and puts something pedestrian on a pedestal, the dense spice cake rife with pineapple and coconut served in three layers separated by light cream and flecked with white chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake

R8G4jAN_zwHqf_qnxRUaIA.text: We went to DW with friends for an early Valentine's day dinner. This was our first visit. My daughter recommended this place and we were not disappointed. It was so difficult to figure out what to order because everything sounded so good and looked so good going out!  First I tried the strawberry infused rum which was delicious and not too sweet at all. I did also have the strawberry Caribbean mojito drink (can't remember what it is called). It was good but I thought it had too much mint and strawberry pulp.  At the table for appetizers we had jerk calamari (not what I expected, kind of sweet), flautas (excellent) and a chorizo and shrimp dish (also delicious).  For entrees I had the special which was a pan-fried skin-on snapper with coconut rice and mango salsa (out of this world), hubby had jerk lamb chops which he loved, most had the ox tails (got rave reviews as did the spicy mashed potatoes), shrimp scampi and chicken pasta. Not one bad review at all with entrees.  We shared a slice of carrot cake among the table and it was delicious. The server brought us a slice of the most chocolaty cake that I have ever had on the house as well.  It is a loooong way from our house but we will certainly go again. There are still things I want to try on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapper Special
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tails with Spicy Mashed Potatoes
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Lamb Chops

UA4GNDCHGRcg-19tQBCsYQ.text: It wasn't love at first site, but after my return visit I see the light. The food this time around was excellent. To start, a beef carpaccio that was rich and savory. Followed by a seafood gumbo was filled with crab meat and spices that warmed the soul.   For entrees we shared their delicious signature salad featuring pecans, orange slices, and goat cheese that was lightly dressed with a balsamic vinaigrette. Along with the salad, we dined on a medium rare filet with borderlaise sauce served over a heaping mound of blue cheese mashed potatoes, green beans, and tomatoes.  To finish the meal we had a piece of their house-made carrot cake with white chocolate shavings and fresh berries. It wasn't your typical carrot cake. It had a much lighter texture than the dense spice cake found elsewhere and it was a bit sweeter with the multiple layers of cream and the white chocolate. It definitely satisfied my inner fat kid.  Unlike my first visit, the stellar service and food left me craving a return visit before I even left.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4oFnYAdrQqNKnim3AehYmQ.text: I had lunch here with my family. Enjoyed the Farmers Market Cocktail very much It was pineapple infused vodka. A little early in the day but was well worth it! We then shared the Chicken Flautas. Very good flavor. I would recommend The BLT with its amazing jalapeno bacon and another favorite was the Jerk Chicken Salad!  Finish the meal with the Pinapple Carrot Cake with White Chocolate Shavings  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.

PyO0JvBFAx0gD22eG6qEIg.text: I can't get enough of this place!!! Love going there a few times a week. Lunch, dinner and the brunch on weekends AMAZING!!! I have had pretty much everything on the menu and each and everything is delicious!!! Whether you want to sit at the bar and have one of their incredible cocktails or sit on the patio and get some fresh air. A must go to Spot on the west side!

zZqVARaCVaVT2r36kMX9sw.text: The workers are so nice here and very attentive. I ordered the jerk pork hash and it was good, a bit dry but still had very good flavors. I came with my family so we also ordered the DW pastry basket and it was so yummy. The bread itself is light and fluffy and add it with chocolate and blueberry. It just made it even better!

q44R7vquRucyt1uxRFTpQA.text: Perfect spot for Sunday Brunch for Las Vegas locals!   The music makes you feel like you are at a party and the energy puts a smile on your face. For just $20, you can get all-you-can-drink mimosas which is totally worth is considering one drink is $12!   The menu doesn't include many traditional breakfast items which forces you to try something new! The chicken & waffles are to die for. I also enjoy the Jamaican pork hash and the Jamaican style omelet. The menu & sauces available are all Jamaican which you won't find anywhere else in Las Vegas!

4bV7cVa8Qx25GzKs_8z_QA.text: I love this place... Cause it's just so damn good!  And we literally had the best service ever from Luis (make sure to ask for him); he actually cares that your food is right!   I usually get the New Mexican slow cooked pork which is ridiculous. Tonight I changed it up and got the green chili burger w/ sweet potato fries and I finished it all. So DELICIOUS. My husband got their special which was jalapeno bacon wrapped filet and could not stop raving about it.  Overall, this place is legit. Go there soon, it's definitely worth it.

hVB38kDYQKLmNgM2jhU1vQ.text: first time my family and i have eaten at this restaurant and i really did enjoy the atmosphere, food and customer service. The food portions are filling so if you can try to hold back from eating up all of the yummy appetizers, lol. Can't wait to come back in the near future.

0XwwWmbN9jExPerFTJCtSw.text: Extremely friendly service. Loved the food. I told my server that I thought the ginger mint tasted good and she gave me a handful to take home! She went above and beyond!

X_vahv6_z-QuD2AnW7KwJQ.text: Great restaurant!  Add it to your list of places to visit in Vegas.  The decor is so adorable and fresh.  The drinks are divine and the food was yummy.  If you like chain restaurants, do not go here.  This is for folks who love to find a neighborhood gem.  Well worth venturing off the strip.

UfxwXq8yvQPCv9160FppXA.text: This was our first time visiting this establishment.  We could tell - from the get go - that it wanted to be TRENDY from the start.  I have to admit, we were a tad bit put off by it.  Our opinion was that if a place WANTED to look trendy, then it had something to hide...and we were looking for it.  Good thing for DW Bistro, they won us over.  Sure, it felt trendy and yuppy.  Sure, the restaurant looked 20-something and L.A chic, but what's the service and food like?  Well, luckily for them, we were won over in that department as well.  The food was AMAZING.  Our server had an accent and I didn't understand him, but I didn't care.  He still kept our iced tea glasses full, and he often checked in with us.  That's True customer service.  Then, at the end - before paying the bill - we asked our server about the restaurant and it's history and it's food style, etc.  He was very knowledgable, and it seemed he was quite proud of the establishment.  Well, no need to keep preaching - we will be back.   This place is great.  BUT WAIT!!  All of a sudden, he shows up and says, "we'd like to give you a complimentary dessert just because..."  What???  First of all, we were already full.  But, okay- sure we'll try your dessert.  They gave us a complimentary slice of the most amazing carrot cake I've ever had.  DW Bistro is a small, trendy restaurant, but it's worth the time and the empty stomach.  No, really - GO!

OUfado_tYfBsgDFROALBcw.text: Amazing casual bistro. I was told that the Exec Chef is Jamaican & raised in New Mexico -- which explains the wonderful SW/Caribe flavor fusion. Outstanding food, reasonably priced (about $12/lunch & $16/dinner) w/ample portions. Slow-cookd New Mexican Pork is amazing as were other dishes we tried. The Standout is the Jamaican Carrot cake. It's  PERFECT. Not too sweet, chewy w/ coconut, pineapple & carrots w/ light as a feather cream cheese/white chocolate frosting. This place is a Vegas gem. In addition the staff was incredibly friendly, knowledgable, and attentive. I think this is the first restaurant I've dined in where every staff person I encountered seemed to love their job, and sang the praises of the food, the owners, and the chefs. I most definitely got a very positive vibe from my visit and that is not always plentiful in this biz --- especially partnered with incredible, affordable food. A definite must for those who want to avoid the glitz of the strip and tire of hotel dining... Do not leave without trying the carrot cake... It would be an epic mistake!

fu55EuSR0dWCN_utPtP--w.text: Always consistently great service and food. Tonight we indulged in Bryce's "special" blood orange martini's and a couple of appetizers. Never disappointed, the drinks delivered and food spot on. Love the rib appetizer and "shrimps" with chorizo. We always leave DW happy...

LYMeE2StP9pIXTdCpwc_7g.text: My favorite off the strip dining! I usually try their Dover Sole special and am not disappointed. Their turkey burger is always on point and sweet potato fries are the best! I've had servers remember my entire order from previous experiences, which was a nice bonus. I've only had 1 time where I wasn't wowwed, and that was because they didn't inform me they were out of the sides for my entree, and failed to substitute them. Owners are awesome and staff is super friendly!

BzIS1CARH1AOuuhI9Ili9g.text: Fantastic brunch.  I had the chicken and waffles.  I've had it in the past in other areas of the country and been unimpressed, but DW's C&W were great.  The chicken was very well cooked and the waffles were ok.  And, of course, the bottomless mimosas were also quite good.

dsWpi-rgH8jDi0ImfDk_mw.text: This place is phenomenal!!!  Today was my third visit in the past 3 weeks.  The food is so fresh!  Ever since my first visit I have been talking non-stop about this place to my husband.  I had him meet me there for lunch today.  He is the type to always find something he doesn't like about a restaurant.  He LOVED it!  This place is a must try.  The service is wonderful.  The staff is very, very friendly.  If I did have to give one complaint it would be that I didn't find this place sooner.

f0WJBGI4Z0fiVQ-mTd92Yw.text: Make sure not to sit at the bar and have a guy named Anthony be your bartender/server. The guy is a complete douche and will just argue that you are wrong and he is right when something is wrong with your order. Worst service I have ever had and it was for a take out order. I can only imagine how bad it would've been if I dined in. Also forgot two of the items with my to go order. Won't ever be going back.

85IyY06THeMiubeAOxu1tQ.text: What a cool spot for brunch!! Went here on a Sunday, and it was packed. I did get seated right away, (thank you to the guy who held the door for me and let me cut him in line) The chicken lollipops were VERY good. I can't explain the flavor, you need to try them for yourself! The employees were very friendly, the owner stopped by to make sure everything was going good. The inside doesn't feel like your in Vegas. It is more of a California vibe. Check it out!

dh599HUOhMjuUgSYxSkDdA.text: Went there for brunch with my little boy! Chicken and waffles were bomb! The syrup was off the chain! Pomegranate tea was amazing too!!

u1T_Zh_8BpjgtbeNI3JzPw.text: This is probably one of the best local restaurants in Las Vegas. Everything is excellent: the food, the drinks, the service, the decor, the ambiance...it really doesn't get any better than this, for a local spot. As an avid foodie, I was very impressed. We went there with a party of four people, for an early dinner seating. We were greeted nicely and were seated immediately. As for the decor, it is a nice mix of modern with hints of rustic. I wouldn't necessarily call this place eclectic, but it's somewhere along those lines. The industrial feel of the ceiling is a great touch.   We shared two appetizers that were mentioned as specials by our server who, by the way, was exceedingly attentive and knew the entire menu by heart - but not in a "this is what I'm supposed to tell you" kind of way. One appetizer consisted of a few shrimp, drenched in a garlicky, lemony sauce, with generous portions of chorizo sausage. They are served alongside buttered bread, making them excellent vessels for leftover sauce. They were absolutely delicious. We also shared the BBQ ribs, which were also delicious and perfectly cooked. They fell right off the bone, and thankfully did not taste overly smokey (no moist towlettes necessary either). The ribs come with a side of grilled pineapple, which perfectly complemented the meat portion. Overall, we were quite impressed by our choice of appetizers.    As for our entrees, we decided to share four plates: jerk lamp chops, chicken curry, slow cooked pork, and braised short ribs. Without a shadow of a doubt, they were all amazing, and it was hard to decide which was the best. We could have done without the lamb chops, as you can basically get those anywhere, yet the ones they serve at DW do have a hint of delicious jerk seasoning, but were somewhat overcooked. They are served over roasted, seasonal vegetables. The slow-cooked pork is served in a bowl, atop white rice. The sauce is very spicy (though you can tell your server how you feel about spices), and tasted similar to a Mexican "pibil" sauce (made with achiote paste), or a Mexican mole. We couldnt' really identify the ingredients used, but they tasted delicious! As for the short ribs, these were also excellent...perfectly cooked in a melt-in-your-mouth manner. They are served alongside one of the best mashed potatoes I have ever tasted in Las Vegas. Lastly, we shared the chicken curry, which is served in a large bowl. It tasted nothing like Indian or Thai curry, but had a distinct, garlicky sauce that was to die for....perfectly seasoned, and perfectly cooked. I thought the string beans added the perfect amount of crunch as well. And, the curry is served over cous cous, which absorbs the creaminess of the curry and is really quite amazing.   We couldn't decide on a dessert, so we went for the dessert sampler. Little did we know that we would be served full-sized portions of different dessert items. There were three cakes: red velvet (delicious, with white chocolate shavings on the cream cheese frosting), chocolate mousse cake (very chocolatey and, surprisingly, not very heavy), and Jamaican carrot cake (it was probably my favorite of the three). Also, there were hand-rolled chocolate truffles...delicious. And, a lemon pudding that was refreshing and velvety. We couldn't finish it all.   For drinks, we tried their version of Mojitos, which were made with fresh lime juice, muddled mint, and strawberries. We only had one each, as we felt that if we were to go for a second, we would immediately feel a buzz.   We loved this place, and cannot wait to go back soon, especially for their brunch service on Saturdays and Sundays. The only negative thing I have to say is that they were out of their DW chorizo and saffron rice, which I would imagine is to die for. I'll have to go back and hope they have it then. We each ate for around $50, including drinks and tip. And finally, I have to say that I love the location of the restaurant...it's in a nice, quiet neighborhood that seems very lively and happening at night.

eYdalje7poGSbKAwEVKbpQ.text: Great food and best service I have had in a longtime, really great staff you guys have. If you live in las vegas you should try this place. Truffle mac n cheese with bacon. Jerk fried chicken.

1oeLRVNDBHX7J_wyD0t_Sg.text: Just finished dining at DW Bistro.  This small restaurant is definitely very likeable with it's well-lit, clean, modern decor.  There's also the option to dine at the bar and the outdoor patio.  The vibe is business-casual to upscale.    Service was good even though there a few small bumps (nothing to raise attention to).  Also, the owners greeted us with enthusiasm, which I thought was very professional.  Foodwise, everyone gets an assortment of breads with chipotle butter.  My fiance orders a cup of the Jamaican Chicken Curry soup.  Wow, that stuff was good.  The soup's viscosity was more of a chowder, and had a smokey flavor with hints of curry.  Unfortunately, there were about two spoonfuls left before our server took it away.  On to our entrees...  He ordered the Jerk Filet that comes w/DW house rice.  There was no rice, boo.  Instead, garlic mashed potatoes that were just average.  I wonder if the DW rice is good?  I tried a small bite of his filet which was cooked medium rare.  The filet was cooked wonderfully.  However, be prepared for JERK!  We realized it is a jerk filet but the jerk was very overpowering, which in my opinion is somewhat wasteful for a filet mignon.  Todd said his food was good but HOT (we're home now, and he says he's still perspiring)!  His only side dish was the DW Sauteed Corn, yummy!  My entree was the Chicken with Roasted Garlic & Cream Sauce with Bowtie Pasta served with sauteed garlic, prosciutto, shallots and seasonal vegetables.  The dish looked stunning and everything was cooked well.  Unfortunately, it was quite bland.  I really wanted to like it but it just lacked flavor.  During the course of our dinner we had three glasses of wine, two rieslings and one pinot noir.  I must say I really liked the pinot noir which was by Alta Maria.  I really want to like DW because we were quite happy with the dinner breads, chicken curry soup, and sauteed corn--all of these were amazing.  I just have to assume we ordered the wrong entrees.  The mishap with the mashed potatoes is understandable as well as the soup being taken away a bit early too.  With all of these calculations I feel three stars is where we'll have to leave DW.  We'll be back to try some other things and would love to award five stars.

v245MJboAyNihJnhhO0ZGA.text: DW Bistro is an awesome place for brunch Sundays! Even though the menu is a small selection, your palate will not leave unsatisfied. Very intense flavors all around. There is not a dish that wouldn't make you drool. I know, each time I have had brunch, I tried something different until I finished the menu. Service is great. I've never had any reason to complain or not like the way of something done by staff.

0aBVuUhhv2slYhhJi4AwDQ.text: It is a great place to hang around for a lazy sunday morning! The atmosphere is contemporary style with a open bar area. Also there is a open sitting patio. We Were there for the brunch, the servers are enthusiastic and helpful. Had a waffle with chicken, a bit weird combination but taste great!  There are a lot of choices for the dressing all are very special. The coffee is pretty good too. The price is great for the quality. Recommend!

YUK7ycxNTbitj2uw7RyOHQ.text: I tried this place for the first time last Sunday and it was amazing. My friend and I are going back today to have brunch again. I love the fact that the one owner walks around helping his staff and talking to people that come.

TEksuFOVOzixFmudtoRSNw.text: They really blew me away - and it was just my first visit! There's nothing like seeing the fresh produce come in the door from the farmers market right as you enter- to then be wow-ed by the decor. The restaurant is done in clean, modern white and orange- with a pop of comfy antique wood pieces- nice eclectic blend of old and new.  The service was great- including the complimentary tasting of the (deeelish) Curry Soup- and we were just in for lunch.  Everyone enjoyed their entrees- from Seared Salmon to Jerk Chicken Salad.  Only down side...we didn't have time for dessert! After my 20+ years in food and beverage at high end restaurants and hotels- they definitely earned my thumbs up and I'll be back. Alot!

xoaH7pbZ_Q-cr7qb5We5VQ.text: Everything was just spicy... no depth to any flavors and we tried a variety of dishes while there. Also, long wait and over priced.

6UCbkQMY4z0pfiZSRRo0Mw.text: It's really sad to give this place a 1 star.  If I could give a zero, I would.  After my bad experience here.  I was invited back, they took care of appetizer and dessert.  Dinner was perfect, everything taste like how it should be.  I was introduced to their special cake.  Loved it to where I placed two orders of their red velvet for Thanksgiving dinner and Christmas dinner.  Thanksgiving dinner was great.  Our friends who joined us for dinner loved the cake.  Then Christmas dinner, I placed another order.  It's a $60 plus tip, it's not a cheap cake.  It was completely different from the one I ordered 4 weeks before.  I was told the pastry chef isn't in town, but they will see if they can make it for me.  I was completely fine with, "Sorry, we can't make it."  I received a cake that looked nothing like the cake before, I was still hoping it will taste the same.  Well, surprise!  The cake mix wasn't even blended well, there were gray chucks there out the cake.  The inside of the cake wasn't even.  There was zero coconut flakes.  This was a very, very embarrassing cake to serve to my mother-in-law and my husband's family who all flew in from Paris the day before.  We were telling everyone how good this cake was.  I think you can imagine how disappointed I was.  I was so embarrassed and ended up baking cookies for them.  I bought back more than half of the cake to this place for a refund.  I got my refund.  I want nothing to do with this place for sure.    It's really sad that the consistency of this place for us is zero star to 5 stars.  Even if consistency was a 3 stars, it would be much better than being super happy and then feeling like you've been robbed.  I posted here the cake I received before and the last one I got.  If you do end getting a cake, I would suggest making sure the pastry chef made it and open the box before leaving the restaurant to save yourself from complete embarrassment from your guests.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Batter isn&#39;t blended.  The cake itself falls apart when you slice it too.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Batter isn&#39;t blended throughout the cake.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The second cake we ordered.  Super sad.

jXyrkKcmxFhablAVPzbjyw.text: Bottomless mimosas in Sundays. Try them. Flautas are the Best. Fried chicken is good. I think their Sunday brunch menu is good. Service is awesome. Bartender Tomas is amazing. Waiting is sometimes a few minutes but worth it. Try them.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iOK5-UKRUvG61y_ZsrhArQ.text: They definitely keep up on the bottomless mimosas but they're also $24 bucks. Not much to choose from on their brunch menu to eat imho. Nice atmosphere, particularly if you're seated outside. The place is on the pricey side. Maybe because its in the middle of the Gramercy. The chicken flautas were good. The jalapeno bacon benedict was good. Definitely small in terms of portion size. Left feeling hungry and unsatisfied - food wise. Service was good and didnt have to wait long but not a lot of options for brunch. Maybe I'll come back to try their dinner menu if Im in the neighborhood. Glanced at their dinner menu on their website and saw a couple items I would be interested in trying. Maybe next time they can fully win me over.

z6G5kiF3fI9_Oh4mvROAYg.text: Went last Saturday afternoon based on a recommendation of a friend. We got there about 1:30pm and they gave us the brunch menu. The wait staff was extremely nice and the service was very good. Our server was especially kind.   The brunch menu isn't very big. Probably 10 entrees on there and a few starters, sweets, etc. However, once I got my food I realized that they didn't need a whole bunch of decent items when everything they do have on the menu is phenomenal.   We started with the scones. Fresh and hot. Served with butter and some type of berry compote. Best I've had in my life. Hands down. They were amazing.   For entree I got the jerk chicken and waffles. The waffle was above average but by itself wouldn't have stood out. The chicken was an absolute home run. 10/10!   My wife got the chilequilas and said it was also awesome.   We will certainly be back. Great ambiance, clean, friendly staff, and excellent food. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Chicken and Waffles. Absolutely delicious.

1g6tpqOvIFgA5sPSs181aA.text: The food was good of what is available on the menu. It seems as though everything we asked for on the menu they didn't have. They have limited items as it is and still they didn't have everything we had asked for. So disappointed because I was so looking forward to eating there.

CWzEWrxRkBa4T-hB6OE6GQ.text: Hosted my sister's baby shower here yesterday. We were promptly seated at our long table when we arrived half an hour early to set up. Our server Vidal(spelling?) Was excellent. He came by frequently to check and see if we needed anything. The appetizers we ordered came out in a perfectly timed sequence.   The sliders were delicious and I loved the buns that had a hint of sweetness to them. The chicken skewers were juicy. The vegetable kabobs were grilled perfectly. Everything was yummy. Bottomless mimosas for $22 was a little steep but worth it! Very happy with how the event turned out.

PVWsZcIcfdT-NOsMW4IZig.text: Alfonso was such a great server. We had a great time sitting on the patio for brunch. He was very attentive, outgoing and made our first experience delightful! We will definitely be back. Thank you Alfonso!!!

pFcAxEGqL9B2P09d_EnqoQ.text: Goodness I really wanted to love this place, but maybe my hopes were too high? I have been wanting to try this place since starting on yelp years ago. I came in with high hopes to be completely honest. Maybe the years of hype just were too hard to live up to.  I chose DW Bistro as a brunch spot for my sister's birthday.   The space is beautiful. It was a beautiful day and they have beautiful windows and lighting. The tables and chairs were too small, crowded, and uncomfortable.   They had like an 80's party theme going on with super loud music and the staff dressed all crazy which initially put me off but I loved by the end. It was a fun atmosphere and vibe. It was like a party at 10am and the place was packed.   Service was very slow which is 100% fine because it was busy however I didn't like how we never got appetizer plates at any point and the servers didn't clear our tables often enough.   Anyways my main thing about the disappointment was the food was so mediocre. My party ordered: flautas appetizer, the cheese torte appetizer, New Mexico chili bowl, curry bowl, French toast, and chocolate chip pancakes.  The flautas app is three taquitos cut in half to make six servings. This is beautifully presented but so mediocre tasting. The filling was minimal, had no distinct taste, and I kid you not I had three pieces and only one had a chunk of chicken.   The cheese torte was a ball of cheese served with som bread and crackers. The cheese ball was a good size but. think we had half the ball of cheese left with no more toast or crackers to eat it with. I liked this but it wasn't anything special.  The French toast was also basic as were the chocolate chip pancakes.   The chili bowl was probably my favorite food item as the generous portion had lots of tender pieces of meat. I did however find the dish to be one note with no dimension to the flavor of the chili.  The curry bowl was vegetarian and had the best flavor out of any of the dishes. This I would recommend, but that's not saying much.  We did have a couple of cocktails that were delicious. The bloody Mary's were a hit and miss for me. Our server informed us that a Belvadere rep was present and offered us a round on the the rep. When our check came our original orders had a $4 up charge for Belvadere vodka. The Bloody Mary was $11 or $12 on the drink menu and there was an upcharge for Belvadere which we weren't made aware of at any point. Maybe I'm missing something but whatever.   We did get a slice of carrot cake comped which I did appreciate however considering the unpleasant and disappointing visit it didn't make up for anything.  Overall I was beyond disappointed. At the price point I just expected way better food. I would not recommend this place for dining, but maybe for drinks at the bar. Maybe I just didn't order the right dishes, but this is a thumbs down for me.

RtY8SC4Rq2xqJzdVMWmV9Q.text: I love DW Bistro..they are now located by the Gramercy Building and they have a bigger spot. The service is always great and love their take on Jamaican cuisine. I prefer doing brunch here but came for a late lunch my last visit and had a chance to try the chicken salad and  curry..and it was delicious. Price is reasonable so probably I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Salad
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e9n5iByRK89oOvqvUA0_qw.text: Tucked in the middle of a newly developed area lies dw bistro.  Part bar, part restaurant, it's a small establishment that has a constant local clientele sprinkled with those adventurous enough to leave the strip.  Meeting up with a friend, we started with a few drinks.  In addition to the normal beers, wines and liquors, the bartending staff make some excellent cocktails.  Review the specials list and you won't be disappointed.  The strawberry mojoto was by far my favprite, and seemed to be the one ordered most frequently by the other patrons.  Light snacks helped fill the snacking void.  No cheese fries or mozzarella sticks.  Freshly made ceviche with homemade kettle chips, crispy brussels sprouts and shrimp skewers with a caribbean flair.  They have more meal options too, but was greatly satisfying for drinks and light fare.  So stop by, order a cocktail and some snacks and relax near a window looking out into the vastness of the LV desert.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gin cocktail with citrus and chili
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mojito
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy brussels sprouts with lime and aioli sauce

8Nsq_J9L7cOzFV1eB-shSQ.text: My girls and I are always looking for new places to have brunch, and DW Bistro had great Yelp reviews and was on a few "best of brunch" lists so we thought we'd try it out.    The food is a fun fusion of Jamaican and New Mexican cuisine.  And it's pretty darn tasty.  We had the Chilaquiles, the Jamaican Curry Bowl with chicken and the New Mexican Pork Bowl.  The Chilaquiles were very flavorful with just the right amount of spice.  The Jamaican Curry Bowl would have been fine without the chicken because it was chock full of veggies, although the chicken was delicious.  The New Mexican Pork Bowl had good flavor, but the meat was a bit dry and that brought the whole dish down.  This is obviously a really trendy spot with lots a beautiful people, but us casual ladies fit fine, so don't feel like you have to dress up.  The ambiance is friendly and casual.  The main issue I had was that it was really loud, which made conversation difficult.  We were sitting at a table near the bar. So we were away from the majority of the patrons, but it was still very loud and we kept having to repeat ourselves to each other.  I would definitely come back, but next time I'm trying the Jerk Chicken and Waffles, yum!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise from top: Jamaican Curry Bowl, New Mexican Pork Bowl and Chilaquiles.

OsvWN0j7oRU-FMjAk2oguQ.text: my friends and I just had dinner at this place for the first time.  As a Las Vegas local I am always on the lookout for new restaurants and lounges to try that are off the strip.  When I read the reviews on yelp how great it was, I decided to check it out. The restaurant has both inside and outside dining options.   I had the oven roasted pork shoulder. It is marinated in Jamaican sauce. This is a little spicy but I like it. The portion is quite big. You can definitely share if you want to or take it home for leftovers. It was quite delicious.  My friend liked the Jerk hanger steak she ordered.  Overall, the experience was very good. The ambiance is nice. The service was good.  Prices are slightly pricey for what's on the menu though.  Parking was very easy. I would definitely come back here and try the brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lafQi5CX5iNqia8VYNyW2Q.text: 4 stars for the food and 2 stars for the pricing. I am not cheap and can spend money with the best of them, but if i wanted strip type pricing I would drive to the strip. Business light dinner for a group of 3 (1) House Chardonnay-$14 (1) Absolute and Tonic $13 (1) Tonic Water -$4 (4) small plates between $14-16 each. These plates are small $96 Total - Too much for light plates and two drinks  The service was good, not great the jerk calamari was incredible . All 3 of us were stunned with the bill, we even double checked the math.  Not sure if I will go back .

vUw0Xyo6vizRuRQzVNwkLg.text: Juan was amazing!  Went there for birthday brunch and he definitely made our experience. Food was excellent. Service was better. Definitely recommended

wi094C5IpOIZ5r5QVqrF0g.text: I have eaten at DW Bistro for many years, from back when they were a smaller location off Ft Apache to the beautiful current location at the Gramercy. Dalton & Bryce and their wonderful staff have always been friendly towards me and went out of their way to treat me and the many guests that have accompanied me as if we were guests welcomed into their own homes. My experiences have always been positive and I am never hesitant to recommend DW Bistro to friends, acquaintances, or my own clients.   However, my experience this afternoon left a lot to be desired. I stopped in to show a friend the restaurant & space for a baby shower she is hosting in the upcoming weeks; whilst I also took it as an opportunity to grab some caffeine. We proceeded to the bar counter and I requested from the bartender Eric a menu with their coffee drinks listed. Eric was less than enthused that I dare bother him by requesting such a thing, and proceeded to condescendingly tell me they have a simple menu; espressos, macchiatos, and cappuccinos. I ordered a cappuccino to go, and Eric passed the task off to another gentleman behind the bar and explained quickly how to make it. Eric obviously couldn't be bothered with such a menial task of making a cappuccino as he made it clear with his short demeanor that he is a bartender and not a barista. Mind you Bryce (the owner) was sitting at a table near the bar, and had ordered some sort of espresso related beverage himself and when he got up and returned to the bar Eric was happy to serve him his espresso based drink with a smile. I wish that Eric would have treated me the same way he treated his boss. When I received my drink nearly 10 minutes later, it hardly resembled a cappuccino but seeing that I was not of much importance, I accepted it and requested the check. Eric had his assistant bring over the check and had the assistant return the check to me; not at any point was I thanked for coming in or told you're welcome when I thanked both of them several times.   Noted: go to the coffee shop next door instead. More so I was incredibly embarrassed that my friend who I had raved to about DW & suggested for her event witnessed the lack of friendliness & utter annoyance over the making of a damn cappuccino. Needless to say the service I received today was inexcusable, and I was highly disappointed by both the service and product I received. Today I spent $6.33, and I know that's not a lot in the scheme of things, but treating guests kindly despite how little they are ordering will make for a good impression & repeat business, and luckily this wasn't my first time here because had it been, with a first impression like that I wouldn't ever return. I hope Eric was having an off day and if I am to face him again in the near future he will treat me kindly and as a valued guest.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My &#34;cappuccino&#34;.

gdEQLCZryyrF8DrJx3cNzQ.text: Had brunch recently. We all ordered the chicken & waffles. Excellent & tasty if you like spice. The Bloody Mary was on fire.

T0CAsMxwaZwKyk-Aer59Ew.text: I really do like the food here but the service is so hit and miss. Don't get me wrong, they are pleasant, but not always on top of it. I would give it five stars if I always got excellent service. If they can master consistency then I will update my review.

SdCGfzi3v5y6dZs53wFc6A.text: Great atmosphere. The plate proportions are a bit over the top but the flavors are good. I had the Benedict with jalapeno bacon. If you love spice you will enjoy it. If you just 'like some spice' then the heat will likely be too much as the heats takes over the dish.

pv1q2yHCgHGLeLYCNleU5w.text: Decent place for brunch or lunch but the prices are pretty high, considering the type of food and the atmosphere. The food is decent and good but not amazingly surprising or wow factor, mostly considering the prices you are expected to pay. Would like to see more coffees and teas instead of just alcohol and what is at the bar.   The space is really really loud, especially during lunch time on the weekends. I could barely hear my friends talking to me and I heard a lot of other people at other tables shouting and being pretty loud.   The staff is pretty rude and tries to rush you as much as possible. They seem pretty preoccupied when taking your order. I know that they are busy but it would be nice to get some suggestions or not have to deal with a server that looks annoyed at you. They also don't check in on you very often to see how things are going.   Overall, decent place for brunch/lunch but I would probably avoid coming during busy hours.

z47Hq63GZc8GmABCJnH-AQ.text: I'm a firm believer in brunching & mimosas or bust so obviously this place had been on my radar for quite some time. I finally found the time to go with my girlfriend for a Saturday late brunch bite.   When I got there it was busy but not overly crowded which was nice. I was able to be seated right away and the hostess was super friendly. I also love the decor in this place, super trendy and still classy. Almost makes you forget you're in southwest Vegas.   Finally, the best part, mimosas and food! I decided to go with the eggs Benedict which had a bit of a spicy kick to them. They were cooked extremely well and came in just the right portion size. I also enjoyed the fresh fruit garnish on my drink, a very delightful, unique touch. You can't complain about the price either. Very reasonable! I'll definitely be back for more soon.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

X7b8Io9qGGVt621Vcz6zUw.text: Always an amazing time. Love the personalized service from owners to servers and bartenders. And of course, the food is always delicious. Happy Holidays

sSDeNC2QM2VSFuqcnOUGtQ.text: Me and my girlfriend have been living in Vegas for almost 2 years and we are big foodies! We accidentally stumbled upon this place and man are we glad we did. Not only Is the food amazing the service is top of the line. When you come in you get treated like family, your drink is never empty and you never leave unsatisfied. Always ask for Luis he is the absolute best and will have you smiling your whole meal! I wish there was a 6th star because this place deserves it !!!

g5ULI9dnhlZfxfSx6b_VlA.text: I remember falling in love with the location on Fort Apache, and when I drove by the plaza one day and saw a different restaurant name in their place, I was heart broken. A dear friend of mine, who I texted about the incident with many  emojis, informed me that DW hadn't closed, just moved to The Gramercy. YES! I had to drop by to see if it was still the DW I fell in love with before.  It definitely is. I dropped by for a nice, relaxing lunch after working 16 days straight. Vidal served me, and his personality is perfect for this industry. He is very knowledgeable about the wine selection and menus. I was stuck between the vegetable burger, the ahi tuna couscous salad, and the vegetable Jamaican curry. He recommended the curry and accommodated my extra spicy level request.  Delicious! The food here is just as good as I remembered. The Flavor of the spices in my couscous dish came out BEAUTIFULLY, and the heat level was perfect! Not unbearable, and matched with a Malbec, was just delicious!!  I asked my server for the bartender to create a delicious, weird, amazing cocktail to end my meal with. A little advice for people who ask servers and bartenders for a "surprise" cocktail, tell them what you like and absolutely cannot have in your drink. All I asked for was a cocktail that wasn't overly sweet, a little bit weird and off the wall, and absolutely no egg-whites because I do eat a vegetarian diet.  Bless Vidal, because he was so busy at the time, and he didn't hesitate nor express any annoyance at my request. The bartender made a great cocktail with tequila, a pomegranate tea, and some muddled ginger. Simple, tasty, and exactly fit what I ordered.  There are three things I rate restaurants on when I visit them. Ambience, Service, and Taste. DW has never disappointed me in these three key areas. I cannot wait to come back and try some more dishes and cocktails with such pleasant service.

NLDQbVKwS_JcAaFRmXqSnw.text: Oh my goodness. Best meal in Vegas so far. We went on a Wednesday night for my birthday around 5 before we went to see a show on the strip.   We felt crazy old eating that early because the restaurant was empty! But around 5:30 as we were finishing up our pesto torte and the scrumptious basket of bread, people started filing in. The pesto torte is huge and absolutely enough food for about four people to share but it we just my husband and me and we stuffed our faces and finished it off, along with the bread basket, ourselves!!!   My husband got the jerk filet and I got the curry chicken bowl! I could have easily shared my bowl with someone else and the filet was great for just one. My husband got the Mac and cheese on the side and wow, best Mac and cheese I have ever tried. So perfectly creamy and peppery.   Finally we got the carrot cake and not only was it beautiful but it was the most delicious cake I've ever had. Get it you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday to me! The most delicious Carrot cake.

2rtmainRvWMSEn1JSK1qug.text: Love this place...food is great... Vidal was our server...  Hey Vidal...Debra the dentist is not the brightest bulb in the chandelier    infidel infdl,infdel/Submit nounarchaic 1. a person who does not believe in religion or who adheres to a religion other than one's own.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xPH44oy1vGEcSuaNVvHoRg.text: I love me a good brunch spot, and DW Bistro is one of them. There is little to no wait, even on a busy Sunday afternoon and the ambiance is great. I've been here twice - once for a bachelorette brunch and for the second time just a few weeks ago with friends. The service is quick and friendly, and the food is so good - with huge portions. For starters, we ordered the DW pastry basket and pesto torte, both of which were amazing. The pastries came out warm and the cream and goat cheese was so smooth. For entrees, I've had the jerk chicken and waffles and New Mexican-style slow cooked pork omelet. There's definitely a party vibe at this restaurant, so if you're looking for a quiet meal, this isn't for you. It is a swanky place, but the two times I've been here I showed up in workout gear, so no need to stress out about your attire.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken and waffles
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AxX-HfYffUir5Ukt0xR7LA.text: Wifey and I went to basically the other end of town for us, to dine with a friend on her birthday dinner at DW Bistro.  Nice place!  I can see why DW Bistro gets a lot of love.  It's a unique place in a corner of town!  Where else you gonna see Jamaica meeting New Mexico cuisine?  A rare mix that actually works with yummy results.  According to Yelpers this joint is all the rage for a weekend brunch.  Considering how sparse the choices are in the SW part of LV they are probably on point.  Me?  I don't do brunch much.  But oxtail?  Yeah, sign me up!  DW Bistro was more than half packed on a Tuesday night, good sign.  Our party was the biggest on in the restaurant by far, but many of the other tables were at capacity as well.  Looking at the surroundings, I had no clue of Jamaica or New Mexico in the mix.  Seems more Asian to me!  But nice and quaint place.  Upon sitting and getting our drink order in, I went straight for the menu.    Yep, those who know me know exactly what I went for.  It was a near no-brainer.  Braised Oxtail ($20) with a veal demi glace, and mashed potato of the day.  That's what's up!  I couldn't wait for this!  My patience paid off.  This dish was very yummy!  Oxtail was tender, juicy, savory, sticky on the lips from all of that lovely collagen - just the way it should be!  Veal demi glace really gave it a good depth of flavor, and kept the meat moist while I was eating through the dish.  Great oxtail that was probably simmering for the better part of the day (or with a bit of cheating from a pressure cooker).  Had no problem licking this up!  My only minor gripe about this dish was the uninspiring mashed potatoes.  They were on the dry side, I was expecting more butter and cream with them as well as a lighter texture to go with the rich oxtail.  Instead the mashed potatoes were rather dense.  If I had my choice, since we're cooking with Jamaica...why not do it with classic rice & beans?  Now we're talking!  Only other complaint was the portion size, I'm a big boy so I'm looking for a big boy portion.  But for the money, this was probably the right size amount.  Wifey ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Scampi over Linguini ($20) with fresh parsley, lemon juice, crushed chili pepper, and fresh garlic.  I tried it and it was pretty good but I think the dish is lost in translation when trying to figure out it's Jamaican and New Mexican influence.  Tasted pretty much Italian to me.  We liked it, but it really wasn't what we were expecting the dish to be.  It was spicy though because of the chili pepper.  If we got it with the Jerk Chicken instead, I'm guessing it would have been more on that influence we were looking for.  But overall still a nice entree.    Big plus here for me?  That damn Jamaican Pickapeppa hot sauce!  It is the bomb diggety!  I love that hot sauce and glad DW Bistro added it to the tables.  It adds sweet & heat like no other.  I'd put that stuff on a Nike (preferably non-Jordans) and probably be able to take a bite.  A little dip with my oxtail was nice, real nice.    Overall the experience at DW Bistro was excellent, food was tasty, service was excellent (though a tad slow with our large party), setting was nice.  I can see this place as a local hangout with friends enjoying a cocktail.  Relaxed but very hopping.  Jamaican me crazy.....Ole!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Shrimp Scampi over Linguini

upk8yZD6VkKHCcK72TTV_Q.text: I've tried several times to eat here but every time I come, they were closed. I made it a point to come here early and drove from Henderson.   The place looked nice when we came in but it was empty. The waitress sat us in the dark back corner, and we asked if we could sit in the main room where their is light. They told us the main area booths are for party's of 8 or more, and would not sit us there. Mind you we are the only two customers in there.  I'm don't know what the food taste like or how the service is, but this is not a place to go to if your wanting to enjoy a lunch with your wife in daylight.  I did however notice that other restaurants have seating with windows, so we are gonna go elsewhere.

5yXPf1Oni2XfOrr2MgCv9A.text: I have been here multiple times. The first time I went here it was for brunch, which the bottomless mimosa deal is ridiculously awesome! For all the folks who want to relax and drink before Monday rolls around, then you must stop by here for brunch. There is a long wait, though. It's $20 per person, and the servers are very generous.   For lunch, when I went the second time we had a lot of New Mexican-style dishes. The appetizer we got was the DW Spanish Chorizo w/ shrimp. The chorizo was nicely cooked. The shrimp was perfect and I loved the bread it comes with, which you can use to dip in the lemony sauce.   My sister had the New Mexican-Style slow-cooked pork. This is a bit spicy since it was simmered in red chile. It is served with two over-easy eggs and rice. I recommend adding a third egg if you really love the flavor of yoke over rice and pork. The dish is HUGE. So you can definitely share if you want to or take it home for leftovers. It is delicious and probably my favorite entree I had in this meal.   I had the New Mexican-style green chile cheeseburger. I added avocado in it because I love avocado. The burger is really big and tall. I had to cut it up and even cut a portion of the top bun away just so I can eat it comfortably. The sweet potato fries taste surprisingly great with the burger. I would definitely come back here again. We had dessert. It was a cookie type cheesecake that was very rich. It seems the desserts change often so I am not sure if they will have it here when you go.   Overall, the experience was very good. The ambiance was a bit loud. But I assume it is because it is so packed and busy because of the awesome service and food! The drinks are overpriced, except the bottomless mimosas on Sundays, but the food is reasonably priced and it comes in large portions. The service was great. On the weekends, there are themed dress-ups, which is always fun to see.   I would definitely come back here again and recommend you do as well for lunch and for brunch!!!

Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican-STyle Green Chile Cheeseburger
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork

NSGRCpAZaf2mZyLoadhrxg.text: I have visited DW Bistro many times both for lunch and dinner and the food has consistently impressed me every single time. The decor of the restaurant is very modern contemporary with beautiful splashes of color and natural lighting. The menu offers many unique items with a bold mix of flavors. They also have a variety of cocktails some of which are daily infusions of tropical flavors. The only reason for 4 stars is the inconsistent service we have received as regulars. Luckily the food makes up for that. We will definitely continue to return.

rK0I-PjJgO0p2AAyt9SwFg.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said?  Knowing how crazy Brunch can be (DW does not accept reservations on Sunday Brunch) we went around 11am to eat. This turned out to be a perfect time because all the 10am "Brunchers" were on their way out, so we did not have to wait for a table.   Shout out to our waiter Nick, who made our experience amazing. He was very attentive and gave great suggestions.  I will not comment on the food, because its pretty amazing! and you can read everyone else's reviews.  Nick explained all the sauces on the table, as well as sent us complimentry Carrot Cake for dessert. We were stuffed! but not complaining of course!    Tip: If you're on a budget, ask how much the specials are before you order. My boyfriend ended up getting the special filet breakfast burrito but we did not realize how much it cost until we got the bill. Overall, the experience is great! Can't wait to try DW Bistro for dinner.

dA9XlbTydM3k9TnnxJXfBQ.text: Amazing service and amazing food! Great drinks and great atmosphere. The chicken flautas are so good and I love the calamari. Great fun spot for Sunday Brunch!

s_dJYKa0SGryaE8dipJ6VQ.text: This place is the best! I can't even remember how many times I've been here. The staff is fabulous! You can tell that they are happy to work there. You won't sit through your meal without a few table touches from either your server or the owners. So rare of many restaurants nowadays, so refreshing to see owners care about their product and customers.  One of my favorites on their menu is their Truffle mac and cheese with bacon and mushrooms. This side dish blows my mind. The best mac and cheese ever! Please take my word and order it. Their jerk fried calamari is also excellent.   All of their desserts are great except for their red velvet cake. It was incredibly dry and disappointing. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt that it might have just been a bad day for them. I ordered this at night so it might have been the last piece of a cake that has been out all day.   Regardless, it would be unfair to give DW anything but 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chops

S5DzfTHnGDxAuDOfvGjcUw.text: Top shelf dining experience for under $100 per couple!   Dinner for two...  1) App: Plantains with cayenne and honey  2) Dinner: Salmon  3) Dinner: Oxtail 4) Dessert: Pumpkin swirl cheesecake  5) Two glasses of wine   Total: $90  The service is 5-star and the food is exceptional! Great decor and location!   If you want great service EVERY time...just ask for Louis! He is the man and never disappoints! Awesome recommendations and always has the meal on the table quickly and efficiently!

8D4vry7c4DliVvkV6Bqdfg.text: This place is fantastic! I came in with my boyfriend and we were completely surprised how visually appealing this place was. Everything was so brightly lit & we were seated with a variety of bread accompanied with some delicious spread. Before ordering, we voiced out our concerns of peanut allergies. Our waiter, Ernesto, kindly read over the menu & informed us which dishes included them. I ordered the jerk chicken linguini & my Bf ordered the Jamaican curry bow w/ couscous. When our orders came out, a different server placed our food on our table & also kindly reassured us that they made sure there were no peanuts in any of our dishes. Aside from the amazing service, the food was phenomenal! If you're really looking for a flavorful, spicy kick, I highly recommend the linguini. We ended the night with a delectable red velvet cake topped with white chocolate. Definitely coming back again!
