t2uFLtZ7gnWa5YUfD3lY_g.text: Love our neighborhood locale! My family has frequented DW since it first opened several years ago. We eat there as a family, enjoy date nights there, meet friends &/or business associates at DW, and enjoy takeout, typically on a two-thrice monthly basis. The atmosphere is relaxed & bright (love the orange & white motif), the service friendly & timely, and most importantly, the food phenomenal and unique. We feel at home whenever we go as the staff is welcoming & accommodating to our ever changing requests. Overall, a superb & much appreciated change for Las Vegas!!

OhbzhROxWOfwfV_b6jk_cw.text: Yum, yum, yummmm!!! The sweet potato fries are TO DIE for. The whole place screams chic :) I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place :)

BBthzurPcICn8ixkP9H2Wg.text: How could I live on the Westside for so many years and NOT eat here!?  I love this place.  Just had lunch for the first time today and the decor is so pretty and super inviting.  The weather was great so we took advantage of the outdoor seating which I appreciated was under a covered patio.  I had to bring my 2 year old along for the lunch and wasn't sure how "kid friendly" this place would be.  I was pleasantly surprised they actually had highchairs and a changing table in the restroom ( didn't use but glad to see they offered).  The thing that stood out to me beyond the awesome atmosphere and food, they have great service!   My server, who I was bad and didn't catch his name, he could see my son's patience was being tested so he asked if he could bring him something, I said sure!  He brought my son some flashcards.  Such a simple thing, but kept my son happy for another 15-20 minutes until our food came.  Small gesture but means a lot to a mom!  We had the ceasar salad which had some spice chipotle very good and the turkey burger with apple chutney and sweet potato fries.  All very delicious and both a large portion and $22 for both full meals.  Can't wait to go back with the hubby for weekend brunch

VPjA_-e2EeLr5DEN6iD38w.text: A Sunday requested off work for my birthday clearly means one thing: brunch. I decided I wanted an intimate brunch with a few friends in order to celebrate, and after hearing about this place through an acquaintance, we set off to DW Bistro.  The restaurant itself is gorgeous - bright, well-decorated with gorgeous artwork, modern. We waited about ten minutes before actually being seated, which was understandable for a Sunday brunch. Once seated, however, service was sporadic - uncomfortably attentive at first which eventually drifted into long unexplained periods of absence.   My friends had ordered both the Blueberry White Chocolate Scones and the Pastry Basket. The former were absolutely orgasmic - light, airy, studded with fresh blueberries (though lacking in the white chocolate department). They were then featured in the latter, alongside Chocolate Croissants, turnovers of mysterious fruity containment, blueberry muffins, and cranberry almond scones. The chocolate croissants were delicious - rich, flaky, perfect. The others were somewhat lacking - mediocre at best.   As for entrees, both a friend and I ordered the Jerk Chicken and Waffles while the other ordered the Tuna Nicoise salad. The chicken and waffles were delicious - ordinary at first with a kick of spice bites later. As for the Tuna Nicoise, huge pieces of Ahi tuna were barely seared atop greens with all of the normal accoutrements. Mango on the side was a random, but welcomed addition to the salad. As for the portions, the prices definitely are right on. All of us finished half of our entrees before calling it quits.   More into service, there were long gaping moments were no service was to be found - extremely awkward when you're trapped in a restaurant's alcove with a table of gay men casting judgmental eyes toward your outfit! The worst part of the DW experience was handling a price discrepancy for the Pastry Basket. As we received our check, we found that we were charged extra for an upgraded pastry basket when we asked for the one specified on the menu. While I took a detour to the bathroom to avoid conflict with the waiter, I came back to the tail end of the conversation to which our waitress bluntly told my friends that while she'd fix it, that the price she charged was ultimately right.    Food wise, DW Bistro has me mesmerized - I am smitten. However, service was lacking, but when I think of those blueberry white chocolate scones, it isn't enough to discourage another visit.

0Wfnu0cdLYfdGu7r-kcpOQ.text: This place has a very modern and trendy feel. Oddly, it reminded me of the cafes in Portland Oregon.  The persimmon infused vodka drinks were delicious, but definitely pricey. The bloody mary was tasty and garnished with a giant piece of bacon!   The fried chicken was tender and flavorful, perfect! The Jamaican curry chicken was awesome, the curry had a unique flavor and wasn't too overwhelming.    Good drinks, great food, I will definitely go back--and next time I am saving room for dessert!

dn9nB5mzABWD-mibnh59Dg.text: A MUST in Las Vegas. This place is friendly, fun, inviting, and the food is DELICIOUS! So different than the typical reataurant. What's great is that you can tell the fun vibe of the workers too. Such great atmosphere. Came in for lunch by myself and got the star treatment from Anthony and Tyler.

abHKPkXbGbNHA2NkdR7GjA.text: Loved loved loved DW Bistro. Came with a group, and ordered a jalapeno and bacon bloody mary, and snacked on the pastry basket while deciding what to order. I finally decided to go with one of their staff favorites and it was the jerk chicken and waffles. Huge portion but so so so delicious. There is kind of a long wait but it was a Sunday brunch, so be warned to just take a seat on their couch and start drinking and enjoy your company why waiting. Can't wait to come back!

GAumhs7ePDcZf9YBt2LaDw.text: party - 5 when walking in (since we did so separately) the atmosphere was great, being seating and not being pressured by the wanting of being in and out.   as we were seated the service was great, got drinks within a min being greeted by the owner and just walking to our seats. the automatic water dispense of water was amazing and the accommodations to what ever drink you would like the have. Me having the lemonade (it was a little lemony but upon request it could be sweetened) and with their pomegranate white ice tea was a good choice, light, aromatic and delicious (highly recommended).  as we moved on we started with a salad and starter dish, being their torte and jerked tuna salad. the torte itself was light and refreshing and it hit the spot (if needing to curve your appetite this was the right choice) with some crunch, abundance of flavors and spices, and richness of the cheese it was an amazing choice to have. our second started (actually being an entree) we had the jerked ahi tuna salad. the salad was surprising it has sweet, spicy, freshness and all the flavors after tossing was impeccable.   main courses - with presentation being a high must all the dishes look amazing and with your burger/sandwich the choice of salad or sweet potato fries give a good health or substance benefactor. then the burger (myself getting the turkey burger) was more than a surprise. After a peer saying it was amazing the the staff giving it good marks i just wanted to try it and it was nothing less than expectation. it was juicy,  filling and great combination of flavors and the chutney gave it an over the roof kick.   all went well our stay didnt seemed rushed (being a 2 hour sit time) and all was impeccable.   definitely a must eat for lunch dinner and weekend brunch they have an amazing menu if ever in the south west.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. goat cheese torte with spicy vinaigrette and herbal flavors.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. jerked ahi tuna salad (and a spicy and sweet marmalade)
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. turkey burger with chutney and a side of sweet potato fries

PGP-nSZDuP17D3GPfVmq8g.text: Would have definitely given DW 5 stars, if it weren't for the service being kind of slow.  It was ok though, because this was the 1st time I had seen my friend Shirley since she had her baby Maksim, and he is as cute as the come!  So it gave us time to catch up.  :-) plus the food is AMAZING! Thanks Shirley for finding a gem of a place.  Perhaps it was the pretzel bread that clouded my judgement, but everything I had was super delicious and I'm eager to return to try more.  I order the veggie curry and a small house salad to start and Shirley had the Jerk Chicken.  Right after we ordered, several new tables came in and after waiting a little long for just a side salad, I couldn't help but wonder how long the entrees would be.  Just as I was about to track down the guy with the pretzel bread, my salad came.  I scarfed that down because the dressing was absolutely perfect. Then just as we all were getting a little antsy, the food finally came.    I felt bad when my curry came out steaming and Shirley said her chicken was sort of cold.  We both agreed that it tasted good though, in fact the curry was down right delicious! The spice was spot on and having the option of couscous, instead of rice, was unexpected and appreciated.  It's texture with the creamieness of the curry, was almost dessert like.  Leftovers were my fiances breakfast the next morning, :-) so now we both are curious to see what else DW has to offer, although I'm not sure the two of us will be as patient.

19MyYeWdrCuUvKxFhxGHQA.text: The interior in this place is really nice. I just moved to the area and a friend told me the food was amazing and he was right. We started with the chicken flautas and I had the fried chicken. It was so flavorful. Also the customer service is awesome. Thanks

qACBTlXGEb1SrBXo1vTLjw.text: What a gem! It's sad I haven't been there until now, I'm a bit ashamed since it is so close to home. Dined with a friend after a day of hiking. We received a warm welcome. We snacked on dinner rolls to begin, that beer bread is awesome! Then, I had the oven roasted jerk pork shoulder. It was hearty and flavorful. Really comforting on this chilly day. My friend enjoyed her turkey burger, the chutney makes it extra special.  We also indulged in a side of truffle mac n cheese and cornbread. Oh, so yummy! Portions are good sized so we have plenty left to enjoy tomorrow.... and probably the next day.

FTV6y7aJ9U-V4OYOp4sp1A.text: Nothing to complain about here!  Beautiful, clean restaurant. Bright, modern decor. Friendly and professional staff all around. The food was very good. I had slow roasted pork with rice. Meat was tender and the sauce was delicious. After adding a dash of one of the many hot sauces on the table it was perfect. Will definitely be back soon to try more.

6Ap7MzjcfxdnEwYMDHsN0A.text: Tried this restaurant based on the recommendation of a co worker fusion Carribean and New Mexican Cuisine, the flavor and the presentation were really good. A good hip place to dine, and something new due to the fusion cuisine definitely a must try. Service was good as well.

hypuRE2GD5oDlgM5eRWMbA.text: DW Bistro is one of my favorite places to brunch. Working in industry I love recommending hidden gems in the Valley. There were three of us calling ahead to check when their last seating was and they told us to be there before 2 and we made it by 1:45. When we arrived we were coldly greeted and told there was no more seating for the day. We were taken back seeing as we just talked to them 10 minutes prior. It has changed how I feel about one of our favorite places, now we are taking our business to Honey Salt.

bJXjML-jyQdLz6xwuWjBBg.text: My friends and I just bumped into this bistro and was greeted very kindly by the staff.    We just sat at the bar and they had an amazing selection of champagne and wine. Of course i order the usual vodkha on the rocks with 2 limes and they recommended me to try Hanger 1 instead of my greygoose and wow i love this Hanger 1.  We ordered appetizers to share. The jerk style chicken lollipops were delicious. Lots of spices to make it flavorful. The turkey sliders was okay. There was too much apple chutneyy taste to it. The Jamaican Chicken curry soup was amazing! I wanted to order more. That was my favorite dish.   We met the executive chef and GM. The staff was really sweet. I noticed when every customer that came through the door they all knew each other like it was family in that restaurant. The decor was very chic and but stuffy. Great place!

oPZLmBxMon002emW73O6Aw.text: Went here for Brunch this morning and was pleasantly surprised. I had looked on Yelp for a dog friendly brunch place and this had the highest rating and I can see why. We were lucky that we arrived at 9:40 and they did not pen until 10, we walked to get coffee while waiting at Starbucks and came back at 9:50 and there was a huge crowd out front!!  We got seated out on the patio right away with our 2 dogs, they brought the dogs water which is a plus in my book! The food was very good, I had the Nicoise salad $16 (sooo good!) and my boyfriend had the daily special of steak and eggs (a little pricey at $25 but it had 2- 4oz filet Mignon medallions, eggs, and toast) He loved it! We also got an appetizer of a small fruit salad brought to us (we didn't order it, it just appeared) which was cute and tasty. Our waiter was very friendly. and attentive, even though the restaurant quickly filled. I would go back in a heartbeat and will recommend it highly to anyone looking for a tasty brunch spot.

RhpeueeT07byD8Y24ig7ug.text: 4.25 star.  I had the turkey panini with new Mexico chilis. Very good. Moist, immense primary flavor. Clear secondary flavor of the NM chili. Bread was oily and hard at the edges. Crispy and soft in the middle.   Sweet potato fries were good. Each fry had salt flakes attached. Not the best I had, but above average for sure.   Price is worth it. They have an interesting menu that is definitely worth trying a couple of things.   I normally just grade food quality, but I must add that the service was prompt, polite, friendly and great. If I graded on service, they would get 5 stars for sure.   I would recommend this place and I will be coming back.

dsSyarD5wSUfCaMWBnL86Q.text: We arrived in Las Vegas in search of the best burger for myself. The bellman at The Orleans, Jeremiah referred me to DW Bistro.The term Bistro had me somewhat apprehensive because I had never though of Bistros for Burgers. This place is the place for the best burger in Las Vegas, I had the New Mexican-style green chile cheeseburger. To describe it as phenomenal would be an understatement, hot, juicy, wow!! Let the Chef, as I always insist, cook it as he intended it to be best, which turned out to be medium. I ate this work of art with the DW Salad and had this all complimented with the  DW Bloody Mary, Yum!!  My wife had the Jamaican Curry Chicken on white rice and my Trini Girl loved it. She opted for the Pineapple Ginger Beer to go with it. We also had as a starter,The DW Spanish chorizo with shrimp which was a veritable festival for the pallet. We completed this holiday with the Carrot Cake and it too was great and not too sweet. All the staff conducted themselves in a very professional manner and we were fortunate to have Luis walk us through this Beautiful, Delicious Flavor Journey. It not far from the Strip and believe me when I tell you, IT IS WORTH IT!!!

vv1-1De1HgmI5o7CJAcSHA.text: My party of 4 and I went to DW Bistro around 3:45 pm for a late lunch. There were very few actually dining but several people at the bar. None of us had been here before, and we were tired of eating at Asian restaurants... Because this was close by, we decided to check it out! At first impression, I loved the interior design: the light was pouring in perfectly. It was bright, contemporary, and very modern. My friends and I noticed that the patio outside was also very well-decorated and wondered what it'd look like at night. It also helped that the weather was perfect. The host that handed us the menus and seated us was very friendly! The ambiance was perfect and I loved the art on the walls. We were attended to immediately, and our server, Louis, was attentive and patient considering we were first timers. Our glasses were always filled! There were no long waits and our food came out pretty quickly.   A friend of mine asked if they had tea and our server said they only had pomegranate iced tea. Because he didn't know what that was like, our server was kind enough to bring one for him to try and see if he'd like one. Here's what we ordered:  1. New Mexican style slow-cooked pork - Served eggs over easy, this slow cooked pork has the perfect texture and is jam-packed with heat! The portions are huge when you order bowls so you might want to share this one... 2. Jerk Chicken scampi over linguine - Their jerk chicken is absolutely delicious and the sauce was delish!!! The jerk chicken was a little too spicy for my friend, and our kind server (again, to the rescue) brought him a glass of milk. It helped him a lot! 3. Grilled Jerk chicken breast - One bite ensued a burst of flavor and harmonized well with the rice! 4. New Mexican style green chile cheeseburger - It was tasty! But I am not a fan of jalapenos...That's just me though.  Our server also gave us a complimentary slice of cake because we were first timers there! We chose red velvet and it was heavenly! He also mentioned that brunch here was big. I will definitely be coming back for it!

V_2ykB-4eBllcbVW0ybK5w.text: We came here for the bottomless mimosas. We ordered them and hey sat in the window for 15 min as our server stood outside and chatted nonchalantly. He came back inside and stood at the pass where our mimosas sat, walked away, came back, and walked away again. We ordered scones as an appetizer and he brought them out AFTER our main course was delivered. Our mimosa glasses sat empty more often than they were filled. My eggs Benedict needed more seasoning. The chilequilas were ok, but needed salt. Our server, Louis, left A LOT to be desired. Won't be coming back. The bottomless mimosas weren't all they're cracked up to be. Disappointed.

pEslh6UxEObYJpEzG3X6Og.text: I heard about DW Bistro a few years back when a friend of mine (after eating there for the first time) decided to get a tattoo of a piece of their Red Velvet Cake. My wife loves RVC, and we had DW Bistro on our wish list of places to eat. Last night we were finally in the area and decided to check it out.   Service gets an A++. Entire staff was friendly. There was always someone to refill our drinks and clean up throughout our meal.   Food was excellent. My wife had the fried chicken, and I had the veal parmigiana special. I had the pomegranate iced tea (amazing) and my wife a beverage. Every bite was bursting with flavor. I have not had a meal where it seemed every bite was calculated and created to give the eater such a flavorful experience. Of course we had the Red Velvet Cake for dessert. We were skeptical going in, because my wife's favorite dessert is her grandmothers RVC. Not to disappoint, we both loved the RVC. It was a neat twist on an old classic. The cake was moist, icing was creamy, and the white chocolate surrounding the top and sides was to die for. Hats off to the chef at DW Bistro.  It was a Friday night. We were there at 6pm, and good thing because as we were leaving a huge wait building up.   Our bill was $100 with tip, and well worth very penny. I highly recommend DW Bistro, especially if you're looking to have a nice night out with your wife/husband/significant other.  Bravo DW Bistro! We'll be back!

jQrS9MhCH_QgeegidapXlw.text: Ok I have to say that this is a restaurant that I really want to believe in. I believe that they are better than what I experienced, food wise, and I will return there one day for dinner expecting more. Ok so on with the review.   I went there for lunch and was really smitten with the decor, derive and patio. Its a beautiful place to eat. Their lunch menu had a nice selection.of Caribbean and southwest inspired foods .I had the shrimp and chorizo appie, curry.chicken bowl and.the portobello mushroom burger. Although each item was True to the cuisine they were all just missing that little extra something that made this reviewer give it 3 instead of 4 stars. The flavor just wasn't quite developed enough for me but I have a hunch that by dinner time that flavor that makes Caribbean food so good will have woken.up. Until next time DW.

KafG2qOURAjKtT6dvSDwrA.text: We came on a Saturday morning about 10 minutes before opening and a line was already forming at the door. The staff was friendly, greeting regulars and it was nice to see couples with babies in tow. It looks like a classy place but was super kid friendly without being overwhelming. The owner even tried to get my toddler to dance. The food was superb. I ordered the Challah French Toast with both strawberries and sauteed bananas. It was an impressive plate and my only complaint was that it needed a reprieve from the sweetness like a small side of hashbrowns or bacon (or a kosher alternative). My daughter loved mixing in berries, raisins, almonds, brown sugar, and toasted coconut into her oatmeal. All came on the side so we could add as much or as little as we wanted. My husband was a little disappointed with the chicken and waffles. The chicken wasn't crispy enough for him and could have used more syrup to cut the heat (It was a tad spicy in addition to temperature). To me, there was an unpleasant aftertaste to them that he said was reduced when he poured honey on them from packets on the table. It was pricey and I can't say everything was worth the money but I would go back for the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Challah French Toast with sautéed strawberries and bananas

py6wBJcI-J-gccelJkRbFg.text: Service was good. I didn't realize it was a Jamaican/ Mexican fusion type place. I just went to have dinner with friends. Kinda pricey and the food was meh. But I'm not really into Jamaican type foods though, so I might not be giving a fair review. I had the braised short rib. It was kinda bland, and it was like pulled pork.... I might give the lunch or brunch a try though.

M3IiuuzuveeJ_JtLhWUa_Q.text: So glad this place is in Vegas! I don't know what I would do without it! I eat here literally 2-4 times a week, I get the same thing the Turkey Panini for lunch!!! Seriously i'm addicted to this thing. And even if the food sucked I would still go there because everyone who works there is awesome, especially the owners! GO!

ICQd0BDxqdOrcgBshjpNEw.text: DW stands for the owner's initial. The man definitely belongs to the front of the house. As for the ambiance, think Miami Vice.   We had quite an assortment of brunch food here but the star is definitely the curry with couscous. The menu says vegetable but I definitely tasted chunks of chicken with it. Great news considering I love meat but my conscience wants be more bio-sustainable.   The rest of the menu here I would say is slightly above average. The chicken and waffle looked fantastic but cutting into it was a big disappointment because it was missing a *crunch* factor. Another disappointment is that the waiter asked if we wanted to start with a bread muffin assortment. Most brunch places I've been, offer that for free but upon careful inspection, there is a steep charge for it. So you may be suckered to say yes thinking it's free.  Yes the pricing seems $2-3 higher than it should be but that is nitpicking since the ambiance is quite unique for Vegas.   3.5 stars rounded up to 4

kAzizpfk_tR3tRmU83mcRA.text: One of my favorites for business lunches. I haven't had a bad meal yet. Oh and the fancy iced tea is a must!  I recommend you try it!

okhuuMEoAIOiI9RUrwgHTg.text: I got the burger, and I have to admit, it was really good. They mix the onion in with the meat, to give it a meatloaf texture, and slight taste. I loved it. The only thing I don't like is the prices. A bit on the ritzy side.

TdDWGpy8ExF4ARr7llL5sg.text: This place is out of this world delicious. I highly recommend the ribs for an appetizer; they are fall off the bone delish. They serve a basket of fresh made breads that are unique and very tasty. I ordered the jerk chicken salad, it could have used more flavor in my opinion, but it was a huge portion and everything was fresh. The crowd was a combination of younger fashionable people sitting at the bar, but families and people of all ages eating dinner there too. Great modern, clean atmosphere. A little on the spendy side but well worth it.

FcUQ3zI0tvWnK7sdpk_UpQ.text: This spot has a unique flair and flavor that I haven't found anywhere else in Vegas... It has a vibrant atmosphere despite being located in a humble strip mall. Try the ribs, they're great and the fried chicken is awesome. My only criticism would be that the food can be "one note" in that it seems that almost everything on the menu is jerk spiced; of course please remember that the jerk spice they use is delicious.

NRrDsuAdJOVYwgKPRaLd0A.text: We love this place! We eat here several times a week and we've loved everything we've tried! Whatever you do try a cocktail, you will not be disappointed!

EiTar6Plf2RBxqTFVmzT_g.text: I saved all my visits for one review....roll them all into an average and....I still get 5 stars. Start with the host...what a keeper! He makes everyone seem welcome, no tude and is incredibly personal. The food - not been disappointed, full of spice, flavor and presentation. Haven't visited for dinner, but brunches are the place to be. $20 bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's make the ( sometimes looong) wait bearable.  You'll love it!

-fshUoeilpJ3wx8a3gMeag.text: This place was awesome!  We were there for lunch on a Friday just before taking off for a vaca.    The ambience is clean modern with a touch of artsy and boho.   Get the Deliciouso as a starting cocktail...not to sweet and not sour...just perfect, I believe it has Agave in it. The Ahi Jerk salad was perfect...absolute favorite!!  The pepper jelly added just the right sweet hint to the over all spicy tuna...what a great balance. The  Short Rib sandwich was great too; tangy and sweet with just a kick of slight heat.  All portions were perfect.  We had the Pesto Torte fro a starter which was good, but nothing to write home about.  Actually there was too much goat cheese, but it was quite good.  We are planning on going again and checking out their dinner menu as there are more selections.    Definitely give this place a shot if you are looking for really good food, conversational atmosphere and a place to tell others about.  You will be glad you did.  :)

nqpdyA_LAq62TV_KldNthQ.text: Such of beautiful place, Service always amazing and stunning food!!! In general this is my favorite place to get delicious food and a fantastic date to be!

iwtFxwPk0rrpK4NRXcs87A.text: Alway fantastic!!!! Love the Sunday Brunch...Eric, Luis and Marco always take great care of us!!!!!

5fDK017-3wCzawYXWcwVUg.text: Although this place is pretty known for their party vibe Sunday funday brunch (where the wait can be hours); I prefer coming on quiet nights. The ambiance and vibe is wonderful. The decor is gorgeous. I love that this restaurant is somewhat tucked away, making it feel like a hidden little treasure. The food is amazing, my favorite being the Jamaican curry chicken bowl...it's very filling so I usually end up with a doggie bag. The complimentary assortment of bread is fantastic. Service has been consistently friendly. I adore this little bistro.

TpiVc56iyhuIxFfI8ruKZw.text: DW is perfect for brunch.   I am always looking for delicious breakfast spots in town. The decor here is modern, chic and Caribbean. I love the Red Stripe chalk board with the tide time on it. Nice touch.  I had the jerk chicken and waffles and my buddy had eggs benedict with jalepeno bacon! SOOOOOOOOO YUMMY! The chicken was perfectly crispy with orange zest infused in the crust. Each dish was around $10 but there were cheaper options.   They have great outdoor seating for those beautiful mornings.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken and waffles

LPZLS1zRoN-K29S7T7VZBw.text: We came to DW for Father's Day brunch and I can't wait to return!  Service was on point and our waiter started his introduction by telling us that he is a customer/patron turned waiter at DW. That's how much he loves this place.  Our order was the following:  -Pastry basket (scones, chocolate crossaints) -Jamican jerk chicken and waffles - Pulled pork eggs benedict - Chiliquiles - Tomato and goat cheese omelet  The food was outstanding! My favorite bite was the pulled pork eggs benedict. On the table were various hot sauces, including a spicy mango hot sauce. I put a healthy dose of the "very spicy" labelled hot sauce as well as the spicy mango hot sauce on top of my eggs benedict. A full bite consisting of a little homemade biscuit, egg, pulled pork, and that delicious mix of hot sauces made me happy beyond words :)  I was very happy with my DW experience and will absolutely be returning very soon!

0rYbrVoqtRreXww8HchXHA.text: I absolutely loved this place. True it's waaaaay off the beaten path (meaning far!) but TOTALLY worth the drive! I had the Ox Tails and was not disappointed. The atmosphere was totally trendy but the staff was extremely nice and the food was served very quickly. I would definitely and do intend to go again, the next time I think I'm going to round up some of my family members and have a good time.

cGSx-_E8uh0Y68QNZlS9_g.text: DW Bistro offers more than just your traditional breakfast!

uXg-6kZAwfKIbiij2GKaxg.text: Love this place.... Fun eclectic menu.... Cool Vibe... Reminds me of South Beach.... Always busy but service is fantastic EVERYTIME I go!!! And for their yummy Sunday Brunch they have all you can drink Mimosas... Must try!! Guaranteed to be a fave!!

cCRmQkNI38gIbUSyFX6DEg.text: My first visit was last night, and it was wonderful!  The staff was amazing.  I called ahead the day before the ensure that they could accommodate for my multiple food allergies.  They called back and said absolutely.  I informed our server last night, who discussed my allergies with the chef.  They washed all of the cooking utensils before cooking my food in it and the chef even made the Jerk Chicken sauce special just for me to ensure that it was safe!  I was absolutely amazed at the lengths they were willing to go for me!  My Jerk Chicken was delicious.  I was also very impressed with their seasonal vegetable selection:  zucchini, eggplant and peppers with mushrooms.  I was in heaven.  Thank you, DW Bistro, for going above and beyond to accommodate my special dietary needs.  I will be back!  On a side note:  I was amazed by the portion sizes.  HUGE!

Oe0Pk994GHMQpZzs0nf0bg.text: What can I say - I would eat here every single day if my body could afford it. I come here with my girl every Tuesday, and not once have we been disappointed. We always get the New Mexico green chile cheeseburger.. With sweet potato fries.. My mouth is salivating as I type this! Their iced tea is to die for, as are the Bloody Marys. I recently came here with my boyfriend and he got the filet, which he was impressed with, and he is fussy when it comes to food.   Servers are amazing, always attentive and super sweet.   Ill be back next week. Hopefully sooner.  Oh! Get the carrot cake. Just get it. You'll thank me later I promise you.

ofEzLz76xc9rYT916Ow3DQ.text: Loved this place! Came here on a Saturday for brunch. I got a Bloody Mary and my hubby got mimosas Both really good! For brunch I got the flautas which were very delicious and my hubby got the pork hash! Can't wait to go back !

NYzwyksY2QvJLcqENnusoQ.text: We found our new favorite brunch spot! I have never seen so many beautiful people gathered in one place as DW Bistro for Sunday brunch! Seriously unlimited mimosas and a show you can't beat that and to top it all off the food is delicious! Even though it was crowded when we arrived we were seated quickly and the staff was very nice. We hope to go back very soon!!

A94aQCfhC42HWlZCFGMKNw.text: Nothing gets better than DW Bistros chicken and waffles and Bloody Mary's!!! Impeccable service as always.... Crowded and Fun! Little pricey for a local spot but delicious!

0YqW06lXMWAckWxnnUJPQw.text: We went to this place the other day from Yelp reviews. The first thing you notice is the bright inviting colors and decor. The staff is friendly and personable. Inside and outside dining, with plenty of room between tables and structure. So here we go...  Cons (in no particular order):   The bathroom men's sink is not mounted on center, which appears to cause water flow over the back side. Not a huge deal, but for a clean freak it leads one to believe there will be mildew on the bottom of it eventually.  Again, a bathroom thing; the refuse bin has no handle, so you must lift the lid with your hand or foot. It does appear to be made of bamboo, which is a nice environmental touch.  Price is a bit much for a local bistro. That's a personal preference point, but still.  I ordered the ahi tuna special, but was charged for the lamb chops. The price may have very well been the same, but I didn't notice it until after we left, so its a matter of distress to be sure.  Pros (again, as they spring to mind):  The staff is exceedingly friendly and personable. They make you feel attended to and welcome. One of the owners (Bryce) walked around to each table and actually talked to each guest (that I saw).  Not the usual manager walk by you see, but a sincere "how are you, where are you from, what do you think" conversation.  The food was phenomenal. Curry soup with just the right amount of zing. Seared ahi that was perfect for a fork on top of yellow and green beans that were done perfectly, with a nice crunch to them and not drowned in butter or oil. Excellent mashed potatoes. Generous portions of pasta and shrimp. Red Cake that was creamy yet not too overbearing. Strike that. If I weren't a guy I would call it luscious. If I were a violent man I'd have left that place, driven to the airport, hopped on a plane to Betty Crocker's house and slapped her across the face. It was that good.  Two words: Ginger. Beer.  Ordering an $8 shot of premium liquor gets you an $8 shot of premium liquor. Enough to fill a glass nicely.  Definitely recommend DW Bistro for a nice quiet dinner after work, but also have not tried to brunch, so I can't pigeon hole it just to night dinning. There's absolutely room for improvement to turn it into a local upper scale place to hang out, but for a little restaurant in a strip mall they are off to a superlative start. I mean, when two of the only cons for a place are in the bathroom, you know it has to be on the right track.  Please give it a try and let me know what you think.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first Jamaican Beer.

JWlKhjbUnXjso1ggC-ZrgQ.text: I love this place. The restaurant is modern, cute and chic. The food is super tasty and well presented, drinks are great and service is excellent. I don't know how I hadn't reviewed this place before. One of my favorite places in town. The food is like a modern version of Jamaican cuisine. I absolutely love it!!!

i3ziEV7zk4q6sNIcoXg7gg.text: Stopped in here for my final meal on the way to the airport (maybe 10 minutes away), and it was fabulous! Both indoor and outdoor decor are updated, and you could tell who the regulars were as they were greeted by host and manager/owner (not sure which one?) with open arms. Although the clientele made me a little nervous with their designer purses, the prices are completely reasonable, especially for the food you get.  For lunch, I had the couscous salad with perfectly prepared ahi tuna. It was incredible. My mom had the jerk chicken salad which was also good. Throughout our meal, we were check on a good amount and waters were always refilled. We probably should have stated that we were in a hurry at the beginning because they are willing to let you take your time. However, once we voiced this, they were attentive to our needs. Only downside is that I couldn't take leftovers! It was a big salad and could have easily been split into 2 meals.

D-B16cTuQkt94l0X18auyw.text: We are new to the area and read some good reviews about DW Bistro. It was a great all around! Love the modern yet comfortable decor. The food was delicious!!!! Hubby had the pork chop and said it was yummy! I had fried jerk chicken and it was excellent! Our waiter Nick was awesome - very personable and recommended very well! We will be back!!!!

8MdzkYEZVamMdSGqac5zpg.text: Wow amazing experience. Seriously impressed by this place. The atmosphere is great, the interior design is lovely, the service is fabulous and the food was delicious. What else can you ask for in a restaurant? Our server was Vidal and he was so nice and very attentive. Thumbs up!

nyZdCRs-9_zMYKvGYepk1Q.text: DW Bistro was very interesting the food wasn't as great as I had expected it to be based on all the reviews and based on the various recommendations.   During our visit we order  the breakfast taquitos and the jerk chicken and waffles.  The breakfast  taquitos were great however the Jerk chicken and waffles left much to be desired.  The location is small, but the staff is nice.  Overall,  I don't think I will be in a rush to be return.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Taquitos

wWjzO-69y2jRnpGTaGa-qA.text: I've been here twice. First time was an amazing experience, I came with 3 of my girlfriends and we had a blast. The service was great and the food was delicious. However, I was here last week with my friend and the food took about 40 minutes to arrive. It was a busy Sunday, so I didn't expect to get our food quick, but 40 minutes is unacceptable. I ordered the eggs benedict/bloody mary and my friend got the chicken and waffles. The food was delicious just like my first experience and the server was very helpful and friendly.   I just couldn't understand why it would take 40 minutes to get our food. A table sat down 30 minutes after us got their food right after we got ours. I would give this place another try but I really do wish that the consistency of the restaurant was stable.

VTtQ9ITJuA1NPkWOjcjU4Q.text: Been living in this neighborhood for 7 years, always drove pass this place and never ate here? This was pretty much the same for our entire party. Thankfully a birthday celebration brought us here!   Great attentive service. We had an 20 month old who had allergies to just about everything and our server was able to find something on the kids menu that he was able to have.   Ordered a bottle of German Riesling and that started my day! Paired with my grilled chicken Cesar, I just couldn't go wrong!   My friend had the turkey burger with sweet potato fries (that I helped myself to). Also delicious!   This is obviously a very happening spot. We came around 11am when it was empty and it quickly filled up for a lunch rush. I need to come back and sample this menu!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp salad
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken Cesar
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger and sweet potatoe fries

hmoHrbJllm1oL2Yz7Tw_UA.text: Pretty good brunch spot! I got the DW bowl that has red chile and pulled pork. Really flavorful and the portion was huge! I had to split it. Our server seemed annoyed from the start.. Kind of a bummer on the vibe of eating. I'll come back but go straight to the bar instead! They also offer bottomless mimosas for $22

K9qLyE9BOJLrj2Ltf-ibZQ.text: One of the best joints in town! Just beware it can be pretty crowed and you might want to plan ahead.

kK1Gulf8gkZEB2LXaCYKnA.text: Let me start by saying this review is strictly based on their dinner menu- I can't find anything bad to say about DW bistro!   Clean environment, polite / informative servers and high quality food.  I just kind of thought everything tasted the same and was a little bland / dry- which was extremely surprising to me because I've heard so many great things about DW Bistro!   Items ordered:  Jerk Chicken Braised Short Rib  Mac N Cheese with truffle oil  Light and crispy fried plantains  DW sauteed corn   "Capri Sunny Slope" -ok "DW margarita" -ok "DW Bloody Mary" -good "DW barrel aged white Manhattan" -not good  Maybe I just hit this place on an off night?

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Bloody
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed corn with green chili

VeZAwbgF17WYLE_EaXde9g.text: The DW bowl of New-Mexican slow-cooked pork is a curry/stew lovers DREAM. It is SO DANG hearty and GOOOD. If you're a curry/chili/stew lover like myself, and also love your spice, this is THE dish that combines the awesome elements of all of them together in one. Not sure if that made sense.   It had a kick to it, and with rice, oh-mah-gahhhhhhhd. And eggs? Oh-mah-gaaahhhhhd. What human being came up with this? Some genius, I say.  The jerk chicken and waffles were okay for me. I had the best jerk chicken of my life in Nassau, Bahamas, so my standard is a bit high here. This one was good, but not out of this world.   I forget the third dish we ordered. That must mean it wasn't memorable.  Love the interior. Service was good. I'd come back. Solid 4.7 stars.  Can't wait to try the bread basket one day.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW BOWL OF New Mexican -style slow-cooked pork. MONEYYYYYYYYY.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk fried chicken and waffles.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mystery dish...cannot recall what this was.

hq6bwlUmyYuR7TXvyIFPog.text: How have I waited this long to try DW Bistro?  Plot twist, I came here for a birthday dinner instead of brunch (which I have heard is phenomenal...) and I second all the great reviews that have been written before!    The service was top notch. Our waters were never less than half full, our server was talkative and friendly but not overly so, really down to earth staff.  And the food! AH-MAZING!  The Jerk Fried Chicken is definitely spicy spicy but the flavor was wonderful. I also had their chicken pasta which was some of the best chicken pasta I'd ever had in Vegas. It helps that it's so pretty when it comes out (w/ edible flowers!). The only disappointing thing on the menu was the fried plantains - they were a bit dry and doused in honey which made them almost too sweet.  Got a carrot cake for dessert which was DELICIOUS!  I can't wait to come back and try their brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plantains
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken bow tie pasta :)

Jj1m8dRswezxiOx-kBAW3g.text: Went for lunch today (Wednesday) and it was a very good experience.  The place is definitely hipster based, but not obnoxious.  The menu is a bit limited, especially at lunch.  The flauta and shrimp/chorizo appetizers were fresh and excellent.  The salads were very fresh as were the ahi and salmon.  I had the New Mexico chili burger, it was tasty, but the burger had the consistency of mush, very strange.  Service was very good as well.

baP1TsAy1O7eOBZpu0YZag.text: Service - great no matter who your server is  Food - I have yet to eat something I didn't like but carrot cake.... to die for  Bottomless mimosas. Def the best in LV   LOVE D DUBS

aTteyvVxJTHqVacczqdjAA.text: This was my first time at DW Bistro. I was there for Brunch. This place is AMAZING!!!! I really like the hip and chic atmosphere. Since it was Halloween, the staff was dressed in awesome costumes. They all looked great! The food was delicious ! I had the chicken and waffles, and the eggs and jalapeno bacon. The chicken had that nice and spicy taste. The staff was great!! You gotta check this place out! It's worth the drive from the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rVudGOFWBh2u7-bICyMdEQ.text: Poor service.  Second time I have been when the salmon tasted fishy.  The server was rude & argued about whether sugar was in the tea they serve.  I cannot have sugar & told him that, he brought me the tea & said I was wrong. My body had a bad reaction right away & I told himof course I know there was indeed sugar because I reacted to it. He STILL argued. I can't believe it.  Worst customer service ever.  I WON'T be back again!  Besides, what restaurant fails to offer plain black iced tea?!  Bad decision on the owner's part. I would not continue to go someplace like that anyway.  But because the server was outright rude, I am now telling everyone else I know about this experience too.

af-tGA5i_P0HeI0FmKmjHw.text: Food was very mediocre, service was good.  Came with a friend for lunch one day and it was packed. We definitely had to wait for a table. There is WIFI here, so that was nice, we could do work and eat at the same time.  We ordered the Jamaican chicken curry with cous cous and the seafood bowl. Chicken curry was good but the curry was overpowering and very plain, so I couldn't really taste anything else. The chicken was a bit dry also.  The seafood bowl had no flavors in it what so ever and I had to add salt to make it eatable. The ingredients used were very good, 2 large prawns and 2 pieces of scallops.   Service was nice and friendly, at times spotty most likely due to the crowd at lunch. Prices are slightly pricey for what you get. Parking was very easy and bathrooms are clean.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican chicken curry bowl
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HdzmvGYtetvmE9vx-aPUIw.text: Wow I'm so glad I met Brice the owner today at another local restaurant in Vegas this am . Not only am I super full ,and will be taking home my dishes , but , This place is awesome ,staff ,great decor, big portions , and eclectic combos .. I had the jerk Jamaican curry chicken , goat cheese  appetizer ,and the  house Bloody Mary, thanx to our friendly waiter ERICK we are super happy satisfied full and I def recommend this place to all my fellow travelers  Humbly HairDoc Tk.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Bloody Mary I&#39;ve had in my life wow

Ha9Y1YPwJh-KCEp0CBji6w.text: Myself and a few friends went to DW Bistro Halloween weekend for Sunday Brunch and i cannot begin to tell you how amazing my experience was. The ambiance is both inviting and modern. From the moment you walk in we were greeted by a DJ playing theTop 40 hits. As we danced to our seats our waiter dressed in a costume offered our entire table complimentary Bloody Mary shots. First met me say that i am not a fan of Bloody Mary drinks but this shot was so tasty and savor that i was surprised to finish it! Immediately we were asked for our drink orders.   Although i didn't drink and stuck with an unsweetened ice tea my friends ordered the Bloody Mary and the Jamaican mojito and they raced at how gold their drinks were. Service was phenomenal! Not much longer we were submitting our orders to the waiter. If you haven't taken a look at the menu, please do. You will simply be overwhelmed. EVERYTHING sounds so good. I had a very difficult time choosing an entree. I love a good turkey burger but i was reluctant to order their turkey burger when there were so many other entrees and i could have a turkey burger any where. I ended up sticking with my first instinct and ordering the turkey burger and i do not regret it! Their turkey burger i would rate as a 10... there is nothing basic about it. Although my server warned me that it was spicy i still ordered it because i have a high tolerance (btw it's more sweet than spicy... has a little kick). The mango, pear, apple chutney that went on top was delicious, so was the side salad that accompanied it.   My husband couldn't decide what to order so he ordered two meals lol. He got the jerk chicken and waffles which were AMAZING! The perfect balance of sweet and spicy. This is definitely our new go to spot when we visit Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DJ jamming at DW Bistro with his costume!

sHVsrUNqJW79a9DR3wtquA.text: So we finally tried this place after wanting to for forever. We went in for brunch, and while the place was packed we were immediately greeted and sat right away. This place knows service, because our entire experience was flawless, service was awesome, and the food was top notch. We had the pastry basket which was huge and more than enough for a table of 4 (we were 2 with a toddler). We also tried the challah French toast, which was simple but extremely well executed and delicious. We also had the friend jerk chicken and corn bread Benedict which was one of the specials, and it was perfect. They also brought out lots of carribbean hot sauces for us to try which were nice and spicy. My boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich which is one of their signature dishes, and for good reason. First, it's huge, second, it was the best breakfast sandwich I've had. We look forward to our next visit.

RsW-JMovhIk6HRVi2OkAtg.text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday with a group of about 6 people. We got in within 5 min which was nice considering how busy they were.   We all had the "bottomless mimosas" and they don't mess around. My glass was constantly full. And they even put some fruit in the glasses as well. The food was delicious as well. I had the slow cooked pork omelet, it was huge! And so good. Prices were pretty reasonable. We def will be back.

9ot0YD0sNHvJR-KUJT3fVg.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(172/365) "Lured By Patron"  So we finally decided to give DW Bistro one more try for Marie's birthday a while back, again for Sunday Brunch and totally pushing my first visit experience aside, Wifey ordered the special Jerk Chicken Benedict and I went for the New Mexican Slow Cooked Pork Bowl.  The Jerk spices on the chicken got a little tiring with more bites, and the dry cornbread and soft boiled(again, not correctly poached) egg didn't make this dish any better. The pork bowl was huge in potion size, kinda like a Caribbean style loco-moco, full of spice, but lacking salt. I actually had to ask for the salt shaker and I'm not one to sprinkle additional salt on my food!   Unfortunately, the company we had was much better than the food we ordered, and we had such a blast that our noise level got up to 100 decibels(yup,someone broke out a decibel meter on their smartphone!) and after 3 hours we got the boot. How? Our waiter tells us "My boss would like to offer you guys free Patron shots....out on the patio. Nice way of freeing up the tables...great, more alcohol knowing that a few people in our party were already plastered from unlimited mimosas inside. I just hope one of DW Bistro's guests don't cause an accident or fatality on the road. ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  2.5

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice way to kick us out to the patio....complimentary GTFO Patron shots
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With Dalton, Chef/Owner of DW Bistro
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch at DW Bistro with the gang

X3M4t9jfftOWjeopozIRLg.text: I received excellent service and the food was pretty tasty. I ordered chicken fluatas, seared tuna salad (spices on the side), and a slice of carrot cake to go.  Chicken fluatas flavor 5/5 - Delicious!  Tuna salad flavor 4/5 - It needed more tuna slices. Carrot cake flavor 4/5 - I didn't care for the heavy frosting, but the cake was delicious! Interior and exterior decor was very modern retro feel with a little bit of artsy playful funk. :)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The final bill
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor patio
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna salad. Spices on the side, it just needed more slices of tuna. Great flavor.

uSV8nEylsYVyxWBMpFE2_A.text: Located in another strip mall in Las Vegas, you wouldn't guess that this restaurant is actually pretty good.  It was easy to find, and lots of parking.  We were immediately seated - the space is very clean and spacious.  They staff was friendly, super nice and attentive - they provided excellent customer service.  Now onto the food: The boyfriend and I shared the chicken flautas and the jerk pork hash.  The chicken flautas were amazing.  All the flavors and textures were balanced and it was a good sized appetizer to share with a group of 4 or even 6 people - though you would only get one piece if you shared with 5 other people.  It was a great appetizer to start with.  In addition, my friends enjoyed it so much that we had to order another one to share as a group.  We also decided to share the jerk pork hash.  We decided to order the full size because we thought it was going to be a small portion.  Boy, we sure were wrong about that.  When the meal came, we asked the server to place it in the middle.  We were wrong about that as well because when the server asked where to place the other half, we were dumbfounded.  When we were ordering, I briefly mentioned to our waiter that we were going to share the jerk pork hash.  He took it upon himself to have the kitchen do it for us and they plated it in two different plates.  It's such a small detail, but it surely impressed all of us.  The jerk pork hash had a little bit of a kick to it.  It was flavored well, the portion was huge for a half size, and when I kept digging further down in the bowl, I found the potatoes.  You would think that the potatoes would be mushy but they weren't, however, they were not crispy either.    Overall, we were impressed by the portion of the meals, the flavors, and the service they provided.  If I was in the area again, I would come back to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half portion of the jerk pork hash. That egg is a game changer. Nom!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas. These were delicious!

WWQz1nyI36NNtgxwHCxo4A.text: I went in today to get their jerk chicken sandwich to go. I called in the order and was greeted on the phone by Cydny. They say the customer service is dying but deafly not with this young lady. In an era of political correctness I found it refreshing and very endearing the way she spoke to me and smile throughout the conversation .   When my sandwich came out Sydney recited it back to me verbatim. I waited at the bar for the bartender to ring me out but he was engaged with other guests. Sydney got another member of the staff to ring me up. I should have checked the sandwich but i was a bit disappointed. This resto used to have the most beautiful bowl of bacon right by the bar.  I asked for some extra bacon on the sandwich. It was repeated back to me. What I received was two little cross crossed strips.  The sandwich was ok. I was kind of shocked to see how thin, dry,and small the chicken breast was.  For a price point of 14$ I think they are over charging.   Flavor wise It's hard to judge food when you get it to go due to condensation and travel time etc. the size of the piece of chicken however is not affected by those factors.  If it want for the wonderful experience with Sydney, I would have given it a 2.

C98jmUIbZgAGs0yB1acNbg.text: I hate to say it, but this place was over-hyped for me.  It's Memorial Day weekend and my friends and I walk in on Sunday morning for brunch. A DJ is present and playing pretty good 90's Hip Hop and R&B, just what we like. We are actually impressed that there's an actual DJ, lol.  The ambience in here is on the more upscale side of casual. It's very cute. Bougie decor. Great for pictures. Located right in the heart of The Gramercy.  We are seated promptly and our server is very attentive. My girlfriend orders bottomless mimosas, a pork chile omelette, and chicken flautas. I order the special tiger shrimp omelette with a Caribbean sidecar (this drink has Hennessy privilege in it with sweet simple syrup... so good), and my friend's husband orders the fried jerk chicken and waffles.  1) Our server spilled my drink on the table and a bit on myself and on my belongings. He was very sorry, however, and continued to clean it all up. 2) My girlfriend got the wrong food delivered to our table. So that had to be fixed. 3) My omelette was very bland. Not enough shrimp, not enough Hollandaise sauce, the potatoes had zero flavor. I was not very impressed by my meal. I was more impressed with the appetizer of the chicken flautas, to be honest.  Will I give this place another chance? Maybe. But I think I would like to come back for lunch or dinner with better options for entrees. I feel like my meal was not satisfying. I would def like to come back for bottomless mimosas.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special: tiger shrimp omelette with Hollandaise sauce
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caribbean sidecar - very good
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas (we should have ordered more of these, honestly)

as5Jd0Xfzyuw1j-HCkE8Kg.text: Very hip and cosmopolitan dining experience in Las Vegas. Feels more like you are in Miami or San Diego.  Tropical and florid, the decor takes you away from the desert.  It appears to be influenced by one of the owner's Caribbean roots.  And that's a good thing. Yet, it is not shabby chic, but sophisticated.  The food is very thoughtfully and confidently prepared. Bold flavors and inventive takes on traditional favorites, like chilaquiles, breakfast burritos, tacos, and rice bowls.  Spicy is the order of the day! But not heat for heat's sake...it's slow-simmered flavor. My favorite is the New Mexican Spicy pork rice bowl with an egg on top.  Wow.  It's huge, and very satisfying.  You MUST try their Carrot Cake with what appears to be gold flakes.  Just do it.  Share it.  It's enormous...and worth the calories.  No one I've been with here has not enjoyed their meal--with one exception. But the owner came right over and gave my sister-in-law a different dish than the one she had misunderstood when she ordered. They have a full bar, too, in case you're wondering.  They have bottomless mimosas, and pair alcoholic drinks well with your food.  I don't spoil my appetite with drinking, but appreciate their effort. Price for food is what you expect for a high-end, well-executed, upscale brunch experience. I think this is a classic brunch place, although of course, I take it they do lunch and dinner, too. Another plus is just how diverse the crowd is here.  You almost never see so many people of different backgrounds in one place in Las Vegas.  This place looks like the United Nations, and seems as worldly.  Another good thing.  The lack of 5 stars: It's really, really busy.  Oh, yes, that's a good thing, and creates a very charged, exciting vibe.  But it's less fun when you're waiting for a table for brunch.  Sometimes you'd rather be at a place where you don't want to feel you have to be an "A lister" to get right in and eating.  (Not that they're like that. Seems the staff is fairly egalitarian).  But that's not necessarily DW Bistro's fault.  They can't help that they're popular.  They moved to this location to better accommodate their burgeoning fans.  Parking is also a bit challenging.

9WNKdJpsE6WNOSpfptkpCQ.text: Excellent food.  Mediocre service. definitely not two $$.   Dropped $100 on a simple lunch.

Z617TfaeoT2PDUim5upfBg.text: You want good service? Come here! The food was AMAZING, and the drinks kept coming! We literally finished food 2 hours ago, and they are still keeping our drinks flowing! So thankful for Juan and the other amazing staff here! So worth every dime. Come here if you want great food and even more amazing service!

a4GbdDKpB_cn9LkK3syFDA.text: This place blew my socks off. The atmosphere was great, service impeccable and the food was out of this world. I had the curry chicken on brown rice. It was huge, I could only eat half. It was full of vegetables that were cooked perfectly al dente. This was the tastiest curry dish I have ever had. I cannot recommend this place enough

UwKIu9ydaTU-P2yIHrPIjw.text: I'M STILL DROOLING. When I originally looked at the menu I didn't think I would like anything...I usually don't like jerk chicken! I opted for the cobb salad and OMGGG. Seriously one of thee best salads I've ever had. So much flavor I can't even put it in to words or describe it. It was such a huge lunch portion that I didn't think I would finish it but honestly I just shoved the entire thing down my throat. I could not stop eating it. I wish I could explain how much flavor there was and I wish I knew the right adjectives to describe the chicken and the salad and the dressing but I honestly cant. It was just pure deliciousness. I can't wait to go back. The decor is beautiful. The vibes and atmosphere are awesome. And the service was amazing. I have absolutely no critiques or criticisms, it is truly one of the best! (and not overly pricey either!)

Fgkm4FnU8OG8cu6OMrZlVw.text: I live across the street, but that's not why I'm biased. They have amazing food, like AMAZING, not just saying that. And when they say bottomless mimosas, they really mean it. We stopped eating 2 hours ago, but they moved us to the patio to keep drinking. World class service.

QdTSjj3fAzX7CVlgVPe7SQ.text: Excellent food and service every time! Must check this spot out for Brunch!  The Jamaican Mule and Gin & Juice cocktails are my favorite! For food, you can't go wrong. I recommend the Jerk Chicken & Waffles and Chilaquiles

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless Mimosas &amp; grilled chicken sandwich w/ sweet potato fries!

7i5vdRPpK8UK2D4_Y6dBQg.text: Amazing food every time I stop by. Sunday brunch is a religion to some people.   I ordered the New Mexican Green Chile Cheeseburger (Jack Cheese, Jalapeno Bacon, Heirloom Tomato, Potato Bung, which was fantastic. Ordered it medium, which I only do at restaurants where I trust the cooks. Great flavor and a hearty burger with a great mix of flavors, the Chile and heirloom tomatoes singing together.   Got the salad instead of the sweet potatoes fries, which I was sad about until I saw the side salad had candies walnuts and goat cheese (or feta, I forget now).   Friend had the New Mexican Pork Bow and seemed to like it. Her only complaint was that the restaurant didn't have almond milk for her coffee.   I need to have lunch here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ImpxDt6d4jZkS_ZbrNmonQ.text: Always heard about this place so we tried it Sunday before last.   They had a function going on.   We absolutely loved this place.  It was late afternoon so they were closing soon so we did not get to try the food.   But everything looked  delicious.   The drinks were great.  The vibes were awesome.  The DJ was spinning great tunes.   This place reminded me of a happening WeHo place.  The owner came by and chatted with us.   What a fun place!   Can't wait to go back.  Bottomless mimosas are a definite plus! Open modern airy cheerful place!

7OKeqR3ZzsN35O4Vqzs21w.text: It's been six years since we lived in Las Vegas and I was a little worried our favorite place wouldn't still be as great as we remembered. It was. They're still my favorite chicken flautas I've ever had and the jerk spices on the chicken bowl and the sauce on the turkey burger is on point. Definitely an all time Vegas favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas

W7VCVS6-BRpX6PtFHA6_5g.text: I am not one for "Bistros", but I had heard through the grapevines that DW's was the spot to have an amazing Brunch while in Vegas. I dropped in on a Sunday, mid-morning, and there was no wait.  I decided to just sit at the bar though as I am a fan of talking it up with the Bartenders, and learning about the area and foods.   The staff was friendly and informative about the items on the menu along with their well-known drinks. I took the bartenders advice and order DW's Eggs Benedict with Ham. Moreover, I thought I would also get a bowl of Steel Oats. Service was prompt and I got my Steel Oats first. It was prepared well and included sides for me to add if I wanted. Overall, it was good and quite a bit of food. Next came DW's Eggs Benedict, and I have to say I have had many Eggs Benedict's, but this one takes them all. I say this even though the egg wants as runny as I would have liked it. The ham was thick and cooked just right. The English muffin was slightly thicker than normal which allowed the hollandaise sauce to soak into the bread, and I am a big fan of that. Now not knowing about DW's hollandaise sauce, I took my first bit and about fell out of my chair. It had everything you would want in a good hollandaise sauce, but with a little kick (spicy). By far the best eggs benny I have ever had. I will be looking to drop in for another brunch at DW's ready for another mouth adventure.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW&#39;s Eggs Benedict with Ham
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steel Oats with Berries, Coconut Shavings, and raisins.

VgHSxqTMmqzpjEyhWO8EfA.text: Fantastic food we started with the beignets that are to die for. Place is a little funny to find but is bright and welcoming staff was on point went for breakfast on a Saturday at 10.30 and it wasn't crazy busy. Food was great everyone loved their meals and we all shared and tasted each other's meals Had a photo by the gold piano as we left but we will be back

DbysjgrGY1nmf7hokno6qg.text: Love DW Bistro!! The lunch turkey burger with a salad is delicious.  Staff is always smiling and friendly .

k4ONx2K9pUjT3GT_J8P-8A.text: How you guys shut the kitchen down at 2pm on a SUNDAY??   Come on... change your hours if that's the case.

2k0Wye_l1dB809P5d3-ygA.text: DW is a fantastic Vegas brunch spot; I've been going here on a regular basis for a few years now, even prior to their relocation to the Gramercy.    The food is delicious, the staff members are super friendly, and the vibrant decor evokes feelings of a tropical getaway.   Some worthy mentions include the spicy Bloody Mary, the jalapeno bacon breakfast sandwich, the jerk chicken dipped in hollandaise, and the pastry platter. Don't forget to ask for a bottle of the calypso hot sauce!

7AELS-K7nH_8IkYWvBeRJA.text: My boyfriend and I most recently went to their happy hour at their new location in the Gramercy and everything was superb!   The ambience, service and food was nothing short of amazing.   Their unique carrot cake is a must get every time so be sure to leave room for dessert!

Uat2zbIMDjN-eAwQQb2aAg.text: Last time I came, my experience was not so memorable. The Rudy ( the GM) sent me an email. I have to say, every time you have a bad experience and you write a bad review, the GM invite you back for a free meal or want to send you a gift certificate ( I never accept it). This time, it was different.. Rudy sent me a very personal email, about dropping the ball. I know buy experience, everybody can have a bad day, even a chef can cook you a bad meal and missed.  Due to the professionalism of Rudy, I decide for one time to take the offer and came back with a friend. My meal was spot on and my friend was happy.   I really want to thanks Rudy for being one of the few GM in town who really and sincerely cares about his customers.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best vetebale burger in town. I keep talking about it...

rp_Wnsm7lwla43JqnLA9aA.text: Amazing food, amazing bottomless mimosa special. Best of all was the service. I've been here several times and have always had exceptional service. Haley L. Was truly amazing, a stand out in all my experiences. Made us feel comfortable, helped explain well and was very attentive. Thank you for making this another great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Flautas. Soo good.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles, season fruit and bottomless mimosas. Amazing. Truly recommended.

4M66xKtfCYDgOiF-C1txuA.text: We moved to Vegas 6 months ago and we weren't sure if we pick a good area to live because there are no many restaurants around. Finding this spot today make us reassure to renew our lease.  I found this awesome place through other yelpers. We went for brunch today and it was spectacular. The place is beautiful and the vibe was incredible. So many large groups, several of them celebrating a friend's birthday. It was a little noisy for me, but so vibrant that I did not care. I order the Eggs Benedict and my husband the chicken and waffles. I love Eggs Benedict so I try them every time I have a chance and I have to say these are now in my top 5! The eggs were perfect, the hollandaise sauce had a spicy (I believe Jamaican) twist that was simply unbelievable. I tried my husband food and both the chicken and the waffle were delicious, even though the chicken was too spicy for me. He loved it, but he prefers this dish to have southern flavor instead of Jamaican. Coffee was really good. I had a Cappuccino. My only complaint will be if they could include different type of milks for coffee, such as lactose free or almond milk.  I also had a mimosa. They offer 2 options: a glass for $12 or all you can drink for $22. Good options to pick from. I saw many people ordering the bloody mary. It looked spectacular with bacon flowing out of the glass. I read the owner was born in Jamaica and moved to the US when he was 7. I saw him at the bar entertaining customers and refilling mimosa. It was great seeing him around.

L5cc7wLwpkgzOGCgZnq47Q.text: My impression was what's an amazing restaurant like this doing in a small SW strip mall? This place should be in the Bellagio I'm serious! Absolutely amazing all around.  Definitely take the time to come eat here, You will fall in love with the place.. DW BISTRO

yMNteKWVxKn2nM_vN-0wkQ.text: This place can get very busy, especially on holidays and Sundays, but it is well worth the wait. We came here on Mother's Day and were told that there would be a pretty lengthy wait, but ended up with a table within 30 minutes thanks to Bryce at the front door.   The atmosphere and decor are very chic, but comfortable. This place is exactly what we need more of in Vegas, which is why it is so popular.

S2s7ddZ8r31_iMKndBsMnA.text: Probably eaten here eight more times since my previous reviews.  What can I say? It is the very first place to pop into my head whenever Sunday brunch or a nicer lunch is in the works.    Brunch with the fam yesterday was a dreamy success as usual.  We started with a DW pastry basket.  It is a steal at $8. Everything inside is warm and buttery and just darn good on a Sunday morning: blueberry scones, turnovers, cranberry popovers, cinnamon roll and chocolate croissant.  They serve it with butter and a scrumptious jelly on the side.    Dad struggles to fit the gargantuan BLT in his mouth gracefully but was pleased with it, nonetheless.  Hubby cleaned the plate on his nicoise salad.  The tuna looked awesome.    I can't believe I haven't mentioned the very refreshing and tasty pomegranate iced tea.  It is lightly sweetened and very refreshing.  They keep your tall, pretty glass refilled too!  On our most recent ladies lunch, my co-diners were thrilled with a special of shell pasta, grilled chicken and veggies in a blue cheese sauce.  That's part of the fun of coming here!! Completely different specials every time.  Brunch yesterday boasted a special eggs Benedict on a country biscuit with a special sausage and a cognac sauce.    The place is always jamming now...so glad they are successful and busy.   It is definitely 5 star worthy now.  Everyone is beyond friendly and things are flowing seamlessly.

_dEzmWbu5R92KGcZxT7tBQ.text: Love this place!! I love the decor of the restaurant and the food is so good. My favorite thing on the menu is the calamari but everything is delicious.

j65BEg5vOwXuY3m631luQg.text: Ive been here for brunch a couple times and have enjoyed it immensely.  Bloody Marys are YUMMMM, Service is awesome and its very clean and the decor is pleasant.Jerk Chicken and Waffles is some of the best in Vegas. Spicy and sweet and te hot sauce choices are much welcomed and appreciated!

dyrm9-CvFdGEjYRTTXGIfw.text: The green chili burger is the best in all of Las Vegas.  Yes, you read that right.  The best burger in the whole city.  The side salad that comes with the burger instead of fries is wonderful.  The turkey burger is also very good but be warned that it's a little spicy.  The seared tuna salad is a great choice  The patio outside makes this a nice place to kick back and enjoy a meal with friends.  I haven't been for brunch yet and I plan to try a bacon bloody mary very soon.  I have ordered take out quite a few times and it's always neatly packaged and just as ordered.  Great iced tea.  Adding another soup to the menu would make me happy.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Burger In Town

VGhxKW7Uue-b2e4u03Dwfw.text: On a Sunday Funday, it's ALWAYS a BLAST!! Can't go wrong with the "Hair of the Dog" Rose sparkling wine with jalapeno bacon! YES!

XkgmT41x7fSzXCZvJJVpUA.text: Highly recommend. I had the hanger steak, it was cooked perfect and tasted excellent. It's worth the drive from the strip.

nxBLM_B01Os2501qFGoLZw.text: This place is amazing! You cannot go wrong. I had the jerk chicken and waffles and it was delicious. Beautiful atmosphere and the owners are so nice and friendly. Bryce accommodated myself and my husband at the last minute and made sure our experience was great. The customer service from our server was impeccable and he was super friendly. Love this place officially my new "Las Vegas go to"

eyBL5ZtVfOVz3o80w30ejA.text: Recommended: Wasatch White Ale, Pesto Torte, Mac and Cheese With Truffle Oil, DW Homemade cornbread, Braised Oxtail, DW Fried Chicken, Pan Seared Salmon  It's not just delicious, it's genius!  We've been here several times and tried something new each time even though it's tempting to just get the same great stuff over and over again.  The menu is that good. The dishes are crafted: everything is deliberate down to the garnishes.  Clean your plate without shame.

h_9tbgl1N6NM1M8aAEYx-g.text: Thank you to Luis for his amazing service! Right from the beginning he made my husband and I feel welcome and answered any questions we had about the menu and the history of DW Bistro.  My husband and I had their margaritas, pork shoulder bowl and short ribs with mashed potatoes. The food was TO DIE FOR.   We told Luis it was our first time at DW and he even gave us a special carrot cake dessert to sample.   If we could give this place 6 stars we would. We will certainly be back and we will be requesting Luis as our server!

DsKVrzIQZAigMUNLVxdH7Q.text: I hung out with them at land rover Las Vegas at a wonderful event where they where showing there support..... Models for mutts ASPCA event.....   If you are craving jerk flavor with a twist take the time to check them out!....  The Red velvet cake is awesome:)

Ncze2RqGwBUeGaTMY_HR2g.text: As with most great places in Vegas, this little gem is hidden in a strip mall on the far west side of town.  Dont be fooled by the outside, and dont let the distance scare you if you're from Hendo.  I finally mustered up the effort to travel to that side of town. I'm kicking myself for not going sooner.    This place is amazing.  It's small and it gets loud during brunch, but the food is incredible.  The staff is extremely pleasant and attentive, especially when it comes to refilling the mimosas.  The food was great and the menu has so many wonderful choices on it.  Portions are large and this is a perfect way to spend a long brunch on a sunday morning/afternoon.  Also, if DW wants to offer unlimited flautas and mimosas for $50, i'll take up residence at the bar.  The flautas are just. That. Good.  One tip for you: Don't bother looking at the menu before you go to try and figure out what you want. The daily specials will make you re-think your choice several times over.

PAHYZNP6sd5qaCvs7Pv8Yg.text: So you drive into the parking lot of a random strip mall and see a restaurant with "Bistro" in the name. Based on my personal experience, that normally would mean that the restaurant would need to be avoided.  But that generalization certainly does not apply to this place.   This establishment is one of those rare gems where you can achieve three- to four-star restaurant quality flavors at a one- to two-star price.  We came with a large party of 9 for lunch, and everyone was satisfied with their choices. My personal favorites were the couscous salad, which featured perfectly seared and seasoned ahi tuna as well as a perfect level of acidity in the couscous, and the Jamaican curry chicken, which had the right amount of spice countered with a seemingly endless variety of greens. Certainly, fresh ingredients are clearly the focus at DW's.  Not many folks would expect such quality for entree prices identical to those at Applebee's.  Drinks are also tasty and generous in terms of their alcohol/cost ratios.  The atmosphere is hip but very informal and relaxed. Servers are cordial, attentive, and have a keen sense of humor.  If you are visiting Las Vegas and have a car, do not hesitate to drop by this restaurant if you need a break from that casino prime rib or buffet special.

dcNPRq8bmzzFd5n52Jbmuw.text: Jalapeno Bacon Eggs Benedict?  WINNER! Better get here right when it opens or you will be waiting awhile as their brunch here is amazing. I mean I can only really vouch for their Eggs Benedict, but the waiter was so awesome that he allowed me to get half classic, and half jalapeno bacon because I wanted to try both.  Both were amazing, and that bacon; man it haunts me!  I haven't tried but I hear they have bacon in their Bloody Mary too!  I believe this is a legit brunch spot and intend to come back and try more menu items!  Excited!

Hw9ny7tTodkTA54aaNUcMQ.text: There is one reason why I gave this place the extra star, the food here is excellent, although I do suggest getting it to go due to the lack of good service. But I'd rather spend my money elsewhere where the business cares about the customer, afterall we are the reason they stay open.  Waiters/waitresses need to know their boundaries as to what type of remarks to have to say to their guests. Obviously in this atmosphere neither their front of house staff nor the owner cares what we think of how they treat us. I had invited my best friend here for a lovely lunch and instead had an overall bad experience. We were very disappointed in the service and how the owner handled it... I just won't be returning.
