HGFm8dgmQfkdeu8p2dxrHA.text: Hosts were awesome & very polite !! We had the bottomless mimosas & food was excellent!  Would like to see bottomless bloody Mary's as well!

AIaYTSzmUPPgY4dB9KvI1g.text: First timer here! Our server was awesome and the entire staff is friendly! The inside is very modern and beautifully decorated. $22 bottomless mimosas and delicious food. Very cute place for girls brunch or date. Definitely will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas are made with flour tortillas.. still pretty good and filling.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half an order of NM pork bowl. Not spicy at all and still had lots of flavor.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My chocolate chip pancakes were burnt on the bottom  :( Syrup has rum in it btw.

063vk9ONQt32ledviEXBGg.text: First time to DW tonight.  It's in the Gramercy and not visible from the street but well worth looking for. It a tidy small restaurant with a cool vibe and modern decor.  Not sure what to expect but was pleased with the Caribbean influenced menu.  We didn't have a full dinner but sampled a salad, soup and wings. All were excellent with service to match. Looking forward to coming back for a full dinner!  Thanks!

9KnVB2o1eBViEmLfuH8wCw.text: Amazing service, amazing food, amazing staff, amazing owners, amazing space. Simply put this place is incredible and run like a well oiled machine! I recommend this place for Brunch, power lunch and dinner! Be sure to book a reso they book up fast!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SDqb2BMcunVLXviPxYrTJg.text: I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but we absolutely hated the food here. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch~ we had the Jamaican chicken curry bowl and a bowl of the Jamaican chicken curry soup.  I can't rightfully say that I've ever had Jamaican curry, but as a connoisseur of Thai curry, Indian curry and a lover of Jamaican jerk chicken-- it seemed like this was a safe bet.  The curry soup was very bland and It just wasn't good. I was left wanting some sort of sweetness, or tanginess, or something. It was just off and lacked any type of identifiable flavor (other than curry).  The Jamaican chicken curry bowl wasn't good either. It was just meh. All the ingredients seemed fresh and the chicken wasn't weird or anything-- it was just completely void of any flavor. It tasted like curry powder and nothing else. The chicken tasted like curry powder, the rice-- curry powder-- the zucchini-- curry powder.   The restaurant was very clean, modern and cool looking. The service was fine. The food was just not very good. Such a letdown, because the vibe in this place was great!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican curry bowl and soup
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

Gz_QDlUjenenwOBrVe12gQ.text: Fantastic brunch! I've had eggs Benedict at several locations throughout Las Vegas and DW Bistro's Salmon Eggs Benedict is hands down one of the best I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Eggs Benedict!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexico Sopapillas with apples, cinnamon and sugar
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary!

0Y5cEtWB1bZ9Q8DXXoyYKA.text: Came here for lunch, very friendly service and they have a nice outside seating area. Place is a little difficult to find, its easiest to go into the center of the whole complex and you'll find it if you're lost. Had the Jerk chicken sammy, had some good flavor and was at a spicy level 6 out of 10 for me. Could have definitely used some more acid or something to balance the spiciness. Sweet potato fries were crisp, spicy aioli. Also we tried the Jerk curry bowl with Pickapeppa spicy mango hot sauce. Flavor was really great, but not that spicy. Overall experience was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken sammy

YKG7H6S48M01obS61qccYw.text: Our first time here. Since we were on that side of town and had heard so many positive comments we tried their  Sunday Brunch this morning. I must confess the food  we ordered was just so so. Sorry. Perhaps brunch is not the best way to enjoy DW on your first visit. Somewhat disappointed. Service was excellent, we sat at the bar. Good, not great Bloody Mary's. High energy, great vibe, and it was packed. Eclectic menu to chose from. Ciao

6jSULGLV0laPElHcIVfJ2w.text: DW Bistro has recently made it to one of my favorite brunch places.  Pastry basket is a must and can easily feed 4. We got a butter croissant, pain au chocolat, blueberry scones, and madelines shaped as mini muffins. The pain au chocolat was decadently delicious with semi melted chocolate, the madeline was perfect for dunking into coffee, and the blueberry scone was lovely and moist, but perhaps a little too sweet. The only thing missing from the basket was clotted cream. Scones are just not the same without clotted cream and it would have also balanced out the sweetness of the blueberry scone. I skipped the butter croissant as I also ordered the Challah French toast, which I really didn't need... I'm just a sucker for French toast.  The Challah French toast was fluffy and light, and again, probably enough to feed 4, but I ate it all by myself. I would have preferred the syrup on the side, but I didn't think to ask for it.  Can't wait to return to try out more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Challah French toast with sautéed bananas.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry basket. Items rotate, this basket had a butter croissant, chocolate croissant, blueberry scone, and madelines.

puPHMdc0vZ4F4SWIW6HsTg.text: Second time coming here, but first time dining. They usually have a long wait time, but this time we were seated right away. They have a themed brunch every few months and we happened to come during "I love 80's" theme. The music was fun and the vibe was very lively. I ordered a Bloody Mary, which was a little too pickles for my taste, but not bad. Girlfriend got bottomless mimosas which she thoroughly enjoyed. The salmon and spinach eggs Benedict was savory, with a sweet hollondaise on top. The salmon was prepared well and melted in your mouth. The chicken flautes had a spicy kick, very crispy on the outside and the chicken on the inside was almost creamy, with the peppers the dish was complete. Their customer service here was fantastic, never an empty glass and always a friendly smile. Would defiantly come again.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BtLsflbZHStAjWaydCGR1g.text: AMAZING experience at DW Bistro. A little tricky to find because you can't see the front from the parking lot. It's inside the tall building, just go up the stairs. Sadly we missed brunch but was still able to order our usual BM drinks. Our waiter was the best! He warned us that the BMs were very spicy and I told him I couldn't handle too much spice so he said he would add more tomato juice if that was the case.  - DW Blood Mary The spiciest BM I've ever had in my life, I'm pretty sure he mentioned the vodka was soaked in jalapenos or maybe it was a spicy Jamaican vodka? I can't remember. The presentation was beautiful, came in a tall glass with a slice of pickle.. my fave! They were very generous with the bacon slices too, it was sooo good! Once I added the extra juice and let the water dilute the drink it was really good!  My bf ordered another drink, it must've been off the menu because I can't find it. It was a chilled coffee with alcohol served in a martini glass with espresso beans. Holy crap was this drink strong! I think this is what put us over the edge. We were on a good one after sharing this.  - DW Cobb Salad Definitely needed this after a long weekend of drinking. This salad was so refreshing, it hit the spot. The chicken was cooked perfectly, not too dry. There was a generous amount of avocado. If you enjoy cobb salads I highly recommend this.  - New Mexican Pork Comes with two over easy eggs, rice and flour tortilla. I don't know if it was the BMs since it was so spicy but this was difficult for me to eat because I swear this dish has a kick to it! I wish I was able to eat more of this because it was so damn good!! Our waiter boxed this up for me and I sadly left it at my parents house since we had a flight to catch back home. I need to order this again the next time I come back.  Our waiter was kind enough to bring out a GIANT carrot cake. Just when I wasn't able to eat anymore he brings this out on the house and I almost lost it. I love sweets. It has pieces of white chocolate on top and inside the cake. My bf and I INHALED this cake it was that good!! Thank you to our waiter that was so kind to us and made our lunch experience here amazing. I didn't catch his name but I think it was Michael. We'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb a$$ carrot cake and really strong alcoholic coffee drink in the back. Don&#39;t know the name might be off the menu.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Cobb Salad and New Mexican Pork
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Bloody Mary -- careful very spicy!

aqQnBULIACoPoRv_OOjuDQ.text: I lived here for 15 years (transplant from  Northern California). I can't say enough great things about this restaurant but let me start by saying this; we have numerous fantastic dining choices on the strip, when my friends come to visit while staying in the strip, ask me "where shall we go for a fantastic meal?" I pick them up from the strip and I take them here.  Now I have over 8 friends that go every time they are in town, while staying on the strip. The service, the menu, the ambience here is simply fantastic! Please note that I have dined at over 50 restaurants locally and dine out frequently.  This is a an absolute must visit spot for visitors and my favorite spot as a local!  If you happen to be here on a Sunday afternoon...not a better brunch in town! Get there early because it fills fast and people tend to spend their afternoon there!!

9FjnvlZACuQBJnAodxt00g.text: I absolutely love DW !!! I've been here so many times and it still has yet to disappoint me . The service is incredible and  the food is AMAZING ! The owners are so nice and usually come to the table to make sure everything is ok . The jerk chicken sandwich with the side salad is my go to ! If you haven't already been here, you are missing out .

OPImMSdIYLhhxjS-11yM1g.text: This was my first time dropping by since the relocation to Gramercy and I was not disappointed. Bigger and better. Still my favorite local brunch spot hands down. My favorite dishes are the jerk chicken and waffles and the salmon and spinach egg Benedict and to top it all of with bottomless mimosas. The perfect way to start off my day.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xQwuK40nSUrUoFu5jH13Nw.text: Their new location is beautiful. Very bright and a nice open space. I have had some real hit and miss meals at DW. I've enjoyed brunch in the past but felt it was overpriced for the portion size.   One time I went with a group of 8 and we shared and I can't say any item stood out to me as something I want to try again. I ordered the New Mexico pork chili bowl and I didn't enjoy it. I found it bland with no spice. Surprised that people rage about it.  I'm not a fan of their jerk chicken so avoid anything with jerk chicken. I usually stick to the Cobb salad or curry bowl after trying too many disappointing meals.   Yesterday I had their curry chicken bowl with couscous which was always my go to favorite meal to order and it was curry soup! The flavor was also off. I'm not sure why it was so watery but I don't remember it ever being that soupy.   Lunch crowd gets very busy on a week day which was surprising due to their location.  It's funny I continue to come back but it's usually friends or coworkers that bring me back but I think next time I'm going to suggest somewhere else!

3pS5Icn-TJUs0IEqhfig7A.text: Carrot Cake is to die for! Whoever you are and if you like carrot cake or not, this cake should be a bucket list item because it's that good. It does have chopped nuts in there, so a bummer to those with a nut allergy. We got the asada fries and the chicken fried steak with cornbread- both super delicious. The cornbread was a star alone- very moist. This is a great place if you aren't craving any specific cuisine because it has a little bit of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy chicken steak with cornbread
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Carrot Cake pure bliss. Must try!!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily Tacos ;)

THyxNx5u8MNU5zhSzuKDvQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for ever.  It is definitely worth going.  FYI they can be a little hard to find.  They are located in the Gramercy up the stairs.  There's a tiny DW sticker on the side of the road and the main entrance is in the middle courtyard.  We came for brunch, lingered for a couple hours, and during that time it was about 1/2 full, so no need to worry about a wait yet.  They don't take reservations for 4 people (maybe it was 6 and up?)  Our table shared the DW Pastry Basket, which was a popular item in the restaurant because most of the other tables also ordered the same thing.  I understood why as soon as we got our platter.  The scones were moist and delicious, the croissants were sooo buttery, and the house jam was a nice touch.  Only thing missing!!  Clotted cream.  I hope they add this to this platter and then you would find me camping out here all. the. time.  This platter is so filling that If you're 4 girls like we were, ordering a pastry basket is probably enough food.    But that's not the way I roll.  I also got the Jerk Fried Chicken and Waffles.  I don't know why, but as soon as a restaurant offers Chicken & waffles I have to get it.  I've been disappointed in the past with soggy waffles and chicken, but they've done an excellent job there.  I like the jerk spice seasoning on the chicken (this one is boneless) and their breakfast syrup is really good too.  I noticed vanilla bean and cardamon(?).  In any case, a great combo all together.  My friend who was on the same wavelength got the french toast which looked really delicious as well.  Overall, fantastic flavours, very reasonable prices and portions, really great friendly staff.  Looking forward to being back!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Pastry Basket.  Worth it!  Delicious!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles w/ extra jerk sauce.  Waffles were crispy, chicken well seasoned.

HDuYI7P53DO1BHae4zxgvA.text: Hands down my absolute favorite! Staff is incredible Setting is modern clean and refined Menus has awesome takes on classics- gotta LOVE the New Mexico flare thrown in the menu- If you know anything about Nm cuisine or you want a True taste of authentic NM- the NM Pork bowl IS A MUST and is very authentic.  Can't say how much we love this place and love the staff

x8ha4ydJ8tCmib2LprFqtQ.text: I've been coming here for years so I figured it's about time I give these guys a shout out. Ok so usually I'm here for business lunch meetings and business happy hour but I've also been here with friends and family for dinner and also their excellent brunch. Obviously my favorite is brunch with friends. Never ending mimosas fo sho! The staff is with it  at making sure your flute isn't empty for long! One of the best reasons why brunch here is tops. Please Lyft :)! I usually order their chilaquiles- the chicken is cooked to perfection- moist and oh so flavorful! If you've had chilaquiles- these are on point- but definitely a more modern look and texture. Soooo fancy. That lime-sour cream though! So good!!! Their lamb is the best I've had and they have a solid salad selection! I always order the Cobb but have tried the Ahi as well, both very good. If you're looking to indulge but want to seem like you're being healthy- go for the CousCous. Very rich and filling. As far as appetizers I never not order the shrimp chorizo appetizer. Generous amounts of fresh thick cut pieces of chorizo, rotated cherry tomatoes and shrimp. Not sure what the dressing they use is (I want to sip it straight out the bowl) but I've seriously thought about coming here solo so I wouldn't have to share. If available, I will always ask for fried plantains as a sub for dessert. Yes, fried platanos!

K3w2p0FGQ4f5I3DyMx3Wdg.text: I'm no Shakespeare so I'll keep it short. Great food and beautiful patrons. It's obvious why this place is so popular.

nsi13U6sYOOX01YBnOneyQ.text: Curry with couscous is my favorite!  Chicken flautas is on point every time. We usually order togo but order is always ready when they say it is so that's great we don't have to wait.

GrMIVzLDVW_NQM9oca7UFw.text: The bloody Mary tasted a lot like vodka that's a little too strong for me. Bacon and pickle were the bomb, service was top notch. Eggs benedict were yummy

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict

CJoJA0QE02dCbbFH8IZhmw.text: Delicious. Simply delicious. I sat at the bar and the bartender Michael provided really good service. Had the Jamaican chicken and curry, the haricot vert/tomato side dish and the couscous/seared ahi salad. Everything was spectacular.  A little heavy handed on garlic and the bar was kinda a mess but overall, I love everything about this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum.

p662FebvSgDxitOa8DhpjA.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant, despite having a slightly difficult time finding something to eat. As far as vegan food goes, they are not very vegan friendly, but the mushroom veggie burger (without the bun) was delicious. I would love it if they added a bun for the burger that didn't contain eggs, because it was honestly one of the most unique veggies burgers I've eaten and I'd love to eat it in its proper form. Food aside, the atmosphere was so nice. I found the decor really beautiful. On top of that, all of the staff was super helpful with finding vegan options. I would definitely give them 5 stars if there were more options for vegans!

faktORmrraD1fBxpx6eZdw.text: Went to DW Bistro for a late lunch. Our server was very friendly and prompt. I remember the Bloody Mary being more flavorful than what we got, so bummer on that. But, the food....OMG the food!!!! The food here is incredible. I got the vegetable curry over couscous. I rarely order vegetarian but thought I'd go for it. And I am so glad I did. This is a real contender for my favorite dish in the history of ever! The curry was perfectly flavored and the mix of different veggies (heavy on the mushrooms...yay!) far exceeded my expectations. So good!  The BF ordered one of the daily specials: bowtie pasta in a marsala sauce with chicken. He loved the dish! The bite he allowed me to have was seriously good eats.   Glad we beat the crowds as this place tends to get quite packed. But once you taste the food, you'll understand why. Would highly recommend!

3LE6GjpouK0PCQ9SM512Hw.text: DW Bistro is truly the restaurant that most downtown restaurants strive to be, yet this gem is tucked away in a shopping center in the SW.   The crowd? Cute.  The food? Incredible.  The drinks? Never ending.   My friends and I frequented DW this summer every Sunday to partake in their unlimited mimosas for $20. Not only is their good crazy good (chicken and waffles are out of this world), but the vibes you pick up from here are amazing. You'll always bump into someone you know, and the owners keep it nice and personal by filling your drink themselves.   Obviously the wait is a killer, but I assure you it's worth it.

9s_ZIPSFuVtOyIw7TK8VHA.text: Huge portions, great prices, delicious food, and awesome service. Tried a whole bunch of stuff and everything was pretty damn tasty. The bbq rib app was really tender, sweet and just a hint spicy. The shrimp and chorizo with crostini special was really tasty with plenty of large shrimp. Their jerk chicken salad was probably one of the best salads I've come across with orange segments, tender chicken, macadamia nuts, grilled veggies and a mango vinaigrette.  Their entrees were humongous and could feed two easily. I ordered the oven roasted jerk pork shoulder bowl which was really tasty although it would've been nice if some veggies had been included (but it's okay since I had salad beforehand.) I also got to try the jamaican curry chicken which was delicious, the curry soup, the ahi tuna salad and the grilled jerk chicken breast (which came with about 4 pieces of grilled chicken!) Honestly, nothing was mediocre and everything was under $20 which is a great deal for a restaurant of this quality.  Also had the dessert sampler which included their dark chocolate mousse cake, red velvet cake, lemon-lime pudding, and carrot cake although by that point, we all were about to explode. I'm not a huge dessert person so I'd have to say their desserts were the weakest link BUT still pretty good. The cakes themselves were a bit dry but that was alleviated by the frosting.  The service was phenomenal. Bryce came by several times and treated questions with humor and knowledge. Our server was also awesome and even the other customers at the restaurant were super friendly! Great space, great food. Definitely one of the best restaurants I've been to in Vegas!

9zMzBTMqrOApiVg7Szns2Q.text: This place is amazing! I was visiting my brother in Las Vegas and he recommended this gem! I had the Ox-tail (which was fall off the bone tender), while my brother had the DW Pork Chop. Excellent, attentive service and great drinks! I will definitely return back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent Jamaican/Southwestern fusion off the Strip!

T1cGNpHu00zoijyB8rgEvg.text: Beyond phenomenal. Had the braised short rib sandwich - a little horseradish sauce and jalapeno bacon gave it interest and bite without being overwhelming. Short rib slivered and marinated and very, very tasty. No fat, nothing left on my plate.  Came with a side house salad of mixed greens, red wine vinaigrette, feta crumbles, red and yellow pepper slivers, pecans... just perfect. And my Arnie Palmer? Made with homemade pomegranate iced tea and homemade lemonade. And then they gave me a 16oz cup to go! Wow.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib sandwich on ciabatta with horseradish sauce and jalepeno bacon.

S8XRfj5LVyXLQtCqNgItPQ.text: What an incredible experience! An exquisitely delicious new flavor to brunch far beyond a traditional toast and eggs breakfast accompanied by extravagantly delectable beverages in an upbeat fun and gastronomically flirtatious environment.  Phenomenal food service and experience.

aABjtYVroYCavoJyiCNl1g.text: My favorite place for Sunday Brunch! Atmosphere is great, and food is fantastic. I would recommend going 30 minutes prior before your brunch time, as they are always busy.

tq9u3RbmD8fWtOXo8ozg7w.text: Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! I had the fried chicken (a bit too salty) w/cornbread (a bit too sweet) and gravy! He had the New Mexican-style pork served hot and needs to be eaten hot; otherwise it turns to eggy porridge. House Pomegranate iced tea is delicious and the refills kept coming. The chocolate peanut butter ball thingy (not on the menu) for dessert was pretty tasty but, tiny for two. We'll be back again and soon!

mNQty7WrFb1pLSVM380O6g.text: This is probably our favorite neighborhood restaurant. We love that we only live like 5 minutes from here. We have been here for brunch & dinner and every time we visit, our service and food is always awesome. I love their jamaican fusion and fresh ingredients. The presentation of the food is beautiful and it really is as good as it looks. They have bottomless mimosas on (Sundays?) which I have not had, but definitely on my list of things to-do. I have had their Bloody Mary which is gigantic and is served with a strip of Jalapeno Bacon. Um, what? Um, YES! SO GOOD! I haven't had anything here that I didn't like. EVERYTHING is delicious and the ambience of the place is awesome. Some days they play island-y reggae music and the other day they played 90's alternative. The music is never too loud and the interior of the place is very clean and well lit. Every time I suggest going here to someone that has never been before, they immediately have a picture of the place in their minds and its never what they expect it to be. The interior is very modern.... white and orange. (you'll see)  oh and CARROT CAKE. just do it!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is probably the BEST bloody mary I have ever had. And it&#39;s probably b/c of the crispy jalapeno bacon bathing inside of it.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto &amp; Goat cheese fornicated and this came out. A deliciously creamy baby served with an assortment of crispy things.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas bowl with a fried egg....... and some flowers. BOMB.

2OwdaO2nhDQ0hbEqL_A-1Q.text: What a hidden gem off the strip!  We came across DW looking for a place that could accommodate about 14 of us for an "after Thanksgiving brunch."  The waiter was super helpful.  He explained to us that the chef was Jamaican who trained in New Mexico - thus the twist on Tex Mex menu and the AMAZING Jamaican chile sauces on the table.  These are to die for (in fact, we bought a couple bottles to take home, the Gingery Mango sauce was really special).  The waiter recommended several dishes, and so we ordered a bunch and had brunch family style.  It was a hit!  In order of yummines, must eats in BOLD:  CHILAQUILES - This was AMAZING!!!  I've only had this dish once before (and my Chinese family never), so the waiter described it as a quiche baked in tortillas.  It really was the hit of the table.  Especially with the mango sauce.   PORK OMELETTE - This dish had a much fancier name on the menu, but GET IT.  A really yummy twist on an omelette with the shredded pork and spiciness.  CHICKEN and waffles - I bolded only the CHICKEN cuz it really was the star of the dish.  It is breaded in this jerk concoction, which is AMAZING.  The waffles were buttermilk, on the heavier side, and just Eh.  I think they might have a similar chicken dish for lunch (maybe on a salad?), that would be heaven.  PASTRY BASKET - The ladies really loved this.  A huge assortment of pastries - scones, croissants, cinnamon buns, etc.  There is a smaller $8 version on the menu, but this special $12 version was a huge hit.  Perfect with a cup of coffee.  French toast - Made with challah bread, so it was thick and soft.  The maple syrup is really tasty, but compared with the other dishes I mentioned above, this dish was just OK.  Chocolate chip pancakes - Really nothing special about this dish.  ===  Would I make a special trip from the strip for this place?  Maybe not.  But definitely if I'm visiting family in Rhodes Ranch again.

jZNPguPwVbGCGGc1PAs8Gg.text: The decor is absolutely adorable and so unique for the Las Vegas area. We were greeted by a lovely hostess and taken to a table outside. Everything from the servers to the bus boys were wonderful, but the food was the best part. I had a turkey panini with a beautiful salad on the side, and my husband had a green chile cheeseburger that was (almost) worthy of my home state, New Mexico. We topped off the wonderful meal with a (complimentary) piece of Jamaican carrot cake, which was delicious. This is our new "go to" place for lunch, and we can't wait to check out their dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Carrot Cake. Delicious.

lMj23rhQmy5-oNK6Abx9EQ.text: Every once in a while, you step out of a restaurant feeling like the heavens just opened up, sprinkled you with rainbows, and released doves and butterflies to commemorate the occasion.   This happened to me on Sunday, after leaving my new favorite restaurant, DW Bistro.   It's rare that a place has great service, amazing food, a fun ambience, and bottomless mimosas. We found all of the above here. They treated us so well, and we had a great time. We'll definitely be going back many more times!!

aGw2c2gE8kINoA_SJUT7Ew.text: Great local spot to get some Caribbean and American food fusion cooking!  First, they make some nice fresh ice teas here.  Very refreshing.  Onto the food:  Grilled plantains with honey - Very tasty, actually sweet and with a kick of spice to it too.  Jamaican Jerk Chicken Salad - Awesome!  The salad has a great citrus dressing with the fresh mix of vegetables.  The moist and flavorful jerk chicken is like icing on top of a cake!  Butterfish daily special with spicy aioli and fresh vegetables - Butterfish was grilled perfectly and melts in your mouth.  The grilled vegetables and roasted potatoes compliment it well.  Vegetable curry with cous cous - The curry is a bit sweet for my taste but that being said it does pair well with the vegetables and cous cous.  Chicken bow tie pasta - Overall the dish is pretty good, the best part is the pasta, vegetables, and sauce.  The chicken we had didn't have much flavor, but the pasta sauce helped carry it.  Jerk Chicken - The jerk chicken here is great, very moist and flavorful.  It does lean toward the spicier side, but I love spicy dishes so this was a great dish in my opinion.  Desserts here are always a joy:  Goatcheese Pumpkin cheesecake - At first it worried me that the goat cheese would overpower the pumpkin, it's definitely there but not as strong as you would think.  Pretty good for the most part.  Chocolate peanut butter cake - This is pretty awesome!  The peanut butter mousse is great and provides a lighter flavor to match the more dense chocolate cake.  Great taste!  Red Velvet cake - This wasn't bad, but a bit on the dry side for my taste when I got it.  Carrot Cake - Awesome!  Very flavorful!  Chocolate cake - Very decadent, but not bad.  I love chocolate so all those layers of chocolate just gel very well.  Service is really good here too, very attentive and they are all friendly.  On Sunday they have a popular brunch, typically it's super busy so set aside some time to wait for the brunch.  Occasionally they do themed brunches there too.

CmwyfUocZhC1zUUrtQznLg.text: I absolutely love this place. I've been here numerous times and never had a bad meal. This place is close to work and when vendors want to take us out to lunch we always suggest DW Bistro.    I really don't have anything negative to say about their menu. I've never had anyone complain about their dish or return anything back to the kitchen. My favorite dish is the New Mexican style pulled pork bowl. Flavorful, spicy, saucy and very satisfying. I personally like the two fried eggs on top. If you are really hungry, this bowl's for you. I also recommend the chicken curry with couscous dish. My wife had this dish last time and I had food envy. I still haven't tried any of their jerk chicken dishes or any sandwiches or salads but I hear they are equally delicious.   Lastly, the decor is trendy, modern and casual and the staff is friendly, fun and accommodating. The owners are so fashionable and always around helping the staff. Truly a hidden gem. Oh I know for a fact they get really busy. I've never had to wait to be seated cos I'm always there before the rush, so get there early.

fWPxF_P6C7MFR8pGYohk4Q.text: Great food! Busy for brunch. Dinner items delicious.  Great staff. Cocktails are tasty. House made lemonade is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chorizo with tomatos
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta

sLXgXIbY374eBeNWmcGZbQ.text: I have been coming here for at least the past 7 years and absolutely love it. The atmosphere is wonderful and good customer service. I stopped in for a to go order at 8pm the other night it was pretty slow since it was late and middle of the week. I took my food home and for some reason it was awful which was so sad because it's something I order frequently. Idk what happened but I've never had an inconsistent visit before so I'll still be going back and hope it was a one time fluke

xMewstoogDJwuWASoxXr2g.text: Wow what a great place this is!!! The service was awesome and the food was even better, got the chicken and waffles and it was So good!!!! The "secret" menu item on the during the weekend is the bottomless mimosas, definitely get!!! I would love to come back here and I suggest you go go go!

rgjG0VjMEn5E8GI3k1dBzw.text: LOVE:  $22 Bottomless mimosas for brunch. When they say bottomless, THEY MEAN IT. Never saw the bottom of my glass, and they were delicious! The only thing that could have made them better was a variety of juice, but there wasn't much OJ in them anyways so it was all good! :D  Veggie Omelet. I asked for mine with egg whites which they had no problem with! I have never had a veggie omelet with the variety of veggies that they used! Asparagus and zucchini are never in any other veggie omelet I had &let me tell you IT WAS AMAZING!   Friendly staff. I didn't deal with the hostess myself, but the bartenders were great and our server was amazing as well. Very nice and accommodating. Again, mimosas were never empty.  DISLIKES:  The wait. I understand it was a Sunday brunch, anywhere in town is going to be packed. However, I would just have liked to have been aware of the ACTUAL wait time when we got there. A "20-30 minute wait" turned into an hour. Thankfully, we had our drinks in hand which was great, but I wouldn't have been so upset to wait an hour if I was just told that in the beginning. Once we were going to be seated, our group of 3, saw 2 other open tables on the walk to our table. Weird. Then, it took about another half hour to get our food order. People here bottomless mimosas until 2, they tend to stay in their seats until 2pm. Definitely need a larger space or to use the outside tables as well.   Bathroom situation. There is ONE bathroom. ONE single toilet for the entire establishment. Not okay especially when everyone in there is drunk.   Overall, had a good experience but I think next brunch I would try another place before making this my permanent brunch go to spot.

-OjihQ8ubNGu2GT9M9asPg.text: Came here for lunch Thursday August 24th at noon. Long wait for a server to come get our drink order. Ordered the shrimp salad, but the restaurant ran out of shrimp (I've been pescatarian 3 years now).  Ordered it without the shrimp. Waited 25 minutes for my food. Salad looked like it been sloppily thrown together, and the avocado "dressing" was just smashed up avocado. Very disappointed, because I have been here multiple times for brunch, and food was delicious.

5cOCehuBO1HEAv5xKvoycA.text: Food was awesome! A lot of the dishes had a  curry theme, which was fine by us. Daughter enjoyed the curried chicken wrap, hubby had their signature pork bowl with rice and I had  the Nicoise salad with Ahi tuna, very fresh and delish.  A bit noisy, lots of hard surfaces. Good beer options.

kY4cDCPlok0_I0JeOBeCZA.text: Not only is the food AMAZING but the service was exceptional! Eric was our server and he was very friendly and informative with the menu. The manager, Rudy, even came out and introduced himself. They knew we are new to the area so we greatly appreciated the extra touch. The Palma granite iced tea and carrot cake was so good! We'll be back!!

NjzA8Ysm6IOLfRwAmxAn1g.text: Whenever I get together with a friend I haven't seen in a while, this is my go-to place. The vibe is chill with good music at a great volume where you don't have to yell to talk, the food is exquisite and the service is great! I've never had a bad experience here. Well done DW.

6ejYGEwwvjzEU4L4ItlciA.text: Havnt been here in a long time and it was just as bomb as it was the first time I had it . Myro our busser was amazing explained all the new things on the menu described his favorite dishes as well. I'll have to say service, food, environment was all 100% will Be back weekly!!!

LJtr6EdilvJzYiaK4qOivw.text: Went for brunch and we were seated right away although there were people waiting ahead of us. I saw this happen quite a lot there. Maybe I looked hungry...  We ordered the $10 pastry basket, I couldn't help but notice ours did not have the same variety and amount of items as others which was strange. I think they gave us the smaller portion by accident.   The ambience was great I loved our server, the music, decor and overall vibe of the place. Mimosas were yummy, I opted not to go for the bottomless however the waiter topped off my glass twice. Which was oh so kind and made for a fun trip to target after brunch.   Then jerk fried chicken eggs Benedict and the jerk chicken and waffles were winners. They were delicious but I will probably order the curry cous cous next time its still favorite of mine but I'm happy I tried something new.   Their chocolate cake is divine, everyone talks about their carrot cake but oooohh girrrrl try the chocolate cake.

D27_kz4wyJj5Cq8JJ71w1A.text: Went on a Saturday night.  The place was packed.  Initial reaction, small place with nice decor.  Like the bar as well.  Nice outdoor patio, wish the weather was a bit cooler.  Staff was friendly and on point.  Water cups were regularly refilled.  Seemed like someone was always coming around looking to fill empty glasses.  We also kept getting our table cleaned and a new setup after every course.  We started with a chorizo and shrimp appetizer.  It was a bit salty.  Big shrimp and slivers of chorizo with some red and yellow tomatoes.  For our entrees, we ordered an oven-roasted jerk pork shoulder bowl and shrimp scampi.  The shrimp scampi had the same huge shrimp.  The portion was what I would consider average.  But seeing other peoples food as well as the jerk pork shoulder bowl, I felt ripped off.  The other entrees were HUGEEEEEEEE!!!  The jerk pork shoulder was very tender, but I couldn't taste much of the jerk seasoning.  The rice underneath the mounds of pork was quite delicious.    DW Bistro is really good for a neighborhood restaurant.  I saw someone order the jerk fried chicken and it looked quite delicious, and also a big portion.  I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.  And I will definitely be back.  I'm on the cusp of saying it is a 5 star place, but for now I can only give it 4 stars.

v8srtkqctaa03VCR0oSzWg.text: I've been a loyal DW patron for over 6 years. Yesterday's experience was the worst and in my opinion the final time I go there. During lunch we had our department's mini-Christmas party. We were reserved a table right in front of the kitchen counter. I realized that I was getting the attention of the kitchen staff that were literally 10 feet away from me through the kitchen cutout. It was raining yesterday and so I came in wearing my Trump Make America Great Again hat. The people behind the counter were staring at my hat while talking amongst each other, made me very uncomfortable to say the least. Even when I eventually took it off as I settled in my seat the stares still lingered. I tried to brush it off since I cannot really leave because this was a group outing. Anyway I just wish they didn't do that. I wanted to leave this part out in this review but I think it's worth noting that this place or at least some of it's staff won't be as welcoming if you belong to a certain political persuasion.   Service wise I think the place really disappointed me yesterday. 15 mins to get our orders in and another 45 mins to get our food seems a bit of a stretch. The place was busy when we started and towards the middle of the 45 minute wait the place already half emptied. We don't know where the hell our waitress went. My coworker had to stand up, walk to the bar and get another round of Mojito.  Food wise my only gripe is DW has been giving smaller and smaller portions of my favorite Ahi Couscous while jacking up its price. It used to be a good filling meal with generous portions of Ahi and couscous now it's only a fraction of the size. The one dish that keeps me coming is no longer worth the price.  That being said, thanks DW for all the years but we part ways here. The rest of my group feels the same way. These people were all diehard DW fans. Our Monday morning work conversations of DW Sunday brunches the day before will be just history.

WwTar6YF9_tNPw-FiwWzSg.text: Superb!!  That's just one way to describe our experience at DW last night.  My wife and I went on a double date yesterday at DW.  The food is unique and the flavor is amazing!  Everything was delicious!  All the staff were very cordial.  The restaurant had a warm family feel.  And the jerk carrot cake... YUM!!  I would highly recommend this wonderful bistro to anyone looking for a delicious meal and great service.

nU74wYe9-gBmpMqcIdoDZg.text: Review on weekend brunch!  Always been a fan of the DW (old location) and was excited to go to the newer and bigger place.   Decor - so much more spacious, big and bright, and the patio is very beautiful.  Service - all the servers were all friendly and very on top of filling up drinks (water, coffee...etc).  No wait either on Saturday brunch.  Food - the reason why this is only a 3-star.  I've been to the old location for brunch a few times as well and somehow I feel like the food was prepped better there.    First of all, the pastry basket.. I remembered at the old location, it's made to order (they tell you it may take a while as all freshly baked), although not mentioned on the current menu, I was expecting the same thing (my own fault).  The portion was generous (5 giant pieces of pastries, 2 cones, 1 plain croissant, 1 chocolate croissant and 1 almond croissant).  The texture were all just ok, and the biggest disappointment for me was it's not baked to order, in fact, not even warm.  They couldn't even try to make it nice to warm it up in the oven before presenting to you.  Everything was room temp. not what I was looking for in both the texture and temperature.  All too buttery (a good thing for some ppl I guess), but all quite dense vs. the crispy and flaky texture you'd want from croissants.  Anyhow, it's still all edible, just not what I had expected, especially it's so nice at the old place.  I wanted the salmon benedicts and they didn't have it, not out, just didn't have it.  If you plan the weekend brunch menu, salmon is not a hard thing at all to shop, why wouldn't you have it?  So i picked a ham one instead.  It's a mediocre benedict, not bad but nothing to raved about.  The microgreens they put on top are just a few sprinkles, almost too little to put on the plate.    We had bendicts, pork hash (full order, just with too much potatoes), omelet and french toast.  Everything was ok, mediocre than higher exceptions you'd get from this place.  Maybe just a tab step up from your local cracked egg/egg works I regret to say, and only slightly better than them because of the decor of the space, the food is really not that much better.    I'd probably still come back for lunch and dinner at some point, hope they'd be better than the brunch I had recently experienced.  But definitely won't be a place for me to return for weekend brunch anyone, for the price, it's just not worth it.

ucu4T2AV3uKIzJrjd3uMUQ.text: I had heard great things about this restaurant, so I was excited to visit - especially on Mother's Day Sunday. Overall I was impressed at how well they handled the rush, especially since we were seated quickly and given drinks shortly after.   The rest of the service wasn't extraordinary. Our waiter seemed to thrive on over using sarcasm, which was funny at first...but after being there for over two hours it lost its charm. I ordered eggs for my breakfast and he faked shock, since everyone else's food was more "interesting" I suppose. I told him I had a dairy allergy and he said "there's plenty of other things without dairy on the menu." Great, okay, but I already made my decision 15 minutes ago when we got the menu. I just want eggs and bacon, dude, no need to make a huge deal out of it.   We had a fairly large group, so we knew it would take a while for our food to arrive, but we were not given updates or anything regarding how soon it would be ready. Our drinks were constantly refilled, so that was nice.  After finally getting our food, we were a little disappointed in the quality. My fiance and his mom both ordered french toast and agreed that it was too sweet. On top of that, the menu said that there would be sauteed bananas and fresh strawberries - but the strawberries were clearly sauteed and the bananas had not been touched. It wasn't anything huge, but a little irritating considering how much the food cost.   After finishing our food, it took forever to finally get our bill. Again, I understand how busy it was due to the fact it was Mother's Day, but an update every now and again would be nice.   Overall, the food was good and the restaurant is cute. I would like to visit again and try something else when it's less busy and the waiter isn't questioning my choice in food.

acCHBOkot62GC7L3Jbo8-Q.text: Yesterday we went to the new location for the first time and I was so excited to go. We usually go on special occasions. This was for my birthday. I was totally disappointed! It was very loud in there and kept getting louder. The food was good but sitting there watching the prep counter I wasn't sure I wanted to eat it. The bathroom was disgusting. Not sure we will go back and I loved that place. What happened DW?

bwe4v8XiJyx3TzSMrJmhJA.text: When I want a nice dinner and don't want to go to the Strip this is the place to be. Everything I've had here is really good or incredible. Standouts are the jerk calamari and salmon. I tend to order the same things so haven't yet ventured the whole menu and would love to check out brunch one of these days when I can handle some daytime drinking. I think their infused vodkas and other liquors are a nice addition to the bar considering they double as decor in the huge glass jars with colorful fruit in them. However, there was a time I tried a pineapple-infused vodka drink and the fruit flavor was only a minor note in the cocktail. Maybe it wasn't submerged long enough? That's about the only negative I can think of.  Servers here seem genuinely friendly and like their job which is a plus.    The SW side of Vegas def needs more places like this. Upscale-ish, unique & fantastic food without breaking the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L_dxUSbFWDtt9H79VNZHSA.text: I was super excited to come here for brunch today!  The reviews had all been great, and there were lots of things I wanted to try!  Unfortunately, I left somewhat disappointed. After arriving, our server asked if we wanted a starter.  I eagerly ordered the white chocolate and blueberry scones - and was told that the pastry person last night did not prepare enough, so they were only available if one ordered the pastry basket, and not on their own.  Neither of us wanted the chocolate croissant, so no scones for us.  We proceeded to order our meals, a roasted pork omelet and a roasted veggie omelet.  These came with bread - I ordered an English muffin and my friend ordered brioche toast. My omelet was good, not great, and I asked for salsa to liven it up.  My grind enjoyed her omelet.  We didn't get any butter for the bread, but it was brought when we asked.  When I went to butter my "English muffin", I realized that it was NOT AN ENGLISH MUFFIN!  It was a hamburger bun cut into the size of an English muffin and toasted.  Seriously.  I tried to eat it, but it really wasn't worth it.  When I told our server, he told me that they had a new bread supplier, and it probably was just a different brand.  When he looked at it, he realized that it truly was a hamburger bun.  He apologized, but did not offer anything to correct it.   We ordered the chicken and waffles next, and those were great - wish we had started lthere.  Overall, an OK experience, but a lot of excuses, no scones, and an awful substitute for an English muffin.  I may return and give it another shot, but for now, I will stick to an occasional business lunch here.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My &#34;English muffin&#34; - a poorly disguised hamburger bun - seriously.

iqA8PDv2KJDt6UEZiCompw.text: I literally never have a bad time when I come here, can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review!  Well I just went here this past weekend for my friends birthday brunch and had the bottomless mimosas (as always) and had an amazing special! Our server (for the life of me can not remember his name) who we have all the time informed us about the daily specials. I ended up choosing the eggs Benedict with filet. HOLY MOLY, the best eggs Benedict I ever had. It was a tad pricey at $25 but the size of the filets were very nice. The steak was cooked to perfection, though the eggs were poached hard and I don't really care for that too much. But still awesome!  The staff is so friendly and the owners are so welcoming and make it feel like we are in their own homes. I don't come here as often as I'd like but when I do, it's the highlight of my day.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place for large groups!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with filet :) &amp;&amp; bottomless mimosa

Snvei4SH-0-B2BX6NUu9Bg.text: It is rare to give a place 5 stars for me! Let alone write about it the same night. Yes, this place exceeded my expectations and I had to tell everyone right away! From the moment we called ahead to see how busy it was to the moment we said our goodbyes were way beyond satisfied! No wait, perfect service, delicious food and refreshing drinks. Everyone was attentive and the place was clean! We ordered their favorites, pork chops, Mac n cheese, couscous salad, short ribs, Jamaican jerk calamari and chicken. All were simply mouthwatering. The pork chops were huge and juicy with the right balance of flavors. Definitely sharing portions! Their bread basket had a variety to choose from. Now to the drinks; pineapple infused martini, gin and tonic, and  this citrus drink (I forgot the name) were all so yummy...try em all! Just have a DD ;).  Our service, especially Nick our server, was impeccable. Nick was one of the most knowledgable and attentive servers I've ever known. He knew his menu, and everything he recommended was spot on! I could tell he was a food junkie like me, and described all of his best meals like I would. They were so accommodating to my one year old boy and offered more of the tiny muffin bread he enjoyed. We are definitely going back to try their brunch. Hope our next visit is just as amazing as this one! Wished they opened another place near the GVR area.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duroc porkchops, Mac n cheese, COuscous salad, Jamaican jerck calamari and chicken, braise pork!

ilcsSQzDsm1wG3hGpCf7lg.text: Everything  was good  The ahi tuna salad was ok need more tuna for the price  The carrot cake excellent very light  The services was very good very friendly

cT-Su9y3PLz7WLvVEc0f_w.text: First and foremost I wish I could give 10 stars... by far THE BEST dining experience i have ever had in Las Vegas.  came in this morning and sat at the bar with the bartender San. My bf and i have been in search of a good brunch place in Vegas and we've found our new spot! the decor is simple modern and elegant. DW was also behind the bar and he was so humble and nice!   I started out with a Strawberry Ginger drink (its on their specialty cocktail list) it was amazing! so refreshing. then i moved on to a Bloody Marry. Amazing! their Bloody Mary mix is made fresh and it has a jerk spice that really kicks up the classic cocktail.   for Brunch i ordered a roasted veggie egg white omelet. by far the best omelet Ive ever had. Roasted squash, peppers, and potatoes. and the various hot sauces they have really made the dish! my bf had the turkey burger. the bread on the turkey burger was so light and fluffy it was so good!   we finished our meal with a strawberry mojito, but instead of soda water San introduced us to a Jamaican Soda called Ting. its almost like a Squirt but far better!   all in all i cannot wait to go back. we almost came back a 2nd time tonight for dinner haha. Amazing place i will be recommending this to everyone!

UTLaQdFkes0fkH_N6MpwBQ.text: LOVE AT FIRST BITE! As a Las Vegas local I am always on the lookout for new restaurants and lounges to try that are off the strip. When I was first introduced to DW Bistro it was love at first bite! The restaurant has both inside and outside dining options. This is a big deal to me because I am someone who likes to sit outside and enjoy the nice Las Vegas weather when the extreme heat decides to give us a break. All of the staff is super friendly and great at remembering returning faces! Sometimes you can even catch the owners Dalton and Bryce in their visiting with customers! DW Bistro has one of the best Sunday brunches in Las Vegas. It is so good the line often goes out the door! BUT have no fear, it's always a short wait and totally worth the mouth watering tease as you watch plates of Jamaican and New Mexican style food pass you by! Every meal I have had at DW Bistro has been an explosion of flavors and spices complimenting some of my favorite dishes. When it comes to breakfast I am a huge eggs benedict fan. When I saw that DW Bistro had eggs benedict on their menu I was very excited to try this. I asked if they could add some of their New Mexican style slow cooked pork that is simmered in New Mexican red chili on top of it and they gladly had no problem. It ended up being the best decision I have ever made. The mix of the red chili, tender pulled pork and hollandaise sauce made for one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. REMEMBER - The eggs benedict is on their menu but you have to ask for the New Mexican style slow cooked pork to be added. Lunch is always something I have a hard time with as I am never really too hungry at lunch and seem to never be able to make up my mind on what I want. I decided to try their chicken flautas since they sounded so good and seemed like a small enough dish that I wouldn't leave feeling overly stuffed. When they brought me the dish I was very impressed! First, you could tell they put a lot of thought into the presentation which of course made for an awesome food porn Kodak moment! Second, the taste was out of this world. They drizzle fresh lime infused sour cream on top which taste delicious and add avocado tomatillo on top. I was very impressed. When it comes to dinner DW Bistro will never let you down. From the Chicken with roasted garlic & cream sauce over bowtie pasta to the New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork, each meal is sure to pack flavor that will blow you out of this world. I went with the New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork simmered in NM red chile. The bowl is served with over-easy eggs and rice with a fresh flour tortilla. The meal is a little large and I never finish it. There is so much flavor in the pork and the red chili that I didn't want to stop eating it. If you are looking for a highly recommended local Las Vegas restaurant, with great prices, amazing service and food that is guaranteed to give you a whole new perspective on Jamaican and New Mexican style cuisine then DW Bistro is the place to go! See my full review here: corkedandporked.com/2015...

YUDFDSjd4gpdKVVvQU3vVg.text: I think we found ourself a hip little bistro in the desert! Atmosphere here is very artsy, decoration shows that too. The staff here is wonderful and our server Lorenzo gets two thumbs up!! The owner is from Jamaica but raised in Mexico so that's how you see the variety in the menu.   For drinks we started off with a Plum Rum on the rocks which had just the right amount of strong for my fiance. I had a pineapple mango infused rum served as martini. Can you say refreshing?!!!  For appetizer we had Mac and cheese with bacon and mushrooms and shared also the Jamaican Curry soup just as recommended by other Yelpers.  The soup has just the right amount of spice to eat and you should definitely save your bread to dip in it. I will admit it was a bit too salty for our taste, but still we enjoyed the flavor. The soup is the same base that they use in the curry bowls so this is a good way to get a taste of the flavor in other dishes.  Mac and cheese with bacon was the best thing that was on the table. I must have ate too much because I definitely had very little room for my main dish. As a matter of fact I just recommend.  Fiance ordered the Osso Bucco special because he can never resist Osso Bucco. I had to get the braised oxtail.   Osso Bucco was up to standards in his taste, of course the best part of it was the marrow.  Meat was very soft and tender and you can taste the wine reduction. It was served with wild rice, but was nothing to his liking.  The portion for the braised oxtail was enormous.  I took my bite and was expecting more flavor, I thought it being braised I would have been more "marinated" in flavor.  The oxtail was topped on veggies and served with mash. I cared nothing for the mash, it tasted too earthy for me. Honestly they can do without the flowers in the food because had I not picked it out I would have been eating it... Not in my food please.  Since it was our first time there they served us a complimentary carrot cake.  That had white chocolate shavings on it, made it taste extra special.    Three stars because my main dish wasn't all that.  Service and atmosphere was fantastic however.  Perhaps my next try ill get something that is more flavorful without the saltiness for flavor

aZHI2gSC-eCD1MmVFDKDKQ.text: Exquisite place I am definitely coming back.  My amazing boyfriend picked this extremely delectable restaurant.  He and his mother visited here on a different occasion.  He was correct in his tale of the food...delish!

o-QF9mxH6ye1_8_clTPA0A.text: After debating for a while where to go for brunch in Vegas, my partner and I decided on a local's place. Actually, I will admit, it was me. I am sad that I made that choice.   The food started off good - the scones were super moist and chewy. The chocolate croissant was super moist. They were a little a-traditional, but I was alright with that since sometimes scones are just too crunchy; but who turns down a flaky croissant?  The $20 bottomless mimosa was disappointing, and where the restaurant's charm was lost. It came in a carafe that the waiters carried around. Who knows how much/how little you are being skimped on when it comes to champs. There are a lot of places in Vegas I can drink for, and for a lot less.   The chicken and waffles was interesting. It had a cajun flair to it, which provided a nice zing. The chicken however, was very moist and the breading was not as crunchy as I had hoped for. The syrup had a very vanilla taste to it, which was great. My partner was not impressed by his fishy eggs benedict.   Why is this brunch rated so highly with over 600 reviews? This was the question we pondered the rest of the afternoon.

wNLoItR-503Q4_Z3wwAsDQ.text: Not worth the prices. Party of 12 and all of us were unsatisfied with our dinner...just "ok" Also, the hype was dessert carrot cake, after dinner the waiter informed us they were out of it.

XKm07vbURNP__ujFd7M8DQ.text: I am very, very happy my good friend and fellow yelper Alma found this place, because without a doubt I'll be back several times.  The appetizers I've had were all near perfect, especially the appetizer special Mac and cheese, which both of my other party members said was the greatest Mac and cheese they've ever had.   The Jamaican curry soup is easily one of if not the best soup I've ever tasted. I generally like to try everything on the menu in each category, but thanks to that soup I won't be trying any specialty salads there anytime soon.   For entrees I've tried both the jerk filet and jerk chicken breast. The filet was absolute perfection, I was able to easily cut through it with a butter knife(they gave me a steak knife, I was just testing it). The chicken was pretty good, although on a menu this awesome I don't think it's the right choice. The side sweet corn and truffle oil Mac and cheese was also very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican chicken curry soup

4ca9SVXq0t-ivK_IA3QV3A.text: DW is a must! My wife and I have eaten there a couple hundred times! Every time we're just as impressed as the last time!   My Top suggestion would be Sunday brunch, their ChilaQuiles are amazing!  Lunch, Their Jerk Chicken Sandwich is awesome! As well as their Salmon, I also really like their slow roasted pork bowl if your real hungry!  Their Chicken and waffles are awesome too!  You will be very happy with their food! As well as their service. One of the things that have always impressed me is their ability to retain their employees. There is almost ZERO turn over! This leads to highly trained staff who are very good!   Also the owners Bryce & Dalton are great guys who have done a great job building a great team, a great environment with awesome food!   Go there you'll be glad you did!

SGE2q4W3bC4I2zbAkpBbuA.text: I have been living in Vegas for 9 months and have never had a more amazing bottomless brunch!!!!

if9ZGXkXVfrawg2zpaFh7g.text: I loooooveee DW! :)   I've been here for lunch, dinner and brunch, and oh boy is it good. ;) GREAT food & drinks. (Plus there's bottomless mimosas on brunch!)   Servers & owner are very friendly. Never had bad service here.  My favorite lunch item is the chicken curry with rice. For dinner, braised oxtail is always on point.. but also I've ventured in getting their specials and it never disappoints.  Everything I had, from appetizers, salads, or bowls are good. They also have these great sauces (or hot sauce...) that isn't your typical tabasco, that goes well with everything! Although their food doesn't need it I think it adds other dimension to the flavor.  DW is definitely one of my favorites! They do get busy on brunch though, but it's always worth the wait.

aM6AI2h42I6tKRc40J0qXw.text: Love everything about this place. It is so beautifully decorated and the service is always friendly. The food is to die for. There isn't a bad thing on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter pie so good!

xOyJ9KzDdym_76PYStBN_g.text: Great looking place and it is definitely a happening place as we waited for a while before being texted that our table was ready.    It is EXTREMELY loud though and how can it not be with bottomless mimosas being served all around us maybe next time we will have to drink just to endure the craziness.   I absolutely recommend the pastry basket which included delicious filled flaky turnovers with goat cheese and guava paste accompanied by banana muffins and scones.  We ended up sharing their version of Chilaquiles which where not bad tasting I think since it was too damn spicy to taste anything that followed my first bite :(  I wish they would at least advice you of the level of spice since not all of us can endure fire! We also ordered a BLT which was complete turn off since served on a once toasted some time maybe that day bread...the only edible part was the Heirloom tomato.  This came with some cold sweet potato fries.  I will give this place another try but perhaps not on a Sunday... the steak Benedict served to the adjacent table looked delicious.

DUwd1Sxxbj0OWmPDVZaJaw.text: I LOVE DW Bistro!!!! They have an incredible weekend brunch and I just had dinner there for the first time and it was phenomenal too. These guys crush it. I will always recommend them and I'll be back very soon to dine again :)

_ojUBzph5ZFl2sPk0yRaCg.text: Headed out from Hendo as we have been wanting to try DWB for awhile now.  This place is awesome with it friendly and stylish atmosphere.  Lot's of different cars in the paroling lot and many manners of dress.  All that did not seem to matter.  How server and at times other servers where polite and helpful offering up there suggestions of what was good chow.  We opted for the following...   The Boy had the bacon green chile cheeseburger..Great!  The GF had the jerk chicken breast. The jerk was jerky but didn't leave you wanting to gulp down your drink after.  I had the special of the evening that consisted of  seafood curry with coconut rice....AWESOME!  We shared the mac & cheese with mushrooms and bacon.  A tasty heart stopper but I did not give a damn.  For desert we had the last order of of the special brownie crust coconut creme pie..The topped off and excellent meal.  I was told that DWB has their own pastry chef in the kitchen.  This was a phenomenal dining experience and I look forward to trying it again.

7_V96ZyoVWVdEidzXeiG9g.text: Went to DW Bistro for breakfast and enjoyed endless mimosas and a breakfast with my friend. Loved how they just kept filling you up and not being conservative with the refills.  I got breakfast with chorizo sausage and it was to great!  I will be coming here again!

h5LzEoNf5zPnQWa09y0fIw.text: Great food with awesome staff! I also felt very comfortable in the nicely decorated dining room! Everyone has got to try their new location, it is so yummy!!!

eNkyw0zo2JVM-6sh1WBqOg.text: First time coming here after much good buzz. Went in on Friday night and had a friendlt server from the west pacific. Friendly guy, great with suggestions. He recommended the Chicken Flautas for an appetizer although I wanted to try the Chorizo but nontheless was not disappointed at all. My date had the Oxtail entree and I tried the famous fired chicken(not bone on) but it tasted very very good especially when you ask for the gravy to dip it in.. Was pretty mellow when we went in (around 5:30pm) so we had some attentiveness service. I look forward to trying the New Mexico burger next time and we will be back. great stuff

3DqcijsXKPgKibou08O4ag.text: Literally obsessed with this place! Sooo cute, great food, bottomless brunch and DW himself is AMAZING!! It's the best thing ever to see an owner operator so involved  love it! Oh and side note the carrot cake is orgasmic

Xv1eimchh_akjOg28zjXow.text: My wife and I just had the pleasure of enjoying this great restaurant. Fantastic staff, and Fantastic food!! We had the DW Turkey Sliders, the Fish Taco on special, the Plantains, and finished it off with the Caribbean Carrot cake!  Wow!! We look forward to our next visit.

sOhT-AjtyYnrlX7CST_22Q.text: I love this place! A few years ago a great friend and his colleagues treated me to the original location in a strip mall. 8F5lurIUVPQ4Hd5BZkFbbg.text: DW Bistro for lunch before work today. An interesting fusion restaurant that blend Jamaican and south west dining together. The Chipotle mayo was perfect for both the sandwich and for the side of sweet potato fries it comes with. I'll definitely be back to try more. The ambiance is also fantastic and the service was good.

elCxu0Ft6k_-A94RZbEtvQ.text: My husband and I came to DW bistro for the first time for an early Valentines Day brunch and it was everything we could've hoped for! We were seated right away. What we ate: Sopapillas Jerk chicken and waffles Eggs benedict with salmon and spinach  What we drank: Jamaican mule Carribean sidecar  Total: $78  Alfonso was our waiter and he was fantastic. Se-tpwP_pDXnB8Dl7Ru4Ew.text: They have upscale food within a more modern environment.  The ambiance is great, as often times the owner is there and is oh so kind and welcoming.  If you want to try something different and don't mind paying a bit more, this place is great!

yhYaiLYSdXlVsJWgzZ2-cw.text: We tried Dw Bistro for the 1st time because they were having a Rum and Ice Cream event.  We were greeted upon entering and seated at the Bar. The Bartender we had was apparently new. He didn't have a clue. The lead Bartender ended up making our drinks.  It took me almost 15 minutes to order and receive my drink. We asked the cost for the special drinks they were having for the event.  We never got a answer until we saw it on the Bill. The food and presentation were very good. The staff seemed to be very unorganized.   Because the food was good we will give DW a 2nd chance.

EM9R8DwX3KksbVY9VcH_2A.text: I die  No seriously I'm so in love with the DW.   Sunday Brunch on fleek.   Can't they just do Sunday brunch every day of the week though? Not all of us get to be off on the weekends you know?...I digress.   This is day drinking at its finest!!! With bottomless mimosas flowing at a rate similar to that of your favorite drag brunch (which means your cup is never left empty).  The food is innovative, fun, and perfectly portioned to keep you happy. The DJ spinning the most fabulous day party music to get you pumped up for your fabulous day off ahead of you...I can't even say enough good things about how much I like this atmosphere.   I was told I just HAD to try the chocolate croissant, which was baked in house. And I was not disappointed. Fluffy and somehow dense at the same time. I decided to balance out the carbs I just had with some omega 3s and get the salmon Benedict. ''Twas amazing. The sauce was spicy and creamy perfect pairing to the salmon and spinach and perfectly cooked egg.   I also tried the mule. It was suuuper tasty and I can't wait to join them for their new happy hour starting at 6 on the weeknights so I can try more signature cocktails!!!

fZVd7V5wfCHGnQ4F06Kojw.text: I can see why they are so successful. Great food and service delivered by Vidal, the best server! Great bottomless Mimosa and wonderful Bloody Mary's. We had the hash and the jerk chicken with waffles

J593yuC6ODyxDzZs3qr5oQ.text: This was the second time I have been to DW Bistro. First time I went to see Frank Marino's Diva-Licious Brunch which was fabulous. I only split some pastry with a friend and the pastry was very good. Today again I went for the Diva Licious Brunch but I met the owner he was very personable. Such a nice Person, he got us seated right away. This time I ordered the New Mexico pork it was very good the ice tea was amazing. The waiter remembered my name how impressive is that. Especially when the place is seated to capacity. I definitely will be back for brunch soon.

LNvGwclp-OxGq0b2vEbQXg.text: Such a popular place, but seems like lately they are trying way too hard. Food takes forever and when we were there an omelet came out with nothing in it. The DJ is super loud -- at least in the front part. When the waiter came he asked, "What does your heart desire?" Huh?  I almost said, "The love of Jesus and a good woman."   But here -- eggs I guess.   Not my scene.

_wnFqGTq1qSx2-3AEAFeag.text: Love, Love LOVE this place! Definitely in my top 3 brunch spots around town. Literally, the entire staff is super friendly, helpful and upbeat. Not once have I had to ask for a refill or anything. They are so attentive. Food never takes long to come out. They have a very unique menu of drinks if you're looking for something outside of bottomless mimosas.   I came once on a Sunday and there was a dj. Can't beat good food , good music AND good service. Not sure if the music is every Sunday.   It's an overall great vibe. Even the crowd that comes out for brunch is super friendly. I've never left and not making at least one new associate! Great place for networking. I've been meaning to come during the week for happy hour. I'll check it out one of these days soon. You can't go wrong with any of their menu options. The pork hash is my favorite so far. During my last visit, I kept it simple with jalapeno bacon and eggs. DELISH. I love spicy food and our server/ bartender hooked us up with some unique hot sauces that I'd never tried before. Made the dish just that much more amazing.   If you haven't checked this place out yet, you're missing out. Make it a point to go soon!

lOsMjINQ41dslJaj9EswEw.text: DW Bistro is my favorite brunch place in Las Vegas for good reason. Between the DJ playing good music, the friendly and attentive servers, the good food, and the almost immediate refilling of the bottomless mimosas, DW Bistro is an absolute home run.  DW Bistro puts a Jamaican and Mexican twist on traditional brunch dishes such as eggs Benedict and chicken and waffles. Everything my group had was solid.  Unfortunately, the only bottomless drink option is traditional mimosas, but the mimosas truly are bottomless- they refill your glass before it is even empty. Single-serving margaritas, bloody marys, etc. are also able to be ordered.  Finally, the ambiance is what ties everything together. DW Bistro has a DJ that plays a good mix of music, the servers and hosts/hostesses are all friendly, and the restaurant is very clean.  Highly recommend.

BD7_z06s2UeHg6wWczHmDA.text: Great food, great flavors, great presentation and super friendly service. Lunch prices are very reasonable and casual.

9Ug_j0mEgu8HDEkb-1bp5w.text: Went today, Mother's Day, and they were packed.  Still the food was served fairly quickly given the circumstance and the food was delish. I want to go back and try a few other things.

PSFqSG6S6v0ocgctZfcLWg.text: First time at this place today.  Found them on Yelp with high rating reviews.  Service was good, but maybe we ordered the wrong food as we were definitely not impressed by it at all.   All the entrees or appetizers we saw on Yelp have been discontinued. Our server said they've changed their entire menu, so the photos of food on Yelp are not the latest.  Overall, I think everything is overpriced and bland. The place is not $$ but is at least $$$, which makes a huge difference.  Ordered:   * BIG EYE TUNA TARTAR $18 + $2* (picture #1) The taste of the tuna tartar was actually not bad. But it only came with three (small) crostinis, so we asked for more. They served us additional 5 pieces of (small) crostinis which cost us an extra $2*.   * CURRY TAGLIATELLE $22 (picture #2) The shrimp is good.  But the pasta is bland and the serving is smaller than I expected for the price.  * DW Fried Chicken $24 (was not able to take picture) The outer crisp part is okay. The chicken meat itself is soooo bland and the cornbread crumbles. Oh and no sauce.

KnroZRgRONKIFjZmVaUJew.text: Always on the hunt for a great Sunday brunch spot (bottomless mimosas always having to be part of the criteria... which they do have for $22 per person)! Not knowing what I was getting into but was pleasantly surprised to find out they are Jamaican Mexican fusion! The wait was quite extensive, but I've heard amazing things and hoped the hour wait was worth it! Located in the Gramercy on the corner of 215 & Russell, I was thrilled it was on the southwest side and easily accessible as well!   ORDERED:  - CHICKEN FLAUTAS ($10.00): Lime crema, queso fresco, pico de gallo, avocado tomatillo sauce. (These were a decent appetizer, came with 5 pieces and had great presentation!) - JAMAICAN CURRY BOWL ($15.00): Imported curry, coconut cream, seasonal vegetables, rice or couscous. (I personally am a curry snob, felt like this lacked flavor and did not have enough curry mixed in. Does not come with any meat; added chicken to it which costed an extra $5.00. Did not feel this justified $20.00 at all).  - JERK PORK HASH ($16.00): Breakfast potatoes, eggs any style. (A little bland but surprisingly spicy for jerk flavor, came with a side of tortilla which was scarfed down to counteract the spiciness).   Maybe ordered the wrong entrees, as I wasn't very impressed by the food. But I definitely would still give this place another try -- simply because the bottomless mimosas hit the spot and the service was AMAZING. Thomas was our server and was very personable and attentive! I would definitely like to try more items on the menu in the future.

0UfOfxeKjBGlI-QpMiCJjQ.text: Had been wanting to go here for 5 or 6 years. Live right around the corner. Finally made it after my girl and I decided to have some brunch for my (-?-) birthday. Didn't want to miss the original before they moved.   Sat on the patio on a delightful Sunday morning. Great ambiance but could've used a little music to set the tone. Very relaxing nonetheless.   Started with the taquitos and a cold hefe. Then got the blueberry and white chocolate scones. As well as the chilaquiles. Scones were a great portion as well as light and fluffy. The chilaquiles were a little small but so delicious. We're definitely excited to check out the new spot and will be sure to try other options.

_28sHzKK3paj0EF3OIYLpg.text: I went here with a world renowned chef, luckily we didn't have to wait for a table The owners were so friendly bringing out plate after plate of delicious food.  I cant remember what we had because it was ALOT, the place does well, all my friends love it there, its a drive for us, as we live in Lake Las Vegas, and the restaurant is in Summerlin but I remember we had several items on the menu and we were very happy The recent time I was in a car with my friend she had said as we pass the restaurant I'm dying to eat in that place I told her that I had already in there which chef Keller and she said it's always packed  The reason this restaurant is packed is because the food is delicious the atmosphere is great especially for brunch and the food is prepared quite well A recommendation to people living in Summerlyn but even if you live on the opposite side of town it's deafly worth the drive!

I can't wait to come back.

e_2-DTNqJZgiS58y0KZnqg.text: This is my favorite brunch place.  The food is fun and delicious. A mix of the classics with spice. You can tell the chefs love what they do because every dish is tasty and the staff always has a smile on their face.   My favorite is the jalapeno bacon breakfast sandwich. Simple yet fantastic

F-7mlBzQvRzSSoxul0sGoQ.text: Las Vegas is awash in the typical stereotype restaurants.  Not this eatery!  The menu is a distinctive spiciness of the unique New Mexican cuisine.  Nothing on the DW Bistro menu ever disappoints and the quality of food they use is A+.  The menu provides various accompaniments which would delight any palate.  Their desserts always tantalize my sweet tooth, and I have many ;).  This means leave room for dessert, please:). Be sure to ask the bartender Thomas which vodka infused specialty you may try- you won't go wrong!
