Q-kQ3O0ghr3J0ctpiufXwg.text: We always love coming to this brunch on Sunday's. The food is phenomenal and the environment is beautiful. The owners are so nice and friendly. There's a reason you see everyone saying bye to them on the way out. Definitely worth the bottomless mimosas.

ZIlWP4rmCraKIYCZnF7Irg.text: Slightly intoxicated while writing this because Louis hooked it all the way up with the bottomless mimosas. Best server ever he really made our Saturday morning incredible and the food was amazing. I don't usually leave reviews but..... bomb.  Hell ya Louis.

MnDA3Zr1LwVEzPAcdnOisg.text: This place doesn't need any more reviews. I just came here to praise the service.   I set up a brunch for a friend's birthday for 14 people. The table the set us at was too small and we literally had no room -- so they moved us to an empty room so there was much more space for us. Perfect.   We figured that since they only opened it for us, we'd get less service. Nope. These dudes/dudettes were on top of it. They were constantly checking up on us; refilling our drinks without even having to ask, and the food was out so quick. I didn't even mention that it was my friends birthday, but they brought her some cake anyways.   I've been here quite a few times for brunch and this is why. Always excellent service, food and I love the atmosphere.   I love this place. Probably my #1 spot for brunch in Las Vegas.

_xtZg2XoJ_fu9SsglR3lJw.text: Fun-Fuckin-tastic!!! Service, Great! Food, Great! Best place for brunch in Vegas.. great Vibes!! I never miss a Sunday!! Ask for Fonsie (Alphonso), he's the best server

fwGK3OdV_zCRtp48qCSoyw.text: Besides the original food and venue, service is great too. Alexander is the best bartender on earth! He is always attentive and friendly.

INxt2sZjK8a9ymMu3dGpbA.text: I love DW Bistro. I go here for lunch all the time because it is so close to my office. The cocktails are fantastic and the food is always delicious and very consistent. I love to eat here at the bar because the bartenders are always funny and friendly which is great because sometimes I go by myself. The only thing that I would recommend for them is some sort of happy hour, but I also understand why the don't do it. They always have customers. :)

t1inkWa_oqjZws5P64_Ynw.text: Great place for Sunday Brunch. There was a little bit of a wait, but it was worth it in my opinion. The atmosphere was vibrant and friendly.  I enjoyed the option of purchasing cocktails while waiting for our table. Try the bottomless mimosas! Can't wait to try them for dinner in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with Salmon and Spinach. Brunch menu.

YGiuPPuURwwdBkuSJo41YA.text: My wife and I enjoy their Sunday Brunch.  Always good food, Always good atmosphere.  They have a bread basket that we really love with coffee.  People and staff are super friendly and some super gay.  They always make me feel beautiful and fabulous

TC9wbzDg2KGC-ZPImBeoBg.text: Food, service, and drinks were amazing even at peak hours during weekend brunch. It was nice to see the owner there welcoming people and helping out the staff pour drinks as well. The wait was shorter than with their old location and the price was very reasonable for a top brunch spot.

d9lqGnjMmvTcy-4OWdH-fw.text: Love, love this place! Great friendly service. The staff know their food and ingredients, very knowledgeable. They show pride in their establishment. The food is meticulously prepared.  Beautiful presentation and delicious! I can't wait to come bk. And.....reasonably priced!

dauYoRSThvIBdyX9Rj6_Dg.text: GREAT place for Brunch off the strip. If you are passing through Vegas & have a car...stop by. It is located in an up and coming trendy neighborhood. Tasty food at a great price! Good place to catch up with friends and relax for a bit.

47zesPhBsNRYBpt5zI0J1A.text: Salmon with guava blanc was amazing , this dish is created by real Profesional,  loooooved it . As long as it's a restaurant food first , service is good as well same thing about visitors nice decent class people and our waiter was good too

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PaFScEvocHy6QN7q8s4qJA.text: The food is amazing!!!! Where do i start?? lol  Came here with a group of friends while visiting Vegas... I must say everything that we all order was so flavorful! We all ordered different things so we can taste as much of the menu as possible for brunch!  Jerk chicken and waffles - BOMB! chicken was so succulent and the flavor is out of this world! Never had Friend jerk chicken before. Waffle was great also! But that chicken!  Mini Corn tortilla - I got this and it was soooo yummy! the black beans were soooo good! I wish I had gotten some to go! very light, but fulfilling!  Chilaquiles - Amazing! so much flavor I can't explain!  Jerk pork hash - mmmmmmmm good! potatoes where great! the pork was so yummy and tender! My friend ate every bite of this! (she wants to marry the owner who thought of this awesomeness lol)  Over all the place is the place to go for brunch! the staff was great! Our waiter was even better! I'm so sorry I can't remember his name, but he was great! We also got bottomless mimosa and those were nice a strong ;P  Will be back! :)

AJbOfFXja8_icLsWhjK8bg.text: We went there tonight for dinner. The first impression was that the restaurant is clean. The food is made to perfection when it comes to taste and presentation. For starters we had jerk fried calamari- it had a little bit of a kick to it but the sweet glaze reached our taste buds right after the spiciness did. For me, who is very sensitive to spice, this was the perfect dish. I also got the raspberry fizz drink, which was made with fresh raspberries. The drink was fresh and did not have that overpowering sweetness that cocktails usually have. Also, their desert is a must have. Their red velvet cake made our mouths water as soon as it came out. The texture was moist and it had the prefect amount of sweetness. It was also very light so we had no problem finishing the whole piece.

fxtA8T_Wu5hZPRx6VcgM4g.text: Came here after putt putt and was really hot. Was greeted by this very cute guy who kept my water glass filled while I waited for a table. Very good service from him, loved it!  Finally got a table and sat down. I love the menu, the food all sounds so good, but finally settled on the DW Nicoise salad. My date had the Jamaican curry chicken.  I loved my salad, the dressing was divine! I really liked the tuna, but the server never asked me how I wanted it cooked so it came out rare, which I never eat. It was okay, but I would have MUCH preferred medium rare. I dislike hesitating before every bite because I don't care for the rare taste. It wasn't bad, but I could have enjoyed it more had it been cooked a tiny bit longer. The fingerling potatoes were really, really small too. That's too bad, because I really love those. The salad was great, but it really needed those two things to be an excellent salad (bigger potatoes, tuna cooked longer).   My date had the curry chicken bowl and it also had a choice of couscous or rice and he didn't get offered that either, they just brought it out with rice. He would have liked it better with the couscous. As it was he barely touched it.   The service is great as far as refills, etc. But they fall a little short on the actual customer service and what they really want. I don't like to have people assume about what I'll eat.   Oh well, it's a great place, I really like it and would highly recommend. Just read the menu and know your choices!

VPcm4mZzu3d99dACqjTqvA.text: Oh how I love DW Bistro...let me count the ways!!!  1.The FOOD: It was just simply amazing. I went with a group, so I was able to sample a good amount of the menu. I had the Jerk Chicken and Waffles, which was just amazing. I did not leave a single bit of it on the plate. We also had the Chicken Flautas as an appetizer, which was much more delicious than expected. I would recommend, however, the Curry Vegetables and Jasmine Rice. We were all envious after sampling this dish. It was the best at the table.   2.The Staff: Our waiter was amazing. We were greeted warmly at the door and was ushered to our sits on the patio immediately. He was patient in explaining the menu and the drink options. He was attentive to the table, so much so, it did not seem like he had other tables...although I knew he did. He made it an amazing experience   3.The Restaurant: It is casual, but also stylish.  4.BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS: And they weren't stingy with them.  I just loved this place. I wish I could go back and if I am ever in Vegas again, I will make it a point to return.

XbxAangPQqoXSeOYv57uWA.text: We wanted to like this place but it failed our expectations.  After driving 25 mins to get there, my boyfriend & I were seated at a very wobbly table, we moved to another table, which was also very wobbly.   I order the slow cooked pork bowl ($12). It was a lot of food & the flavor was good, but after eating the top layer, we noticed the only reason it looked like so much was because more than half the bowl was just rice.    He ordered the New Mexican chili chicken enchiladas ($12). When they brought both our plates out I couldn't believe they were the same price! My huge bowl compared to his 2 sad little enchiladas was disappointing. The enchiladas came w/ just a very small bowl of plain boring white rice. After his first bite, it just kept going down hill, BOTH ends of BOTH enchiladas were burnt. We told our server but he didn't seem to care to much. I found it funny that even after our complaints, he asked if we would be wanting dessert.  Uh No! First & LAST time at DW Bistro.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Chili Chicken Enchiladas. Burnt ends! And very small portion. Only a small bowl of boring white rice as your side.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican Style Slow Cooked Pork Bowl. Good flavor but they fool you by putting lots of rice at the bottom!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh lemonade with berries.

SCH74p3VBrSDtjG6VQzXrQ.text: I love the concept behind this restaurant.  It is trendy and affordable.  Some items on and off the menu however can use a little fine tweaking if not revamping.  We ordered a couple of appetizers including a DW appetizer special for the day and the oven roasted baby back ribs.  The ribs were ordinary while the calamari was terrible! I mean, have you ever had candied calamari before? I have, here! The sugar and breading that coated the calamari made the dish a tough and unappetizing one. It's a good thing the entrees made up for the starter mess.  For entrees, we had the jerk lamb chops, jerk chicken scampi over linguine, the filet with bordelaise served over mash f the day, the pan seared salmon and the Jamaican curry chicken. The lamb was juicy, cooked to my desired doneness and seasoned perfectly.  The filet with bordelaise was so so, I've had better breaded fish.  The jerk chicken scampi over linguine was really good.  I recommend this one for anyone who likes to try something new and delicious.  Unfortunately, I did not get to sample the pan seared salmon nor the Jamaican curry chicken. No desserts were ordered as we were all very full.  The price is absolutely reasonable for the portions.    One thing I like about the place is that the owner of the bistro comes around.  He remembers his patrons and engages in conversation with them.  Another plus to the bistro is their corkage policy.  We brought three bottles of wine and enjoyed it and shared it with everyone in our group.  I am excited about this place.  It is promising.  They just need to work on their specials and their starter menu.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk lamb chops
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with bordelaise
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken scampi over linguine

W5nemo_TPBobadOAXCnKxg.text: For those of you visiting Vegas, make sure you get off the strip to experience some great cuisine!  DW Bistro is another GREAT reason to rent a car for one day while taking a break from drinking/shopping/being hungover, and experiencing some really quality food.  The first thing you notice is the decor.  The design is very non-Vegas and is almost artistic.  It is a vibe that makes you want to sit, relax, eat good food, and have great conversations.  The vibe only sets the tone for the delicious food.  I was a part of a group of four that came for Sunday brunch.  Because there were so many of us, we got to try a lot of the menu.    The Pesto Torte is a MUST item.  The cheese, crackers and pesto are so-damn-good-I-want-to-fly-to-Vegas-to-eat-now good.    The Chicken Lollipops with Jerk Buttermilk sauce are amazing, and just the right size.  The sauce compliments the slight spice and smokiness of the chicken perfectly.  The New-Mexican Style Slow Cooked Pork is served over rice with an egg and is a gourmet version of the chili and rice all of use ate in school.  The pork is nice and tender with and is a great, hearty hangover dish.  The French Toast is nicely cooked and the highlight is the slightly spiced syrup.  (We killed the syrup and wiped the plate clean of it).  The best entree item was the Jerk Fried Chicken and Waffles.  If you have had the ones at Hash House, do yourself a favor and try these.  The slight spicyness from the jerk seasoning, the fluffy waffles, and the syrup all combine to create a symphony.  Hands downs, some delicious Chicken and Waffles.  Oh, and make sure to get the Bloody Mary with Bacon.  It is pretty damn good, especially with the bacon.  Be warned though, instead of a pimento in the olive, it is a chunk of habanero pepper, sure to wake you up and knock out any hangover.

i1D2f7XgDTQ747YYLm__mg.text: We really drive quite a ways to eat here regularly. The food is superb, but the fun part about the DW experience is interacting with the owners, Bryce & Dalton. It's one of those places where the owners take pride in their restaurant & make it worth the trip. AND, once you've gone a few times, you can brag to your friends that you know the owners.   A few random observations: The atmosphere is trendy; there's a quaint outdoor eating area; they close early on Sundays & are closed altogether on Mondays which is unusual; the food is jerk-style, so if your sensitive on spicy food like me, your choices may be limited, however, if you're feeling extra picky, just ask & the chef will make something special just for you. You don't find that individual attention every day!   They acquired the space next door - I imagine for more seating, banquets or special events. Either way, I'm sure they will be successful. They got something good going here.

70xBvsruL9EmMUWjnYamZw.text: Waitress wasn't too knowledgeable about what was in the curry soup. Everything they make is with bacon. Bacon on chicken sandwich, BLT, Bacon on this, bacon on that... so if you like Bacon this is your place!  Our food took a while to come out, the place was packed for a mid week lunch.    Motif is awesome, outside seating looks great too. I'd go back and try it again, but I wouldn't send anyone out of their way quite yet to try it.

X1tYbOeM4aUNT5lVC2sDIA.text: I really enjoyed their food. I got slow cooked pork over rice and it was pretty good. Pork was really soft. I wish it was a bit more flavorful but good enough! Price was pretty decent too. Fried chicken and waffle wasn't that great though :/ I've had better ones.  What I found funny was that, on the weekend brunch, all you can drink mimosa cost $20... and food costed much less than that.

UboEFJlB2KI0PPYB80LzNQ.text: Delicious! I had the pork bowl which was delicious and had a generous portion, I took half of it home. Their homemade ice tea was also delicious, with a twist of Caribbean flavors. My friend had the pan seared salmon ( I try to refrain from ordering salmon when eating out because it's so easy to make at home ) but their salmon was delicious as well, a slight twist on the rice (saffron and lemon?) our waiter was also a highlight of the visit, extremely courteous and friendly! Will definitely be coming back for brunch

Q_70AMpH-Z-NWVhpwJVl0Q.text: Very nice staff. The food was good.  We had our 2 kids with us and they were patient. My husband had the lamb chops, but we're kind of small.  We want to try their brunch.

Rn5XZ3_CntxREZvYmFFJhQ.text: It's nice. It's contemporary. It's bright.  It has a good social atmosphere.  Yeah, I'd probably come back sometime in the future.    Although I enjoyed the atmosphere, some of the food did not stand up in comparison.  I had brunch with some friends, and the other three had traditional breakfast items that were not spectacular.  Not bad, but again, nothing impressive.  My husband did get the chicken and waffles, and as many other yelpers have complained, the waffles were a little tough and not crispy at all.    I did thoroughly enjoy my vegetable curry with couscous.  The curry was flavorful and just delicious and the freshly made couscous complimented very well.  Again, worth trying again.

mm--zRA2dW-nHzcG2EVvIA.text: Perfect food perfect theme perfect presentation perfect classy dining high class 5 star feeling love this place just left the restaurant

9L7ka-VUIrAAgXnjXaXhMw.text: Best brunch place in Las Vegas!!  Food is always tasty and I have tried almost everything on the menu. Service is great - always friendly and happy to help. This is a must go to restaurant!

it-B5eH9kX88yAExjgpV2A.text: We went to DW Bistro for brunch during restaurant week. I had been meaning to go there since I heard about them at Bite of Las Vegas a few years ago, but had never gotten around to it.  My wife ordered a pomegranate iced tea which she liked. I'm not big into iced tea, but I took a sip and thought it was decent.  For our appetizer we both got the shrimp cocktail which was good and had a nice kick to the sauce.  For my main course I got the chicken and waffles. The chicken was spicy and delicious. The waffle was served with a really good rum syrup. Would definitely order this again.  My wife got the crab cake Benedict. I'm not a huge fan of Hollandaise but the dish was still pretty tasty. The egg was a bit over done though and had a firm yolk.  For dessert we were give an assortment of treats: mud pie, red velvet cake, lemon lime pudding, and peanut butter pie. I'm not a big fan of sweets and was a little daunted by it all. But I have to admit that they were all very good. My favorite was the peanut butter pie.

2Zbg_oBvyCJ-Vzd3M3CzgA.text: The only thing stopping me from giving this place 5 stars was the service.  It's not that the service was bad, just slow.  The waitstaff was busy, I just think they needed another waiter or 2.  They also have the most uncomfortable plastic chairs!  They don't have a wine list here, but they will bring you samples of a few wines to try which was a very nice touch.  I think we sampled 4 different wines before choosing a bottle of the Dirt Red.  2 of the 3 us picked this as our favorite.  On to the food!  It was delicious!!  We started with appetizers - the curry soup, the house salad and the cream/goat cheese with pesto.  The soup was fantastic and the pesto was some of the best I've ever had.  You could tell it was fresh, not made with fillers and it was not nearly enough to go with the huge piece of cheese.  We asked for a little more pesto and our waiter brought a small dish with plenty for all of us.  For the main course, we had the vegetable curry, the jerk baked fried chicken and the shredded pork with red chiles.  Everything had great flavor and was a huge portion (we all brought home leftovers).  Our waiter forgot to bring our side of corn, but that was okay after we saw the size of our meals.    We did splurge on dessert and went with the cake sampler platter; a slice of carrot, chocolate and red velvet cake.  Now for a sampler, we expected to each have a taste of each flavor, but nooooo, it seemed like there were 3 almost full slices of cake on the plate.  All the flavors were good, but not spectacular.  I'd skip this next time easily.  I for sure will come back here next time I'm in Vegas, it's not that far off the strip and well worth the drive!

WN07hO3K4HM5nt3nPLj3Dw.text: Great service! Great decor! Great food! Great time!   Went with a bunch of my girlfriends for a birthday dinner, and we all had a great time! The wait staff was very friendly and fast! I had the short ribs and liked it but felt it needed a little more flavor something was missing either salt or a seasoning it just needed one more thing, but I would def recommend it and get it again (prob just add salt myself) the daily mash that came with is was DELICIOUS and the vegetables that came with it, eehhh I could of done without. Other menu items ordered was the salmon (which I had a taste and LOVED! I thought it was perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and perfectly moist on the inside) and fried chicken (my friends didn't like it). All in all we had a blast and I will def be back . OHHHHH I can't BELIEVE I almost forgot to mention the Jerk Calamari TO DIE FOR! I would eat this everyday! Even non calamari and non seafood eaters at our table LOVED IT!

rGvgmi6Gnz_FxB7pFmiwrg.text: Another amazing meal! There is a fine attention to detail in every dish I've tasted here. I ordered two specials: a seafood ceviche with a honey chipotle sauce that was hot, sweet, and perfectly balanced, followed by an entree of  sea scallops and filet over celery root / roasted garlic mash.   5 stars all the way. Can't wait to go back.

q5TG7S3NlkqmucF-foErGw.text: Hands Down, the best restaurant i've been too since living here in Las Vegas. One of the chefs, Chef Green made a portion of our food and delivered not only a great presentation but an amazing burst of flavor on our pallets.   We went for brunch, everyone was so friendly. The ambiance was relaxing and inviting. The owners came around and spoke with us. He's such a humble individual, you'd never know he was the owner until he says his name.   I'm a photographer and the art they have in their main lobby is AMAZING. Must see for yourself!   I need to go back and try their lollipop chicken. I mean Jamaican infused goodness, great services and a fun environment to be in, that's a recipe for a great experience.   LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.

NxEG76bPrNG5_gaE2ttAjw.text: My goodness, how refreshing to find this wonderful "secret" in a shopping mall off the Strip.  From the outside you have no idea what to expect, but once inside there is a welcoming vibe that draws you right in.  From our wonderful waiter (Vidal) to the bartender and the cooks we  say "A BIG THANK YOU" for making our lunch a great adventure in fine eating.  We first ordered the "Pesto Torte - a combination of cream and goat cheese with roasted nuts; served with flatbread crackers,"  which was truly amazing!  For our main we got a big rice bowl, "New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork simmered in New Mexican red chile with two over-easy eggs and served over rice."  My son said it was delicious, but was too spicy for me.  I had the "DW turkey burger served on a brioche bun with a dash of jerk seasoning and mango pear apple chutney."  Well, that was a total treat and I licked the plate clean!  And don't forget the perfect, fresh squeezed lemonade that was refilled three times!  If you are anywhere in Las Vegas and want a beautiful meal, great ambiance, amazing food and a wonderful service staff, then get in the car, it is well worth the drive!

N6F0numapAL9M_p7RG_VAA.text: delicious food, amazing pineapple infused vodka....great service....

yE35dMQc4lv-ivWt-Gtssg.text: This is my favorite brunch place in the whole  wide world!! You can't go wrong ordering ANY menu item! Nom nom nom nom

YcqdN7aJJCHhfckcJrbhAQ.text: I spent 4 days in Vegas and so far I've found that these little places outside of the strip are cheaper, the service is better and the food is outstanding. This place has great food I recommend getting one of the specials or the jerk chicken salad. They have a decent selection of beer. Overall I'm very impressed and would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for affordable and quality food!

Lje5MAkq1q9bFFkW8nwnoA.text: This is it folks!! Went here on a whim and DW's instantly joins our rotation for eating out.  Went their for lunch and I had a the short rib sandwich and Mrs. Devo had the Jerk chicken sandwich. Both were amazing and the sweet potato fries were superb. The decor is also pleasant on the eyes and  the ice tea was delicious. We will be back.

9Qtr7gskD_JzEXbTNwr70Q.text: How is it that I have not written a review for DW yet??!!  We have been there over a dozen times and it is about time I share the awesome dining experience that we always have!!  This is one of our favorite Brunch places and we love their food AND all you can drink mimosas for $20!!   DW is a fun place, a little swanky, yet completely comfortable!!  The service and Food are always GREAT and we love the variety of the menu!! The food has a wonderful West Indies/Caribbean spice that will leave you wanting more!!  There are so many great items on the menu....but here are a few of our favorites -  -- Chicken Flautas - quite possibly my favorite thing on the menu and a dish that we get every single time we dine there -- Eggs Benedict with cognac infused sausage - DELISH and comes with a little side of potatoes -- Jalapeno Bacon - you must at least order it as a side (they also make their BLT's with it and it is AMAZING too)!! -- Fried Chicken and Waffles - The chicken is juicy and tender and the waffles are light and crisp -- Chilaquiles - First time I ever tried them was here and it was very good!!  Have had them since at other places, and this still reigns supreme  -- Drinks - Make sure that you try their Bloody Mary's - they are good and have all the fruit and veggies and a nice slice of Jalapeno Bacon in it (they also used to have a Habanero stuffed olive that they would put in there too, although I think they stopped that....but be on the safe side and check to make sure....don't make the mistake I had and innocently just pop one in your mouth) and their Homemade Marinated Vodkas and Rums!!!

xZro1RJ4AfW27z7T8hAc4A.text: I was looking for a new spot to enjoy Sunday brunch. DW Bistro was an excellent choice. The food is great, the staff is very friendly and the space is comfortable. We sat outside and thought that I was on vacation. Beautiful greenery was all around and hid the parking lot nicely. Well done.   Everyone from our table enjoyed their food and drinks. If you enjoy a sweet dish, the French toasts are some of the best I have had in a long time. The chicken lollipops are very nice as well. The slow-cooked pork was fork tender. I have to admit that I was not a fan of their red velvet cake. I thought it was too dry. Their coffee was excellent.   Nothing to complain about the staff. Every single person we interacted with was truly friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ynwXU0n6o7pvkjBuDRpcCg.text: I just love this food here, and its so fresh and perfectly seasoned, its amazing really.  The owners have done a great job and are there every day.  Service is stellar, and the food is top of the charts, its a little pricey, but you get what you pay for at this joint.  Quality ingredients, Superb preparation, extensive details on each dishes presentation and a tasty finish.  I am hooked, I wish I could go more and slam my face into some killer carribbean grinds, its a little  fancy for some tastes, but overall, I think everyone should be able to find a home run here.  I love the salads, Ahi Tuna particularly, but everything is good.  5 STAR STUFF HERE!  as Daniel Tosh says at the end of his disclaimer...ENJOY!

VSPx-gwhLgXn0LIlJZQvBg.text: You know, when you want a really great meal, but NOT on the Strip? Something Tasty, that you know you will enjoy, this is the goto place for me. I LOVE their food. Spicy Lamb Chops - Jerked, and such great service to boot. The restaurant  always feels lively and fun, with a wide open bright layout it cheers you right up! Maybe this is why the wait staff is so pleasant? The bright colors make me feel good psychologically and the fantastic food fills my belly physically. I always leave feeling well taken care of and satisfied!  I have heard great things about their brunch menu! I have yet to try it, but I plan to soon. ( the wait for brunch can be a bit...so plan accordingly)

Jgy9714Z-Ni3U03xWdWaSQ.text: Amazing food! Amazing owners! Amazing atmosphere! Amazing staff! This place is wonderful! All of their food is great. I love their Benedict specials, especially the Jamaican jerk chicken Benedict with jalenpeno bacon on green chile cornbread!! If you're lucky enough to catch this on the menu, order it!! Dalton is wonderful, he's a good man that cares about what he does. He puts love into everything. Bryce is amazing too. This place is all around perfect.

_McJwrgvrizj46lZGkRdDA.text: Great cuisine with the service to follow. We enjoyed the Sunday brunch. Tasty mimosas and as a special request I ordered the salmon bowl. Deliciously prepared, usually only on the lunch menu but thankful they made a special order for me. Try it, but get there a bit early, it gets pretty busy but you wont be disappointed.

SCr7hEp2zNuWTZiW9qTEiw.text: Everything here is delicious and the servers know their stuff... They always recommend something I love and are very knowledgable about the plethora of sauces on the tables.  My husband and I go here to treat ourselves to date nights and we're never disappointed. The pesto torte app is our favorite!!!!

i1VbaBN79P_HOEV7pU_Kxg.text: After seeing so many reviews & pictures from friends who frequent this restaurant, we decided it was time to check it out. I'm so glad we did. It was amazing.  We went for dinner. The items my boyfriend & I enjoyed were:  -chicken flautas (delicious - I was sad when we finished them) -jerk chicken scampi (I wanted to lick the bowl clean afterwards - I didn't but I wanted to) -chicken curry bowl (this was the boyfriends & he loved it - especially the variety of hot sauces on the table he could choose & pick from to add to it. I tasted it before the sauces - so good) -carrot cake (this is where they were docked a star - it was not my favorite. I love carrot cake & the cake itself was good but the frosting was a little on the light handed side & couldn't be tasted through alllllllllll of the white chocolate curls it was covered with. If I could request no white chocolate on it, I'm betting I would've like it more.) -lemon lime pudding (I only had a small bite & it was very good - the boyfriend didn't care for the dark chocolate truffles on the side but I was very happy to help with those.) -iced tea (boyfriend got the house iced tea which was pomegranate, I believe - very good. Not overly sweet. Perfectly refreshing) -blueberry-licious cocktail (I loved this one - sweet but not overly sweet) -Jamaican mojito (good but the muddled berries kept clogging the straw - the taste was great though when I could drink it)  All in all, it was a delicious meal. The service was spectacular. We were attended to but not hovered over. Food came out hot & fresh, we never had empty glasses & everyone had a smile on their face.  I can't wait to go back. I want to give them a shot during brunch & again for a different dessert to see if the peanut butter chocolate pie is worthy enough to get them that last star!

pS-TqYQWBuCtMl5ykQQxOw.text: Great food! Great service! Wine Starts at $52 a bottle, $13 a glass!  We were looking for a great afternoon, late lunch restaurant with a patio where we could bring our dog.  We had always wanted to try DW Bistro. We called and were told the patio was open and Yes!, our dog was welcome. We were happy and headed right out. The hostess was charming and our server was very nice and full of great information about all the things DW had to offer.  He brought us a beautiful little basket of tasty breads with the menus.  We were hungry and dove right into the menus.... and the bread!   First, to the wine menu!  We were looking for our normal bottle of under $40 Cabernet or Zinfandel. Normally most every restaurant we normally visit will have a few offerings in our price range - but not here.  A bottle of the least expensive wine was $52!   We do like our wine and we do appreciate a good wine. We are Trader Joe's and Lee's regulars and we know of many very tasty under $10 bottles... that we can usually find in most restaurants for the regular 300-400+% markup,...and... we do not necessarily appreciate what others consider to be GREAT wine... which I guess is our only choice at DW.    We just do not buy $52 bottles of wine... Our nose and taste for wine is just not that, how you say? "educated"?  This is a deal breaker for us.  We always buy at least one bottle of wine at dinner, but today we settled for a $13 glass of house Cabernet for each of us.  I will admit the house Cab was delicious. but I think outside of the strip hotels this is the most we have ever paid for individual glass of wine. (yeah, ok so we run with a low end crowd,,, what can I say)  That told, the food was delicious!  Everything... the appetizers and the main courses. We didn't have any deserts but they all sound wonderful and I am sure they are. This only made us more disappointed in the wine selection.  It sounds like the brunches might be the best thing to hit. We might try that sometime.

8Y__dQa1puqUiacHqHyuIw.text: I was excited to gather a few friends to do brunch today so rounded them up early to get there in time time to avoid the usual wait time . When we arrived approximately 11am were told told it would be an approximate 1hr wait. As we agreed we would wait and order a drink at the bar. To my surprise as myself and another patron noticed 4 employees working the bar and continuously ignored the 2 of us. After finally a few gestures we we got 1 bartender to get our  drinks ordered....1....at...a...time. my group and I waited outside over 1.5 hours..after inquiring and told were were were coming up next it began to rain..needless to say we left. Maybe give other try in a month or so

VUlWkyUjSzXa2wFmEWB_IA.text: Great place to hang out, great food, and great service! The only thing that I hope they'll change is going back to chill music for brunch on the weekends...last time I was there, it was club music and that's the last thing you wanna hear when you are trying to unwind from your week!  But great place altogether!

xQtlcbxUirakRJ0MiXqyBA.text: Arrived at around 8:45 pm on a Saturday, there wasn't a crowd. Actually it was pretty clear. The wait staff is so knowledgeable about the flavors of the menu, and the wine/cocktail menu, refreshing. I will be back...so freakin' good!

x3plt43C9cPEbzEn0Y0M3g.text: My favorite brunch & lunch spot! I thoroughly enjoy the brunch menu ~ unlimited mimosas, chicken flautas, fruit, I could literally eat everything!  Lunch is to die for, first choice is their salmon however; Dalton is a master and the daily specials will quickly distract you from your *usual*.  This place is amazing and I think I just planned lunch for Thursday!

nEejtMQR83n1ArMlMdExlQ.text: I know that one's review of an establishment is influenced greatly by the ambience experienced and service received, as well as food quality (if the establishment is a restaurant).  My recent visit to DW Bistro scores an A+ on all of those points.  I enjoyed the banter of my very funny server, the beautiful contemporary chic of the interior, and my meal!  The cool modern decor was truly a feast for the eyes (see website for pictures).  As for the actual food, yum!  We started with the pesto torte appetizer, a lovely blend of cream and goat cheese topped with fantastic pesto and nuts.  The size of this appetizer was quite large, easily besting my party of four (really).  I'd come back for that appy alone.  Other dishes selected included the Jamaican curry chicken bowl over couscous grains so big they seemed fake (it was very tasty though and the portion size was enormous), braised oxtail (tender and covered with a sweet glaze), and the New Mexico chili cheeseburger with sweet potato fries (the green chili tasted very similar to what I had during my time in NM).  Dessert was the trio cake sampler (chocolate, carrot, red velvet).  I think my favourite was the red velvet due to its tangy frosting.  Yum!  The carrot cake was also very very good and featured pineapple and white chocolate flakes.  We left DW Bistro stuffed and satisfied.  I'll have to return for brunch!

Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican curry chicken.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican chili cheeseburger and sweet potato fries.

k19PiOSKZ4SL2iVIb3nxBQ.text: Buried in a strip mall deep in SW is something truly original for Vegas...Jamaican/New Mexican fusion dining.  Yes!!  1) Owners Bryce & Don are simply fantastic, and represent well the great things that happen when 2 diff worlds come together.   2) I'm glad I got in while I could.  It will be reservations-only for dinner in a few months. 3) fresh, light art deco-caribbean atmosphere.   4) fast, attentive service.  5) shrimp curry on couscous is savory, creamy heaven.  6) perfect chocolate cake.  Literally.   7) yellow watermelon infused vodka that needs no mixer...absolutely luscious!  ...100% worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eveything here is unique...
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9wlQGIZcWIo8flwHvvbZYw.text: One of my favorite places to go eat. Great food, friendly staff, very clean and good vibe

nN10J3E6u8bbLTjUBeuTQg.text: You've read myriad reviews about the inventive drinks, meals and deserts.  I completely agree with the raves.    What I love about this place is the relaxed, no-rush attitude.  I'll be honest, if you are in a hurry to order, eat, pay and run, let them know as soon as you are seated.  You'll get a little more attention from your servers during weeknights.  The weekends and Sunday Brunch are usually a raucous, madhouse setting.  If you decide to join them for the party be prepared for bottomless "All Day" mimosas, a long wait to be seated and lots of time at your table.  Personally I love the fact that I can share a drink or two at the bar with friends and take our time without ever feeling rushed by staff trying to flip tables.  A few suggestions:  1.  Dine during the week for the most attentive service and less noise. 2.  The daily specials are always amazing. 3.  Specialty cocktails are worth a try.  Beware: some are very sweet and very strong. 4.  Feel free to bring a bottle of wine from your own cellar, they are very accommodating.   5.  Remember, most of the flavors are bold and spicy. 6.  Sunday brunch is a time for friends and good times, be prepared for an event, not simply a meal.  Schedule accordingly. 7.  Come back regularly and bring your friends.  Good Eating!

D07bECdj2QItf0bLJuxQTQ.text: I got the veggie curry and found it to be rather bland, and way too expensive. I took over half of it home, and added a bunch more spices before I ate the leftovers so that it actually tasted like something. I really don't get the 4.5 star rating for this place.   The ambiance and service were very nice and the bread basket was full of tasty offerings.

j0kzFEyk4EQQ5DMbItfHpw.text: Have you ever flown first class? or have gone to a spa and got pampered? Well, at DW Bristro you will get a combined experience of being pampered by fulfilling your taste buds and the service of first class. The place is inspired by the taste of Jamaica, Hawaiian fusion and Latin food. Love this place. A must go for great service, cool atmosphere, and super delicious food. The owner of this place DW is genius.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Carrot Cake custom made by DW him self. Not to sweet, but just sweet enough to make you want another slice.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared Salmon on top of rice with a secret butter sauce. So delicious it just melts in your mouth.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Jerk Chicken with special dipping sauce and sweet Potatoe fries. Very good.

WKFtSG6NtFaqIym66RwEYw.text: The food is ok, drinks are good but overpriced. Service was a bit ridiculous. Since when did waiters get the sense of entitlement that they're doing the customer a favor?  The waiter, from the get go,  had such an attitude that it made me not wanna bother ordering anything else. One of the most traditional Chefs in this town just walked in (with me) to eat at your restaurant. Are we just not "cool" enough for ya?!

teYNAqHKIKxhC38xJ0cbPw.text: During a recent trip to Las Vegas, we visited DW Bistro again for lunch on a Sunday.  The place was jammed packed, which is always a good sign.  We had eight people in our party making the wait for a table even more challenging.  The person (I think he is one of the owners) who checked us in was so friendly and welcoming that we trusted the fact he said it would not be too long, and he was correct.  DW Bistro has a pretty cool check in system that sends a text indicating your name has been recorded and when your table is ready.   After being seated, they offer all you can drink mimosas for $20.  After a hectic weekend, we went with pomegranate iced teas, and one person had an amazing Bloody Mary.   The pomegranate iced tea was super refreshing, and the Bloody Mary was exciting.  The Bloody Mary comes with a garnish containing an olive, a pickle, and a piece of bacon...yes a piece of bacon.  There was certainly nothing boring or routine about the Bloody Mary.   I started off with the Chicken Flautas as an appetizer.  The flautas were spicy enough, and the chicken inside was perfect.  The presentation was equally impressive.  My main course was the Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Waffles with homemade syrup.  Do not be concerned when you see the coating around the chicken.  The coating is dark, thick, but it is so delicious.  The coating is complex and contains several Jamaican spices.  Others in our party went with the Eggs Benedict, and they indicated it was delicious as well.  The item is served on fresh biscuits and a side of potatoes.  In regards to the service, it is clearly five stars!   If you find yourself in south Las Vegas near Summerlin, you must give DW Bistro a try.  On the other hand, if you need some time away from the strip, drive 15 minutes south and enjoy the unique dishes that DW Bistro has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Waffles with homemade syrup

r2iXjYeoZHgK0ohbY8yi2Q.text: A. Maze. Ing.   Just celebrated my birthday here with an unbelievable brunch.   The staff, food, atmosphere and vibes were totally on point.    I opted for the Jamaican chicken and waffles.  Oh my gawwwwd.  Life affirming chicken.  Fluffy, golden syrupy waffle deliciousness.  Just try it, you won't be disappointed.    Make sure you get some ginger mints on the way out!!  I left speaking like a Jamaican.    Yaaa monnn.

E7JkDQvA8rRIqRQIZqwfvQ.text: 8/1/18 - A return review....Had dinner and discovered they changed the menu (and not for the good). Drinks still over priced with very little alcohol. Shrimp n Grits was more of an appetizer or kids portion. They no longer have Curry chicken and vegetables with couscous. The chicken was $4 extra and it was served with an enormous amount of white rice that sucked up the sauce and made the meal dry.   Bring back the old menu. I wonder if the chef changed as well. I felt like I wanted $32 for a drink and entree.   ****************************************************  Food is very flavorful and taste really good.  However, very pricey. $$ is not a True representation and should be $$$$. Great decor but chairs are not comfortable and it's loud if it's crowded.  Jerk Chicken $22, small portion of chicken for the price considering it only comes with rice & peas and a spoon of vegetables. Fried Chicken $22, over priced considering it only comes with cornbread & gravy and NO vegetables.   Cocktails were not good, they tasted nor like juice and must have only had a splash of alcohol. Jamaican Mule $13, Capri Sunny Slope $12, & Red Stripe $5.

ZGh3H0HeVHGVxCzZOblJFQ.text: One of my favorite brunch, lunch and dinner spots!  I've had almost everything on their menu and I enjoy every bite.  My favorite is the Bloody Mary with the jalapeno bacon and fresh made Bloody Mary mix.  The decor is great and I love the art on the walls.  I just adore everything about this place.  The service is always excellent.  From the owner to the servers and everyone else, they are all very friendly and welcoming.  I come here every chance I get!

OinjMukLUK5eQHAEkNgb1Q.text: Greeted at the door by the best owner/manager/host/bartender/person/friend in the vicinity. The unlimited mimosas appear out of no where, like...bam!!! More alcohol, and more alcohol! The food is in proportions where you need to share. But the food tastes so good, you want to keep it all to yourself. The flavor is something that is so unique, I don't understand why they aren't franchising this place. I would go here in every city I go too. Did I mention the food is freakin' awesome. Brunch here on Sunday alone is worth a trip to Vegas! Thank you for having us!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best home-made sauces in sin city!!!

S9xqT3-rEPd5TCsgSSPnjQ.text: Just wow. Impeccable service and super, great, really tasty and fresh food. It's hard to find if you don't know - so go where Siri takes you then park. Walk toward the nail salon and it's past it, there's like a quad area once you get inside the center of the buildings. It's called Gramercy. It was so hard to find I called them twice and I usually don't have to call to find a restaurant. The young lady at the reception told me they are new there and working with the city on signage so that's good because I was about to give up. Back to the food, it was simply so delicious this place is on my list of top places to eat in Las Vegas for real and I have lived here 25 years and been to just about every place. This place is so clean, the staff is so friendly and the food was great. Thank you so much and I will be voting for DW Bistro as one of the top places to eat in our town, look at the photo's y'all.

Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend had a special of Lamb Chops
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New location they just moved in here in Russell Road and 215

kHaSZkpYAqPSx5S_70XmQQ.text: Hands down, one of the best brunch spots in Vegas. Chicken and waffles, jalapeno bacon, chicken flautas, everything is so good. The service is on point and the drinks are great! Dinner is good too, but I only come for brunch!

Ifd5iZxGu4sS1_01RjMg1Q.text: Pretty irresponsible restaurant and service. We ordered the Challah French Toast for the table to share and served a decent portion to a toddler before any adult tried a bite. My first bite I immediately tasted alcohol in the syrup. There is no indication of this on the menu. My wife is pregnant. We asked the server about this and he explained there is Rum in the signature syrup and they have a separate syrup for kids upon request. They replaced the item but still tastes of rum, maybe that version is cooked down. Unacceptable not to label your menu items or inform your guests for these considerations.

cVhwevo3ea5KEpaUdeC6jA.text: I went for lunch. Took my mom for Mother's Day. Mom loved the bottom less mimosa. great service. I feel like I've had better food from other places but I gave 5 star because of all other things. Big window, modern but cozy, can be casual but upscale atmosphere. It's just really a beautiful place!!

-wYImOfAOfM9Dumy4Xy-bA.text: This is my 3rd times I come here and I always order different salad and it always good. This place has a great atmospher and the service is good. Next time I will try the  real meal cuz it seems like always looks good from someone else plates.

DImamoLfhApqdZA1in-CdQ.text: Love this place!! I always go for brunch with friends. Food is delish, cool atmosphere, friendly staff.

hwIUQ0VSPU8mUgtd86w7UQ.text: I went to DW Bistro for brunch on my birthday. The atmosphere was great but I ordered the wrong item. The very popular jerk chicken and waffles was disappointingly dry. So save your time and skip the jerk chicken and waffles. It's a bit disappointing when the signature/popular dish at a restaurant isn't good. So that's why it's a 3 for me.  However, I did have my friends turkey burger. It was very good. The chilaquiles are also quite good. So I would go back and order the non popular dishes.

D25JlQKS06ECq_z6-8UagA.text: Beyond tasty, best salmon I've had in a long time. Service was great. Thank you for the great dining big experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GVFrlzZj7sd_70vuvLxJUg.text: Amazing.  Every.single.time.  My favorite is the Ahi Tuna salad.  Also the hibiscus iced tea is so good.  Been there numerous times and I've never been let down.  Make sure you try the street tacos and fried chicken skins!

NpoSjc8c9eVTVqPxAd8VdA.text: Totally love the atmosphere of this place! So cute and perfect for Sunday bunch. The music is everything, but I was disappointed by the food! I went here for brunch this past Sunday and got the jerk chicken and waffles.. the waffles were soggy and the chicken was honestly not the greatest, especially for the price.

LfAQeM5xENo91Ba0FqCqyQ.text: I came here solely because of one of the signature cocktails that I saw on their website, that I had to try; Na-Cho Negroni - Gracias a Dios Gin with Campari and Broadbent 5yr Madeira. Smoked with applewood in a smoking box. I loved it.  Came for the cocktail, stayed for the food. It was more than worth it. One of the specials was this salad, and I don't really remember what all was in it because I heard fried ball of goat cheese and tuned out. Salad was delicious. There were mixed greens, chopped garlic, red onions, and something that looked like a cherry tomato but was far more savory and tart, with champagne dressing. Very light.  I also decided to try the turkey sliders with sweet potato fries. I was never a fan of sweet potatoes, and especially sweet potato fries, but these were delicious. The sliders were small, but they were also from the Shareables section. The apple pear mango chutney gave a nice kick to them.  Finally, since I was a new visitor, I was treated with a complimentary piece of carrot cake, which had white chocolate, macadamia nuts, ginger, and coconut. They gave me a separate fork, which was brought out in what looked like a small wooden box laid with satin. Talk about presentation.  I'm definitely coming back. There were many other menu items I want to try, and the service was great.

Gf0_HE5XQzuBMB276H7Tig.text: I like my mimosas just like my beach attire... bottomless.   I mean over seven hundred reviews and a four and a half star rating, DW is obviously doing something right. From the decor of the venue, to the amazing food, and don't forget the drinks. No wonder this place is always packed.   Walking up to DW Bistro you can already feel the buzz and I'm not talking alcohol... yet. On Sundays this place is humming with hungry brunchers, and with an hour wait ahead, why not start starting sippin' on some bottomless mimosas. These will cost about twenty dollars a person, which really isn't a deal bad especially if you're here with a large group. They aren't stingy either, every time my glass was empty, before I could look around for a server my glass was being topped off.   We finally sat down and immediately ordered the pastry basket. This is filled with chocolate croissants & blueberry white chocolate scones. The soft pastries were very fresh and surprisingly not overly sweet. This basket is overflowing and will easily feed five people, a great way to kick off the brunch party.   With a group five I won't bore you with what everyone ate, I mean it's really all about my snacking skills, right? Kidding of course (NOT REALLY)   I ordered one of their "off the menu specials". A Mexican-style slow cooked chicken omelet. This was a delicious, and I didn't feel bad about eating an omelet with chicken inside. I mean who cares which came first. The chicken was super tender and came soaking in a New Mexico red chili sauce with peppers, onions and pepper jack cheese. I would most definitely order this bad boy again.   Our service was point and our party never had any issues. We ever stayed after they closed and the servers were still pouring mimosas.  This place is a great local hangout spot and the owner, DW, is awesome. He even topped off a few of our drinks personally.   PRO TIP: DW does not take reservations. So if you plan on coming here for brunch on Mother's Day, better get here early! Just sayin!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry Basket!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chicken Omelet!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4zwhKXcqxOYsfAFC0OJGCA.text: I really like this place. Nice drinks, excellent service and tasty food. I had the New Mexican Pork Bowl , um it was soo good! Today I had the DW Turkey Burger, oh my it was so good!

aspY5X-MxaSNS51RV7RNAQ.text: I was hoping to order the jerk chicken and waffles but Ordered the fried chicken, fried calamari, and fish n chips. The food was fantastic and bursting with flavors. They have separate menus for the different time of day, and I wish you could order anything at anytime, but understand why they do it. We will be back for brunch, lunch, and dinner!!! Not to mention the customer service was A1!!! Highly recommended!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HeHS8w75VRYWlwCWOucaIw.text: This was a great place to go for lunch but I got there at 11:30am and had to wait 2 HOURS before we were seated. In addition to the long wait, they had run out of silverware and glassware so we had to wait a bit before we got water.  I'm giving it a 3 stars simply because of the wait and the lack of dish ware to accommodate the restaurant. Outside of that, the food was good and the service once we received it was okay.   I will try this place again to see if the logistics on seating and serving are better.

OL3u8gVNYinh3619kBOogg.text: Delicious Dining @ DW!  It was finally time for my lucky charm and I to visit DW Bistro.  We arrived shortly after they opened for a lunchtime treat.  We were immediately seated but it still filled in quickly even for a weekday.  The main dining room is lovely decorated.  We did notice there were two rooms adjacent to the main dining room which could host a private event.    My friend and I started off with sharing the DW Shrimp & Chorizo. The shared appetizer is served with several types of bread to enjoy with the dish.  The lemon beurre blanc enhances every bite to savor.  This meal definitely started off right!  For lunch we chose to spit a few sandwiches: Braised Short Rib and Turkey Burger.  The braised short rib was tender topped with infused jalapeno bacon.  The kitchen did a superb job filling the sandwich meat to the brink of the bread.  Their turkey burger really stands out on a pedestal.  What makes it so well done was their mango apple chutney nicely layered on the burger.  The soft buttery brioche would make this a repeat order for me.    If that doesn't sound like enough, we wanted to satisfy our sweet tooth with a dessert.  We shared the White Chocolate Mousse Cake.  I loved how light the cake consistency is.  It's topped with the freshest of berries  for a beautiful presentation.  After eating a large meal, a light dessert was great.    Thank you to Alfonso for providing such great service.  He was so attentive of our needs especially when sharing dishes.  DW will be on the return visit list soon!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib sandwich with sweet potato fries
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish Chorizo and shrimp shared plate
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Burger with sweet potato fries

T61e0TfdavEO91nBApia7w.text: We love it here! DW has been our "go to" brunch spot for a few years now...recently we discovered their dinner. All in all...the service is great. The owner/manager is often present...he is friendly and kind and always welcoming. Food is great. Good variety and always fresh and hot. Chilaquiles and Benedict's are a must try. For dinner you can't lose. DW is a hot spot for brunch...dinner...or to sip on some cocktails. The location is great and the pattio opens up into a private terrace.

jd1mii5C1Sdb5a4TM0M-jQ.text: I didn't have much but what I did have was excellent! Ordered the AYCD Mimosas, they were a little pricey but the servers were quick to bring refills so I don't paying a little extra. Also had to flautas, that were a perfect little snack.   Have to give a shout out to Alfonso our server, he was friendly, quick and took awesome care of us from start to finish.

3wiqLGDfZGo_xgOEZszihg.text: First of all, this place is super cute! The decor is fashionable, yet absolutely inviting and comfortable. Every staff member was friendly and attentive. The drinks and food were AMAZING! I can't wait to try their brunch menu.

hBAt71614GjtwOePmPnxFw.text: DW Bistro offers great ambiance, flavorful food, and excellent service. My friend and I were discussing a return visit for brunch after the appetizer.  The ambiance of the restaurant is pleasant. The dining room is full of clean lines and pretty decor. With it being December they were playing pleasant holiday music and had holiday decorations that really added to the ambiance. The restaurant offers a main dining room, a dining room behind two sets of doors, a large bar, and a small outdoor patio.  Service was excellent and added to the experience. Our waiter and everyone that assisted him were friendly and attentive. Our drinks were constantly refilled and they were on top of clearing plates. I mentioned that my friend and I were sharing and our waiter had the kitchen cut our sandwiches in half. That was unexpected, but very appreciated.   We started with the DW Spanish Chorizo and Shrimp. Wow! This appetizer really started the meal off right. The flavors and combination of ingredients was amazing. The bread served alongside was delicious as well.   The DW Turkey Burger and Braised Short Rib Sandwich were also full of flavor and palate pleasers. The short rib on the braised short rib sandwich was tender and well flavored. The horseradish and jalapeno bacon was a nice pairing with the short rib. My favorite of the two was definitely the DW Turkey Burger though. The spice of the jerk seasoning paired with the amazing mango pear apple chutney was perfection. The brioche bun was the perfect bread to pair with this burger. The sweet potato fries on the side were also really good. The sauce with the fries was unique and had an unexpected kick of heat that I loved.   After all of the delicious lunch items we were full, but had to try something from the dessert menu. We shared the White Chocolate Mousse Cake. At first a little disappointed that this wasn't a layered cake I enjoyed the flavors enough. The white chocolate layer was more of a whipped consistency making it on the lighter side for dessert. The other flavors worked well together. I'm not sure I loved it enough to order again though.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Chocolate Mousse Cake
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib Sandwich
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Turkey Burger

v1-CXwGkfDfLXefvgnB37g.text: So my wife and wanted to try something new for brunch and this place came up in our yelp find. This Jamaican brunch spot just off the 215 knows how to hit the spot.   The atmosphere is upbeat. Expect a wait depending on the time and day you decide to go. I suggest calling ahead to book a table.   The food is made just right to have you wanting more. I ordered the Jamaican jerk chicken and waffles. If bliss comatose with a symphony of sweet, salty, crispy with a Jamaican fusion can be a thing this would be it.   I also could not get enough of the Caribbean side car. If it didn't make me look like an alcoholic I would had ordered a lot more than one.   I looked forward to trying more of the menu

QRvWskyaYIekQSXTX5FE9g.text: One of my favorite brunch spots. The vibe is always great here. The owners are amazing. Everyone who works here is always super friendly. The food is so delish. I love their veggie curry, mimosas and margaritas. My friends love their jerk chicken and waffles, chilaquiles and carrot cake. Everything here is good. Highly recommend everyone to try DW! The best!

yPpmb_0wbZo080RuaY9SMQ.text: Cute, cute place for brunch but WHOAH IT'S LOUD ON SUNDAYS. They have a DJ spinning the latest, hippest toons. DW Bistro is definitely a hip brunch spot that Vegas was lacking.  The food is all "New Mexican." American food with some flare? Appropriate for the younger crowd, appropriate for the grandparents (just not on Sunday unless you want to blow their hearing aids out).  It's a cute plaza with coffee shops and other restaurants to check out (no stores to browse while you wait though).  Park in the giant lot next to the Gramercy!

sOzYlDIBZPaJkq3sg_Z0aw.text: I've been a regular at DW Bistro for years (before they moved to this new location). I love going here for dinner and breakfast! I enjoy the fried chicken, and you MUST order the carrot cake for dessert. It's heavenly! For breakfast, the eggs Benedict is delicious. Brunch is also good when it's paired with their mimosas. The hollandaise has a little kick to it. Overall, the service is very good and this location has a lot of seating. I love the patio area too.

FiuMDPKcPVjKFxNdgloRow.text: Amazing food & impeccable service!  From the appetizer to the dessert the food was so delicious.  Shout out to Vidal and Luis at DW Bistro for the VIP treatment this evening. We will definitely be returning.

oanDMUEDejwNonaXJ6ma1w.text: We were there this past Sunday for Diva's Drag Brunch celebrating a dear friends birthday and it was over-the-top amazing! The whole team took such great care of our party and the food was delicious. A special shout out to our server Luis who provided the most attentive service to our party of 10!  Thank you Brice for begin the consummate host!

7_uf7k7TnV7JHjNwXsTlWA.text: I've been to the old location a few times and was in love not only with the food but also with the decor.  It's problem was it's size and that's what this new place takes care of.    The food was just as good although when I went I had a bit of a cold so it tasted bland.  I have gotten the New Mexican pork bowl on two occasions and it has always satisfied me.  This was my first time trying the chorizo and shrimp appetizer and although it was good, it was very soupy.  I guess I thought of it as more of a dip but that's on me.  In the past I have gotten the turkey burger as well as the chicken tinga flautas and both were great!  I need to come here again soon and try more options so I can write about how good they all are.

yTQhcq6Fp5Dy6ebRN_8tsQ.text: Love Love Love and can't wait for Sunday Brunch.  I went here for lunch on the recommendation of my buddy from Florida who is a foodie and owns a restaurant...and it was PERFECT.   Service was great, sitting outside was beautiful (a bit chilly... depends on what position the sun is in) BUT, from start to finish... service to the VERY well versed server made all the difference but, you honestly can't go wrong no matter where your eyes end up on the menu...  Had the pleasure of meeting Bryce and for sure will take his recommendation of SUNDAY BRUNCH... if anything like the lunch menu (and you can count on it being over the top) I'm going to love it. Being a newbie to Summerlin... I have been venturing out quite a bit...DW BISTRO is my new favorite! Thanks guys, great job... VERY HAPPY I FOUND THIS PLACE... You will too!

2-cJBcYUH9L5Wduq2OmFYA.text: My absolute favorite place! I love coming here! The service as you walk in and the energy of all the employees is incredible. Not to mention the owners! Food is flavorful and colorful , as it should. I love my salmon! Drinks and bartenders are always in such a cheerful mood. Wish i lived closer.... will definitely come back again and again and again

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmón

BlR4x6kwlERzmq0JTKFzWQ.text: Decided to give it a shot after reading all the amazing yelp reviews.   Parking can be a bit hard but you can get in the 1 hour parking spots for a quick  lunch.   It's a pretty decent size place offering Jamaican and New Mexican Fare. Went with girlfriends for lunch. My girlfriends tried the Jamaican mojito and Caribbean sidecar, both were good. Cocktails are on the pricier side ($12-$14). Wine by the glass was $11 and over   For our main we tried the turkey sliders, couscous salad and Jamaican vegetable curry bowl. The best dish was the couscous salad. I wasn't too impressed by the Jamaican vegetable curry bowl, could taste raw turmeric and the flavors just didn't do it for me.   Service was a bit slow and the place was very noisy.

c9bIf58xM0YlEGLs_GQTdA.text: Wow! We had brunch at another location that was "hot and new" nearby before coming to DW Bistro and this is some fierce competition! The atmosphere is lively and the staff is super friendly.  If you want to get your Sunday Funday started this is where you need to be.    They have options for bottomless mimosas and the bloody Mary's are spicy and served with their signature jalepeno bacon ::: drool:::   Overall this place is a win in my book.  I can't wait to come back and try more of their food options.  Tomas and San were our friendly bartenders and they took great care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vzol4XqzqRWqQeSZpgqfBw.text: Visiting Vegas for a conference and my cousins said, "I know JUST the place." That place was DW Bistro!  Instantly fell in love with the SoCal vibe.  Started off with Moscow Mules (I had a non-alcoholic one since I had a conference later that day) and it comes on a CART. Bryce (the owner) shows us the steps of a Mule, serving us with the upmost fun and joy.  We had the chicken flautas to start, which I wish two things: 1. That I took a picture before we devoured the whole thing. 2. I had one all to myself.  I ordered the New Jamaican Omelette with jerk pulled pork and jack cheese. I missed the pork the first bite, but that's the great thing about brunch: there's a SECOND bite.  Oh man, DE. LISH.  I took a bit of my cousins' jalapeno hollandaise from their Eggs Benedict, and that REALLY made things pop. Will remember to ask for a side of that next time!  Overall, great vibes, chill place with a DJ that knows what to spin to keep people jammin'. Will definitely bring my crew here when we're back in six (6) months!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Jamaican Omelette, filled with perfectly seasoned jerk pork and jack cheese, with slices of tomato subbed for toast.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flauta. The last one standing of the original five.

URu9OnpZH-rxwyw2-oHD3Q.text: Create experience. Definitely check this place out it has a  Great Southwest flair to the menu try the corn chowder the chicken flautas and the red quinoa and green salad.   Happy hour is a great deal n the cocktails are delicious!

NH_0rGpAYWjqTwpwUqTRtQ.text: Pretty good food at a moderate price. Came here during lunch time and although the place was busy, my party was seated right away. This restaurant is huge and is decorated very nice and makes the restaurant feel upscale. Service is fast and employees were very helpful. I got the New Mexican Green Chile Burger. The burger was cooked perfectly and was juicy and flavorful with just the right amount of heat to it. When I ordered this burger, I was assuming it would come with chili like "chili soup" but the Chile is a large sliced green Chile. My fault for reading the menu wrong. Burger is good but a bit overpriced in my opinion. Overall, good service and food but too pricey for me to come here regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican Green Chile Burger

kUj1-DIrBNs1ESI5lSz_Dw.text: Terrible service and overpriced food. Came for Sunday brunch with a table for 6. They sat us at the large table by the bar. Unfortunately the bartender happens to be the server for the table as well. We kept having to ask other employees for help because we couldn't get any service from the bartender. Food wasn't great. I had the caesar salad. I think was about $16 for a very bland caesar salad. North Italia's was 10 x better. The worst part about it was that we were automatically charged 20% tip for a party of 6. No wonder we got such bad service! Take my advice and go to Kitchen Table Squared instead

hUUsNZOSa-Jvl7t46FPv1A.text: The menu offers unique and flavorful selections such as Jamaican Curry and Jerk Pork. One of my favorites is the Spanish chorizo and shrimp. The drinks are interesting and seasonal as well as other menu items. Top it off with the carrot cake which is big enough to share.

WroaFDylBHnWEZioO975xA.text: This place is insanely good. Great service, amazing food. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone! I always get the curry and it will blow your mind!   Bloody Mary's are fantastic too! Go here!

OAfvrT34cfJXzK7D297zzQ.text: I stopped here for lunch because I saw a pasta dish on Yelp that looked yummy. Unfortunately, that was the dinner menu so a return is needed. This restaurant is so swanky. Lol.....it was quite busy with "coolness". The owner who looks like Seal, was hanging out near the door and I kept wishing he'd grab a mic and start singing,  "I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the gray. Ooh, The more I get of you, The stranger it feels, yeahhhhhhh"......  Unfortunately he didn't, but he seemed to be extremely engaged in the FOH operations, a lost trait amongst many owners. Everyone that walked in the door seem to know him and was greeted by a hip insiders-only handshake, a hug, or directed to a VIP table. I was intrigued because these are the type of restaurants you see on Lifetime television where the owner is a real hot shot suddenly being stalked by a infatuated customer or overlooked employee and weird things start to happen. Haha...... I ordered the BLT with sweet potato fries. The jalapeno bacon had just the right amount of heat and although there was some sort of remoulade-like mayo it was perfect and not overpowering. If you've read some of my previous reviews you know how I feel about food arriving IMMEDIATELY after ordering and it being lukewarm. After the order was put in 3 minutes later my food was brought to the table. The BLT looked amazing,  but the fries looked like Ursula's "poor unfortunate souls" from The Little Mermaid. They were shriveled, withered, and. ..... (GULP)..... cold. I knew they were probably the last of the precooked batch. I tried to suck it up, but I couldn't because each fry was so disappointing. I let the server know and he brought a fresh new batch. When I bit into it, steam came out and I smiled like a little kid. They were amazing, and I had no guilt eating them. Although I cut my sandwich in half and anticipated getting a TO GO container,  I devoured the other half effortlessly. With each bite,  I watched the "cool crowd" shake hands, make business deals, and laugh heartily at each others witty humor. It was surely a frequent flyer guest list. A place where these people felt taken care of, a place "where everybody knows your name" and the service is customized. Yes, swanky.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Goodness to go...
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jb-1I0_htq--AuVjEjUqfg.text: VERY HAPPY DINNER.....  I took my family to DW. and we had a delicious meal, we all loved are meals and the restaurant was beautifully decorated my oldest was so impressed by the paintings on the walls she took a few pictures. I left a bit unsatisfied due to the food not being real Jamaican food it was in my opinion a cover band not the real thing. I had the oxtails plate with rice and peas, when the food came out it looked like Jamaican food but it didn't taste like it at all.....  very low on seasoning but a ok plate of food it was definitely not authentic in no other way than looks.  My parents our both Jamaican and I have visited 5 time so I know the real when I taste it...sorry this at it you mon.

Jqnf6NnP1y2jjFY45hHBOw.text: I had heard good things about DW Bistro, but never really wanted to try it because I'm very picky and Jamaican food wasn't very appealing to me. A good friend suggested this place for brunch, so I finally gave it a try earlier this month. The ambience inside is nice with bright lights and artwork on the walls.  The first bad sign was when I looked at the menu and didn't really see anything I wanted to eat. For me, its not good when a menu is complicated! I remembered seeing pictures of shrimp scampi and mac and cheese here on yelp. But unfortunately, those were on their dinner menu. I decided to try the jerk fried chicken and waffles. I asked our server how spicy it was and he said that it was pretty spicy. Then I asked him if they could make it mild and he replied "No, we don't mess with the levels of spiciness." My friend and I thought he was joking at first, but unfortunately he was serious. I was surprised, since most restaurants will tone down spicy foods if requested. Plus, that made me wonder if everything really was prepared fresh? Then he asked "you don't like spicy food? Are you from China?" I wanted to say WTF does that have to do with anything?? I decided to keep cool and replied "no." Finally, he suggested the Jamaican curry chicken for something more mild, so that is what I ordered.   Our food took a while to come out, but when it finally did, they made everything look pretty. My chicken curry wasn't spicy as promised. However, they were stingy with the chicken and it was kind of dry. They also went overboard with the vegetables. At the end, I got tired of digging through all those veggies just to find the chicken and rice so I stopped eating. Of course our server made a comment to me saying "oh, you didn't like it?" Umm, does it look like I did?? I can't remember what my friend ordered, but he enjoyed his food. Like I said, I am picky. :P We decided to share a dessert. My friend asked our server what he recommended, and he replied "Well, we have an excellent carrot cake but she (looking at me) doesn't like carrot cake." What a smart @ss! Then he looked at me and said "was I right?" Lol, he WAS right. We ordered a slice of their peanut butter pie. It took a very long time to come out, but it was delicious and the highlight of my meal!! The only weird thing about it was that they put raspberry sauce on the plate, which we both agreed that it wasn't a good mix.  Would I come back again? Probably not. If I ever have to, it would only be for dinner! Warning: watch out for their smart @ss servers!

XLFpS_YPurS7XgfivCOeyg.text: Excellent service tasty delicious food. One negative observation one of the owners needs to humble him self or just don't be on the floor you are way to arrogant.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

shs1WnUXAq9RZvf8rOpQOg.text: I wanted to love this place so very badly! There is nothing that I love more than Brunch in a cute place with Jamaican food! But errrr it was not great. Based on the reviews though, I may have to try it again.  Walking in, this place was right up my alley. I loved the decor and just sitting in the restaurant made me happy. I ordered a bloody mary, which I was told was spicy and I love spicy so I was all in. It was a beautiful bloody mary and the jalapeno bacon was a nice touch. However, that bloody mary was spppiiccccyyy. Like something was wrong with it because I have never had a bloody mary that was spicy enough. It may have even ruined my taste buds because my chicken and waffles were just average and everyone on yelp raves about it! I had to have our server bring me some more tomato juice it was so spicy.  I ordered the jerk chicken in waffles. I love Jamaican jerk sauce and was disappointed when the chicken was not saucy, but just spiced with Jamaican jerk spices. The chicken was so-so and the waffle was a waffle, but I could tell the syrup was homemade and it was great. It was a huge portion too.   My husband got an omelet with filet tips which he thought was really good. I didn't try it though. All in all, it was just ok but we managed to rack up a bill of close to $60 just for breakfast. I think I may try it again with my girlfriends and partake in the all you can drink mimosa deal because the place is so cute. I will be giving DW another chance.

_j3X11Vft0ANFYTM1Be2uw.text: This place is on point! The coffee is delicious and the chilaquiles are amazing!! It's fancy enough to have a brunch date, but also laid back and social - came here with a group of girlfriends and had a great time!

b9B4-lM8y_qXx0mSMmIQpQ.text: I had a wonderful Sunday brunch here. I like that they have an app that takes your name down and texts you when your table is ready. I didn't mind the 30 minute wait since there was a Starbucks in the same plaza. The staff was incredibly friendly. You can tell they enjoy working there.   The restaurant seems like it should be in Southern California. It's modern, fresh, with a buzzing atmosphere. But I'm glad it's in Vegas for all us locals to enjoy!  I ordered the salmon and spinach eggs Benedict and finished every little piece of it. My friend and I joined everyone else in the bottomless mimosa craze for $20/person.   DW is now one of my favorite Sunday Brunch spots!

WdvHLbTBA8WbrSDRKauMCg.text: This is the model of a perfectly run brunch breakfast joint! Best place for weekend brunch in Vegas! Hip, good food, attentive service, innovative cuisine.  They've got it dialed in.

H-D62NFyzP3VbS2aZ1V5bw.text: I love this place when I come to Vegas! D.W. Bistro is one of my favorite place to eat in the valley. I had the Turkey burger with a salad and my ex-wife had the salmon. Every thing was cook to perfection. Very clean restaurant and restrooms. Fantastic job D.W Bistro

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

3QVtLSQsXE_We1o-vpR0gA.text: Tried this place out because of all the awesome reviews and my friend kept telling me to go! I'm sure glad I did because DW is awesome.
