Upon walking into the restaurant my friend (Sheila A.) and I were a little bit confused because you immediately see a couch and a wooden cabinet, I honestly felt like we walked into a furniture store. Caught me a little off guard but then we saw the host and on the other side of the wall of the entrance was the bar. I notice the interior is modern (bright orange walls) with a few accent pieces wooden distressed furniture. We were seated and introduced to our server Luis. Calamari was our appetizer of choice and a few minutes later here is comes. I liked the taste of the breading and it was different, but Sheila did not expect what we were served. Luis asked us how it was going so far and as much as we hate sending things back to the kitchen, we sent it back and opted for flauntas instead. Luis was very accommodating and did not make this an issue at all. We were served the flautas, OMG they were amazing. I like to think of these as taquitos, but made with chicken. The tortilla that was used was delicious, I don't know if they make their own, but they taste just like Cafe Rio's tortillas and everyone knows Cafe Rio has amazing tortillas. Onto the entrees, I ordered the bow tie pasta with chicken, which this was really good too. The veggies were really fresh, I even love the fact the string beans were perfectly cooked because they still had the snap to them (I could tell they used the shocking method to cook them). Sheila ordered the slow cooked pork with egg. This dish had a little bit of heat to it and the dish itself was hot (temperature wise). Pretty good too, I could tell there were a number of spices in this dish. I think Sheila was sweating a bit from eating this dish, haha! Finally we were served a complimentary piece of the carrot cake, probably the best carrot cake I've ever had! The cake didn't have the typical cake texture, but was a bit more rough (in a good way). Possibly due to the amount of carrot they put in it. I also love the white chocolate shavings they trim the sides with. The best part is Luis said it was on the house since it was our first time at DW.   This restaurant is truly something special. We need more spots like this around town because this restaurant has personality and serves great tasting food. Although the price point is a little higher, it is worth it. I will add that this restaurant is a wonderful option for a special occasion dinner or an intimate date. Finally, Luis was an awesome server, more people who work in customer service should be trained like him because he went above and beyond to make our experience at DW enjoyable. I will recommend DW to anyone and everyone. Yumm.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow cooked pork with egg
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with bow tie pasta, delish!!

gmrPjrmY78DOehoUj8jrEg.text: This spot is a hidden gem , amazing ambiance and the people who work there are so friendly. Freshly squeezed lemonade was  delicious and the jerk ahi tuna salad was out if thus world. I added avocado:)! Price is worth the quality . If ur in vegas this place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JERK seared ahi tuna salad

-e5VhlxZiIm5bhjJkyTqfg.text: I met a group of Yelpers at DW Bistro to celebrate the birth of the one and only Jessica M. Sadly, DW Bistro does not accept reservations for Sunday brunch, and we had a LONG ASS WAIT of 90 minutes.   Thankfully once we were seated, everything was great. An automatic 20% gratuity was added to our bills, which sometimes results in sub-par service, I am happy to say that was not the case with our group.   Allison S.  and I decided to split two dishes because we were struggling to decide what to order. We had the chilaquiles as well as the special pulled pork eggs benedict:   The eggs benedict was very tasty, you could tell that the english muffins used were made in house. I would have prefered a little more hollandaise sauce, and overall I felt that it was a rather small portion for the $18 price tag.   The chilaquiles were fantastic. Not the most authentic chilaquiles I have had, but still so delicious. And a rather generous serving for the $15 price tag.   I started out with a bloody mary ($12), which I enjoyed. A few members of our group went with the very tempting bottomless mimosas for $20, I had things I needed to get done later in the day so I could not be that indulgent. Instead, I ordered a latte after my drink, but it never came out, That is the sole service hiccup that I know of for our large group.   I don't think I will subject myself to the uber-long wait for a large group to have Sunday brunch at DW Bistro again anytime soon., but the food was excellent so I am sure I will be back sometime soon to try some of the other items on the menu.

kq0Cn-Rv1lLKbgO2KUGMXA.text: The food is decent there, only ruined by the LOUD atmosphere.  You can't hear yourself or others. Had to strain my voice and now I have a headache. This place is exhausting. Too much work over a meal.  Oh, and $12 for a mimosa? A little pricey for an off strip bistro  I won't go back

kXMM8KOroMOP-ZM3T_COhA.text: I've only been here for lunch, but it's one of my favorite spots for a business lunch. The interior design is very well done, which is rare for a locals' spot. You expect that from a more expensive restaurant on the Strip, not somewhere in Spring Valley.  The food is delicious and the flavors are well developed. The menu is a mix of Jamaican and New Mexican cuisines, so there's something for everyone. My favorite item is the New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork bowl, simmered in New Mexican red chile with two over-easy eggs and served over rice. The portion is huge and I always have leftovers for dinner.  Prices are fair. You get a Strip like experience without the crazy prices of the Strip. It's not exactly cheap either, but considering the food, ambiance, and service, the prices are acceptable.

QalbtlWtU8vvFNC_Ga8BuA.text: This is one of my favorite places here in SW Vegas.  The Mac and Cheese is CRAZY good. And the chicken is addictive. Everything is so fresh.  On the lighter side The seared AHI TUNA salad is an excellent choice.  The service is top notch also, feeling like a 5star restaurant with 3star prices.  Go to DW BISTRO. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valentines Dessert...

a-s_5-wmJOBzPH5Jvvjs6A.text: I came here with a group of people last night. Although they weren't able to seat us at a table altogether, they had a small section just for us. Which worked out well. We all enjoyed our meal! I'll def be coming back to try the Jalapeno bacon burger, ox tail, and ribs. Great place, service, and amazing food!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Curry Chicken with couscous
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Bacon Burger

xxJsAmXK67-jclfnA7edJA.text: Only our favorite brunch place, that's all! I cannot say enough good things....we are impressed by bar staff, waiters and the owners at every visit. Cuisine is the tastiest brunch we've had. Don't listen to the haters, this place is the BEST!

2QZ5Ye3Ox6tw7feN1BK7Ew.text: I had lunch with some coworkers earlier. There was such a great vibe to the place. Everyone was so nice, and the service was amazing. The food was delicious! I ordered the New Mexican style green chilie cheeseburger. The bun was so soft, there was so many flavors to the burger. It was wonderful. I got a side of sweet potato fries that were yummy. It came with a sauce that tasted amazing with the fries. As for dessert, I ordered a peanut butter chocolate mousse. Ugh! It was wonderful, sweet. It was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the peanut butter chocolate mousse. At the bottom was the chocolate, and the middle was the peanut butter.

h-fn_uxtNhO8PiTX9WbMIw.text: DW Bistro is amazing! The food is delicious & the staff is super friendly & polite. The different cocktails they serve are always quite savory. I have been here numerous times & I don't get tired of the vegetable curry with couscous. The tingy v is also my favorite cocktail. The menu here is quite different than other places & that is a good thing because they have a wide selection of food & vegetarian options. This place deserves beyond 5 stars!!!

rYDSIqqob8PrdG9KvkMzLA.text: So when my friend wanted to go to this Bistro .. I thought ok, bec I have heard some really good things about it.  We arrive and its hot inside and its very busy.  We get a waiter that has the worst "TUDE" ever.. Marco was his name..  If you get him, you might as well go home right there bec you are about to throw money out the window !!! We order Bottomless Mimosa's which seemed to be very popular in the rest.  They were $20.00 a person and we figured this would be fun and pretty cost effective... LOL  Boy were we wrong.  They were super hot, prob bec they were serving so many... and it worked out pretty damn good for them bec the Champagne they used was CHEAP ! With a capital C baby !!!   We finished one and we sat looking around for our slackass waiter Marco... UGH ! We finally got a refill and we ordered...  the Chicken Flautas for appetizer , they were ok, nothing special and a little spicy . Once we got those, I decided not to break bad with $20 for an entree bec I could see that we were going downhill at a fast pace.  My girl ordered Chicken and waffles... The plate came and the chicken was so overcooked.. It was damn near black ! It was dry and not great, we will say.   By this time, we are waiting for another Mimosa.. Waiting, Waiting and Waiting.  We get another hot glass of cheap champagne.. exciting !! By this time, the place is clearing out ! I see a cute lil black gay come in and then I realize that he is walking around the rest. in pedicure shoes, yes that is right yellow pedicure shoes with painted black toenails.  CLASSY !! He starts seating people in these ridiculous paper shoes lol. So we ask Marco for another drink bec this is about how we have to manage his ass.. What a joke.  He says " we arent serving those anymore"    WTF????  What did he just say ??  Yes we arent serving those anymore... EXCUSE ME ??? Im sorry but bottomless is bottomless, you serve them until we get our asses out of our seats and leave... It was the icing on the cake for me !!! I wouldnt go back to this place EVER !!!! I am surprised to see they are still in business !! THEY SUCK !!!!!

bNn2EjDCAg4Wdv6cpayPNw.text: WOW! Met a friend here for lunch because I have heard great things about it...  What I heard was right!  The special was a kobe beef sandwich... By far one of the best sandwiches I have ever had... tender beef, some of the best carmelized onions, jalapeno bacon, greens and tomato on soft sweet bread! A combination of flavors in every bite.. My mouth was having a party! For my side i got their signature salad (nothing to really claim about it) greens, pecans and a dressing that I couldn't describe about later.  Before the sandwich, I did have their chicken curry soup... another great choice..  A creamy curry base with bits of chicken and jalepeno bacon... only had a cup.. could have gone for a bowl.  Very excited to go back again. My friend says the brunch on Sundays is FABULOUS!

5EQwAjq2cV2Mvst4VnGrXA.text: The first time I came, I was so blown away with the food I had to come back! Best carrot cake you have ever had hands down!

rpau8JjreaZTxHg3xmiWSA.text: This place is pretty great. Very high quality food and quite diverse. The portions are definitely decent even though I'd say the menu is a tad pricey.  But, it's worth it.  Lots of different flavor combinations, really good drinks, always friendly service even though it's always slammed every time I've been there.  I think dinner is much better than brunch but everyone raves about their brunch. I wish we had more privately owned restaurants in the SW and more high quality ones like this all over the valley.

TPcS3lSO1JFLOz-X9mhTJw.text: Nice little swanky spot. Excellent customer service. Water guy watched us like a hawk and would have done anything for us. Food is interesting. A tremendous amount of effort is put in. Did they nail it. No. Was it good..it was but won't eat here again. The Caribbean twist to the food only becomes obvious once your seated looking at the menu. Lots of "jerk" stuff. I ordered the fried chicken and it was jet black and overly rubbed or spiced up. Not enough sauce served with it.

ZJzu1yUk-fQzT6GPA-JH_Q.text: So went to this place for the second time during Sunday brunch. I must say their food was really good during brunch. The wait is pretty long so come early. The staff was friendly and service was on point. The Jamaican jerk chicken and waffles were tasty. The best was their chilaquiles super flavor flavorful and delicious. Bottomless mimosas can't go wrong

csdYX1_OqkookXAET2bjlA.text: Always great service and food. Be ready for jerk style food, if you haven't had it before.

kAsbVK6k1d_1zw8kypcRPQ.text: Place has great customer service, great food but the price is way up there for the food. Not worth it in my opinion. Hopefully they start putting some more food for 26 dollars a plate.

92EwCTWgQCm77wxwBrx_qw.text: Hands down, best place I have ever eaten at. Had the Jamaican Jerk chicken sandwich with a house salad and my friend had the Green Chile Burger.  The jerk chicken sandwich was amazing. The jerk seasoning on the chicken was perfect, with some spice but not too much. Jalapeno bacon was on point, and the heirloom tomatoes added a nice juicy flavor. The side salad was seriously amazing. The candied pecans, goat cheese and peppers were the perfect combination.  The burger was seriously, the BEST burger I've ever had in my life, and I'm a food snob so it's not easy to please me.  I'm from San Diego, and I now can't have a burger or chicken sandwich from any other place because it will not come close to my experience here.  Oh, and since it's our first time, the Waitor brought a complimentary Jamaican carrot cake for us to enjoy, as a thank you for giving them a try. Wow, where do I sign up to invest in this place? Rockstar status!

rMz3ePcxnRpAG7JNcMuFfg.text: Based on reviews and the atmosphere, I thought this place was great at first but two factors brought the review down.    First, the service.  When we first entered, we were greeted and seated pretty quick.  The staff was very friendly.  But, our waittress wasn't so great.  Although she was friendly, she only came to our table twice.  When we needed something, such as a refill or for the check, she would take forever!  The bistro wasn't even that busy at the time!  After waiting 20 minutes for the check, I looked for her and saw that she was talking to another waiter in the corner.  I couldn't believe it.   Also, the food was bordering on bland.  I got the Caribbean Jerk chicken and waffles.  My father got this dish that consisted of slow-cooked pork with rice, cooked in a Spanish-style.  At the first taste, the food was amazing!  Everything was hot and beautifully presented.  The Caribbean Jerk chicken and waffles was a refreshing and interesting take on the dish.  The chicken and the homemade maple syrup was flavorful.  However, the rice dish had no taste and the waffles tasted like stale bread.  Really thick, stale bread.  I loved the atmosphere and DW Bistro was based on really great concepts.  If only the food was more flavorful and the service wasn't so slow.

q0wPwjhFTOCbfqXqSML6Zg.text: In one word OMG.  I moved in to an apartment about a block away from here and in doing a little research I realized the chef had a New Mexican background.  I was so excited but also poor.  So we waited to go since it is not a cheap place.  I was starting to get worried we were building it up in our heads too much.  Well we finally got jobs and finally started to get paid so we went to celebrate.  The decor, as you have read in all the other reviews, is very eclectic, funky, but clean.  It's nice and the patio is my favorite part of it.  They do have a heater on the patio but it was so nice out we didn't need it.  The hostess was prompt and nice and our server was on top of things.  She greeted us right away and promptly offered us drinks.  I had a half bottle of gruet sparkling wine, a little New Mexico celebratory treat.  The cocktail of the day was a strawberry mojito and the boy enjoyed it.    The bread service was nice, some of the breads were a little dry, but that's a problem with doing everything in house.  The lavash was super flavorful, I had one of their beer knots and a sweet/salty brioche bun.  All very flavorful if just a little on the dry side.  On too the food!  We had the ribs to start.  They were not a small portion for an appetizer.  The sauce was delicious and tangy and sticky and spicy.  The meat was super tender.  The boy ordered the chicken curry soup and the jerk pork shoulder bowl.  I had the green chile cheese burger.  This is where the OMG comes into play.  My burger might have been the best burger I have ever had.  The bun was deliciously toasted with butter, the meat was flavorful and cooked perfectly MR, the cheese and chiles were delicious, the bacon had been dusted with jalapeno powder and then it was all topped with a beautiful thick slice of heirloom tomato.  I mean.  Come on.  It was perfect and dirty and just made my day.  Plus it was served with sweet potato fries and they were crisp and cooked perfectly.  The jerk pork was also super flavorful and a hefty portion and was used as breakfast today and tasted just as good.    We really had such a good time.  And I'm so happy this is within walking distance of us.  I can't wait to try brunch.  Thank you DW Bistro for being so awesome!

4-OrKUGHhrPft_8LUIhLRQ.text: Came here for the first time on valentines day and definitely won't be my last. Our server was Travis and he did an amazing job handling everything. We will be back!

sz5rtBUe1fFIxvx4YX6Kqg.text: This place is delicious. I went there for lunch on a Friday afternoon. The service was very quick and prompt. I ordered the chicken curry bowl and it was huge. It's almost big enough to share. The bowl was soo good thought. It was loaded  with veggies, chicken, rice. (Yummy!!). I will definitely be going back soon.

W1lQE4HED3ABf274-Sd0Hw.text: Just had a FABULOUS meal at DW Bistro - jerk rubbed salmon with veggies and jasmine rice. Cooked to perfection, flavorful; wonderful friendly staff. Always have a great time there. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The picture doesn&#39;t do this salmon justice. So savory and colorful.

AcSMUTlqZ5cc0d1H3gJ8vQ.text: What an awesome restaurant! Love stopping by this place for lunch. It has a very trendy vibe, but not stuffy or too desperate like some places. The service is always very great, and no matter what I order on the menu, it's always very tasty! I love the Turkey Burger (I never had one like it any place else), and if you like spicy food, they have some great spicy dishes on the menu (but don't worry, they have non-spicy items too). It's a locally owned place from what I've heard, which I appreciate. The outdoor seating area is perfect when the weather is nice, def. recommend this place.

h4xbldoVt5WrwqemW8_9UQ.text: Totally redeemed.  The place has expanded since our last visit, so it's not as cramped.  We sat on the patio for brunch, which was wonderful.  Our server this time was attentive and friendly.  Do yourself a favor when you go here and get the pastry basket.  Blueberry scones are to. die. for.  I got the pork omelet which had a nice spice without being overbearing.  My husband got the chicken and waffles.  The chicken was surprisingly sweet, an unexpected but tasty surprise.  The portions were huge and I was very satisfied with our meal.  So glad we tried this place again.  It really is a gem.

uiZL0MAuO2BULO32L1pk5g.text: If I lived in the region, I would make a point of eating my way through the full DW menu. (Actually, I'd move or shoot myself, but let's just pretend.) We stopped by during their Sunday brunch madness, found ourselves staring down an hour wait, and opted for food to-go on our way to the desert. The staff at DW is impressively competent and friendly. They're essentially wrangling a herd of ravenous socialites with the attention spans and attention demands of toddlers, and they do so admirably. Not surprisingly, we ordered Jerk Chicken & Waffles as well as the Jerk Pork Hash. Both meats were nicely cooked and the portions were perfect. If you're still reading, you're no doubt wondering why this isn't a four-star review. Two reasons: 1. Their jerk seasoning is much too timid. You get the allspice, some herbs, and citrus (there's even some additional orange rind on the waffles), but the habanero heat is a no show. It doesn't move far enough beyond regular chicken & waffles. 2. I am not a weirdo who carries condiments in my man-purse, but I'm officially designating DW as a B.Y.O.Syrup establishment. It's a sad moment when you find yourself wishing you could un-pour the sticky sweetness you just splashed all over your waffles and chicken (for the record, you cannot). You know that irrevocable moment when you dump way too much brandy or Grand Marnier into your recipe and convert the whole dish into a boozy mess? We've all done it, and we'll probably do it again. With luck, DW only did it on the day we visited. The syrup was odd, overbearing, and unfortunate. You have been warned.

yIcvJTmnYa3MINqsdoFMUQ.text: This is one of the best places for lunch, dinner and especially BRUNCH in all of Las Vegas. What I admire about this place is how the owners really care about their guests and ensure everyone has a smile on their face. I notice that work also work as hard as their employees, which is pretty amazing. All their staff look very happy. Great food, great crowd, great music. This is a MUST GO!

Xvo32Hfr7ZtrYyzWqN_NlQ.text: Best brunch place in town. Drinks, entrees, and pastry basket so good. I can't say enough about DW Bistro. If only I lived closer to this place, I would go there more often.

vZNVQy3SZlRtsMFtupSZ8Q.text: This place was PACKED! when I came here with some friends to enjoy some Sunday brunch.  The bad: the wait was an estimated 1 hour long. The AWESOME: you can start your all-day mimosas while you wait! And DW himself did not disappoint! He kept my little glass full, even as we waited outside at the entrance.   I love the look of the restaurant and the food tasted great. I like how the food here has that Jamaican influence. For my meal, I chose the DW bowl of New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork with rice and...(wait for it): an over easy egg. How can you go wrong with pork, rice and egg? The red chili gives the dish so much flavor and spice. I also got a bite of the eggs benedict with jalapeno bacon, which was also very tasty.  Overall, I really enjoyed the energy of the people and the food of DW Bistro. Thank you DW for the most epic brunch I have had in the longest time.

eQgfj_Lx1iVk-qqKi3jAfQ.text: 5 stars is bold! I know. But here's what I look for. Food, service and prices. I have to say, this place was 5 star on all! Food, was delicious. As a vegetarian, for dinner, my choices were limited, however, we able to get an appetizer to share. And I got an entree. For the app, we got the goat cheese torte. It was very good. As we were eating that, they came out with a basket for 4 or 5 different breads. Can you say YUM??? I'm new to curry, and the only vegetarian dish (if I remember correctly) was a vegetable curry over cous-cous. I am usually, and I stress usually, not a fan of cous-cous. When my giant bowl of curry vegetables and cous-cous came out, I was like.......oh. Not what I've been used to at Pan Asian. It was absolutely delicious. I mean, seriously, ab-so-freakin-lutely delicious. It had flavor and a touch of spice. And the vegetables, they were endless!!! Onions, cabbage, mushrooms, peppers, sooo many vegetables. And the cous-cous were so good. I guess the combination of curry sauce and cous-cous made it wonderful. It was a GIANT bowl of cous-cous (BTW, am I spelling that right?). I had lunch for the next 2 days. Both lunches were large portions too. For dessert we got the carrot cake. Not something I would usually order but the waitress treated us and WOW! We devoured that cake. It was like 3 layers and tons of yummy cream cheese (?), marscapone (?) cheese, I dont know. I know it was YUM! So, 5 stars for the food. And service was great. Oh, we also ordered the house ice-tea and it was pretty and delicious as well. So, service awesome. Before my ice tea ran out, it was refilled immediately. I didnt feel as though I was being stared at, as much as paid attention to. Very cool.  I had dinner and 2 lunches for my dish, which was $14. To me, that's fantastic!

-t81Ks5AqeeWz9RwtzrSoQ.text: I would like to add my praise to the rest of the group here.  I had been hearing about this place for quite a long time and was entirely impressed.  The Decor is light and airy, seems very open even though they seem to fit a very decent amount of people in a fairly smallish area.  Decorations aren't over the top but it's very pleasant and quite clean.  Service was excellent, maybe a little slow every once in a while, but we came in during brunch so lots of people.  Food: Great food, I haven't had anything from the dinner menu but the lunch/brunch was very nice. Everything appeared to be fresh, and came out quickly.  I need to try more  The Bloody Mary: Best Ever.  Go drink it now.  I've never had such Garnishments in it,,, loved it!  DW & Bryce: Amazing hosts, entirely delightful, and treated us like regulars though it was the first time in.

hAOIHdz8uM7GwyqYZLYTHA.text: Went here for a early lunch with another couple. We were early so we decided to sit at the bar and have a drink. It was very busy and everyone looked like they were having a good time. When the bartender got to us we ordered two mimosas, he asked if we wanted bottomless but we declined since we only planned on having one each. When we got our bill for them it was $43. I knew he charged me for bottomless. He was super friendly and when I reminded him we didn't want bottomless he explained it was cheaper if we got more. I told him we didn't want more then one each and he voided the one bill and charged me for the two mimosas which was $25... for the size their not worth $12 each.   We got seated and had good service the only thing I thought was odd was the server comes over and he just started telling us the specials (he was talking so fast I don't even know what the specials were) he didn't even start by welcoming us or telling us his name. He was nice but it was very odd. He seemed very rushed which is something that always bothered me when we're out to eat.   I got the BLT, I'll definitely try something else next time it wasn't as good as I hoped it would be but everyone else's food smelled, looked and tasted amazing. Food price was reasonable for the portions.   When we got home I checked my bank account and since the bartender swiped my card for the bottomless mimosas and "voided" it I am stuck with that $43 charge and the $25 until the void transaction drops which really sucks. That's almost $70 for a mistake that he could have avoided if he had listen to us. (Takes about 4-5 business days for voided transactions to become available again)    I'll definitely go back and give them another shot, just not on a weekend.

7x2rOPfP4_AGcNkPYDxj7w.text: Staff was very friendly, food was tasty and presented nicely.  I had the eggs Benedict my friend had the veggie burger both amazing.  Great experience!

KBvAY50ATNvVJ6BF7RBUAw.text: A must try in Las Vegas. Their brunch is the best.  Sunday's have themed parties sometimes and it can get loud, but it's good vibes and high energy.

EVdW-_8D7SBdhlCPFCQWkQ.text: Really enjoyed the food. Nice experience. Friendly stuff. The order took a while, but hey, we were like 20 something people.

YGUQQV7Qh0-JtSVM7JnBdA.text: Very clean, modern restaurant with a laid-back vibe. Reggae music was softly playing in the background and I loved it. Our server Luis was extremely knowledgeable and really seemed like he loved his job. He was animated and passionate about the food when describing the specials; he made everything sound so good, and it wasn't. It was GREAT. All our dishes quickly came out hot, well-presented, and well-seasoned. Super delicious. The cocktails were stiff and fruity. We ended our meal with the carrot cake and it was make-your-toes-curl good. This place is awesome. Tell all your friends.

TAhXRjdOawObo0wy8dSCgA.text: Maybe I went on an off night, but I did not have a great experience.  I ordered the beer-braised short rib ($18) and it was SALTY.  Holy shit, it was so salty. Like, so salty I had to stop eating it.  But, even without the salt, I wouldn't have finished it because the short rib was really fatty.  A really bad cut.  The sauce on the seasonal vegetable mix was also a turnoff; I felt all the flavors in this dish really clashed.  The mash of the day was also the victim of oversalting.  Yeah, not ordering this again.  Also, I was seated near the bathroom and there was a putrid smell in the air.  I don't want to think about what it was, but it was awful. They need to take care of that (other people remarked on it too while walking by).  Highlights:  my well-mixed whiskey cocktail, friendly service, and the tasty Parmesan crisps.  I hear such great things about this place.  I'll have to go back and try something else.....but I am afraid.

isaRHmnEv7I8JYGHkrpbRA.text: D-efinitely W-onderful. they really D-o W-ork the food.  D-aring & W-himsical.  the food is D-electable & left me W-onder-struck.  So I don't know what DW stands for but what the place stands for is just plain good food.  The fusion of New Mexican with Caribbean flavors is really interesting to the palate.  Eatings:  The Jerk Chicken lollipops are a great starter.  I ordered the beer braised shortribs which came out super tender piled on top of  rosemary Mash potatoes.  The flavors were earthy and full so don't expect anything bland here even though each table has a plethora of hot sauces from the islands.  The misses ordered the Salmon which didn't taste fishy at all but full of flavor with the guava berre blanc sauce served over a bed of rice.  We also went for brunch one Sunday and our favorite was the New Mexican-style slow cooked pork omelet. Blasted with flavor! The Jerk pork hash was highly recommended but i did not enjoy that one as much.   Dessert was excellent. The carrot cake was decadent and did not taste like carrot cake! If you hate carrot cake which my girlfriend does, you'll still enjoy this! Sweet and  delicious perfect meal finisher.   Imbibe: The wine list is decent but we enjoyed the Pavi pinot grigio! well paired with the full flavor food offerings.  I saw a bunch of people order the Jamaican Mojito and on Sunday brunch the bloody mary's were almost on every table but we decided to go with mimosa's.  Must trust those two on the next visit.  Ambiance: For dinner I fell it was too bright.  They should dim the lights a bit since most of the decor is a bright orange. On the flip side the ambiance is perfect for Sunday brunch! The servers were super friendly and the manager checked in on us 3 times! Very nice staff and attentive.   Overall: We enjoyed the flavors and our food was cooked perfectly.  The wait can be a bit long BUT they told us 25 min wait...yea we were sat in 5 minutes..Over estimate much? it's a good thing.  D-efinitely W-ant to come back.  This place D-istinctively W-arrants a visit at least once for you fellow yelpers.  D-o W-illingly come try it!  DW!

RNQ8bH3pR-1mDrxrIO7OrQ.text: We went here for my Birthday brunch with family.. I love this place! The decor, the colors are so fresh and full of light. The staff is welcoming and friendly. We started with the fresh blueberry and white chocolate scones which were delish! Next, we tried the chicken flautas, which were a perfect bite of flavors. The menu was filled with an abundance of savory options. So at first glance I could not decide, until I read "Thick jalapeno bacon" !!! Those very words made a simple BLT the most appealing pick for me! It not only spoke to my stomach by it's name, but also by it deliciousness. I was then lucky enough to snag a bite of the fried jerk chicken and waffles, yum yum yum. Last to top off the great meal and lovely atmosphere out in their patio dining area, they brought me this delectable slice of carrot cake with a birthday candle and topped off my mimosa... Thanks for a great BDay experience DW.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Carrot Cake
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Jerk Chicken and Waffles
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW BLT (Thick Jalapeno Bacon)

0zs-O7nermpyKtilZ74U1g.text: The hype is real.  Been to DW a few times since coming to down and will agree that it is legit.  I will also agree that there is a good value when it comes to portion and price.  One word of warning, if you are dining in a group, one side might be enough for the entire table.  My wife and I got a side of mac and cheese and after we threw in the towel it looked like we barely made a dent.  I will definitely be back for the Bloody Mary's as well.  They top it off with a delicious strip of jalapeno bacon in addition to all the usuals.  Keep an eye out for the omelet specials on the weekends.  $18 seems like a lot for a breakfast plate but it was AWESOME.  The omelet itself was HUGE and all the fillings were great.  The toast is also a big bonus.  In most cases toast is toast, but here it's a little something more.  I would agree that at times it can get loud depending on the crowd and if they are taking part in bottomless mimosas or something like that but you can always request to sit outside or in the back.  Looking forward to going back and trying more of the menu...in fact, I think I'll go for lunch today.

NzYKFQjDPKlpVIg2LqQDcw.text: A friend met up with us there.  Wasn't sure what to expect, but when you walk in everyone greets you with the feeling that they know you, and even thought they were busy for a late dinner, we were quickly seated, and our waiter was very attentive with us so excellent props to his services.  OXTAIL. BRAISED. YES. The most mouth-watering meat I've enjoyed in awhile. Especially after my long work day.  The side salad had delicious candied walnuts! So yummy! Serious meats here melt in your mouth.  And I think one of the owners looks like Giovanni Ribbisi . Jamaican flair is a hit here. So delicious. Need I say more....

cVXkYQ6Gz67b449EBTLr4A.text: OK, my first tip is sharing is caring! The portions are huge! GO ahead and split the dishes. Everytime I end up here I'm starving, so I think I can order half the menu, sooooo stupid, but the leftovers are great!   So far everything I have eaten is great. The place is festive, lively, and they make fresh cocktails.  Check it out.

wGVD9NcsvM4gC06OGn7F1g.text: Incredible...brunch seating delay is always faster than they quote you in order to exceed your expectations.  If you're celiac, there really are options... the kitchen is smart, the staff is educated, the owners are fabulous.  If you're a local and this isn't a regular brunch spot for you, clue in. It's one of the smartest non-strip restaurants in town and everyone can learn something from their operation.

iR_ywvlIXwwMg7T8UpXPWA.text: DW is quite possibly the cutest little eatery ever, in fact I want their decorator to come work their magic on my home!  I really want to love this adorable little spot, but the service needs some work and organization.  The first time I dined here was not long after they opened and I figured they were still finding their groove.    I made my 2nd visit today; my friends and I popped in to sample their $20 Restaurant Week lunch.  Our first course, the Jamaican Chicken Curry Soup came right out, but with no spoons.  Once they hooked us up with spoons, our taste buds did the happy dance for the little cup full of tasty-creamy-curryliciousness.    Little did we know that we were in for quite a wait.  We observed as 3 nearby tables that were seated after us were getting their food.   After waiting for 45 minutes we flagged our waitress, who apologized and said our order would be right up.  After another 20 minutes my asparagus prosciutto salad arrived, then 5 minutes later my 2 friends received their dishes.  My dish was called "Grilled Asparagus Salad with Prosciutto", which I found rather misleading because I received four pieces of asparagus wrapped in prosciutto atop a huge plate of mixed field greens.  It was like ordering a burger and getting the full size bun with a slider sized patty.  Before we were done with our main course they dropped off our dessert that came with the restaurant week prix fixe, which overcluttered our table.  We waited all of that time for our entrees only to be rushed out when they finally arrived.  As we were preparing to leave we overheard another table that had also been waiting for quite a while.

Y3UujpSBK3FzFwLjUeqVCQ.text: The food and drinks are amazing. The atmosphere reminds me of the Bay Area. The wait staff are friendly, efficient and funny (Nick is the best). The owners are polite, welcoming and fun. All around tops.

VcKct7pRT4RAInHWhyT3Rw.text: If I could give half-stars, this review would be more of a 3.5 than a straight up 3 star review, but definitely did not deserve four stars because of the lack of flavor in our entrees. I really wish I could give four stars because the ambiance was great, but fair is fair!   My girlfriend and I and one of our friends dined here on Friday evening for the first time. We got there a little after 9:30 p.m. and there may have been 2 or 3 other tables eating and a few people at the bar.   We opted for patio seating (one star for ambiance).   The menu was refreshing and unique, unlike most off-the-strip restaurants in Las Vegas. It reminded me of something you would catch in Southern California near a beach.   We started off with the pesto torte appetizer. From the menu, I imagined it would be a bit of cheese mixed with a bit of pesto and some crackers. However, it was more like a huge block of goat cheese with a drizzle of pesto/olive oil and a few crackers. I'm not usually a goat cheese, or cheese in general, fan but I did enjoy the flavors. I do wish there was more pesto, but overall it was different and quite good.   I ordered the beer braised short ribs, my girlfriend ordered the chicken with roasted garlic bowtie pasta and our friend ordered the Jamaican curry bowl. I was very impressed with the diversity of the menu and really excited to try each dish. However, when the food arrived, I was a bit disappointed. Everything tasted very bland, which was surprising because the menu descriptions lead me to believe the dishes would be bursting with flavor. They were not. It tasted like one of those old-fashioned grandma meals or something you'd get at a buffet. Great presentation, very generous portions, but nothing to write home about. My dish needed something - some type of spice or salt. The chicken with pasta tasted like it was out of a box or like the chef neglected to add spices or garlic when preparing the dish. The Jamaican curry also tasted bland. Bland and flavorless. I was really upset because I had high regard due to the reviews.   Also, our waiter wasn't very attentive. He came back to check on us a few times, but a lot of time passed between check-ins and our food was sitting on our table, ready to be taken away for at least 20 minutes before he did so.   Perhaps we arrived late at night (we were definitely the only people ordering food) and maybe the chefs were just checked out for the night. I'm not sure.   We ordered dessert. My girlfriend had the chocolate cake and our friend ordered the carrot cake. Both were moist and delicious (two stars here).   Sorry, DW Bistro, I really, really, wanted to love you! Maybe we'll come back another time and try Brunch!

LQsOQkxV8RD6h0p5oXYmcQ.text: Do not leave without asking (begging) for their lemon-lime pudding. It is amazing!!! It is a creation that is not always available, but a must if it is. The delectable pudding is light and melts in your mouth. Today it was accompanied by fresh berries from the Downtown Farmer's Market as well as hand-dipped chocolate biscotti and a fresh mint sprig. Yummy! What do I love about this place? The atmosphere, decor, crowd and fresh-ingredients and dishes that never cease to amaze. Also, I've seen a couple reviews on lukewarm water... just ask for ice they have always been willing to accommodate any of our requests!

xZiF17m-f-gEjcj5rbb6Zg.text: Considering this place is off the strip I am grateful for. Purely for selfish reasons! For a locals dining spot this place is probably one of the best in town. The entire staff is friendly and knowledgable. There hasn't been one thing that I haven't liked. Although the ahi with couscous salad is what I get every time. I reccommend this place to family, friends and guests all the time. If you are considering checking them out, GO!

9w-UmloTIQCP308WWgYMhQ.text: Retried DW bistro for a girls brunch. Decided I liked it now. The pastry basket was good, I liked the blueberry scone. Their special jerk Benedict was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry basket
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special jerk steak Benedict
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

cs_VfXuSPo3vhRT7hNIFHg.text: My sister & I came here for lunch today - she is visiting from out of town so we wanted to try this place since it is less than 2 miles from my house. We were greeted pleasantly & seated right away. Our waiter Alfonso & his helper were very courteous & helpful in getting our drinks & food. The food was excellent - Jamaican Jerk chicken salad on a spinach tortilla with sweet potato fries. My sis had short rib sandwich with the same fries. After our meal I told Alfonso it was our first visit to DW Bistro so he presented us with a complimentary dessert! Will definitely be back again.

3647vd4yaOyvByG-9cxhrg.text: The most basic of basic brunches and it's worthy all basicness.  First time visiting for brunch since they moved locations. The new digs definitely accounts for the large influx of Sunday brunchers which helps a lot. No more one hour wait (for inside seating) to sip mimosas.. on a Sunday at 11am they had a few open tables for 2.. but if you want to sit outside (which is nicely shaded for the most part of the morning) you have to wait about 30 min. It's nice that you can start on your mimosa and bring it to any part of the open courtyard while you wait.. I anticipate the wait is longer than 30 mins though because it is bottomless and people just sit and chat (i.e. we did just that).  The energy is great.. service is to the point... although I think the drawing out of brunch is partly due to the fact that it takes a while for food to come out (to be expected). Also I'm not sure if they still do their themed brunches like they used to... but it's nice not having a DJ to compete with for loudness.   PASTRIES were BOMB. Croissant and the scone were my favorite. You'll have a few to take home also.  Chilaquiles was better than I remember.  The mimosas are to be expected... nice to have a little berry infusion at the bottom..  They take reservations for larger parties.

0zZH_wNHlMOkJzffADodDw.text: I cannot day enough good things about DW Bistro. The service is fantastic. They remembered us including the table we sat the previous time were there and asked if we'd like the same one (we did). Everyone is so pleasant and engaging. The food is really good as well. My favorite is their Mac n cheese although everything I've eaten there has been enjoyable. We will go back often.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good carrot cake!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MGPKmlLpFhFiRdP8UuNESA.text: Delicious ham eggs Benedict and the pesto goat cheese was delicious too! Ordered a Bloody Mary and it was great! Good spice and can't ever complain about getting a strip of jalapeno bacon in it. Wish they had other flavors for bottomless mimosas though. OJ is not my favorite. Would prefer grapefruit, blood orange or peach.

VnQX8JcKRzVjKTptXg5jyw.text: Brunch was amazing! We had Juan as our server. He was very professional, knowledgeable and attentive. We did bottomless mimosas and they did not disappoint! NOTE**they DO have bottomless on Saturday (another review said Sunday only). We will return!

gn5i8Y62J7AbCbiVsa4YjQ.text: Dude. Just go. Go now. Eat things. Thank me later.  I consider myself a foodie, I travel to eat, and I am most happiest when there is something beautifully presented that tastes as decadent as it looks. Food makes me happy. Real happy.  This place made me ecstatic.  We ordered the goat cheese app, and good-goat-cheese-loving-god! It was spectacular. Not too goat-y, not too warm or cold, drizzled with a few amazing toppings, and served with a few variety of toasty breads.  Really wonderful. I had goat cheese dreams last night, so dang good.  Secondly I ordered the veggie burger. The veggie burger was simple, but yet so decadent. Roasted veggies and an heirloom tomato on the most perfect bun one could ask for, with a light sauce from heaven. The textures, the tastes, holy heirloom tomato it was bomb. I challenge any meat eater to try this dish, there is nothing to not love on this plate. It was spectacular. The burger came served with sweet potato fries served with a spicy aioli, which were also incredible.  Lastly, the adult bevs. I ordered a frumpy glass of wine, but my dining partner ordered a Jamaican Mule, and I wished I had ordered the same thing. The Jamaican Mule is sweet, but not too sweet, a little minty, and really wonderful.  Word to the wise, if you like mimosas get there before 2pm, the cutoff for bottomless mimosas is 230pm!! We were sad to have missed it, but plan to be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger from heaven!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half the nicoise salad, it was delish.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat cheese app, it was incredible!

vvQb4T19taRoy_anHDQL0w.text: As much as I love this restaurant I feel like I need to come here more often. We've been here a hand full of times and never has it ever been a disappointing experience, except for the one time we went and they were closed for construction. We love the dinner menu but also crave the breakfast here sometimes.

ZMVmiqgAnExUIQ_HTF6eRQ.text: Food and drinks were absolutely delicious. The dishes are unique and worth trying! The space is super cute as well. V aesthetic. Portion sizes are a bit small, but quality of food is

IVqbbx3aS54MJqcajtvN_w.text: I recently celebrated my sisters early birthday with a visit to DW Bistro. (I know, what the hell is an "early birthday") ANYWAYS... it's Jamaican New Mexican food, which my initial reaction to was "What?"       The place itself is neat and clean, super cute, great ambiance. Right over by the Gramercy. Our server (I think his name was David) was friendly and attentive and made EXCELLENT suggestions. We had the goat cheese with some kind of pesto and aioli which was GLORIOUS. If I ever wanted to overdose on goat cheese, this was the way to do it! Then we had these perfect little rolled taco things, but they were soft and melted in your mouth. The sliders were fruity and meaty and tender and perfect. I also had the NMpork bowl, it's a little spicy (for me and I'm a big baby) but it was so delicious that I didn't care. Also the portion was HUUUUGE, so I took it home and boyfriend ate the rest. We will be going there again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a cute place.

13JYCeayh5yRiUqR8J3psQ.text: This restaurant is a hangout for the rainbow parade!  Men beware!  The food is ok the prices are a little over priced but not too crazy. It's the staff and the clientele which are a big turn off.

BGzHoJzA4E9eEiYelajz-g.text: Book reservations for Father's Day and they said you didn't need one since they are not busy, but I booked for 11am anyways. Got there 15 min before and they told us it would be awhile since they don't have enough cooks for all these people. It's 11:15 and they still haven't sit us down yet and there's 6 tables open since we've been there. The hostess told us if they sit us down, there will be no food or service in 30 minutes. She was so rude like we didn't belong there. We didn't wait and left. My wife chewed out the manager about the poor service. I will never go here again and I have over 10,000 on my Twitter and Instagram accounts to inform them of this poor service.

vGXrTbqKRC9-LuSki2FdNw.text: Great Restaurant!!!!!! Weekend Brunch is to die for. My favorite would have to be the Jerk fried chicken and waffle, they serve it with orange zest. The chicken is well seasoned but not to spicy and the waffle is unlike any I have ever had. I also love the green chili cheese burger , it comes with jalapeno bacon.  If you go on the weekend, expect a little wait time. They are very popular but the wait is sooooooo worth it.

BBzhU3_wCtDqLJ1GYuLitQ.text: Great spot to get Brunches on a Sunday. Great ambiance. Staff is ever lively. And food is amazing!

k4CU6BfWtqX3eOYsnDJocQ.text: I'm not quite sure how this place got such high reviews, maybe we ordered the wrong things? Even though four of us ordered different things. I ordered the jerk chicken salad. First of all, the chicken was dry, second they don't trim their greens, third cold zucchini is never a good accoutrement for a salad. The dressing was bland, no acidity & no salt. The jerk scampi, too much lemon juice and the spice was strong. They should signify that on the menu as "spicy". I felt even though this was classified as a new American type bistro there was mostly Jamiacain influence which is fine but again it's about being up front w customers. The customer service was great though. Maybe this is more of a brunch spot, but we left the restaurant hungry. Sad.

pa2-LMZj1RbupdhldU6mgg.text: Tomas at the bar is awesome! He has the best personality and service. Our wait for the restaurant was an hour so we sat at the bar and had the best time. The chicken flautas and sopapillas we ordered came out almost immediately and they were so delicious I forgot to take a picture e em though they were presented beautifully. We also had bottomless mimosas and my glass was never empty.  Our main food came out just as we were finishing our appetizers. We got French toast, bacon, potatoes, chicken and waffles, and the roasted vegetable omelet. We all were very happy.   My only complaint is that the bar stools are not friendly to large derrieres and the purse hangers are not friendly to wide straps. Lbs

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

89XJ1yAfIGMKo_cvKXv0Ng.text: Best friend is in Vegas for business frequently and highly recommended this place.  That the stellar Yelp reviews brought us here.    NOTE: they have moved to a complex called Gramercy about a mile from the Yelp-listed location.  Go to their website for the exact address.    What a lovely lunch.  My prickly pepper cocktail was superb - delicious and not overly sweet.  The pesto torte is just stupidly good.  It's rather simple but the blending of flavors is brilliant.  I got the couscous salad - sounds as exciting as a gym sock, right?  NOPE.  Again, the flavor combos were brilliant - couscous, jerk seasoned tuna, goat cheese, chile oil and possibly a little black magic.    Best friend says the owner sporadically makes key lime pudding and to ask for it.  I did and they were unfortunately out.  I was a tiny bit relieved because I was so stuffed.   Wherever you're staying (or wherever you live), it's totally worth the drive.

1Zt-vrkT01FA5Xo91yhrmg.text: The rib sandwich was very tender. The carrot cake is big enough to share and the pomegranite iced tea was refreshing.

TMMwaH18YdtZLt29Vi859w.text: This place is amazing!! The brunch is definitely worth it. The Chilaquiles is the best! They have a jerk chicken benedict special with their special hollandaise sauce that's second to none! I usually get the jerk short rib hash and we share the jerk chicken and waffles.   The service is wonderful as well. The owner comes by and makes sure every table is happy and satisfied with their meal and experience.   If you have room for dessert, their carrot cake is delicious!

vV_u0YkukK8SBbc5f_7LYg.text: I have been dining at DW since they were at their original location and the food has always been great! My all time favorite dish was their jerk chicken plate that came with some delicious cornbread. Things still haven't changed after all these years! There is a new chef but he is putting his own creative ideas into the food and everything came out fantastic! Even with change DW Bistro still continues to deliver fantastic food at reasonable prices and with a fantastic atmosphere!

E8IIRetTm4d5ugysMMpKOQ.text: What a treat!   We stopped here based on Yelp rating. Our normal lunch place was closing so we decided to hit something nearby. Turns out that it was so good that we will definitely be coming back!   It was pricey but they really earned it! I had the New Mexican Green Chilli Cheeseburger with Jerk flavored Fries and a Jamaican Mojito. Wow! A great flavor mix! Then I had the Jamaican Mule to top off my meal. I can't say enough! The flavors are on point!   My girl had the flautas and the Margarita and she was happy! The decor and the general vibe is very much our style. Reggae music, light and colorful, filled with life.   The staff is great! They are very attentive and professional. You can bet we'll be back.

Uw7C19_RRs0FEINP4Akg9Q.text: Wow, the last time I went to DW Bistro was 6 years ago and it was at the ft. Apache location. With brunch restaurants booming crazily in Vegas, it seems like we go to different places each time when we brunch. However, we were glad that we decided to come try it out at the new location. Everything seemed to be a better and improved version!   Tip: no reservation can be made on Sundays. We came in at 12:30 and waited around 35 mins for a table. We will try to come earlier next time.   Service: our waiter was attentive and friendly. No complaints here.   Atmosphere: we had to sit in the patio area because it's the first table available. It was nice day to sit out. The dining room is upbeat and welcoming.    Food: We loved most of the items we ordered with the exceptions of the few.   1. Jerk Friend Chicken and Waffles (5/5): chicken and waffles is always my top choice of brunch items, and DW definitely nailed it. Chicken was perfectly seasoned and the waffles were cooked perfectly. Unlike some places, the waffles that comes with the chicken are always soggy. It's not the case here at all.   2. New Mexican Pork Bowl (4/5)the pork shoulder was cooked very nicely and tender. The only compliant that I have is that I wish the red Chile sauce is spicier.   3. Jamaican Curry Bowl (5/5): all the veggie and seasoning just came together so well with the rice. Def will order it again.   4. Jerk Pork Hash (2/5): this was our least favorite dish because the pork is somewhat dry. My friend also didn't like how it only has the pepper taste instead of being flavorful.   5. DW Nicoise Salad (2/5): it seems like this should be their signature salad but the taste stated otherwise. The ahi tuna was flavorless. The salad dressing was blend as well. Will not order again.  There are some dishes we really love and some not so much. They have their signature Jamaican and New Mexican items where you can't get elsewhere in other brunch eateries which made them unique and popular. We will definitely come back sooner than later to get our jerk fried chicken and waffles fix.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk friend chicken and waffles (5/5)
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican pork bowl (4/5)

zITFpE6cBsGJjkq8RAFp-Q.text: Sat at the bar for brunch and had a great time!!! The bartenders took great care of us and the food was delicious!  Had the Nicoise salad with perfect Ahi Tuna, and the New Mexican Carne Adovada omelette.  The Carrot cake cupcake was also amazing! Don't skip dessert! The atmosphere the space, the service and the music were all on point.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macchiato
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z2oRPy1W72cXL9GVfyWj7A.text: My friend and I ended up going to DW Bistro for breakfast. It's been over 3 years since I've gone to DW Bistro. The original location was somewhere near FT apache and Sahara area, but a few years ago, the owner relocated near Russell and the 215, in the Gramercy Square complex. There is spacious parking as there are a variety of local restaurants and businesses located in the Gramercy Square.  We ended up going Saturday morning at 10:00 A.M as soon as DW Bistro opened. We were pretty much the first people at the restaurant. It was open seating, so we got a small table for two at the front of the restaurant.  The restaurant decor is quite modern. The ambiance feels very relaxing and the way that the decor is oriented around the room, allows for sound to keep in it's own personal space. The brunch menu offers a variety of starts, sweet and savory, eggs, salads, and sandwiches. My friend ended up getting the New Mexican Pork Bowl and I opted for the DW Pastry Basket.   The owner talked with us for a few minutes about the restaurant. The waitress provided our drinks promptly and our order was out within 15 minutes! Super quick! The service is absolutely awesome at DW Bistro!  The New Mexican Pork Bowl is HUGE!!! The meal can cover all 3 meals for the day - breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I typically don't like spices, but the chilli type flavor, with the pork, eggs, and rice tasted very wholesome. My Bistro basket came with a variety of pastries which included Butter Croissant, Chocolate Croissant, Blueberry and White Chocolate Scones. I had the blueberry scone, which was delicious with their red jam that came with it. Unfortunately, that was all the room that I could stomach! I ended up eating the rest of the pastries over [2] days. The food here is delicious and the service is just as awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

juE22At-EUfEXPx14r-rgA.text: Can't believe I haven't left a review about this place since I've come here twice now. Came here with my son on a regular weekday afternoon and preferred to sit outside to enjoy the nice weather and ambiance of the outside. It's actually relaxing. Anyways, I ordered the FRIED CHICKEN and you know what comes with it? This amazing freshly baked corn muffin that is beyond delicious. These two in a plate definitely complimented each other and I enjoyed my plate! The portion was enough to make me full and my son. Service is great and waiter kept checking if we need anything else and to refill our drinks. Very relaxing place with a tasteful menu.  When I came here on the second time, I only ordered carrot cake because I heard it's that delicious and indeed it is. Spot is in the commercial building next to 215 and Russel. This place doesn't disappoint! Happy to find this gem nearby my home .

kneMTI1uo5wpmsFUsOdNGA.text: Had an amazing time and probably gained a few pounds at this lovely bistro a couple nights ago. I was fortunate to be a part of a small group that ordered a ton of food to share. I was able to sample so many delicious plates!  Our waiter, Luis, was absolutely the best. He was always there when you needed him, was able to offer advice and suggestions for every time we wanted to order something new, and he always made sure we had a full drink. Plus he's sooooo nice and friendly, he's great at his job! We pretty much ordered half the menu and I can honestly say EVERYTHING is good. The cocktails were all beautiful and very tasty, my absolute favorite was the Jamaican Mojito.  At the end of dinner we ordered one of each of the desserts offered, wow just wow. Gorgeous desserts, works of art! All amazing but the winner seemed to be the white chocolate mousse.  The chefs, bartender and all of the staff deserve kudos, it could not have been a better night. The bistro itself has a great design, totally love the decor! I will be coming back for sure:)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Mojito

gRqtMcc9Vy32XHqZNqcF6A.text: I've had this place bookmarked for so long, maybe for over 2 years now lol. I finally gave this place a try for Saturday brunch.   First, let me just say the service was above and beyond. There were so many servers who asked how we were doing and made sure we were taken care of. If they even detected that you took a small sip of your water, BAM someone was there within like 10 seconds refilling your cup. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly.   It's located in the Gramercy Plaza by Pinches Tacos and Kitchen Table Squared. Parking was crammed but there's plenty of parking all around, you just may need to walk a little.   Inside was beautiful. There's a bar area with a golden piano and I'd say plenty of seating. There were a few large parties so it's great place to meet up with big groups.   We ordered the NM Sopapilla which were supposed to be like small donuts but they said they were no longer serving that but it will be beignets instead. Who turns down freaking beignets!? So I was like yes I'm fine with that instead. Came out with this berry sauce that made it amazing. Dough was perfectly lightly fried on the outside and soft on the inside. 5/5!  I had the Jerk Chicken and Waffles since I was craving something sweet and savory. The chicken was very crispy and was garnished with a little bit of orange zest. Loved the flavor!! The syrup on the other was waaaay too sweet and I made the mistake of pouring it all over the waffles before trying it so it made my waffles unbearingly sweet. Otherwise I would have loved this dish! 3/5.   I'm still not done with this place and will definitely be back for dinner time to try their other yummy dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Chicken and Waffles
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignet with berry jam
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

F7emw-JkPDOt3sbn5RzuBA.text: Our service was supreme. He was simply fantastic. Wish I could remember his name.... but if he is ready this: we loved you!   But the real star was the Shrimp and Grits, it's considered a small plate, but needs to be an entree. It was simply fantastic. As a southern transplant to vegas, I found the grits to be a perfect consistency, not at all greasy or oily. And the white kernel corn really set it off.   We also got the New Mexico Red Chile Pork with eggs over easy: the portion was enormous. The flavors were complex and savory. Nice dish.   The SCALLOP Ceviche with lettuce boats: bright, light, and beautiful. Perfect summer dish.   Chicken Wings: great way to start a meal. We enjoyed them tremendously.   Cocktails: GTT was great, and on happy hour.   Tip: don't share the shrimp and grits, you will want it all for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h42OghK9E5DrAzSPhmBeaA.text: Driving in the car reminiscing about the days I lived in California and really wanted to brunch somewhere with live music...Heard about DW Bistro, and decided to swing through! To my pleasant surprise, there was a live DJ! I was Already a happy guest! The hostess was personable, lovely and accommodating! So upon first impression, we were already thrilled! The decor was very industrial modern too! Super cute!   Service could've been better during the brunch experience! I wasn't really digging our servers vibe to be honest, he was a little weird and standoffish! Might have been a foreign thing to not really smile or look like you like your job rather just going through the movements. So I knocked off one star for that. The food is pricey but the food was delicious.   This is one of my more basic reviews but in conclusion, these are the points   -cute decor  -love the live music (I saw a gold piano, but apparently they don't have a pianist...they should because not a lot of places here in Vegas offer brunch with live music for locals....someone should change this)  -server gave us weird vibes!  -food was good!  -strip prices when it's the farthest from the strip!

2RLc12b3nFR1tKuClvd5LQ.text: This place is a bit overrated in my opinion. The presentation is gorgeous, but the food was underwhelming. I wanted to love the jerk chicken and waffles bc I love all of these things, and it had some flavor to it but it was nothing I'd be dying to have again. The carrot cake was, again beautiful, but the cake part was a little dry. I like more cake to frosting ratio, which as you can see, it had the opposite. I don't hold that against them Bc plenty of ppl like more frosting, but it just wasn't outstanding.  There was nothing terribly wrong with the food or the service, it was just mediocre food beautifully plated and presented. I don't feel compelled to go back like I do when I love the food somewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken and waffles

x_L6AKCDSXULM51bfC_6-g.text: Took my friend here for a belated birthday dinner and reunion. This wasn't our first time eating here so we pretty much knew what we wanted to order. We both ordered the plantains to share. Not only was it perfect size to share, but it was soo tasty and delicious! We also ordered the Cesar salad to share as well. The only thing was they first brought out the wrong salad, and then when they did bring the Cesar salad they had ranch instead of the Cesar dressing. By then we were over it and hungry we didn't want them to change it again.   It felt like it took soo long for our food to come, I was actually starting to get full off the salad. It was a huge size!! even when they spilt it, it was super big.   I ordered the Jamaican Curried Vegetables with chicken and extra veggies no rice. Serving size was also huge. It was served in a cute boat looking dish, and was very flavorful. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but it was still good and I'm grateful. My friend had the special of the day. I couldn't remember what it was but it was fish. She seemed to enjoy it. I did enjoy the ambiance of the restaurant.   I might come back if I get invited again by someone, but I wouldn't say I would be returning any time soon.
