Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special of the day
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HlE1WTdrfRij73OswCduiw.text: This place is a bit extra lol I didn't expect to have a brunch DJ playing music.  The restaurant has a cool and happy vibe and is located in a nice residential area.  I would definitely recommend the pastries basket to start. My husband had the French toast and I had the chilaquiles, it was good but quite average.  Good and funky ambiance, definitely a good place for brunch between friends.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastries basket

LB_ssFCJK6Mn9Zdebq69YA.text: DW Bistro is a lovely Caribbean cafe with a touch of New Mexico. Dishes are creative and the presentation is beautiful.  They are easy to locate off the 215 and inside the Gramercy buildings. They provide inside dining as well as patio dining for warm weather days.  I have had the pleasure of dining here twice. Once for lunch and now for brunch. I have to say that both experiences were terrific.  Today dining on brunch with our monthly brunch bunch was so fun. Everyone enjoyed a different dish from the DW Breakfast Sandwich to the Pesto Torte, Chicken Flautas, Jerk Pork Hash, and the DW BLT. Their brunch also features unlimited mimosa pours for those looking to spice up their meal.  I enjoyed the Chicken Flautas and a they were so creamy and tasty. The chicken was seasoned to perfection and the guacamole was light and  added a nice kick of flavor.  For lunch, I had enjoyed the Ahi Tuna Nicoise salad. By far one of the freshest produce in a salad in a cafe I have ever tasted. So impressed with this salad.  Our server provided the best service and was kind enough to split all of our checks which made cashing out quick and easy.  The only slight negative is that depending on the day and time you choose to dine here, parking can be a challenge. Some spots are marked for 15 minutes, some are marked 1 hour only parking so you may have to walk a little to the bistro.  I will be back again to share this divine spot with more friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior dining
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This tea was delicious
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RYYXGEY4Y1OBZjW6Gyo4jg.text: This place is by far in my top ten favorite restaurants. This was my first time at this Gramercy location. Beautiful both inside and out. Definitely more room compared to the old location. Started Sunday brunch with a Bloody Mary. Can't go wrong with this, it has bacon! Tried the beignets and was wowed. Then the jerk chicken Benedict came out and I was in love. The flavor combination from this dish was phenomenal. Highly recommend the jerk chicken Benedict! Sunday brunch does tend to bring the noise level to a ten, so if you came to listen to the DJ then you might be disappointed. The service is happy, friendly, and smiles all around. Definitely on point!

rWHcQBWWDOfwJiXs77it8g.text: I have been to DW Bistro a couple times already, once for weekend brunch and another time for a weekday lunch. This yummy bistro serves delicious Caribbean inspired dishes and lovely cocktails. It is pretty solid!  I have  tried several dishes including the Ahi Tuna Nicoise to the their incredible carrot cake. If you plan on brunching here, they have a wonderful menu with takes on island inspirational dishes. The Jerk Fried Chicken and Waffles are super and a nice take on the traditional style. The salads are pretty huge too and I honestly think they are sharable. My friend and I ordered the same Ahi Tuna Nicoise and we both took our leftovers home!  The restaurant itself is bright and cheery with a lot of natural light so it feels very welcoming. The service is great here and attentive. This really is a delicious Vegas bistro that needs to be tried!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto torte
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwich
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT

-zAYFpv9DAIwb-21KQEJLA.text: Okay, I'm finally getting around to reviewing DW Bistro! First of all, I've been to DW multiple times and for whatever reason -- I fail to do a review. So, here goes!!  DW Bistro's new location (it's been a few years here though) is in the Gramercy off of Russell Road. I think it's easy to get there off of the 215, but the real challenge seems to always be finding a parking spot. Due to recent construction and development in the area, I think that's made it even tougher during peak times. However, once inside the DW Bistro you're greeted with friendly staff and a bright, modern decor.    I've heard the Sunday brunch is a real treat, but I have yet to be in for that. This visit, I came in for lunch and ordered the Turkey Panini ~ which was excellent. Service here is attentive, but not over-bearing. I do find the lunch menu very limited personally, and I really wanted more choices. However, the panini I ordered was delicious.   Overall, I find the DW to be a solid lunch choice and I would recommend. Maybe one of these days I will get around to trying the Sunday Brunch. :)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Panini
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

zhrZzE1A7owID9cm7o0kxQ.text: Super excited to try this place and was very underwhelmed. Pork omelette was very dry and the added corn was a weird combo. Also breakfast potatoes were pathetic.  The jerk chicken and waffles were much better. They did have a strong cinnamon and citrus flavor. Taquitos were the best thing I had.  I may give it another try for dinner, but I would say skip brunch. Server took almost 10 minutes to come by after getting seated and it was only half busy.  Atmosphere is great and there is a nice patio located at the Gramercy. Very hipster downtown vibes. There was a DJ there and it was 80s themeed so the staff were dressed up.

IQ7jMaQ4KMGWBQv0XDVDHQ.text: This place is always a good time. I have never had a bad meal here. I typically go with the fried jerk chicken and waffles. The portions are large and fill you up! Great place to bring friends and have a drink (if you are into that) while enjoying great food my friends usually get the chilaquilas

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

NWhlByAkHrllthUpmDCV1Q.text: Very split with this review seeing as the service and experience was so great!  Came here to enjoy brunch on New Years Day. Obviously expected it to be busy and it was, but that didn't stop staff from the hostess station, to the bar and our server accommodating us so well with smiles and friendly chit chat.   There was a 20 minute wait, which was no problem as we enjoyed a drink in the meantime at the bar and the service they use which involves giving a phone number and waiting for a text, worked very well! I was also so impressed that the initial text offered me a link to track where we were in the line and kept me updated. Very good!  Before long, I was half a mimosa down and we were seated. The menu is somewhat varied, but a lot of slow-cooked pork dishes and chicken on the brunch menu.  To start, my partner and I tried the pesto torte. This was a huge let down unfortunately. I usually love tortes, but this was just a chunk of goats cheese on a plate with a 'scribble' design of some pesto. Very unimaginative and underwhelming.  Don't get me wrong - if you like goats cheese and you like pesto, you'll enjoy it, but I was expecting something a little more creative. The dish was very small but after 3/4 bites of pure goats cheese, we didn't want any more of the starter. What I did like about it was the variety of breads that come with it. Those were tasty and kept the dish a little more interesting.  For the mains, my partner had the DW breakfast sandwich, which was nice enough, however reheated, and he had to wait for the piping hot eggs to cool a little before trying again. The green chile helped to give some flavour to the otherwise bland egg and the chipotle mayo made it all a little less dry. Overall, an average sandwich.  I went for the Slow Cooked Pork omelet. This was average too. Other reviews have said that the pork is a little dry and I must agree. It was seasoned okay, but not a dish I will remember in a week or would want to go back for. What I liked about the omelet was that it was a good sized portion and filled with ingredients. The small portion of potatoes on the side was a welcomed texture change to all the egg and we were also offered some condiments which was needed to make this dish a little less dry.  All in all, a great atmosphere, lovely staff and an efficient and fast seating service despite it being a busy holiday. Only let down for me was the food.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW breakfast sandwich 3/5
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto torte 2.5/5. Not a torte. Just one lump of goats cheese with a scribble or pesto. Tasted okay, but a little boring.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow cooked pork omelet 3/5

_RXgZN7nxgIvvbiS6Uge9Q.text: DW Bistro is absolutely a (not so hidden) Las Vegas hidden treasure!  I've had a few friends here and there mention this restaurant as an amazing Sunday brunch spot, so I decided to give it a try on a Thursday afternoon.  Although, they didn't have the same menu and drink selections as their infamous Sunday brunch, I was still delighted by some very tasty drink and menu items!  Their menu has a lot of "jerk" or "spice" inspirations, and the drinks are flawlessly designed.  I absolutely loved the margarita we ordered and the food was just to die for! It had so much flavor!  I can definitely see what all the hype is about.  Even the service was phenomenal.  We were immediately and politely greeted by a hostess and a gentleman at the front door. Then our server took over and was extremely helpful and polite the entire visit.  I've told all my friends about DW! It's a must try in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NlOybON8SeWuM2Cn4t5UOQ.text: Zero complaints about this place.  I've eaten a lot of Jamaican food but didn't know what to expect from a place like this.  I definitely wasn't disappointed.  The bread selection was great, including these amazing sea salt muffins.  I tasted the pesto torte (app), the jerk ribs (app), the braised oxtail (main) and the jerk lamb (main) - all delicious.  For dessert, the cakes and pudding were equally delicious.  Some pros: attentive, friendly service; cool decor; and they have ginger beer! Some cons: It ended up being more expensive than I would have expected, but it was worth it.

E2r15Oehn3G0xXeCHgpdhw.text: Great food and service!  We went for brunch and had two pork dishes - one was pork hash and the other was a chili pork rice bowl. They were very different, and both were exceptional! Next time we will try other items because everything that came outmode the kitchen looked great - and prices are very reasonable.

3wEZyK5LhMPq86QVp8phfg.text: This was my first experience at DW Bistro and it was worth the hour plus I spent enjoying the patio, the service, and mostly the food. We had heard the food was great, but today we decided to drop by for brunch. My wife had the DW Nicoise and I had the DW BLT. The salad was delightful - delightful enough that she didn't share. My BLT was to die for - especially the jalapeno bacon which gave the BLT a spicy, but not overpowering. I savored every bite.  We followed brunch with blueberry and raspberry scones (the latter isn't on the menu, but was available today).   The decor was delightful. It was open, bright, airy. I was reminded of some European restaurants I've been in. The service was unbelievable and the pricing just right. We have decided this is our NEW favorite restaurant.

qtPhIYc-y82WFg6pE2zPxA.text: This is THE brunch spot! There is something for everyone...including bottomless mimosas on Sundays! Their egg specials are always divine. And the oxtail on their dinner menu reminds me of my moms! Delicious!

C63g4zs_qRxrrhHrS6_KbA.text: cant say enough about this place, kind of a trek to get there but well worth it. do NOT pass up the bloody mary! i dont even like tomatoes and i love this drink! spicy salty and just the right amount of liquor. chicken and waffles is my all time fav, the hint of orange makes the syrup to die for. chilequiles is simply perfection on a plate, i get it with egg whites, yummmm. everything is freshly prepared and delicious. cant come to Vegas and not eat here. beware on sundays, it gets PACKED for brunch. we went on a saturday and walked right in at noontime, awesome! give them a try you wont be disappointed.

_CJpFiAq80SalMlFEfRKjw.text: My wife Shelly, two friends Keith and Katie, went here for dinner the other night.  We had heard about DW Bistro from a friend and we thought we'd stop by before going to see 'Elvis' for a little pre-theatre dinner.  We were absolutely delighted by everything we encountered in this restaurant.  The ambience, friendliness of staff, service, and most of all, the food were amazing.  We literally could not stop talking about it long after we had left the restaurant.  Between the four of us we ordered the Fried Chicken, Turkey Sliders, New Mexican style slow cooked pork, and the Beer Braised Short Rib.  All four of us tried each dish and this is the first time I have ever been to a restaurant where all the dishes at the table were as outstanding as the next.  I had the pork and could not stop eating it.  It was so tender and so flavorful and all of the deliciousness of it was soaked up by the rice and made it the best rice I have ever eaten.  It was hard to finish for the fact that I was stealing bites of my wife's corbread, which was amazing in itself!  To top off the entire experience we met Bryce who we found to be one of the friendliest restaurant owners we have ever met!   We all cannot wait to return for another great experience and great food!

-Y9IKeZMmM75H36FKC4eZw.text: I had a great experience at DW Bistro.  The ambiance is cool and inviting.  The patio is a place you can spend a couple of hours and not even notice the time going by.  Once we arrived we were greeted with smiles from the staff and the management was very personable.  A nice wine selection and a simple but flavorful menu made for a great experience.  With a party of six, our server didn't miss a beat.  Her recommendations were on point.  So were the Jamaican Mojito's.  I had the large bowl of Gazpacho which was made perfectly.  I was a cool and tasteful starter.  After that I had the Jerk Chicken Salad.  The dressing was light and the Chicken had a bit of spicy kick.  The only thing i would like to see are more starter options.  We did order the top three starters which were great but if you are like my family, we enjoy ordering tons of apps to try as many flavors as possible instead of individual plates.  Apps and cocktails all around is our preference.  The prices are reasonable.

j0CWreXvRj-jRDpsx4Wkcg.text: LOVE DW Bistro. Everything I've tried has been fantastic! I've been there countless times since they opened one year ago. I always take out of town guests here too....so nice to have such a fantastic place off the strip. Well done Bryce and Dalton!

sqoANnuFGzxKOCNuoYtrYA.text: Went to DW Bistro for brunch with our large family.  Food and service were great.  I had the Jerk Pork Hash and it was very tasty.  Eveyone else enjoyed their meals as well.

xVkPGXXapjJ3Ef1MLSjoGA.text: Have been hearing so many good things about this place for the last few weeks I just had to try it.  I came in with very high expectations.... They were met, then exceeded then exceeded again.  I want to try everything on the menu.... Not only is the food delicious but there is obvious painstaking attention to every detail to complete a wonderful dining experience.  Can't wait to go again.

FzV8CU8NpFvMYTNcweO_vA.text: Went to DW Bistro for brunch today with a large rowdy family with some picky eaters. They accomdated us and the little ones well. The service was outstanding, the cocktails and food were phenomeonal. Can't wait to go back to try for lunch or dinner. Everyone at our table was pleased with what they ordered. I had the nicoise salad, the tuna was seared perfectly. Others had a mix of their breakfast items, like chocolate pancakes to please the kids, and the jamaician hash. Definitely a new favourite place to go.

CECUaUoN5KiN7bA6xGe-vg.text: Great food at a great price. I had the jerk chicken salad which was tasty, and the jerk curry soup which was also good. I got to try the jerk chicken and waffles and white chocolate french toast and they weet both excellent. I will be back when I'm in the area again.

VRK3xz3MV0usm4fx3PTDvw.text: Went here for dinner based on the positive reviews.  I had the jerk chicken pasta and tried some of the bf's fried chicken.  Both dishes were excellent.  The decor is clean and modern.  I'd prefer the lighting to be a little dimmer but that's just being picky.  The service was good.  Will definitely be going back.

d5BPsjfto_LOQiMhFnBc2g.text: Very tasty place, came for eggs benedict but reviewers fail to mention breakfast weekends only. Went with chicken flautas instead and I am a HUGE fan! Thomas was awesome! Pricey but tasty mimosas!

OOfyH6X5n5EkvSOUysvUow.text: Beauty, Brains, Braun, Hipsters, Families...wait, what?   That's the type of crowd you'll get here at one of the best brunch spots I've ever been to. Sure, you'll have to wait perhaps an hour, but grab a drink from their bar that has so many different types of fruit-infused alcohol and a $20 all you can drink mimosa special.  Rumor (unconfirmed) has it that the restaurant owners go and purchase all their ingredients and food fresh in the morning before cooking it up during the afternoon. I'd believe it.  They even send you a text message/call you whenever your table is ready. Unfortunately for anyone not living in the vegas area, there's not much to do right around here. Anyways, on to the food.  Starters: Grab the DW Pastry Basket and don't think twice...chocolate croissants, blueberry white chocolate scones, banana nut bread, guava something something goodness, etc. Enough to share all around and you can take the fresh-baked greatness.  Jerk Fried Chicken & Waffles: Best.chicken.and.waffles.ever. Chicken breast made me initially think twice about this dish, as i expected it to be pretty dry. Add in the lightly battered jerk spices on top of a moist piece of chicken breast, and you've got a winner.  I didn't have any, but the slow-cooked pork was pretty good according to the rest of my party.  Friendly waitstaff, fun atmosphere, delicious food = big winner in my book.

PCZQETbhl4loxDv9NRWc7A.text: I was in North Vegas last month and one of my vendors treated me to DW Bistro.  All I can say, is that the food was absolutely great.  On the advise of the host, I tried one of the steak dishes.  Typically, I don't clean my plate...but the steak was prepared to perfection...I ate every bite.  My date ordered some type of pasta dish...I think I ate about 1/4 of his food as well....all I can say, is that I was so full after dinner, I couldn't even think of dessert..but I will say that the next time I'm in LV, I'll pay them a visit again, and again, and again....  Hmmmm Hmmmm good!

nVCyEIIuRdx2hoGUkJ5oLQ.text: First of all, hands down one of my best dining experience at this place! As soon as we walked in, they already had of table ready to go. (Mind you, we called ahead to see if there was a wait ten minutes before).  Our first time here, the waiter, Nick, was great! Told us the specials, what his favs were, and gave us positive praise for choices we made in the menu. From the variety of bread, to drinks, to appetizers, and entrees. We were satisfied! Too bad we REALLY didn't have any room for dessert :(  The bartender was so kind to let us try the fruit infused alcohol too! Yummy! Try the pineapple martini (he read my mind and had it made just as I told to waiter).  It was a Saturday night, the place wasn't crowded, which was nice. However, this place should be packed! Must Go Place! Bookmark it and go!  FOOD: Great! SERVICE: From the front end to the back, it was awesome!  Can't wait to go back!

QE_3mksHMou1Xc2u7Rgatg.text: Eeeek!! Here's the deal. I've known about DW Bistro for a LONG time now and have been dying to come on a date night, but never got around to it. I constantly see the reviews in my Yelp feed because I live so close-by, so I was really excited to finally try it last Saturday. My husband and I went with my sister-in-law before the Xtreme thing, because we had to have a sophisticated dinner prior to blending in with Las Vegas's most obnoxious crowd at Desert Breeze Park.   Our server may have been the tastiest part of the meal (that was piggish, I know, but he was seriously HOT) and so friendly. It seems like the tables he was serving were all regulars, several of them with women. I bet they all ask to be seated in his section for some eye candy. MOVING ON! We started off with the jerk calamari. When they brought it over to us, we were really surprised because it was a pile of black, wet, calamari. It was calamari drenched in their jerk sauce which ended up being way too salty, and soggy. The squid inside however, was high quality, not chewy, and tender. I just wish it wasn't in that sauce. Sadly, this was a recommended appetizer.   For entrees, we went with more appetizers. We ordered the flautas, turkey sliders, and chicken curry soup. The flautas were tasty, but sadly not tastier than ones that I had at a hole in the wall Mexican take-out place in California. The turkey sliders that everyone RAVES about were so underwhelming! My SIL took a photo and put it on IG, and she had 15+ comments talking about how much they love this thing. I found pieces of the chutney to be bitter (orange peel possibly?) and the burger itself to be tasteless and dry. I just didn't understand the hype of this thing. It came with no veggies either which I found disturbing. It was just a brioche bun, turkey, and chutney.   Lastly, the soup that everyone on Yelp talks about was a nice sized soup loaded with chicken and veggies. However, I found the seasoning to be on the strong side. I loved the consistency, which must have used a lot of coconut milk to make it so creamy. Perhaps it was an off-night, but the food was not up to my expectations. Things were over-seasoned and I wouldn't order any of these things again. I really really want to come back (to spy on the hot waiter) and try their brunch because that seems to be where the real magic happens! The inside is beautiful, the patio looks perfect for a Spring day, and the environment lively to make a small or large party feel comfortable.

lTT9gU51mVa1H_5yzRt1AA.text: I would give this place a sixth star if I could!   The ambiance is lovely. The restaurant is bright and very modern. The overall feel of the place was summery and just plain happy. It was very busy but I completely understand why. The service is impeccable. Travis was one of the best servers I have had in a very long time. Very attentive, knowledgeable, and showed a genuine concern about our dining experience. The rest of the staff was a pleasure as well, even a manager visited our table to check on us. The food here is a foodie's dream. Large portions and the flavors are like POW! Of course POW in a good way. Presentation is also amazing. The food is Jamaican style so blends of sweet and spice. Everything was delicious. The carrot cake was the best I have ever had in my life. DW, you and I will meet again...very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best carrot cake I have ever had
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger and side salad

fjLYfimJxMZO3OSclROtpg.text: Here is a place that has the charm of an L.A. hotspot without the 4 hour waiting list.  If you want to eat creative food and drink cocktails from a more enlightened Chef and Mixologist, this is the place.   Vegas has so many places to eat and yes there are many places in town who like to believe they are the only option, but I say skip those places without passion and come to a place thats ALL HEART!

jXfuuYswzPIUsooONbBAmg.text: Decided to go here for a date night with my boyfriend. He even called to make a reservation but they said we didn't need to so we assumed it wasn't busy. So we get to the place and are immediately greeted by a waitress. She asked if we were here for the "event" and we said no and that we just wanted to eat. The waitress replied by saying there was a private event going on and that we had to leave because they were closed. So my question is, why didn't you tell us that over the phone??? Now I'm starving and have to find another place to eat. I was so excited to try this place too. What

sxHeHzp6Y4YlreYn8gu0Rw.text: I thought this place was AMAZING! The service was outstanding and the owner was just a doll!  My friend and I shared and we ordered the Salmon Eggs Benedict and the French Toast with Strawberries and Bananas. The Salmon Eggs Benedict was to die for! The best Eggs Benedict I have had BY FAR! The French Toast was also amazing! The sauce that was on it was made to perfection. It wasn't too sweet which made it even better.  The guys in our group ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and the other ordered some egg thing. The Egg thing was good. Tasted a little better than any other place I've been too. The Breakfast Sandwich was GREAT! I had about a fourth of that because it was so delicious. The Potatoes that came on the side we great as well.  We also ordered two drinks. The Berry Berry Martini and The Bloody Mary. They definitely are not stingy with their alcohol. The Berry Berry Martini was strong and tasted great. The Bloody Mary was CRAZY! It had a piece of Jalapeno Bacon in it and it was just awesome!  The place was set up very nice and clean. They have the best hot sauces! The service was outstanding and the food was just to die for! I think this is definitely a place to try!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Eggs Benedict!! The BEST!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry and Banana French Toast
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwich!

63fX80eEflibaRpIKW8Sbg.text: Finally tried this little gem of the southwest. What has taken me so long?  We went for brunch and it was a great experience: Food- amazing. Service- outstanding. Ambiance- hip and exciting. Wait- boo but what could one expect?   A great start off was the Bloody Mary, though they are known for their bottomless mimosa specials. The jalapeno bacon was fantastic! For brunch we had the slow style pork bowl, which had the perfect balance of flavor and spice. Along with that was the jerk pork hash. This had amazing flavor. The slow style pork omelette was also a treat. The saltiness of the cheese played well in the mix. We also shared the challah French toast. This was a perfect way to end the meal.   I typically am a person who doesn't like to go back to a restaurant twice because there are so many amazing places to try. This won't be True for DW Bistro. I plan on visiting again and trying some new dishes! Thanks for a great meal... Oh and on a reasonable dime too!

jo0ZuOB3x4IR8Pi8C54Z8Q.text: Best brunch I've had. We were staying with some friends just down the street, and happened upon this place. We saw a line forming and decided that meant good things.   Nice atmosphere. Super quick service. And delicious food. I got a Bloody Mary and my wife got coffee. My drink was spicy, and the jalapeno bacon was a nice touch. Her coffee was refilled instantly as soon as it got low. She said the coffee quality was average.   I got the chilaquiles, sort of a Mexican breakfast enchilada I guess? So good. Awesome flavor, glad I went outside the box. My wife got the eggs Benedict with ham. She was pretty happy with her choice as well.   In short, great food, great service, great find.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with sunny side up eggs and Eggs Benedict.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance and bar area.

rNhW8sM-qc4l6GWQTQAEJw.text: I have heard about this place for a very long time and finally planned to take my dad for Father's Day lunch. I had my heart set on chicken and waffles, I even skipped breakfast so I could indulge!! To my surprise upon arrival I was handed a lunch menu and no chicken and waffles. I guess it's only available on Saturday and Sunday's. My dad and I are both business owners and Mondays are our typical lunch date. I will go back on a Saturday or Sunday to please my taste for this deliciousness that everyone talks about. Our service was great, the place was clean just dissatisfied with the menu selection.

wDSqL-zKQH46B-9oTqiAHw.text: I've never had a bad experience here. The service is always excellent, and the food is some of my favorite in Vegas.   If you're interested in cocktails, they have some unique ones made with fruit-infused alcohol.   My favorite soup I've ever had is here: the Jamaican chicken curry soup. It's a neon green like teenage mutant ninja turtle ooze, but has consistently had a perfect flavor.

078IlvApO0k3xxLDAcZG9Q.text: It was fellow Yelper Jessica M's birthday and it was decided that we were going to check out DW Bistro. Since we were a large group of about 10 (All of us Yelpers) we tried to get a reservation. But we were informed that they "Don't do reservations." So it resulted in an hour & a half wait!! If it hadn't been her bday I totally would have gone some place else. There was no real place to sit down and wait either cause there were to many people already waiting.  We were all starving and thirsty by the time they finally called our name. We were seated at a table in the far back of the restaurant right next to the bathrooms and the kitchen. I was so happy when the waiter came around to fill water glasses and take drink orders. I really wanted the bottomless mimosas like the majority of our group ordered, but I was on a tight budget. Instead I went with a not to spicy Bloody Mary. Yum! It came with crispy bacon, green olives, a wedge of lime, and (my favorite) a dill pickle! Jessie B and I were sharing a menu and could not decide on what to order. Everything on the menu sounded good cause we were so hungry. When the waiter came back out we asked what were the specials for the day. Jessie and I immediately looked at each other and said we so need to get the New Mexico pulled pork Benedict with spicy Hatch Chili Hollandaise sauce. Dyanna L and her man Brent over heard us and asked if we wanted to all get different things and share. I was all in! I love getting to try ALL the things. So we decided on the Special Benedict, Chiliqulies, and the New Mexico pulled pork Hash with scrambled eggs. Wow! If I could rate the food alone I'd give them 5 stars. Let's start with the Benedict. The English muffin is homemade which I loved. It also was very light and fluffy. I could cut through the muffin with my fork and normally that doesn't happen. The English muffin was piled high with tasty pork and topped with poached eggs and had a dab of spicy Hollandaise sauce on each egg. I wish it had more Hollandaise sauce cause the little bit that was on there had a great spicy flavor. It was served with maybe 6 pieces of potato and a cup of fruit. (Which was tainted with pineapple. Not a fan.) Next the Chiliqulies!! Omg yum!!! If you've never had Chiliqulies it's like a breakfast nachos. I loved their enchilada sauce! It really tied the whole dish together. By this time I was starting to fill up!! I did take a couple bites of the pork Hash. The pork meat was tender and full of flavor. I enjoyed the spice from the Hatch chiles. Vanessa N offered us all a taste of her Veggie Curry. Yummy! I really enjoyed that.   Now let's talk service. It was pretty spotty. The waiter seemed almost annoyed that we were there. He asked if we wanted more drinks and Jessie asked for a vanilla latte, but it never came! When Niyen was asking our waiter if he could have Jessica's bill put on his bill the waiter acted all in a huff about it. Jessica was given a free birthday piece of Carrot Cake that was soooo good!   As long as Jessica had a good time at her bday brunch is all that matters. But I was way disappointed in the rules of "no reservations" and the waiter with an attitude. Since DW is on the other side of the world from where I live I wouldn't go out of my to stop back in. It pains me to give DW Bistro 3 stars cause the food was a 5. Perk up DW!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiliqulies!! The best!

I like coming here for lunch but it's usually a bit busy and loud so business meetings are hard to hear. The food is excellent though! the brunch is the bomb but the wait for it is crazy.

qFO8tHXQszmGuGdjEOPSGQ.text: Since my first review a year ago I've been once a month on average. Lately, they'd been slacking- the server actually lost our order last time (Ha!) and today he actually forgot to bring out our app. At any other restaurant I'd lose my mind, but these guys get a pass.   The food, which is usually amazing fell flat today. I never use salt on their food, but today was that day.  Lastly, they gotta turn up the music and change out those dying flowers on the table a little more often. Details.

WsEZU7rgvnrmc8ch2KxvUA.text: The service was impeccable. The staff and server were pleasant and accommodating. The food itself is a fusion of Caribbean as well as New Mexican cuisine. The dishes were decent and very unique. For example, the calamari here isn't served as what you are use to traditionally, instead it's smothered in a jerk sauce, a little too flavorful for my taste. The cous cous salad is ok nothing too special. The lamb chops were cooked nicely and beautifully presented. The sliders for me personally were the stars of the evening. I'm hoping to try the brunch soon!

gAlvxUiz8ccGtZSA2EA3TA.text: Love this place. The appetizers are amazing. I had the salmon it was amazing. its a nice place and  the service is outstanding

E_iC5BJrSl2FdV9CneV2UA.text: You can read others positive reviews I'm want to list the opportunities. After spending 15 years managing restaurants I can spot the opportunities within two minutes of being there. Only in exceptional great restaurants does this change -why? Because the staff is well trained and cares about the success of the restaurant vs a staff just going thru the motions until their shift is over.   Arrived for Dinner at 5:30pm Opportunities:  -Server had too many tables and his service was lacking. Too long to greet us. We were first timers and nothing was explained about what was on the menu. Bussers had to be told by a manager  to bring his 3 tables bread. This should of been a clue to the owner that he was in trouble and needed help. The server seemed to be MIA a lot. One of my biggest pet peeves - the server failed to meet the 2/2 rule. Always, always ask your table within 2 bites or 2 minutes of receiving their food if everything is ok.  Food 4/5 - Dover sole was overcooked.  Atmosphere 4/5 - No music playing Service 3/5

a8ShYsGjqBvioazLZn5PdQ.text: We had high expectations for this place since it was recommended by a friend and reading the reviews but, we did not have a great first impression. We went on a Friday evening and were sat right away outside on the patio. That part was lovely.   Our server, Ernie, was friendly and we chatted a bit about the fact that we had just moved into the neighborhood and that we were first-timers. He explained the menu and their specialties. We started with Garlic Shrimp & Chorizo Appetizer, Martini's and sparkling water. For entrees, Hubby ordered the Fried Chicken & Gravy and I ordered the Oxtail. We finished the appetizer and cocktails and waited. During that time, several tables were sat around us and those tables had received their entrees. I ordered a glass of wine to go with dinner and we waited some more. Finally, Ernie came back to the table and admitted that he forgot to put in our entree order and we needed to tell him what we had ordered again. He also said to save room for dessert because it was on them.  We weren't in a hurry so it wasn't a huge deal. Ernie brought me a second glass of wine and said it was on the house. Our entrees finally came and both were delicious. I asked for some more sauce but it never arrived. Ernie did bring dessert as promised - chocolate cake. It was not anything to write home about and definitely not worth ordering again. I ordered a Chocolate Martini and it came with chocolate sauce drizzled around the rim...only problem is that it also dribbled down the side of the glass and was very sticky to drink.   All in all, the food was delicious, the drinks and wine were good, the patio was wonderful but the service was below standard. We will go back for the food and hopefully get a different server.

kcXg0ZCIu9SiSjBka2SgbA.text: this place has an AMAZING brunch menu!!!! nom nom nom! my girlfriends and I went here and we were all very impressed. I ordered Eggs Benedict with salmon and spinach, and a kick a$$ Bloody Mary. we all cleaned our plates. Service was excellent, the ambiance is very neat, nice cozy little place. This is definitely gourmet food, I've been here for dinner a couple times and have always been impressed. OK so it's a tad more pricey than your average breakfast spot but it is worth it. Will be back again soon!!!

_in20IYGGfC0RFI6HP0Idw.text: Awesome food and specialty drinks. A local favorite of mine. Great atmosphere and ambiance.

mlDIfSEU3xDT6b8t5KZCCQ.text: The service and atmosphere is excellent.  The food items I ordered were okay.  I think they over use the cajun spices.  The fried chicken was very dark in color due to the spices and it actually looked unappealing to me; the flavor was okay but I've had better.  The only reason for me to go here is to meet up with friends who like the place.  Otherwise, I pass.

E8uZICYdKEZCHujgiuUe-A.text: One of my new favorite spots in town. My first visit was during dinner. I tried the turkey sliders and they were delicious, a bit dry but the flavors of the mango chutney i believe was unique. my friend and i shared the seared ahi tuna salad. The quality of tuna was superb! Something about the vinaigrette and tuna makes a perfect pair.   We each had a slice of raspberry cheesecake i believe-UNBELIEVABLE. I'm actually craving a slice right now.   My second visit was for brunch on a Sunday morning, the line was out the door! If you come as a duo, sit at the bar to avoid the table wait. They serve food at the bar as well. I tried the bloody mary with an order of chicken and waffles. Bloody mary was delicious! Very spicy and authentically made. I don't normally like bacon but the slice of bacon in the glass was perfect. Chicken and waffles were amazing. Chicken was moist and flavorful while the waffle was simple yet fluffy. I could only eat half my order. My friend ordered the mexican-style slow cooked pork bowl. It was so satisfying! More of a lunch items rather than brunch to me.   The only downfall of the meal was since we were at the bar and the restaurant was so busy that people were ordering drinks from all around us. Very loud inside but great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles! Delicious
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE bloody Mary-it was delicious!

LOR8zGwWxMmkesmlvH8uBg.text: In short, DW Bistro is a fantastic brunch spot.  Here are the keywords/phrases to help you consider whether or not DW is for you: FRIENDLY ATMOSPHERE, JERK FRIED CHICKEN, and BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS.  There is always a warm greeting from the hostess and courteous attention from the wait staff. As busy as they get (and trust me, they can get busy--I wish they took reservations), they keep an eye on you (and your BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS).    Even the customers at the bar are FRIENDLY. We met a regular named Randall. He was giving me drink suggestions while we waited for our table. People who frequent this place really care about it and want you to enjoy your experience.  And by the way, Randall was right about the Bloody Mary--it was a bit too spicy for me. I'm glad he asked he bartender to let me taste it first.  It was perfect for my Dad-in-law, so there was something for everyone.   Of course I didn't need any help from Randall with ordering the BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS. When people linger too long, I believe these drinks are often to blame. This is a place to gather and linger.  That adds to the energy of the place.  I can see how that lingering can be both a pro and a con.   We've been coming to DW since they opened. Even from those first visits they were putting out a delicious, high-quality product. DW takes a Caribbean/Southwestern angle with their relatively traditional dishes.  I don't LOVE every dish. But I do enjoy them. Their unique take does lead to some less successful dishes for me. But I so appreciate the creativity and effort.    They always have tasty off-menu specials. This trip we tried the JERK FRIED CHICKEN sandwich and it was divine. I have no idea why it is not a regular item on the menu. It was one of the most tender, flavorful chicken sandwiches I have ever had. My mother-in-law declared it was THE best she had ever had.   This is a fabulous local spot. I'm glad they are becoming a popular, regular spot for so many.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Bloody Mary

Ol9_sxpSy5mKcLAb6_p9og.text: Great place for brunch!! Had the eggs benedict because I didn't want anything too heavy...the jerk chicken was also good..the ambiance is great and best part was the unlimited mimosas for $22...say what?!

y0yJ5B58KrLqkfKRptjP9g.text: Whenever I am in Vegas next; hopefully sooner than later, I don't care if I have to pay a taxi from my hotel to take me here...I'M GOING! This place was fantastic. We made a reservation for brunch on a Saturday for six of us, although two people in our party were running late. Even though they were pretty crowded they cordially let us sit down and didn't make us wait until our whole party was there. About a minute after being seated we were greeted by one of the most cheerful waiters I have ever encountered--I forget his name but he has red hair--and offered us some drinks to start with while we wait for our friends. I have two words for you : JAMAICAN MOJITO. You may want to wait a bit before driving after this one but WOW.   Our friends ended up taking a little longer than we expected but our server showed absolutely no frustration or rush for us to order. I'm usually a faithful eggs benedict bruncher, however I ended up going with the jerk chicken and waffles. Well, as soon as it arrived I knew I would not be leaving hungry...it was HUGE. But it ended up being great because the others at my table realized how delicious it was and had some bites! The syrup is sooo deliciously flavored and it's the perfect combo between sweet and savory. We were so mesmerized by our meals that even though we were stuffed we couldn't help but order desert! (Only one for the table though). Can't wait to come back, maybe even for dinner! Nice bright, sunny and welcoming atmosphere for brunch though.

DYePxRfB_1kE_MeWK4RV9Q.text: Love this place SO SO much! You can't pick a bad item from the menu, everything is so wonderful and the staff is the best out there, so attentive and sweet!

7YGqL2mhrMlI_chKbAkQ-g.text: We drive by this place all the time and finally decided to give it a try.  We were early for dinner, so not too many tables, a few sitting outside, but inside was empty.  We got a couple of things to try as appetizers, like the Jamaican chicken curry soup with fresh New Mexican green chilies, spicy but subtle. And we got the DW signature salad - baby field greens, caramelized pecans, orange segments, seasonal bell peppers, topped with goat cheese and served with balsamic vinaigrette.  Both of these were yummy!  Enjoyed them both.  For entree, I got the Dover sole special of the day, and it was a really large piece of fish, over a bed of mash, and smothered with three sauces, red roasted pepper sauce, mango with pepper sauces and the third was another chili sauce.  All of these worked well together, and I really enjoyed the plate.  I'm a fish lover anyway, and these flavors were so unique, I enjoyed it's freshness.  For desert we got  chocolate bottom pie with bananas.  Very delicious.  A good meal with a Yuppie kind of feel, I'd go back, but my hubby, might hesitate mostly due to prices.

Re6iyp60u83lmiqm5Aihvw.text: Love love love this place!!!! Having my day off and wanna go somewhere relaxing and with a lot of sun, here u go DW Bistro with good food and great serves!!! Start with a curry soup and a small appetizer (the one with shrimp) yummmmm, and wait for it, for the main course-- a DW salad and a Mexican beef with rice lol!!! Last but not least we got dessert AGAIN a must have carrot cake and a layer chocolate cake OMG  They told us there will have brunch for sat n sun....ummmm I'm coming again lol

Some of the chicken were room temperature and some were warmer. I also had a sticker that is found on lemons or limes on my plate. Overall nice bold flavors, but I wouldn't want to dine in again.

Can't wait to go again

knKFPsEKOHfzkKvwfR05dQ.text: This is a great spot for lunch and dinner. All of their dishes have amazing spice and flavor. If you are sensitive to spice, they can accommodate with some of their dishes. The ahi tuna couscous salad and turkey burger are always consistently a 5/5.

YxlJkUGUvP18W-fDYwvA1w.text: A favorite fun, friendly neighborhood bistro... great food, amazing flavors, and a staff that welcomes you every time you walk in the door. Crave the couscous and ask for Mr. Delicious while you're there!

TdhKjc-Jyq9iTprq4q3q3w.text: I had the best bacon and the best pulled pork ever all in one place. That deserves 5 stars. I tried everyone's food:  The chilaquiles(mild), BLT, jerk chicken & waffles (spicy), slow cooked pulled pork(mild), and washed it all down w/ jalapeno bacon bloody marys(spicy)  Keep in mind i love me some spice, so if i warn you that something is spicy, you better belive it.   We were all picking at our dishes long after we were stuffed saying, "i'm full, but this is so good i can't stop eating." No one finished all their food.  The only thing i could say was negative for me was the music. there was a dj spinning at noon. A tad early for club music. Heard the "what is love?" Remix from Night At The Roxbury. Not my taste, but the food was so delicious they could play Polka music and i would still come back.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno bacon Bloody Mary. Best bacon i&#39;ve ever tasted. But watch out, this is spicy!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork made my mouth happy!

b5Z-oq3Bdob-lBsc4VB_7w.text: My friends and I recently went in for brunch, which is our favorite when it comes to combining our breakfast and lunch during long morning work shifts, we walked in and were immediately helped out by david  who sat us down in no time. Then approached by Adrian whom throughout our meals attended to us periodically. The mimosos were on point and Adrian never failed to keep our glasses filled. I would definitely keep on coming again and again. Food was satisfying and our server was the best, thank you.

mD5bTL67M7AKNmCUz8qXhw.text: OMG - best brunch off the Strip!  Amazing food and service. Bryce the Owner is all over it!  Eclectic menu , upbeat & clean , great ambiance , with great wait service. Have the Chilaqueles - it will blow you away! Pastry basket is AWESOME with homemade jam. Check it out  !

bnOOVEMy-aS44RcXrDAtyg.text: Quaint little spot in an unexpected location of the SW Las Vegas. It was my first time there... At first a little intimidating, but nothing you cannot forget with good food.   The place is usually packed, and people wait for their brunch and bottomless mimosas. I think they're ready to expand... If not, they should.   Good ambiance, tastefully decorated, a bit cramped, and somehow loud. I assume the crown was happy. And they were! I ordered the breakfast sandwich and it took some time, but it was worth the wait! Very delicious, same with the enchiladas and a beautifully presented pomegranate iced tea.   I will go back!

AxAXGgS_bJH-hTBywyQHNA.text: This place is outstanding. Food cooked to perfection. I mean spot on. Such a gem in the Vegas suburbs. Lovely servers and service as well. A real treat for the Vegas foodies scene.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cream pasta, sweet potatoe fries, plantains, fried chicken.

IWmbV7oU8-ytZ3U05Cs9iQ.text: Best brunch in town! The chicken chilaquiles are my favorite. The pastry basket is a delicious if you have a group, great to share.

Z8mAcrBUFUV9WlaP5FA_gw.text: Wowwed by the new location and changes to the menu. Excellent service for a large party on a saturday night. Still thinking about the plantain appetizer we shared among the table, already wanting to go back for another great meal.

FBHNe_KiuJdQD3NXRa29NA.text: Finally got a chance to pop over and try DW after countless recommendations. We tried the wings, shrimp and chorizo, jerk calamari and the New Mexico bowl.  One dish was better than the next but my personal favorite was the NM Bowl, truly had that NM flavor of red sauce.  We also had the cake trio and the carrot was so delicious. Looking forward to trying brunch sometime soon!!

Eb4EQkyVqWvWDI9suOsZuw.text: Great atmosphere when we dined inside.  The staff was so pleasant and we met the owner.  The Jerk Chicken Salad was amazing. Great place if you want spicy food and there were the only place nearby open until 11pm.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken salad

Zut8AhvdjoqUH5EU2-Lu9A.text: One of my oldest bookmarks...finally checked!  It was a very busy Saturday afternoon...and there was a considerable wait.  Parking was a little difficult as well...busy shopping area.  I was quite a bit bummed out that they don't serve the LUNCH menu on the weekends...only the BRUNCH menu at any time of the day.  Really wanted to give the burger a spin :(  So instead, I went with the New Mexican-style Slow-Cooked Pork ($12): Simmered in New Mexican Red Chile, Over-Easy Eggs and Rice. They warn it's spicy, but I didn't find it very spicy at all. It was super tender though, and had lots of flavor! I enjoyed it :)  Also tried the DW Nicoise ($16): Pan-seared Tuna, Olives, Haricot Verts, Fingerling Potatoes, Heirloom Tomatoes, Sliced Egg, Fresh Mango & Dijon Champagne Vinaigrette. Good overall, but it wasn't outstanding.  I don't think I would recommend it.  Prices were ok and portions were good.  I guess I just wasn't overly impressed enough for the bump in review.  Might have been too hyped up for me personally.  Pics:

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Nicoise ($16): Pan-seared Tuna, Olives, Haricot Verts, Fingerling Potatoes, Sliced Egg, Dijon Champagne Vinaigrette. Not bad!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican-style Slow-Cooked Pork ($12): Simmered in New Mexican Red Chile, Over-Easy Eggs and Rice. Not very spicy but yummy!

PIpRf-qt7iYOrlKLcS0y8A.text: Great service, amazing food, drinks and atmosphere what more can you ask for?? This is our favourite spot on Sundays!!  We enjoy the bottomless mimosas. Alex the bar tender very informative Luis the waiter is amazing. We highly recommend DW'S if your looking for a fun place with great tasting food!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jbDP7lEXSEbtOxs-CVWnuQ.text: My guess would be this place is a hit for breakfast or lunch, at least that is what the majority of the reviews are raving about. We stopped in for dinner. The restaurant has a very cool and modern vibe to it. Our server came over immediately and brought out water for us. The water was lukewarm and had no ice, which I found a tad strange. The dinner prices on the menu were on the high side and hence why the lower rating. Their "from the grill" section averaged at about $25 per plate... I just ate a fine dining restaurant on the strip and my entree that absolutely blew me away was $32... so the price at this restaurant threw me off a bit. Simple salad averaged at about $15 here.. You get the point. It was pricey for an off strip restaurant in the middle of a strip mall.  I opted for the Jamaican curry chicken bowl with couscous ($14). The portion was huge, the veggies fresh, and the curry was adequate; there really wasn't much kick to it. I added quite a bit of cayenne pepper to my left overs which made it more delicious and less bland. Now, they could have EASILY made the portion half of what it was and had lower price points (this is especially applicable to the higher priced items on the menu). This would affect the marginal willingness to pay of the consumer. But, I digress.  Boyfriend had Jerk Chicken Scampi over Linguine ($16), and that was very delicious..but once again the portion was quite large.  Our server was great, friendly, and accommodating throughout. They brought us a complimentary slice of their carrot cake, and it was amazing. The gesture was also well appreciated.  I would probably try them for lunch or breakfast again, but this would not be my choice for dinner.  My suggestion would be to reconsider the portion sizes, and price accordingly. But, something tells me that most of their revenue is generated during brunch/lunch, and dinner is an afterthought, therefore this business model works for them.

_ZeeMktZURTJbW4mzeJX_w.text: This could be my wife and mine new favorite restaurant.  We've had lunch and now dinner and both were out of this world.  Fabulous food and then add fabulous service and you need to stop by and see for yourself!!!!

5yWSL5Gq9IqvkXnBnTHqsQ.text: I don't really give 5 stars but this place is on point. Seated immediately, welcomed with a level of professionalism I rarely see.  Server introduced himself immediately, told us the specials and was on point for every occasion. Water filled, suggestions on point, food was delicious. Every aspect of the experience was above my expectations.   Appetizer was great, charizo with shrimp. Main entree, bow tie pasta with filet mignon. Dessert carrot cake. Everything was made in house and you can tell it was made by a professional chef. Food had balance and presentation was high end. DW Bistro has a new regular.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special: bow tie pasta with filet mignon.

dTTy1ch6ztAk0EtV0I-dVg.text: Had brunch this past Sunday at DW with some fellow Yelpers and it was a fabulous bistro; we've all been to "bistros" that make you feel like you're walking into a Panera but with waitstaff- this place was a legit bistro.   We started over at the bar- of course. $20 bottomless mimosas, and several other cocktails that made it hard to choose; we had the Raspberry Fizz and the Mojito with muddled strawberries- both were delicious but they tasted very similar.   Boyfriend had the special "steak and eggs"- 2 medallions of filet, eggs, potatoes, and sourdough toast. It was delicious but the toast was lacking that strong distinguishing sourdough taste that I crave. I had the Jerk Pork Hash which was a HUGE mound of delicious shredded pork on a small bed of potatoes.. It's still in my fridge, waiting for me to toast it up in a quesadilla- the bill for the 2 of us came out to around $80 but I felt that it was a good value since $24 went to the bar.  We had a really good time there; the service was adequate, the menu had lots of different choices, the bar staff was friendly and efficient, but most importantly the company was top notch. Bring a group of friends and family and you're sure to have a positive experience. They managed our large group of 15-20 well, only a few hiccups- GET THERE EARLY if you have a large party or else you'll be waiting forever.  The only reason this place doesn't get a 5-star review is because I can't see myself driving across town from NLV to dine here unless I was meeting with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito and Raspberry Fizz

_L0r636_sxGtHDSw9SqLvg.text: OK... First off... this was my first time here. I've heard good things about this place so I was a bit excited to try it. I went this past weekend with a bunch of friends to celebrate my best friends birthday for brunch. I'm sure the staff will remember, we are quite the loud bunch. Anyways, firstly, the server seems to have an attitude. He wasn't very friendly, you could see the look on his face when he first came to our table he wasn't thrilled. Second, We all ordered bottomless Mimosas... which GOOD LAWD! $22 a person! Who do you think your ripping off here, my geeze! They didn't even bother to inform anyone of the price or bother to ask if we were aware, as I did not see it listed on the menu, but gladly brought one for everyone. Which my husband, normally wouldn't of even ordered that but he wasn't even asked. The second I got the bill I almost fainted. We went for brunch and walked out spending $100! The food is overly spicy for someone like me who doesn't eat much spice and really, I wasn't blow away by it but the price of the food wasn't that bad, so it is what it is. If you like spending loads of money to eat and having half par service... then this place is for you! If not, there are many other places, with better food at much better cost. Thankfully this was my first and last time at this place.

JJ6R759NjqasqOrU-FKffA.text: We went back for my second time about a month ago. It was, once again, awesome! My girlfriend and I saw a couple people with the Bloody Mary's, so of course, we had to try them. They were GREAT, very yummy! I typically have to request mine to be spicier than typically made, but theirs was perfectly spiced for me (probably spicier than preferred for many). It had a "salad" as a garnish (haha!) because it had a pickle, a an olive, a tomato, and a slice of bacon in it.  I chose the same thing I had the last time (eggs Benedict with jalapeno bacon). Once again, EXCELLENT! Service is always friendly and fast.   DW is one of our favorites for our irregularly scheduled brunch outings. We still continue to try new places (for us, anyway) around town.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome Bloody Mary&#39;s

syL9P1idyVw4vmnqwpt6bA.text: HIghly rated on Yelp, I've been wanting to eat here for a long time.  The first attempt was a fail.  It was a Sunday around 11:30am and the wait was 1.5 hours long.  My friend and I ended up going to the Yard House instead.  Having learned my lesson, I returned on a recent Sunday, but this time my gal pal and I got there around 9:45am, 15 minutes before they opened.  At first there was no one around, but at 9:50am, cars started arriving and people began to gather at the front doors in groups.  By the time 10:00am rolled around, there had to be at least 15 people waiting.  There really was no line formation, which was frustrating because once the doors opened, people just rushed in, not caring that others had been there first.  My friend and I got seated fairly quickly, but I would have been upset if we had to wait longer since we were technically the second ones to arrive.  Once seated, though, everything was smooth sailing for our brunch.       We shared the DW Pastry Basket:  2 big chocolate croissants and 3 blueberry white chocolate scones--we both enjoyed the croissants more than the scones.  I went vegetarian, ordering the Mini Corn Tortilla, an egg over easy with black beans, pico de gallo and queso fresco cheese atop two corn tortillas.  This was a hearty dish, nice and filling.  My friend had one of the specials that involved filet mignon and eggs, I think--whatever it was, she loved it.  Our waiter was very friendly and checked on us often and at the end of our meals, when we were already full, said waiter told us he was bringing us a surprise since it was our first visit.  The next thing we know, there's a lovely piece of carrot cake on the table--wow, that's so nice!       This place is popular for a reason; great service and food.  I definitely recommend it, but be prepared for a wait unless you get there early.  There were people waiting for a table the whole time we were there and also when we left.  I want to go back now that I can have meat again and sample some of the other tasty-looking items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Pastry Basket
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake.

edTDB3ewB7YD0UP_Pc5Nwg.text: 4.5 stars  This review is for the Restaurant Week 2011 Breakfast.  This was my first visit to DW Bistro.  I've been going to try it but never thought about going there when I was thinking of a different place.  Restaurant Week 2011 gave me a great reason to go.  The breakfast menu (good only Saturday and Sunday) had 3 courses.  The first two courses had three choices each and the third course - dessert - no choice but you didn't need any choice.  More on that later.  For my first course, I chose the DW oatmeal with toasted coconut and cream.  There were fresh berries including blueberries, red and yellow raspberries, blackberries, and some currants.  The toasted coconut added a texture and flavor that made this a great dish.  4/5 rating.  For the second course, I asked the advice of my server and I went with the crab cake Eggs Benedict with spicy Hollandaise and breakfast potatoes.  The crab in the cake was excellent.  The spicy Hollandaise was great, and the house potatoes had a zing that made them very tasty when compared with the normal fried breakfast potatoes.  5/5 rating.  Dessert course -- talk about decadent!  As I said, there was no choice for the dessert course because it was a sampler of four of DW's desserts.  They were: Red Velvet cake, whipped peanut butter pie, lemon-lime pudding with one blueberry (neat presentation for this), and Jamaican black bottom banana cream pie.  5/5 rating.  Service:  My server was Maggie and I never had to sing "Wake Up Maggie May."  She was on top of everything including getting me a clean saucer and a clean up from some spilled coffee--without me asking.  She also recommended the crab Benedict because it's not available all the time but my other choice is on the regular menu.  That's what a good server does and Maggie was superb!  A few little minuses - the oatmeal could have been served a bit hotter; what ever happened to spoons in restaurants in Las Vegas?  Do we have a severe spoon shortage of which I'm unaware.  I didn't get one with my coffee, but I didn't need one as I drink it black.  She only knew I didn't need cream.  What about sweetener?; and, the noise level was a bit high for so few people there.  There is little wall covering to absorb the sounds.  It wasn't bothersome, but it was noticeable.  Now that I've been here, I know I'll be back for dinner and another breakfast to try the jerk pork hash.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quad dessert sampler.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake Egg Benedict with potatoes.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal with toasted coconut and fresh berries.

EwMBhcnQkpQywxgGMV2UFg.text: I have been here once for breakfast and twice for dinner now. Breakfast had bottomless mimosas which are GREAT but they were served room temperature. I got banana french toast which was very nice! I have also ordered the apple pork chops which where underwhelming. Our waiter highly recommended them and they were just alright. I have also found that the wait staff there is hit or miss - one waiter has consistently been rude to me while another guy is lovely to talk to! The rude one also spilled water on my phone and didnt even apologize! (My bad for having it on the table, but still! An apology goes a long way)

9ltkyQUJJAVwVq-h0BJQZw.text: Best food I've had in a long time! We are from Houston and we were looking for the best brunch in Vegas. Luckily we have a friend in Vegas who recommended this place. Better than any buffet we looked at! Chicken and waffles were so original. Loved the cloves in the syrup. I usually skip maple syrup but because of the cloves I enjoyed the syrup immensely!  Bottomless mimosas flowed freely. Loved this place!

11vJIVEI9pp58mTAkDrEUQ.text: Last weekend me and my girlfriends stopped in for brunch after arriving to Vegas around 10 am. Based on the reviews, I was sure we'd love our food so I suggested we all order something different. Best decision ever! I got the chilaquiles. My friends ordered jerk pork hash, mini corn tortillas and jerk chicken and waffles. Absolutely everything was delicious. This will be my go to spot whenever we visit Vegas.

M03KGsieOMJ073MgMuyhRQ.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas - on or off the strip!  The food is incredible, both brunch and lunch/dinner items. The Jalapeno bacon is a staple and in many dishes.  My favorite is the pork, egg and rice bowl at brunch. This dish is bursting with flavor. The combination of ingredients is simply brilliant! Great staff and wonderful owner! Highly recommended

nsRWOfugdAQlmQENhzR2BQ.text: My fiance and I went there for brunch in a Saturday morning.  It was fun, pretty environment and nice server,  the food was fancy and tasted good. Usually I don't really care as much for the price as long as it's good, fresh. However, I was still pretty hungry after eating a 18 dollars eggs benedict... so I think the portions were very small for the price we payed. 12 dollars for a small glass of Mimosa? Really? That's way too much lol. 20 bucks all you can drink is ok, but not everyone is an alcoholic and people would like to have 1 damn drink. Loses one start for these two issues I cited. Hopefully they will read my review. The chef is good!   4 stars...

kT5vnlamm5qd1OyXQMimcA.text: The new location is difficult to find. It's not clearly marked on the outside. I ordered 2 items. The Mac & Cheese was very good. The other item I ordered was the Jerk Chicken Wings. For $10 I only received 4 wings. Not worth it!

2UAhW38acqvulCPWYZ14_A.text: This place is a gem. I never thought I'd find Jamaican/Carribean inspired food here in Vegas. One word in particular stands out... Authentic. They know what they're doing. I had the Jamaican Curry chicken and it was a tongue tickling blend of chicken, vegetables, rice and curry. Loved the way the spicy sauce drenched the rice. And the ratio of ingredients were proportioned to perfection. Delicious!   Cristina had the New Mexican style Pork and she was blown away. That New Mexican style red chili was on the money. The pork was lean and tender. And the eggs over easy was a nice touch! Now I never been to the the Land of Enchantment, but a couple bites of her dish and I felt like I was there.   I loved all the hot sauces. I had that calypso sauce a long time ago over some Guyanese style Lo Mein. It just brought me back to my NJ/NY days where this cuisine is easier to find. Can't wait to go back and see what's up with the chicken and waffles. Only one suggestion, or a request actually... Jamaican beef patties as an appetizer?!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I told him not to try the hot sauce hahah. He&#39;ll learn to like it ;)

Sl4qbv_hA5Y7eOxoe83TDg.text: Was once pretty great but sadly has gone downhill. Menu had potential but they just don't seem to care anymore. Used to be pretty tasty but everything was subpar relying on their previous quality to get away with just putting out what used to be tasty and special and now is just barely what is described on the menu. In addition to the quality the service was also poor. Our waiter was unfriendly and seemed bothered to be working. It was almost uncomfortable to ask him any questions. Sadly this has been removed as a place to recommend to friends and removed from our go to places as well.

3EiWq51wsRSd5HjD5ozujQ.text: Let me teach you guys something about the first date. You have to test the waters first see if it is cold or hot. Then you dip your feet in. And finally you go swimming!  This place was very good. The spring rolls and calamari were nothing but delicious! I got the fried chicken! It wasn't too shabby! I was caught off guard by how dark the skin was tho! The skin was as dark as night! Like the dark knight ;) you know what I mean !  Very good tho!   Great place to go for a bday dinner, going away dinner, the breakup dinner, or just dinner !

k4BuCjL42eXtMJXPl-IAEA.text: Went back to DW for a dinner with good friends and was much happier with my menu decisions. Our waiter  as super helpful and led us in the right direction.   Started with a delicious margarita. Ordered the DW Signature Salad and the waiter offered to add jerk chicken for protein. It was delicious! I WILL be getting that salad again. I also ordered a side of the mac and cheese. It is a winner. Lots of garlic in it which won me over. We were too full for dessert.   Loved our table, our waiter, and our overall experience. I would be happy to go back.

bbMIubUKmD-h8EvJg3f-fg.text: Holy smokes! If you're free on a Sunday visit them for brunch. A gem in the SW area and should definitely be experienced by everyone. You get more of a Caribbean sort of flavor profile; everything tastes great.  Nice modern and bright decor with a great and energetic environment.  Ordered the calamari.. Nice and crispy with that jerk seasoning. Great flavor,  Got the curry bowl and had them add a grilled salmon on top. Perfectly cooked salmon; all the veggies meshed together very well.  I'm a big fan of any restaurant that seems super high end but all walks of life are extremely welcome. A big plus is the chef will make custom dishes come to reality.. Michelin quality food without the "be on your best behavior" vibe.  Yo dDub ... Thank you for the constant great experience!!! Keep it up.

4g2BLspYagSnK-Qomq2JBw.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, DW Bistro is fantastic. That's all I've heard so naturally I had to experience such spectacular eats for myself.  From the street it looks to be your standard Vegas strip mall dining spot. I was certainly not expecting the floor to ceiling decorators dream come True upon entering.  Fashioned to the nine, DW pulled out all the stops when it comes to ambiance, decor, and set up. It's fun, modern, but not cold, as most modern decors can tend to feel.  We were dining during lunch hour, midweek so lets just say wait time to get a seat was nonexistent. My guests and I were able to choose our own seats (always a plus in my book).   The menu is a unique twist on sandwich type foods, rice/curry bowls, and other lunchable items.  I went for the turkey pannini and  though it was a little dry it was still quite flavorful. All I have to say is the sweet potato fries are delightful!  My next favorite part about this place is the fact that they serve FRESH lemonade with free refills!  My only bummer moment here at DW was the fact that it took almost an hour for our SANDWICHES to come out to our table despite the restaurant being virtually empty and our orders fairly simple. (Hence the lack of star on this rating).  So should my travels find me on the West Side of town and in the mood for swanky surroundings and delectable eats (and lets not forget bottomless lemonade), I would most certainly keep DW Bistro at the top of the list.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey panini
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f0689TY5V6765y4EGWi_Qg.text: Oh man! I am so glad I did my research for a Saturday brunch and chose this place. The service is amazing, our waiter Vidal had nothing but good vibes and made our experience so warm, welcoming, and awesome. Starting off with the NM Sopapillas (donuts with apple compote and whipped cream) which were the perfect little indulgence to start off our brunch. For entrees I tried the Chilaquiles and my husband had the Eggs Benedict with salmon. I didn't know what to expect moving into the Chilaquiles but it was sooooo delicious, it reminded me of my friends amazing chicken enchiladas breakfast style. Don't let the opportunity to try these escape you. The salmon eggs Benedict didn't disappoint either, he loved it. Other good to knows, their Bloody Mary was definitely spicy, he warned me but it definitely was spicier then expected but I still loved the flavor involved, and the garnishes were awesome! Definitely planning on coming back next time I'm on Vegas.

H3-xNx1axYnju8e-xES6MQ.text: Yet another place you can throw into the argument for best local restaurant!    My wife and I have had a hankering for awesome Jamaican food ever since we vacationed in Negril a couple of years ago.  While this place isn't traditionally that, they blend a lot of what makes that cuisine great with their own creative twists to it.    We couldn't start the meal with anything but the Jamaican Curry Soup.  Anthony M recommended we have it the night before along with pretty much every Yelp review and it was tremendous.  I would strongly consider just getting a large bowl of this with a side of rice for my next visit.  In fact, my wife enjoyed it so much, she ordered another bowl of it WHILE eating her entree.  Who backtracks back to the appetizer?  I got the oven roasted jerk pork shoulder bowl which was rich and filling.  The jerk spice was jerktastic and the portion was pretty generous.    We went for the "perfect chocolate cake" to finish the meal.  Pretty bold to call it that and while I've had better, it was a nice ending to an awesome meal.

Mlw4kZs46gX-jmul7xOf8A.text: This place is awesome.   Service was on point and it WAS delicious. We came here for our teammates birthday. This place is not meant for big parties. We were a party of 12 and they divided us in table of fours near by.  Why this place is 5 stars, the crossant muffins to start off with. The dipping sauce was like a cheese cream. THAT was phenomenal.   What changed my taste in jalepeno was the jalepeno spicy bacon burger. Now that sounds like something jack in the box would come up with but this place did. It isn't spicy enough to not bite into, but it's just enough for me to handle. I LOVE IT. Best bacon burger ever.

J5SJlF2eACpJC7qOdwfftg.text: great food great service.  Jamaican mojito was good.  braised ox tail was declicious.  pan seared salmon was delicious.  great service by Luis (i think that was his name)

Rbp-e9Tbf94IJbcrUT4EWQ.text: I came to DW for their Sunday brunch. The place was packed! I was informed by host that it would probably take about 30 mins to get seated and I would receive a text message from restaurant when table is ready. I got myself a bloody mary with bacon and jalapeno from bar in waiting area. It was kinda spicy but I meant it in the good way. The salty crunch from the bacon paired well w/ the heat in bloody mary. DW has really nice patio seating area. However, we got indoor seating after the wait because we didn't have reservations. I followed yelpers' reviews and ordered pesto torte and DW pastry basket for appetizers, eggs benedict with salmon and New-Mexican style slow cooked pork for entrees. Pastry basket was amazing! Homemade pastries were warm and fresh when they were served on the table. yelp.com/biz_photos/qqs7... I really enjoyed my salmon benedict too. New-Mexican slow cooked pork came with a sizable portion. It contained lots aroma of spices but it lacked dimensions (just rice pork and egg). yelp.com/biz_photos/qqs7... Next time when I come back, I would definitely ask for patio seating and save some space for deserts. (I've heard lots of good things about their deserts. FYI, they are quite generous with the portion!)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW pastry basket was amazing
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad with shrimps

xB5bD9QTJt1woyA9NJU8uQ.text: Oh my goodness! This place is top notch! I have been here for brunch, lunch and dinner before so I asked if they did private parties and they do! I decided to have my baby shower here (brunch style) because I knew they wouldn't let me down. The service was phenomenal, drinks, coffee and breakfast were outstanding. They were very accommodating for everything I requested. I knew I was going to be impressed! Every single guest told me they loved the food which was important to me. Thank you to the owners and wonderful staff for everything! I would recommend this place highly for the delicious food and fabulous service - oh and the decor is beautiful! I would give ten stars if I could.  This place can give all the strip and other popular brunch spots (Mon Ami Gabi and Echo & Rig etc.) a serious run for their money. Actually I think DW is better.  Oh yes, they are at a new location in the Gramercy - bigger then the last location.

Y7pCXnnmjYx6SWUymy970A.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas! I cannot say enough good things about this place! I have been here many times, and while it can be busy, it is worth the wait. The food is so unique and delicious. Not to mention the service is always top notch. You have to try it!!

G8iI1Ld9n31M35iciDtbqw.text: Went last night for the first time ever & had a GREAT dinner. Service was fantastic & the waiter was very informative about the history of the restaurant/owner & dishes etc. The food was super delish & totally different from anything I'd ever had before. The menu is pretty simple & not overwhelming, so I liked that. The cocktails were tasty! We were also given a free dessert which was our choice. We had the red velvet cake which was perfect! (Hats off to ur pastry chef) It has the BEST mango sauce drizzled over it!! I will definitely be going back to try the brunch menu! Oh & u have to try the fried chicken skins with the honey dipping sauce. I don't normally eat stuff like that, but it was amazing!!! OMG!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken Skins
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Bistro Margarita
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet cake with white chocolate shavings &amp; mango sauce drizzled over

rR1nV8LzhHZOIOjNz5CNHQ.text: "Emancipate yourself from mental slavery,  none but ourselves can free our minds"  - Robert Nesta Marley  DW Bistro has been a staple on the Southwest side of town for years now. I recently stopped by their new location in the Gramercy and decided to write a long overdue review.  DW is probably most famous for their Sunday Brunch, but they are an all-around great option regardless of time of day. They are one of the only Jamaican Fusion restaurants I know of in Vegas, and they do a really amazing job of bringing through Jamaican flavors in many of their dishes.
