They're not about traditional Jamaican eats...even their Jerk Chicken is not a traditional style Jerk Chicken, but what they are about is good portions of slightly elevated, super tasty food.  My most recent visit was for Sunday Brunch. My love and I shared the Salmon Benedict and a Special Jerk Chicken on Corn Bread Benedict. Both items were really good. I also tried a little of their Chicken N Waffles...this was a solid item, but not my favorite version. I'm a fan of the Jamaican Chicken Curry Bowl, Couscous Salad, Daily Street Tacos, and Fish Escovitch. The owners are great and I feel good about supporting a local spot when I eat here. My love raves about the service of Alfonso, and I finally had the opportunity to experience the warmth of his huge smile and his incredible service on my last visit.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry bowl
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas

85PElIpW3SMJqHuxkj3dtA.text: I went to the old location for dinner but this spot is pretty!  Unfortunately, they do not take reservations for the patio on Sunday's so make sure to plan ahead for waiting time. Don't worry, the wait isn't too bad since you get to drink your bottomless mimosas on the cute corridor and refill as many times as your heart desires.  The patio is small, so the wait could be anywhere from 30 min to an hour depending on the time of day.  If you don't mind and sit inside there were a few tables open around 11 so I got seated right away.    Make sure to order the pastries appetizer while waiting for your food to come out.  They come out quick and taste delicious.  They pair excellent with mimosas and you're more than likely to inhale the scones (or I did).  Service was fine and our waiter never skipped a beat in filling up our drinks (I like his style).  Ambiance is great and mirrors the energy in this place.  I ordered the steak and eggs- which I did not see on the menu but waiter recommended.  The portion size was large and I had extras to take home.  If you haven't checked it out you are missing out and need to get in on the trend!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy pastries!

gO2KSrT_gUC2mrxUVggeEA.text: I absolutely love this new location! The space seems larger (if you have ever been to their old location for Sunday brunch you would know they needed it!) although the patio is drastically smaller now, inside is so open and modern and not as tight that you don't even mind sitting inside. Win/win!   Hits         : flautas.....always delicious!          : chicken curry......normally all of their items are a little too spicy for me, and I would probably never order this expecting it to be too much but it was perfect. I would totally recommend and order again          :housemade carrot cake......so good and one piece is large enough to split         :chicken and waffles.....it's a must try. It the perfect combination   Misses              : "turkey slider".....in my head a turkey slider is sliced turkey.....this should be called "mini turkey burgers" instead, but the sweet potato frys that came with it were perfect!               : I know I can't be the only person that dines with a toddler, as far as I know there isn't a kids menu (if there is I wasn't offered one)   I really love this restaurant and the service is always great even when they are slammed. If it's your first time here go for brunch!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake!!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Caesar

lMSjqq55Y9VSc8Ch7LrpZA.text: Messed up our order for lunch, tasteless Caesar salad, and bread so hard you'll break a tooth.   I'm sure our next visit will be different, at least we hope. This time it was not so great. Had high hopes too.

Rhj25ZUw0T9vSynprQQ_7w.text: I never write a review but this place is awful,  I order DW turkey burger to go,  left the place without check my order,  when I come home open the box it was BLT sandwich , I called back and the guy anwser the phone handle it so unprofessional. So disappointed.

xoXAlqr1FU_CR5B84qJccw.text: Omg! How did it take me years to find this place?! Literally the best korean fried chicken I've ever had. Awesome place to visit. Open late night

kVCqbJVmwsRA1PwjBXPROA.text: Pretty decent food. Alcohol leaves something to be desired. Don't get the Bloody Mary. Bottomless mimosas aren't bad - can't taste the alcohol, but obviously had an effect - so they're good?? Chilaquiles were absolutely delicious. We've had our fair share from El Paso and New Mexico and this ranks pretty highly. The pork bowl - eh- cooked by white people, great for white people, recommended by our white friends, we'll leave it at that. Rice was a bit undercooked and the sauce was a bit dry, but that either may be personal preference or clouded by an asian palate. Otherwise the other stuff had good flavor. If you go with the burger, the sweet potato fries are good. Breakfast potatoes are excellent. Good place to go with friends for conversation with a more upbeat atmosphere.

9O7Iw-k0UMWxu-m_wCvxtQ.text: Fantastic lunch spot....killer cocktails, hearty and flavorful food, super attentive service, can't wait to come back for dinner.  Great sized portions of fresh food!

Jxrhg4qZcsGGxJLUUFTeYw.text: We came here because we live close to the Gramercy and we wanted to try a fun breakfast place on the weekend. From yelp we could see that they had a selection of unique-sounding eggs Benedict dishes. Parking at the Gramercy is pretty easy since it isn't insanely popular still. The bar is the first thing you see upon entering the restaurant and it's kind of stunning in its decor. I could definitely see it being a great place to stop just for a bite and drinks or just a few cocktails with friends or a date. The dining area is pretty spacious and simple, clean, nice. I ordered the bacon jalapeno Benedict, which had great flavors but came out cold. My BF got the salmon and spinach Benedict, which I think might be a certain taste (fish for breakfast? Haha). He said the salmon Benedict was good but he also said he'd give it three stars (haha). The potatoes that come with the meals are nothing to write home about; it would be cool if along with their unique breakfast selections they did some sort of potato that was also unique instead of just home fries, of which they do not give you many (but they're not great so didn't matter). The server we had was very friendly and polite. I would say the prices are a little high for what you're getting for breakfast. Two Benedict meals, a coffee and a mimosa was $50. I would go back and try other meals of the day here.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño bacon eggs Benedict - mimosa trying to get in on the pic
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and spinach eggs Benedict

5zA1FDvjmQ3hw4v3EASCDw.text: We love the food, but we mainly come here because of the outstanding service! Luis is hands down the best and I always feel like he is the manager or owner (even though he is a server) he cares so much about clients! Luis if you ever want to manage one of our companies we want to steal you!!!

OG_QTp5PVpYgjeXebw9GYA.text: Bloody Mary's AMAZING Service is great  Food is delicious  And must eat carrot cake  If you get there between 12:30  and 1 it might be full but before or after is great

Q9Vb1RU5qZIC2fMGbFChgg.text: I love this place and the new location changes nothing besides you can fit a lot more people to have more fun!  That's right FUN! DW bistro has an amazing menu but when it comes to their brunches that's what their famous for and let me tell you FUN will be had when accompanied by a group of friends great atmosphere and delicious food/drinks!   On Saturdays and Sundays the Mimosa which are always yummy and pretty topped with fruits or Bloody Mary with Bacon are always pouring. The bottomless is the way to go and bottomless they make sure of it. Besides that my all time favorite item is their Jerkin Chicken and waffles. The waffles are crispy and the spices of the crispy juicy jerk fried chicken smothered in the spicy syrup is unbelievable. If you've never tried its a must. Their benies are delish as well as their New Mexican green chili burger with a Jamaican flair and Chiliquiles are a few of my go to items. They all will not disappoint.   DW have relocated to this bigger venue is in the Gramercy high rise on Russell of of Fort Apache with lots of space to bring your friend for good food and good fun. If you don't know now you know!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite chicken and waffles of all times with jerk chicken and syrup

vvw4gihZZL9UWCKgkJKLIw.text: Uhm... Do not get the 5 star reviews. I tried DW bistro when they hadn't moved yet - it was good (surely not exceptional, but I did not feel robbed at the time). After 2 years I came back, expecting good food and good ambiance.  NOPE!  I guess this is now for people who cannot make eggs for breakfast or bottomless mimosa, for sure. My omelette was dry and burned around the edges - truly underwhelming and overpriced ($14.00 ???!!!) - asked to sub bread with tomatoes and all I got was TWO slices of green tomato. Yum.   The curry was okay but still - overpriced. $20 total with chicken added. I will say it was a big portion that can easily be shared but honestly did not taste "Jamaican".   I guess people like to spend money on easy breakfast foods. We came here under the impression that we could order LUNCH (not just eggs or brunch) at 2 pm. There were misleading menu pictures of menus with Way more items than we were offered.   Service was slow but ok.   Our total was $50 for an omelette, a curry dish, coffee, tea, and orange juice. And all of it was truly underwhelming. Not ok.  Not coming back.

QiqIBCTGdJHKlmZKPMEJSQ.text: Came here for brunch with a few friends. It wasn't a weekend so a mimosa costs $12-- not really impressed.   I wanted to try the jerk chicken or jerk calamari, but it was too early (2pm) for them to serve dinner..  I had a bowl if chicken curry over couscous instead. I like the presentation. The food was good, but not exemplary. Wouldn't mind going back to try their dinner menu

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry over couscous
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12 each on weekdays

mmk1Sm6Z_tEtvqGp9N5tpg.text: I loved the food!!! They definitely made me a fan. The food presentation was on point. Service was excellent. I ordered the veggie curry with couscous. It was to die for!!! It stayed hot and the veggies were the perfect texture. I came back another time for brunch and got the jerk chicken Benedict. It melted in my mouth. What a hidden jewel. Brunch was in with a Greatest Showmen theme. The DJ played great music which made for amazing ambiance. Can't wait to try more of what they have on the menu.

pnUqV-Tu66jMAbiscU2pCg.text: Great spot! Much larger venue then the previous DW on Fort Apache. Large bar area.  Food is really good. You better like spicy because most of their dishes are!  A must try is the chicken flautas app! So damn delicious!   Great atmosphere for any time of the day you want to eat or enjoy happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Social Hour at DW! Tuesday thru Friday from 3pm-6pm. Drink specials, shared plates, &amp; small bites!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Turkey Sliders off the shared plate. If you don&#39;t like sweet in your burger don&#39;t get this.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Flautas shared plate! Freakin bomb!

DvDUSkPojiGQrYRL7xjfTQ.text: Chilaquiles were ok but not the best; a little dry in the middle. My sister order a salad and the chicken was hard and the lettuce was old so it was sent back, usually managers come out to see what the problem was but that wasn't the case here. Personally I would give this place another try since it is a clean place and a nice area to have lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_jt9W-Lnh6bKpQHzgNIBqw.text: I've lived in Vegas for 8 years and my first visit to DW bistro was as a tourist. What a delightful and fun experience due to dining with my LV peeps, the ambiance of the restaurant, and did I mention their brunch is killer good?  The decor is bright and vibrant. The owners were working the floor like they were hosting a party in their home. Let me mention again, their food was killer good.  I slapped my forehead as I took the first bite of their blueberry scone from their  $10 pastry basket. I was so irritated that I NEVER paid them a visit as a LV resident. Their scone was not the rock hard, use it as a weapon kind of scone. It was just, divine, that's all I can say. And their croissant was perfection. Flakey and buttery, the French would be proud.  I ordered their breakfast sandwich with jalapeno bacon, softly scrambled eggs and side of potatoes. Again, I don't know who they have hiding in the kitchen but my goodness, best breakfast sandwich ever. For those of you who plan on a visit to Sin city, book mark this place for a delicious brunch. Vibe is fun and mellow, with soft, club beats in the background. Service is stellar and the owners know how to work that dining room.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW breakfast sandwich. Best ever

IZ996xtS-UBySRc4u3K5_w.text: This new location is bigger, cooler, and packed full of trendy foodies! The owners have created such a fun style with their daring combination of orange decor and unique food pairings.   It's a marriage of Top Chef flavor pallet meets Nate Berkus by design. You want to hang out and have another drink long after your bill has already come.   This is definitely an up-and-coming area, I'm excited to see it growing and doing well!

v1zsPPpRk3srW2z5Vn3spA.text: I ordered Jerk Seared Ahi Tuna Salad ($16) & the Pomegranate Iced Tea.  Pros:  * The salad was really good! Dressing was yummy, all the flavors blended so well together * Pomegranate iced tea was really good as well. Perfectly sweetened & free refills. Make sure to ask for a refill to-go as well  Cons:  * Food is quite pricey * It gets pretty loud/noisy inside. I felt like I was yelling when chatting with my party

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Seared Ahi Tuna Salad ($16) &amp; Pomegranate Iced Tea.

pPP9saGyBYbsWw9g97zugg.text: What brought my wife and I across town was some gift cards from House Seats. I must say the restaurant was very clean, very nice, and the staff was amazing! Our waiter Louis was awesome! The service he gave us felt like it was really genuine. After eating the jerk chicken, which I would recommend, it made me want to find jerk seasonings to make for myself at home. We told Louis that it was our first time there and he gave us a complimentary small slice of the carrot cheesecake. It was to die for!!!! We will definitely be going back and taking others with us for sure!!! A great dining experience, couldn't have asked for anything better! Thank you!

WvqNjUzZ1HqWXru0QBMXhA.text: I've lived in Vegas for 3 years now. I moved from Los Angeles, where BRUNCH is on everybodies Sunday Funday list. I haven't found that until now. DW Bistro is the PLACE TO BE. In a city full of Tackiness and B*llsh*t! I have found a place where I'm proud to take my friends and family to!!! The service is nothing but exceptional. Everyone is happy to here. The employees are friendly and Beautiful. The Jerk Chicken will blow your mind and the mimosas are champagne with a Drop of OJ (as it should be.) We did not want to leave and our waiter kindly asked us to step outside and continue to enjoy our bottomless mimosas. We were more than happy to remove ourselves from the table and continue to enjoy the atmosphere, so someone else could have the pleasure of our experience. There's ons nothing comparable to this place and I will tell everyone about our experience. THANK YOU For keeping Customer Service alive and continue to keep your employes happy. It shows. You are doing everything right. DW and Ernesto are sweet as pie.   Let's play more R&B and Hiphop after all Sunday is the Lords Day. :)

54SfJXv507A1hDsRAZhzkw.text: Enjoyed a truly fantastic lunch that included a Jerk-seasoned chicken sandwich accompanied by some amazing sweet potato fries. Also had their seared Ahi lunch salad that had a Jalapeno - Marmalade garnish that was a superb compliment to the salad, mango & tuna. Be sure to have the pomegranate ice tea!  Service was prompt, courteous, and very attentive. Bright, fresh deco, modest pricing, and outstanding food make this a must visit away from the strip. Oh, and the carrot cake is different than any I have ever had...truly amazing.

P8ghSInj8bW1r7Uqdxo_Wg.text: I like this place, it's so convenient because its so close to my house, the problem is that lately it gets so crowded you have to wait hours to get seated,and they don't take reservations, I like the pastry basket and the cheese , I ate the chilaquiles and they were really good not that spicy, my husband ordered chicken and waffles and they were not bad but not good either.  I like that they have a small patio and decor is my  favorite, definitely coming back , if I can get a table of course!

D0rOaMLd0YYmakMrw4Hteg.text: The food is DELICIOUS. The chef is a RENOIR! This restaurant is NOT to be missed for foodies! True culinary genius!

VaLX1kVc5d0ONQhfw8qRJg.text: Hands Down my favorite place in Las Vegas.    Everything was great as usual.  I stayed here kind of late last Saturday with a friend enjoying some perfectly mixed gin cocktails. Instead of kicking us out or staring at us awkwardly like some restaurants might do, they made us feel right at home.    How does this place combine style and class with a family-like feel?  I don't know, but I'm thankful we have something like this in the valley.    If you haven't been yet, what are you waiting for?

q5lfAc8R9leytAWDsL6_Aw.text: Awesome food. Fantastic Service Good Price I ordered Chicken Curry Bowl. I am hungry when i entered but still I could not eat the entire thing.  Quality of the Food is good. I will sure suggest this restaurant to my friends.

7nCuUQLQUy9LgKkQpdjIxA.text: Definitely a hip place, especially when compared to the tedious sterility of the Summerlin area of LV.   Ambiance is nice, food & drinks were both good. Bottomless coffee & mimosas is a nice touch for a casual Sunday brunch. Prices may be a tiny-bit expensive, but portions are big, and the quality of the food seems appropriate for the price.   Service was quite good, and overall this is one of the best places for breakfast I've been to in LV.

bgs_oJHLhgjny6_IilGSzw.text: Absolutely LOVE the food, the service, and the drinks! I am so glad I have found this place and now live closer since I moved to this side of town! Absolutely try it out, you will not be disappointed in the meal.

AsBi5OtrMLjlEhjxGMU-pw.text: I've been here once and it was an amazing experience. Not only did I have good company, the food was amazing. It's not cheap.  They have vodka that sits/stirred/mixed/refrigerated with fruits that taste amazing! So, you're basically drinking pure vodka and it doesn't even taste like it in the least! They were about $12 for one.  So, dinner for two was about $70-80. It is definitely worth the visit, but I need to try out their brunch menu and give it a shot.

agmk8_POshrxRYEkpJRBLA.text: Amazing EVERYTHING!!  So, i've been here for brunch twice this month...i'm seriously in love with the bacon bloody mary, jalapeno bacon benedict, assorted breakfast pastries (GUAVA RICOTTA TURNOVERS), the host (he's adorable), the awesomely knowledgable waiters....  seriously, go.  now.  i promise you won't be disappointed.

-3qMGty8ODNkGOK2ntIz0A.text: Wow.. Amazing. Turkey burger was great. My husband had the fried chicken, I tasted his and it was even better. Do not pass up on the Mac and cheese. The bar tender was not skimping on the alcohol in the cocktails. Great Friday night dinner.

IO0_vWcUIHDn6I0PGZOQMQ.text: Finally had the opportunity to stop in and find out what the hype was all about and I must say this place is by far the best, not only do they have an authentic island style menu they also have a beautiful modern south beach atmosphere. Very friendly staff and an awesome chicken caesar salad with an amazing secret dressing! & if your lucky enough you just might meet the guys who put it all together definitely my go to place for a great meal.

eO0RN9KgHGvnaWKX6f2jrA.text: I had a great experience here!  Joined a friend for lunch one day.  I love the atmosphere, it's very contemporary with interesting light fixtures and clean lines - reminding me of a bistro I could run across in San Francisco, Seattle, or New  York.  Yes, that's what I'm looking for, Vegas!  The service we received was excellent.  Our waiter was entertaining without being overbearing, friendly, informative, and prompt.  My only complaint is a noticeable lack of options for vegetarians.  I will repeat (again and again) what so many others have.  The chicken curry soup is to die for!  Basically like sipping a cup of perfectly seasoned cream, but in a good way, I promise.  Oh... divine.  The turkey burger was a "real" turkey burger - freshly made from ground turkey and seasoned well.  The veggie medley was delicious - perfectly cooked, and lightly seasoned... I considered getting that, soup, and another side or two for a meal next time because I enjoyed it so much!  Everything we had was well cooked, well seasoned, and generous portions.  Absolutely a perfect date spot. I can't wait for an excuse to return...

r_yO4Yuws_91LiBqygQiMg.text: Yay DW!! Fun, cutting edge food, great drinks and friendly neighborhood service that locals love. My suggestions..try one of their fruit infusion cocktails paired with a DW bowl..YUM! Make sure to make reservations for brunch though!

Hp__Bp0akdTH2QfLKfoCJw.text: One of my favorite restaurants!!!  The Turkey Burger is the best turkey burger I have ever had!  Service is always great.

NghCOUzLLXenYBQAHNknZw.text: The spot for dinner dates, whether it be a first date, second date or a double date. It is that rare bird in Vegas that isn't on the Strip, has an impeccable atmosphere that would make your mama proud and some solid eats and drinks. The eats are mildly adventurous, but they won't scare your cousins from the midwest.   They expanded over the summer, which means there is more beautiful space to love.   We returned for dinner and had a drink at the bar. The bartender was friendly, as were all of the servers. We started with some top notch calamari, and I was able to snag a couple of bites of some truffle mac n cheese. I don't enjoy truffle as much as the next food lover, but this stuff was pretty delicious. I had the veggie curry bowl with a little extra spice requested, and it was better than the first time.   I think DW Bistro offers it all: ambiance, food, and service. It's not the place you go for your cheap, quick meal; it's a spot for a True afternoon, night or even morning (brunch on weekend!) of dining.

JGw4XRp-NBrnzufRpLUJGw.text: The food was delicious! The service was great and with it being my first time, the server was very helpful. We even scored a yummy dessert for it being our first time there. I definitely plan on going back!

tdWgX7nqXnqbY3JFT2ZTLw.text: So I have been here in a while so we decided to head back. So we got seated and we ordered around 4 or 5 entrees and told the waiter we will do family style dining. Ordered the pasta which was really good as usual, also ordered the branzini which was really good, tuna couscous salad also good, fried chicken was not crispy at all it was soggy the taste was good but again missing the crunch. So we are eating and the bus boy just comes and grabs my brothers plate and fork... WTF we are still eating hello!!! So my bro asks for the fork back... So we are about finished now and all of a sudden there is a heavy stench of sewer. It stunk so bad!!! They opened the front doors to get the smell out then it was freezing in the restaurant. The hostess was so cold that she had a scarf around her head and face. We asked the waiter what's up with the smell. He said the AC filters have to be change, but I knew that they were cleaning the grease trap!!!

7EkU0JAVj4vMwdoGswzXrw.text: DW Bistro is one of my favorite non-burger joints in town; I've never had a bad meal there and love everything about the place. There are so many great things to try each time between the regular items and the specials that the burger near the bottom of the menu has never crossed my mind. A friend recently tried it and has been raving ever since, so it was during a recent visit with some friends that I caved and decided to give it a try. Did mixing my burger business with some of my favorite local eats work out ok?  For a local strip mall restaurant, DW is surprisingly cool inside; it's very clean with white walls, floors and furniture, highlighted with orange ceilings and some brightly colored artwork. I was definitely impressed the first time I went and I'm still happy every time I'm there. As I said earlier the menu has some great items with its Caribbean inspired flavors like Jamaican curries, jerk rubs and one of my favorites the New Mexican-style slow cooked pork. The lunch and dinner menus vary slightly, and their brunches are excellent. I compel you to get to the bottom of the glass of your bottomless mimosa before one of their waiters comes by to refill it.  But today is a special occasion, and it's time to talk about their burger which is available on both their lunch and dinner menus: a New Mexican-style green chili cheeseburger topped with jalapeno bacon. As expected it was fantastic. The meat had great flavor, although not cooked medium rare as I had ordered. But the burger wasn't dry because of all the amazing cheese and sauce on top of it. The lettuce and tomatoes were great; they almost reminded me of a po boy you'd find in the south. The bun was soft, great and proportioned perfectly to the meat. The green chilies were fantastic, and the bacon was thick, crispy and delicious with a hint of heat. Overall this was an excellent burger, and should have been expected from a place where I've already loved everything I ordered.  The sweet potato fries are among the best I've had; cooked just right and not soft and undercooked as they can often be. They had excellent flavor and were seasoned perfectly. The accompanying aioli was sweet and delicious. DW Bistro is already a place I recommend to friends looking for a great off the strip restaurant, but now I can also include it in the small list of burgers I hold in high regard in Las Vegas. While some meals for two can quickly get a bit expensive here, this burger for $10 is a great deal and well worth the visit.

8RrwYzOGZJ8n4CqWMhJlqQ.text: Stick with beer.  Their red wine selection is over-priced.  Calamari was amazing!  Ordered the Fried Chicken and Braised Short-Rib to split.  While the short-rib was just okay, chicken was wonderful!  Won't split the chicken next time!

5MZjP8QhX0AVeEkd8VdVNg.text: Best Bloody Mary!  That thing was garnished with bacon!    The wait for a table outside was longer than expected, so we enjoyed ourselves at the bar instead.

VpKRZbFjtp2p-l8dxoJV7g.text: First time here and I was totally in love with this place. the modern looking inside the restaurant with bright warm color really gave us a good appetite. The owner has a very good taste as I can tell from lots if details, and the restaurant is also very clean. I always check the restroom as well when I try a restaurant, it turned out to be lovely and clean. For the food and service, absolutely 5 stars. You better go there and try them urself. They also have cocktails, yah!!!

5gXls0HE3ayoCmvT3kpsSg.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my oxtail meal. This was the best meal of my 4 day trip. Hands down!  They have great menu choices, if you enjoy Carribien cuisine or not. The spices were superb and the meat and potatoes were full of flavor. I savored every bite. The waiters were nice and friendly and they could describe the flavor of the meals we chose. I can honestly say that DW Bistro will be my restaurant of choice in Las Vegas.

k5LdXgnEUY5AkkuvjRtwIg.text: My 2nd visit here and I decided to rate them.  I really like the atmosphere and the service is stellar.  Hence the 4 stars.  My first visit was less than impressive when it came to my dish.  For a classy restaurant like this, I expected much more.  I had a grilled shrimp salad and it was a single heart of romaine lettuce with 3 grilled shrimp that were cold and tasted like they were prepared the night before.  Not worth the $16!  I hesitated to return and would have likely given them 1 or 2 stars had I rated then.  Today's visit was inspired by my colleagues, who swear their food is always stellar.  I opted for a curry chicken bowl which was fantastic.  Very fresh vegetables and perfect balance of flavors with a little spicy kick.  So, along with the nice environment and wonderful service, DW has redeemed themselves.  4 stars.

k3-Fec0TA1v9mguAwHsZbw.text: Went in there the first time when the owners were in.  Sweetest guys ever, one of them even hugged me because he felt bad I just moved from California. They made is a free surprise dessert. Food was delicious. The only reason I did not give five stars is because the second time I came in, the owners were not there.  There were a ton of people working but my girlfriend and I were pretty much ignored.  So the owners may need to stay there 24/7

Lceq7WbsvwQRlNR3DxI-LA.text: This is definitely the place to be on the west side! Come here to unwind with a drink at the bar while taking in the ambiance (can get very loud) or come here for date night and sit in the back where it's darker and possibly romantic to some? Ha!  They tend to have a daily menu, which can be quite extensive and you stop paying attention after 10 seconds of a 5-min rambling of today's special. At one point, I did have to ask our waitress to kindly repeat the dessert menu since I had forgotten what she had said 2 Min's earlier. She didn't mind repeating it after she gave me a hard time but eh it's all fair.  Food is actually enjoyable and generous portions for the higher prices. It's interesting to see the fusion between Caribbean and New Mexican food. Being from New Mexico, I grew up on the infamous green & red chile (chili) so it's always a pleasure to see places use it to it's full potential. I must admit that the Jamaican Green Chile Chicken Curry soup was quite enjoyable but I wish it had a stronger curry flavor as the curry taste seemed to disappear within seconds.   The NM slow-cooked pork bowl was huge and quite spicy just like I remember NM red chile being. Due to the meat/rice ratio, you would need to add another egg to calm the burning sensation you might experience while eating it as one of my friend's stated. When I asked to have my leftovers to be boxed, I was a little sad to find out the waiter-in-training had thrown my leftovers away :( BOOOOO!  My guest had the braised short ribs and those too were quite delectable. The meat was so tender that it just fell apart. She wasn't a fan of the house rice that it came with so the waitress accommodated her by bringing a bowl of white rice. That seemed to make my guest happy.  The wait staff was um, interesting to say the least. Though very friendly servers, it's not the typical service you would get from other higher end places. They joke around with you, let you whack them with wet towels (waiter who threw away my leftovers) and can be quite sarcastic. If you're offended by sarcasm, perhaps this isn't the place for you. If you want to hang out with the cool kids but want to avoid the Strip, this is the place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexico Pork rice bowl with over easy egg
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Tiramisu

OhSNQ6kgB8H49TrWTL9YwQ.text: My boyfriend and I had ate here for our NYE dinner which had turned out to be an awesome experience! Not the typical Vegas feel kinda restaurant. What I did really love was the contemporary interior design and atmosphere! Something very unexpected to see at a restaurant here.  Amazing FOOD & SERVICE without the tourist crowd since its off the strip! I almost forgot to mention that they gave us complimentary dessert (which was extremely delicious) cause it was our first time there.The whole staff was really friendly and knowledgeable! I would definitely recommend this place to friends and eat here again.

iH65vbfD6aqg_ABmt8jizg.text: The only disappointment was that the DW does not stand for "DarkWing Duck."  This is a cute little place tucked up on the far southwestern side of Vegas. The DW, as I was told, stands for the first initials of the owners, D and W. I noticed it on a list of restaurants participating in Restaurant Week (a local charity event), and when I got a recommendation from one of my managers, it went on my list of places to try.  But when our crew got there and looked at the regular menu, the prix fix Restaurant Week menu went out the door as we looked at all the tasty brunch options. The eggs were tasty and unique. Scrambled eggs left sitting can get hard and un-delicious. Yes, I said un-delicious. But somehow, the eggs here were softer and tastier than other places. The toast is made from some kind of sweetened bread, and when you top it off with their apricot preserves, it's some kind of wonderful.  Elite Emily had the Jamaican Omlette, and Mama Elite had the New Mexico Pork Omlette. Both were mighty satisfied. Hector stuck with the prix fix Restaurant Week menu, which garnered him some crab cakes with eggs benedict, which looked good.  But here's the kicker: save room for dessert. You must have this carrot cake at DW Bistro. No, really. You must. You should actually go right after this review. Because God bless the person who first created this carrot cake. It uses the standard carrot cake ingredients, plus pineapple, macademia nuts, coconut, with a cream cheese frosting and liberally spotted with fresh berries. It's about the size of a house, so make sure you're sharing.  Holy god it's good. I'm pretty sure I made my O-face at some point.  The atmosphere is nice: it's a quiet bistro in a small spot. The staff was really friendly and attentive. I feel a strong "family" vibe, if you catch my drift.  It's kind of a ways away from me, but I would be totally open to coming back again. Might be a great setting for a date? Just sayin....

toC1FPIMj0W-IPqUngvB7g.text: Ate their a few times and the last time was very disappointing.  The food I got was burnt and I was told that this was just the seasoning.  Boo.  Go there for the cake/ sangria, and perhaps lunch, but dinner was a let down.

S7lGncebCNU8PGkRrfv1nw.text: My boyfriend had been perusing Yelp and came across this fanstastic bistro! We are always looking for something different and off the Strip. The ambiance is great and it didn't even feel like we were in Vegas anymore (which I like). We sat outside on their charming patio which I found to be very calm and relaxing.   Our server (argh, i can't remember his name!) was very informative and helpful with our drink and entree selections. I was in the mood for some red wine and he recommended a delicious Spanish wine, Las Rocas, (of course I remember that) which went perfectly with my braised Oxtail. I can still recall the taste! Our server was attentive throughout our whole meal and definitely made it an enjoyable experience.  I look forward to my next visit with family and friends!

onH6-D-ObPve3cHKEWMJUQ.text: Went here for the first time and it exceeded expectations! The food, drinks and service was AMAZING. Luis was our server and was very knowledgable on the menu and ensured we had a great time. When our food arrived you could tell it was freshly made and original to this restaurant. There were several people in the restaurant but it did not appear in the service.. Our drinks were never low and all of our needs were taken care of. Absolutely deserves 5 stars!

OwwRII7zair-KURlnbcZ9Q.text: Went here for lunch today after hearing good things through word of mouth, I had the smoked Turkey panini and my boyfriend had the sandwich of the day which had chicken breast and an array of delicious ingredients. We were SO pleased. I will definitely be back, I can't wait to try what else the menu has to offer!!!

iP7AZrbvlSUXupvj7NGctg.text: My second visit here,ordering the  same thing again, the new Mexican pulled pork shoulders and also the curry vegetables with couscous delish!

pABSMmzSQR_JcC0ERUgogA.text: I really wanted to love this place but we were not explained the menu too well so I didn't realize the jerk seasoning was super spicy.  Kind of ruined my meal alittle.  My husband loved his dish but again would have loved to been educated at the menu alittle.  They still have quality food so they get 4 stars. Serves was still good but again he explained the diff levels of seasoning when I told him my dish was super hot.  Oh well.

AD7K6xTDYkmaXki53ZROow.text: I'm live in Los Angeles but I spend a lot of time in Las Vegas and I will say that the food here in Vegas is super over rated including most I the restaurants on the strip. And it seams like the locals here have no idea what good food is. Now that I've completely made myself sound like a total jerk I will say that this little bistro here is awesome. It's so far away from the strip so it's locals only pretty much. I think I'm babbling here, must have the awesome drinks I just had. Just come here and you will be happy.

M1OgqmZnTfVcEm3QIpKBdw.text: This is a very trendy weekend brunch spot.  A bit overpriced for the amount of food you get, but the quality of both the food and drinks is great.  Their Bloody Mary's are good, although the bacon they dress it with steals the drink.  I finished my plate of french toast and ended up eating half of my girlfriend's chilaquiles as well.  Upbeat music plays and is loud enough to be a conscious part of your dining, but seems to be meant to play on its trendy atmosphere.  A place to be seen after the gym or casually dressed.

MS3TU6OlEBV4Rx3nnMv6_w.text: The service was great and the food was even better. Light but filling, tons of flavor and so fresh!

RklffwqcciuNc9qwHWYmRg.text: Second time having lunch here, really good food, great guest service. I know if a few restaurants that could use a lesson from the ownership here. Can't wait for next location to open. Keep up the great work

YfGMiKec000yqWQ9y4OeVA.text: It has been a few years since my first review of this place and my opinion has drastically changed. I would now say that I enjoy this place. I usually order the Jerk Fried Chicken and it's amazing! Very enjoyable and I will be back again and again

sBaPbeg0F1yoTS9MbNuY6g.text: We had the most wonderful experience at the Bistro... Hip cool, but casual atmosphere, excellent service, and some of the best food we've had in awhile. Definitely try the couscous salad with ahi. Damn good. I can also recommend the Manhattens... We had a special entree- 2 filets wrapped in bacon, and it could not have been better. We'll be back soon!

jj2q4f1kpwzll-jqKxKx6A.text: Have eaten here many times, it is always great food, great service, great atmosphere, out door patio is a great way to spend the evening when the weather is nice.  We live close by and always just walk in during the week , never have trouble getting a table, and have never had a bad experience.  Just wish they were open on mondays!

XuX8WvtPj92GgTaQbC4qzA.text: This place is too trendy for its own good! My party of four walked in d w bistro around 12:30 hoping to indulge in the bottomless mimosas and a fulfilling brunch. We were quoted a 45 minute wait time & told by the host that we could start at the bar and as long as we had our glasses at the table they would refill them all day. The four of us retreated to the bar where we fought to get attention from the bartenders for a solid 15 minutes. Once we got the attention of a bartender we were told that they were no longer selling mimosas. Another guest commented that they heard the bar was out of glasses so we continued to wait for other tables with glasses to leave. We then tried reordering mimosas and were told that they were no longer selling them as it was after 1- even though a bartender had just given a new glass to a guest that he appeared to know.  We went back to the host stand to clear up the confusion as we had already been waiting for 30 minutes hoping to get a drink. The host then checked back with the bartenders who told her the same thing she had told us. No one apologized for our wait or the miscommunication so we left disappointed. This visit was particularly upsetting because I was visiting in town from LA and I drove 30 minutes out of the way to come here because of the excellent yelp reviews. I can't attest to the food but the service is a NO.

Y9CM67THQ_j3k2x4QbATWg.text: We just moved from Henderson to the SW side of town.  Looking for new places to eat and came upon DW Bistro.  The food was great as well as the service.  Love the variety of breads that they bring out.  We sat outside and it was extremely relaxing.  We will definitely be going back.

0hoCA5yvQMZQQQk_krTfJg.text: DW bistro is one of my favorite places in Vegas! food is consistent and atmosphere is so chill and amazing! You have to eat here!!

ENjgkcUIFvSzWWigCdvCiw.text: DW is AMAZING!  My friend and I shared their oven-roasted jerk pork shoulder bowl and beer braised short rib and oh-em-gee, it's like heaven in my mouth!  The short rib were cooked to perfection that you don't even need a knife because it comes off with just a slight tug from your fork.  And the taste...WOW!  The pork shoulder bowl was full of flavor as well.  My mouth was having a party from all these excellent combination of flavors from every bite.  Their cocktail drinks did not disappoint as well.  I can't wait to go back and try the rest of their menu.

QdSPyA0Znlh8souXUSCalQ.text: I've been multiple times and it is always great. Really friendly staff and even better food. I highly suggest the tomato and goat cheese omelet!!!

X5-NzC2IIQt48I_mGUfPkg.text: I've been here multiple times but have never taken the time to write a review on how amazing this place is! Great food, great service and great environment :) I've never ordered anything that didn't come out perfectly. I'm so glad that its close to my home and that there's so much passion in the restaurant.

KHK1Gnf5Yq9wJhYC2gfcJQ.text: Great food, awesome service. The calamari is a must try, , loved my jerk chicken & the fruit infused vodka, Yum. I've been looking for a bistro/neighborhood place. This is it.

8spafudt09s03SUTdfXMOg.text: wow is this place good.  I went here for Sunday Brunch and the absolute best time. The decor is fresh and the food is right on point.  I loved the Chilaquiles so much and must have them again and again.  The owners came around to check on us and are very attentive.  Service was amazing, Food was amazing.

ViqKgfQbJgRolMc_p8FaMg.text: Never been disappointed here but never been driven to write a review about dw until today.... Today my mind was blown by chicken n waffles... I've been disappointed by all the other joints in Vegas who try their hand at chicken n waffles and dw bistro just nailed it... I will be back over and over again-

d6Dd3mQNSCIoFaYBTbrAsg.text: I always go to DW because it's close to my house and they serve the most amazing Jerk Ahi on a bed of pesto couscous with goat cheese balls... Heaven in your mouth!

iRQqLgEH8gw7zcb8CAXB-w.text: Every single person we saw provided excellent service and greeted us warmly and genuinely:  greeter; server who took our drink order; main server; and the chef (and owner?), his colleague sitting next to him at the bar when we left (co-owner? manager?), and the bartender.  The food was excellent.  The three adults had slow-cooked pork: one bowl with rice, one bowl with couscous, and one hash.  The accompanying homemade tortillas were lovely.  The two-year-old had big, adult-textured, rustic chocolate chip pancakes and a side of bacon.  Yes, two-year-old.  The hip and vibrant decor suited all three generations.  And my Bloody Mary came with a giant bacon garnish.  Oh, hell yeah.

O_RnvqsvV8H2AXDHQDxYFQ.text: Consistently a great meal across the board. I have had lunch, brunch and dinner here many times and all three are always spot on. Service is always pleasant and the menu is updated often enough to make it a place you wont get tired of.

sPUu5HmDd1x-rylAnNy4UA.text: Great food, great cocktails and great service. Staff was super friendly and accommodating.

1Yqt9a42C30_q8CeFJNsog.text: Absolutely my favorite place in all of Southwest Vegas, and worth a trip from the Strip for tourists. My first visit was opening night and I return every chance I get. The staff is friendly and professional and the food is mind-blowingly delicious. Always a surprise in the flavors (like jalopeno bacon on the BLT or this fabulous chutney on the super-moist turkey burger) to make each meal fun and yummy.  The owners are present and welcoming and make all of us guests feel like VIP's.  Don't miss specialty cocktails or dessert; they infuse their own spirits with all kinds of great twists of flavors and the desserts are all made on-site. mmmmmm

YE9T3PkJSCW35WQEnYW4sw.text: Best place in Vegas for sure and one of the best in the world.  The carrot cake will take your breath away, love love love it.  Great staff, great food, and unbelivable desserts.  Miss it only at your own peril.

tWA2OMwoHfNrFlOjnQbyVw.text: This cute little bistro is full of light and art as soon as you walk in the door. Brunch seems to be very popular here because the place was packed. I ordered an omelette that had green chili, corn, cheese, and so many more ingredients I forget. It was huge and bursting with flavors you don't normally experience in an omelette. Our waiter was extremely friendly and knew the menu well. All around us there were at least 3 people who had ordered the chicken and waffles, so my next trip here I will have to try that dish. I've always loved New Mexican food and this place brings a wonderful infusion with Jamaican as well.

eQ5va3hQlB8H9OJhJoneJA.text: OMG!! RUN don't walk to DW Bistro. The mix of Jamaican and Southwestern fair at this establishment creates a foodgasm on your palate. Their curried chicken soup is like something mama would make to comfort you on a cold winter's day, the meat on their dry rubbed ribs falls off the bone, and their macaroni and cheese with truffle oil bacon and mushrooms will make you want to slap yourself it's so tasty.    Tired of the knick knack covered walls at your run of the mill chain restaurants? Well you'll find nothing of the sort here, the ambiance of this place makes even a Vegas local feel as though they have been transported to a chic boutique eatery  where both young and old are welcomed by tangerine walls and a star lined bar. To top it all off the service is second to none, our waiter Ernie and the manager Bryce made us feel like old friends. This is the place you want to bring your out of town guests or dine with friends and family.

Hw8tSt7V8i1jCvwbmo2yTA.text: "We ate here last night. The food was incredible. Pretty spicy but the portion sizes were great. The staff was on top of everything and again the food is incredible."

LxRdAPOWnhjH5a24JQifAQ.text: The most wonderful experience. Happened to land there on Kentucky derby day which certainly added to the festivities but both the food and service were amazing, highly recommend this restaurant.

NuT9pdvnFyIeX64vygyg7A.text: First-  This place is fabulous and fierce and so is the owner...  Second- I'm a fan for life because I love a hands on owner...he was all over the place and came to  check on how things were...  Third- try the small pulled pork with potatoes and eggs over medium...in the spicy side but not overwhelming... My lady hates jerk chicken but she was very impressed with the jerk chicken and waffles...my friends had more Hispanic style dishes chilaquiles and a type of eggs Benny ...all bangin  This place belongs on the strip with a waiting line that is very long... Very proud that a venue like this is so close to where I stay and situated in my beloved city of Las Vegas.  Thanks DW

dBUIXbIBbmJ-4Vt7gxo4DQ.text: Love this place, it is so cute and the chicken sandwich is amazing! Staff is awesome :)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich

iyDtTFd7Nh2xSbGVLy-2fQ.text: WOW.  An outstanding restaurant away from the strip.  We had a gift certificate and decided to give it a try.  Everything was excellent.  The menu is not huge but perfect.  We shared a jerk Chicken Salad and Hatch Chili Mac and Cheese.  Both were prepared perfectly.  I had the Snapper. It was juicy and flavorful.  My wife had the shrimp and chorizo and it was also well prepared.  You can't go wrong here. I will be back many more times.  This is a must visit place when you come to Vegas.

dL3tGli15JcDAsE2XjLuVA.text: I really liked this place.  For dinner, they are not as crowded as they are for brunch but I definitely recommend for dinner.  I ordered the braised oxtail and it was incredibly tasty and good.  I practically ate everything on my plate.  The decor and ambiance was trendy and modern.  I want to go around brunch time, but it is first come first serve and the last time I came for brunch, there was a 1.5 hr wait.  No thanks!  I rarely ever wait 1.5 hrs for food. I just don't have the patience.

3er94SKvbtTKkYCO0C_Wbw.text: Went back for dinner.  Breakfast is the True star at this establishment.  How do you top fresh croissants and guava and goat cheese tarts?!?   But DW Bistro offers some really great grub for dinner too.  The fried chicken is truly amazing, seasoned with jerk spices and fried golden, crispy and just the right amount of greasy.  We had a nightly special dish - red snapper with shrimp.  Crazy good.  We also had the braised short ribs and they were so good too.  So many things to love about this place.  The cherry on top is that the service is always great here.

TVQZIuqjPDMtnRZIeb7XQA.text: 3.5 stars.   I think the saving grace for today's visit was the chocolate croissant! It was probably one of the best chocolate croissant's I've ever had. We decided to order the pastry basket (chocolate croissants and white chocolate blueberry scones) since the server highly recommended it.  I wanted to try the Pork Jerk Hash since Robyn L. recommended it. The fiance went for the BLT. The pork was so dry that it was tough to chew....it was spicy too which was expected for a "jerk" style pork but it was too spicy for me. The BLT was huge!!!! Yet again it was super spicy, the chipotle mayo sauce made it so it was so spicy that I could barely eat it and I could feel my stomach lining burn. I wish they had a warning level of the spicyness like in Thai food. We only ate half of each our plates. Maybe I'm just not the type for Jamaican food, but when we came for dinner I did really enjoy it. I am disappointed after spending 40 dollars on brunch and feeling like I didn't have a satisfying meal. If I could just order the chocolate croissant I would come here everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. jerk hash
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QS3F-SDFHbFJTwVVsGY7LQ.text: I have been looking forward to dinner at this place as it was recommended by two of my friends. We came in as a group at 6 PM on a Thursday evening without reservations but were seated immediately. The space is on the small side but was tastefuly decorated with a warm and contemporary flair. Our server was extremely attentive and informative with regards to the daily specials and hot sauces.   We ordered the calamari with Jamaican spice as a shared appetizer, and this was my favorite dish of the night. The dish had a mix of sweet and savory, and it was full of flavor. Several folks in our group (including myself) ordered the New Mexico slow-roasted pork over rice for their entree and were surprised by how spicy it was. It had a good amount of heat and came in huge portions. I would definitely come back to this place and order the calamari again, but I'll probably pass on the pork. While I wouldn't say that the pork dish was bad, I was finding it less enjoyable of an experience to finish my meal because it was just too much food!  They have several other dishes that look more promising. Overall, the service is awesome and the food is pretty tasty!

H5dKn_h3ulYnzuBBwHn7Vg.text: Started with the chicken flautas and then we ordered the slow cooked pork bowl along with the braised sandwich. Everything was great but the pork was a bit oily. The sandwich was very tender even as left overs it was still moist. The total for our bill was about 40 dollars.

uShpR6FK8_EjARj8UDfjRA.text: First time here. Food was amazing. Chilaquiles were so good. So was the slow roasted Mexican pork bowl. Great brunch menu. I am sure this is the first of many visits!!!

FJiUjCjnaS4rn4dFTHRfhg.text: I have been meaning to write an outstanding review for DW since the first time that I went in for brunch last month.  This place was recommended to me numerous times and I desperately wanted to try the 'jalapeno bacon'.  Different circumstances (like the fact that they are closed on Monday's) kept preventing me from trying that glorious bacon but when I finally did - it was love at first taste.  I then went with friends for dinner the other night and just have to rave about the outstanding service and delicious food that night as well.  So this is a 2-part review:  Brunch: I went to brunch with my Dad on a Saturday morning and because we are early risers, we were in the parking lot 10 minutes before they opened.  I had already been warned that the place fills up fast and I couldn't stand to miss another brunch opportunity without trying this place out.  We both got a bloody Mary, where previously mentioned glorious bacon was had and solidified my belief that dreams do come True (atleast when it comes to food).    The options on the menu are solid with the Caribbean influence apparent in the various flavors that are mentioned.  I went with the "DW bowl of New Mexican-style slow-cooked pork" and asked to substitute spinach for the rice. (In order to make the dish Paleo-friendly). HOLY! I don't know if I have ever had a brunch dish in my life that is more delicious than that bowl that was placed before me.  Between that and the additional side of jalapeno bacon that I ordered, I was in Paleo-foodie heaven.  My enjoyment of the dish was so apparent that one of the owners stopped me on the way out to comment on my clear satisfaction with my choice.  We shared a giggle in which I reassured him that when it came to food, I had no shame.  That interaction sealed the deal that DW would be my new favorite place to dine in Vegas.  Dinner: Impromptu dinner plans with fellow Paleo-eaters on a Saturday night lead us back to DW Bistro.  I was once again nervous that we would be faced with a hellacious wait but was pleasantly greeted by the second owner at the host stand who reassured me it wouldn't be long at all.  Our server (I never caught his name unfortunately) was equally as pleasant and very patient with our various modifications as the night went on.  My friends ordered the 'Hummingbird Carafe' which was presented beautifully and apparently extremely tasty.  I stuck with water and am so grateful for how quickly my glass was refilled every single time it was empty. For an appetizer we shared the "DW Spanish chorizo with shrimp" which I believe was consumed in a record 5 minutes flat.  I then was SO tempted to get the previously mentioned slow-cooked pork again, which also appears on their dinner menu. I knew I needed to try something different though so I went with the "Pan seared salmon" sans rice and sub extra veggies.  I'm not going to lie - it wasn't as mouth-gasmic as the slow-cooked pork but it was yummy.  The best part was the various farmer's market veggies that the salmon was served over.    I can't recommend DW Bistro enough.  The staff seems happy, the owners are present, helpful and friendly and the food has yet to disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican slow-cooked pork bowl- served over sautéed spinach instead of rice

NjWjZEarJ2-x3mnZ6YMUmg.text: Great place. Outstanding service. Our server knew everything about everything on the menu and made sure to make our girls night out awesome. I had the oxtail and it was fairly delicious, but I expected much more flavor. My mind wasn't blown as I expected to be by previous reviews. The specialty cocktail was yummy, but again, I wasn't wowed. The carrot cake was good and worth the indulgence!   3 stars for me. Maybe my expectations were too high? Dunno. I've had more amazing food elsewhere in Vegas. I do however recommend this place as their menu is original, inventive, and different. Thumbs up!

KFja3hBw7BLs0LFXLVCusA.text: Great find in my first week back to vegas! Thanks yelp. The decor was very miami with the tangerine, white and lime green colors... Felt very fresh. The food was amazing. I had tge turkey sandwich: which was a staff reccomend. I tryely cant wait to try many of the other items, nice variety on the menu... It was packed for a Friday afternoon around noon. I can see why. My fave in vegas do far. I will be back. Service was quite amazing as well. Got to try a carrot cake for being first time patron. Cheers to that!AWESOME place.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowtie pasta w/ chx
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops

1yIIgpztHWjP3gGpOd_58A.text: We came here about a week ago and I still have this place on my mind. At the time my boyfriend wasn't able to eat gluten for a little while and the waiter was super helpful and nice to talk to. So we both ended up getting the specials of the day. His was a rib-eye steak with scallops and asparagus and I got the fish of the day which was an Atlantic cod over rice and vegetables. Oh my goodness, so delicious! I'm pretty sure it was the first time my boyfriend and I didn't have any leftovers to take home :)  For dessert, he decided to get the lemon pudding because of the gluten thing and it was sooo delicious. It comes with dark and white chocolate truffles and fresh berries. I got the carrot cake which was really great. They say that it's a home recipe and I savored every bite. Oh and be sure to try the tea they have. I regret that I don't remember what kind of tea it was but I'll check when we go back.   This place is definitely a little more pricey than we're used to but it was completely worth every penny. The food was fantastic, I loved chatting with our server, there was very little wait time for everything, and it's so comfortable there. If you get a chance, eat outside!

zrgLk6_iSSD11d54aDsOCQ.text: Lunch, brunch or dinner, you can't go wrong with this place!  First off, the owners are super nice and put a lot of time and energy into the restaurant. That says a lot!  Where do I begin? I love the Caribbean fusion that's brought into every dish that makes it unique from anything you've ever had. Not just a BLT, but a BLT with jalapeno bacon... YES!  This is a great place for lunch, with a number of sandwiches and rice bowls to choose from. I feel like I've had just about everything on the menu, just pick something, it will be delicious. Dessert, make sure you order it. The cakes are all amazing and at a big portion size - perfect for sharing. And I can't forget my favorite tea: Pomegranate white tea Brunch, you might just be spending your entire weekend afternoon here. Bottomless mimosa's along with chicken and waffles, melts my heart. Brunch is a must-have here.

hHwaC-EDu2Vi8Ohj7La6kA.text: I wish there was more to praise about DW Bistro than I previously posted, but I must stress the service, presentation and the creations are what makes this a hip, chic, neighborhood bistro.   Having a martini delivered to you and your guest when you enter the door is classy and very much remembered. Of course there was a slight wait before a premium seating was available, but that's what the martini was for...to allow you time to relax and get comfortable with the dining atmosphere.  The wait staff was extremely attentive and ensure your experience was a memorable one.  I could rave about the crispy salmon, oxtail, and even fried chicken. If you like a little "kick" in your courses, there is plenty available.  Don't forget their daily mashed potatoes...I ordered some by themselves "to go!"  Desserts are also not to be missed...red velvet cake, carrot cake or their sampler are all meant to be shared (if you want to!).  I hope they continue with their expansion and encourage you to experience this little gem tucked away in the western hills.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Watermelon Martini
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Solerno martini...light and refreshing on a hot summer day.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A DW Dr. Pepper Martini

Xcz0bXmtca3RsxCpPRfshQ.text: My man and I agree that this place is legit. The interior is swanky and modern. Lots of white and orange, with cool panels of micro suede fabric walls that are a bit plush.   The customer service is superb. The waiters take the time to have small conversations here and there. They check on you enough to not be annoying and interruptive.   I ordered the Jerk Fried Chicken with waffles. It was a generous portion. My man ordered the Mexican stew with eggs on top. We both had no complaints and pretty much devoured our plates. The only thing I wish was improved was the waffles. I like when the exterior is a bit crunchy. We liked that they brought out little complimentary fruit cups before our meal. The prices are very reasonable. We paid below 30 bucks!   We will definitely come back to test out their other menu options. Caribbean/American fusion. We appreciate unique menus.

hR4s25IDOUYuFrPa6wf8AA.text: It's sad that one server can ruin an entire experience, but that was the case with my first visit. The server was impatient and acted superior to many guests. We didn't even make it to ordering food because of the server's attitude. I don't recommend dining here if you have any questions about the menu.

ROC9jd6BO6XVCaKbZ6zXiA.text: Finally did Sunday brunch!  And was it worth the wait...literally!  We arrived around 11:30 am and waited out front for about an hour.  We didn't mind as the weather was gorgeous.  They notify you via text when your table is ready.  I had the Bloody Mary...spicy and served with jalapeno bacon and skewered veggies - delicious.  We had a brunch-atizer - the pastry plate.  OMG, the scones were delicious!!!!  The plate included chocolate croissants, muffins, and goat cheese pastry.  We sampled all.  My friend had the oatmeal served with fresh fruit and toasted coconut.  She said that the leftovers tasted just as delicious on Monday am!  I had the veggie omelette that was also awesome as a leftover!  Our server Nick was FABulous!  Funny and super attentive.  I can't wait for Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal for grownups
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry plate...your friends will love you if you share.

Zr8kn5HLP6YMdGpxWQWsng.text: Great brunch. The new location is nice. Go early on Saturday or Sunday to minimize the wait. A little pricey but the food is very good.

ulhnF73Z8BnTGNgYODo5rA.text: This was my first visit, I wanted to try so many things on the menu because of all the good looking pics on yelp. I got the fried chicken which was so seasoned and so good... Im not a cornbread eater but the cornbread that came with the meal was amazing... The jerk calamari was so good... I was full from the chicken but couldn't stop eating thr calamari... The customer service was on point, everyone was attentive... Our server Eric was great, he even threw in a complimentary slice of the best carrot cake. I'll definitely be back and soon!

CrKB--UcTHFnEo3nlwBVfA.text: Love my neighborhood bistro!  Came here the other night for date night! Repeat offender, been here 3 times now... and will be back often since I live down the street from this amazing place!  I love bringing my friends here! good place to have dinner with your girls or date night!  I've tried everything from their sliders, lollipop chicken, ahi salad, lamb, carrot cake, and I'm always open to trying their main entree of the night and the dessert special of the day. don't forget to try their selection of breads~ yumm!  On my last visit they gave me the dessert special on the house! Thanks DW!  I'm surprised that a lot of people don't know about DWB! I'm spreading the word! A must in Vegas especially if you live in the area!  Indoor/outdoor seating. trendy. great customer service. fantastic food!  ilovejewelyn approved!  I'll be back soon DWB!  love it! - Miss Yelp 2012

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best yet! Spinach &amp; salmon! I&#39;m a fan!! Sunday brunch :)

eiUE9RMAdWSMptNnE-SfMw.text: By far the best local spot in Las Vegas! Located clear off the strip and away from the crazy, DW Bistro never disappoints! The New Mexican style food is out of this world. As a local I come here very often and know that I can turn to DW Bistro whenever I'm in the mood for an experience that is high quality, away from the busyness of the strip and is not too pricey.   They also have one of the best Sunday brunches in the city that includes bottomless mimosas! How can you say no to that?! If you get a chance, order their Eggs Benedict and have them add their New Mexican Style pork on top. The mix of the delicious flavors will blow your mind.   You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken flautas with avocado tomatillo salsa
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexican style slow cooked pork and egg over rice
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Challah french toast with strawberries and sautéed bananas

06_5EVPoPrNv8sbQmelhAQ.text: Came here some friends, the employees are super friendly and attentive. The brunch menu is okay and drinks are a bit pricey unless you go for the bottom mimosas, then the drinks are worth it.  This place isn't really my style but we all enjoyed ourselves.

rvSK8ltp_TJ56XP02HR2vQ.text: Truly unique food/atmosphere!  The entire menu sounded delicious. Hardest part was picking what I wanted. Everyone got something different so we were able to taste lots of things and they were ALL really good. That is rare, usually one or two people have meal choice envy but not this time.  From the breakfast sandwich to the pastry basket, the bread tastes like it was just freshly made. It was warm and flaky, the perfect texture and served with fresh jam. The jerk hash was outstanding. The smoky taste of the meat was like authentic barbecue slow cooked for days. Two pretty flowers topped the mountain of meat and potato hash.  The service was great too, quick for how busy it was and friendly. The kitchen staff is awesome. Especially LUIS, his food is his passion, you can tell with how beautifully it's prepared and how incredible it tastes:) Give him some kind of culinary award, the best in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We were all pretty happy with our food! Kid approved!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Hash-mountain of deliciousness

LojuS0azp1Xf-XSLHQFZeQ.text: Yum yum yum! I love their brunch here. I just went for the second time and it was awesome. They have $20 bottomless mimosas which I took full advantage of! They were awesome and our waiter was very attentive and filled my glass up many times-even when it was only half gone. For my entree I got the chicken and waffles because I had heard a lot about them and wanted to give them a try. They were amazing! The chicken was jerk style and had this spicy kick to it which mixed with the flavoring of the waffles really well. I would recommend this dish to anyone who want to try something new.  I love the ambiance of DW as well. It's a great place to go to brunch with a friend and sit and chat while eating and sipping mimosas. I would recommend getting their early because if you get there later on you will have a long wait to sit down because their brunch is popular. I would like to come back here to try their dinner selection to see if its as good as their brunch.

sMOUEHmrVnKkrMD0u_iQug.text: Great local place off of Ft Apache for brunch. Have not had dinner but frequent here for brunch/breakfast often. The bloody marys are to die for. They have jalepeno bacon, green olives, lime and a pickle. They have all you can drink mimosas for $20. The eggs Benedict is my favorite. Such an inviting and cute place. They have a Jamaican flavor and it is spicy... nice patio for those awesome Feb and March days with your friends. Check it out. You can see from the reviews this place is off the charts.

k4g7A2MO6oWBqP5Q4b5BNQ.text: Came in for brunch today. Good thing we got there immediately after they opened due to there actually being a line outside. We were seated at a table in the back, a little too close to another table for my comfort. Any time the people sitting behind me got up, I got bumped.   I ordered the bottomless mimosas, $20. The waiter was constantly walking by refilling my glass, I think he was trying to get me drunk haha. I ordered the Eggs Benedict with Bacon Jalapeno. I had super high hopes for it because it sounded super good. The size of the actual Eggs Benedict was okay But it was an extremely small portion of potatoes, which was disappointing because they were so good. I'm not a big girl by no means, but I was left feeling hungry after I ate and ended up filling up more on the mimosas than the actual food.   Mike got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Waffles which is a giant portion and never disappoints. It's always so tasty and huge that he has leftovers for another meal.    Last time I came I got the omelet which was super good, I think I'll stick to that next time so I won't get disappoint again.   Overall I like this place, we will be coming back. The staff is always super attentive and the manager is super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with Jalapeño Bacon
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Fried Chicken and Waffles

i9T91W98EqhKxB4B_eDu0w.text: Got my New Mexico fix! Sopapillas (with apples and butter) to start and NM slow roasted pork omelet (with red sauce)... delicious!  No wait for two. Friendly staff and fun atmosphere.

tE5q9kMSJB6U005DLe1jow.text: This is a great brunch spot! The restaurant is pretty big so there's usually not a huge wait. Sunday bottomless mimosas is so fun! Their chilaquiles are my favorite so far!

Qhwd0StVbsIOqbmdaCvY-w.text: There are not many non-chain Jamaican or Caribbean restaurant you can go to in Las Vegas or anywhere in the USA and I am glad this place is here though a bit of a drive from my other side of town, i still come for their Jerk Chicken or braised Ox tail. Their dessert selection are also fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Squid

m_hryAYYqz0ZRDgL_e7Qlw.text: Eric and I were just driving aimlessly south looking for a new spot to eat. DW Bistro isn't new, I went there for breakfast over a year ago, but it was new to Eric and I had never had dinner here. I don't know their dress code, but if I went there again I would dress smart casual. I felt a little underdressed for the atmosphere the night I went.

aWrvk8qGccc_pr3vfm9gqw.text: We've been to this restaurant several times at different times and the food is always tasty.  Its a place we take all of our out-of-town guests to because of its menu diversity as well as accommodating seating arrangement, perfect for adults and kids.  The decor is modern and comfortable with some eclectic art and light fixtures.    Most items on the menu are tasty but all of them involve a jamaican/latin fusion vibe.  But don't let that scare you if you are not into spicy foods..the spices are flavorful without being overly exotic tasting.    For Sunday brunch, chicken and waffles as well as chilaquiles are a must.  they also  For lunch, def go with the try any of the sandwich specials of the day.  I had a wonderful grilled chicken sandwich with pretzel bun.    For dinner, give jerk fried calamari, braised short rib, and the filet a shot.    The red velvet cake for dessert is pretty bad ass.  This place gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait a few minutes, especially for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with crab

6u48gnLcPCyaDOGWo3Th4g.text: I love this place. The food and the service is amazing. The bartenders try extremely hard to make it a great experience. The reason for 3 stars is the cook. The waitress was very good but she asks how I would like my burger cooked. Not sure why she asks since it all comes out well done. The flavors are great but I am not a fan of well done and I hate sending food back. Two of us ordered medium rare and got very well done.

ysjF574fgTh3W1HP9u9Fpg.text: I saw their sign at The a Great Beer Festival today and rushed right over to the food tent. It was more than worth waiting in line for!!! I've eaten at their main location  with my family and This place never disappoints! I walked around the festival today and everyone asked where I'd gotten the delicious food I was enjoying! This place is a hit! Stop in and make this your go to place!!!! Rudy and Beth, you're amazing! Thank You!

9dHapw-u7-kQgk_znBG8Ww.text: Good food, horrible service every time I go!  And I still tip at least 20% every time! The owner and employees seem very judge mental and only friendly to the upper looking class people. Sorry that I always go in jeans, flip flops and a tshirt. I only keep returning because their food is good and I have a craving for it. And it's by my work. So convenient.  Love their jerk chicken sandwich and their salmon. Their salads are yummy. Nice looking place just wish they had friendlier and welcoming staff. Maybe I should just get my food to go from now on.....

xdv4Emhq2ea_FhcLqh4yjQ.text: The food was amazing along with the service! I highly recommend the vegetable burger.

GunSMrFyj68DajQkvSWW7g.text: I loved eating here for BRUNCH. TODAY was my first time there for brunch. It was absolutely delicious. The foos was so flavorful. The nicoise salad was perfectly dressed. The seared tuna was so juicy. I also had the chicken and waffles which was unexpectedly spicy and sweet. I loved it. The service was excellent, as always.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles. Unexpected flavors. But delicious.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty drinks which were OK. Next time I&#39;ll just go with the unlimited mimosas.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicoise salad. It was perfect.

1wSD2FrGp9MMVWJTAkEtmQ.text: If you like brunch... this is your spot!! The owner (his name is DW) is so friendly, and comes around and visits the tables if he is there. He brought us a round of their new liquor to try as well, some berry infused vodka. The service is always great here, the food comes out timely, always hot and everyone is so great. The restaurant is so lively and upbeat, great energy and vibrant. The food... THE BEST. They have all different types of things for everyone: healthy salads, unhealthy indulgent waffles, sweet, savory, everything is top notch. Best part? 22$ bottomless mimosas!! And they don't lag on bringing you drinks, they fill you up when they see you are empty. Just make sure to take an Uber home (;  The only down side is that sometimes you have to wait a bit for a table, but this is just like any other poppin restaurant in Las Vegas. I've never waited too long, I'm just impatient lol. Would HIGHLY recommend

a9DRQgmwqPc5TDVubrkhww.text: This place was lovely, modern and bright, and had a wonderful atmosphere. The servings were of a good size as well, so you can get full from anything on the menu.   I had the jerk pork hash, which was a large serving of potatoes with a large serving of pulled pork, and I choose scrambled eggs on top. Unfortunately I could not really taste any jerk at all. The dish was fairly bland, which is a shame. Perhaps add a side of jerk aioli or something to ensure jerkyness? In any case, I don't like spicy food, so I'm pretty short it was not just me.  My wife had the turkey burger but found it extremely sweet, so much so that she couldn't finish it...  With a few tweaks in place, this could be a fantastic place, let's see what happens next...

mUfQKgb0vpm2G-mrgFWPQw.text: Amazing place with great food and service. One of the best burgers I've had. Brought us a sample of a carrot cake that was incredible. Can't wait to check out brunch!

k0toN44faC6dNRM7kBiQ-w.text: Had brunch with a friend Sunday (her first time) and as always, you can never go wrong with the pastry basket.  My personal favorite is the goat cheese and guava turnover fresh out of the oven!  We had the breakfast sandwich and vegetable omelet with pomegranate iced tea which were all wonderful.  The place was packed and we just wish we saved room for their infamous carrot cake!  Next time!

kazw5jnDSDaVhfQvvJur7A.text: On our trip to Vegas, I found amazing reviews for this spot. We didn't want to do the usual buffets and this was perfect. We showed up about an hour and a half before they were closing on Sunday, quoted us 40 minute wait, but we were seated in 10 minutes. I ordered the spiked lemonade and fried jerk chicken with waffles. My boyfriend has the Jamaican mohito and the pulled pork bowl. We shared the highly  recommended carrot cake. Everything was extremely satisfactory and we mat go back before our short trip is over.

ivS1g4jeEOG1s6YvbN-1Zw.text: Off the beaten path the cuisine was amazing.  Our waiter Ernie was awesome.  Food amazing. So flavorful and the selection was terrific.  Got right in.  No reservations necessary    Every meal our party of 5 received was better than the other.  The scampi amazing.  The jerk chicken Devine and a steak so tender and perfectly cooked.  A must go to

xlztj6RKiMDilc8NsoXbyA.text: Owners are present and friendly. Service is great and food is delicious. I just wish the wait time quote given was more accurate because then we would have gone somewhere else to eat given that I am 6.5 months pregnant.
