We were quoted a 40 minute wait and was seated after waiting 1 hour and 10 minutes. It was worth it in the end.

AE5vtg9uRPjiW0B1v6dffw.text: Finally got to try the much touted DW Bistro today for brunch!  Loved the decor and atmosphere (it was loud in main portion of restaurant but we were seated in the other area which was great!).  The service was top-notch- all of the servers were attentive and personable.  We started off with drinks-3 of us had the pomegranate iced tea- ( Re-Fresh-ing! )-my husband asked for a Guinness beer.  Server earned brownie points for asking whether my husband would prefer a chilled or room temperature glass.     Two of us ordered the Grilled chicken sandwich with jalapeno bacon, lettuce, tomato & chipotle mayo accompanied by the DW salad or sweet potato fries (I chose the fries).  It was a perfect sandwich!  The fries were delicious and I am usually not a fan of SP fries.  My husband ordered the Chilaquiles  (white corn tortilla with chicken, Chilaquiles sauce, cheddar cheese, two eggs,  pico de gallo, lime infused sour cream, avocado tomatillo sauce and queso fresco).  He loved it but did say he would have declared it perfect if it had chunks of avocado instead of the sauce.  Our fourth person had the Caesar salad with chicken (whole romaine served with crostini, shaved parmesan, and DW signature Caesar  dressing)- the server asked if our friend would like the romaine chopped beforehand- nice touch.  All of the food was plated beautifully (and had I not seen the over 500 pics already on Yelp I would have taken pics myself but my resolution for the year was to quit annoying my friends by insisting on photographing their food!)  We finished the meal with the  famous Carrot Cake.  It was beautifully presented and as good as every previous Yelper has claimed it to be.  I saw several other items I wanted to try so we will be back!!!    I have to say that the food and concept seems similar to Honey Salt but if I had to choose, I would pick DW Bistro!

W_Wpl_5CI7LY1L2xhtwnXQ.text: Love this place!   Bloody marys are to die for! Blueberry scones, I die again! I love to frequent this place during lunch and always get their DW bowl of the day, it's always different and better than the time before.   The service is beyond great.

lbFEvvo7Ds19KUS6jIYoig.text: We were lucky enough to spend time off the strip for our vacation last October, and a friend who lives nearby recommended DW Bistro, and we were in love!  Being foodies from PDX, we considered this place to be absolutely fantastic, rivaling and topping a lot of breakfast restaurants here. From the coffee to the Cuban Benedict, to the most fabulous carrot cake.  Each bite was savored for the beautiful flavors on the tongue, and sadness abounded after the last bite.    The service was attentive and wonderful, I was sad that we could not make it out there a second time before we left.

9GnWD6ogvd6A5alg3a0OMQ.text: Definitely a must go to restaurant. It has a nice chic look to it. Food is amazing and the prices are unbeatable. It's a little far out from the strip but worth the drive. My new favorite spot to eat at in Vegas. Looks like this place is here to stay :)

dSS6ZtJc1DKDkDEZBnUiGQ.text: This place is close to my work so I am guilty of frequenting it a few times a month. The salads are excellent and one of my favorite dishes is the veggie curry. The vegetables are crunchy and the all of the flavors in the curry make my mouth do a happy dance. The serving sizes are relatively big and the prices are fair.  I did the Sunday brunch a few weeks ago, however the chicken and waffles wasn't to my liking. I like the concept but the waffles were a bit dense and the chicken was a bit over fried. I will go back to give it another try but will definitely be ordering differently.

fYTGffVLDNKAUhZn_S_xMA.text: OMG!!! WHERE DO I BEGAN L0L.... This restaurant is amazing!!!! It is freshness you can taste; the decor is very modern and elegant. The actual owners come out and serve you... they shop at different farmers markets around town, hand picking all ingredients used in their menu. And did i mention the food is fa-nominal... This restaurant hands down is one of the best i ever eaten at and that's says a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sinful... DWELL Bistros famous Carrots Cake is to Die for :)

qYRK_lnUlc2N0ViTrO-DrA.text: Tried DW's brunch for the first time today with family. Outstanding. Innovative. Delicious! Special thumbs up for the staggering and inventive variety of savory non-egg items! (My husband doesn't do eggs so I have a tough time talking him into brunching with me. Even he loved DW's brunch!)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles ordered by two in our brunch group. Delicious - perfectly spiced and prepared. Generous portion.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch special - amazing! (We ordered w/scrambled egg)

4uAd47czSz5shAZ3Nk-FEQ.text: Awesome atmosphere. Our server, the blonde lady, was nice and informative. Great place to stop  for lunch or have a business client meet. I would have rated it five star, but the menu was a little limited and flavor combinations repeated themselves often from dish to dish.

_6tIGwHUGsadm_MtxzfTvw.text: this place blows the charts to smithereens!!! my tastebuds were amazed! I highly recommend the chicken fried steak.  The restaurant has a cool vibe and the service was great.

nOtWjmPtHhmP-dRb8jAhTA.text: Great Place for food ! I take clients for dinner at DW when we close on their homes ! Congrats to all those in south Summerlin I have worked with  and welcome to my neighborhood!

BhLc2qP4fbFsN__d7arHEQ.text: i think it was called a caribbean mojito. i wont get it again.  i had the sole. a little on the salty side but good. sister had the steam pulled lamb. looked like pulled pork. really soft. bro in law had lamb on ribs. he got them medium rare and they were cooked right. the bread and lavage was nice. didnt really care for the beer jerk bread. the truffle macaroni with   BBBB              A                  CCC                OOO            N        N                                                B       B          A  A             C         C          O         O         NN     N                                                             BBBB          A     A         C                      O              O       N  N   N                                                     B       B      AAAAAA          C         C          O         O         N     NN                                                           BBBB      A              A          CCC                OOO            N        N                                                                  came out but it wasnt even warm. they brought out another and it was... warmer... im used to having mac and cheese to be steaming. ordered a carrot cake. damn... that thing was so sweet. overall the food was great.   now for the annoying part. the acoustics in the place is weird. ive been to loud restaurants but the acoustics in the place was so awkward to the point that i was getting uncomfortable. it didnt help that there was a table of maybe 10 ladies sitting in a booth that had the walls curved towards us. when i looked around it seemed like everyone was talking in their normal level and tone of voice. but it was so much louder than it seemed. my sister said that when she came for lunch they sat in the corner next to the bathroom area. if you look at the ceiling its curved downward in a sloping fashion. she said she could hear people's conversations across the room.   who designed this place? put some foam on the walls!

r8BlokGjmUESxargexdtsA.text: The best food I've had in Vegas off the strip. The oxtail was great, just avoid the bones. Also, ask for all the extra Jamaican sauces on the side.

V_7tFbX5GltA6I4pB0HvHw.text: My daughter's friend recommended DW Bistro and we were in the neighborhood tonight and decided to give it a try. Loved the fresh, clean and modern decor.  Loved the staff and we were greeted like old friends -  felt like we made friends.  The food selection was fabulous.  I had the Jerk Chicken Scampi Pasta - it was amazing.  Red Velvet cake was beyond good...  Great experience and we made reservations for Thursday!

wSYBpLpMd9vAeh0TvNasPQ.text: I have to agree with My T. on this one, the ambiance is unique for Vegas.  I have to also agree with Thao T., it is very bright and contemporary.  And last but not least, I have to agree with Duy L, the owner (DW) is a very amicable guy.  You can tell as soon as you see him that he is the owner and takes pride in his food.  (BTW the above shout outs are all long time friends of mine, I just wanted them to feel cool)  Okay moving on, the place itself is very feel good.  Bright lights, very fun, friendly atmosphere.  The food is very good in my opinion, we had the brunch.  I had the breakfast sandwich.  Packed with flavor and not too greasy, which is always a good thing.  I tried my friends Chicken and waffles, but there is too much competition out there for this to be the best.  And the curry was excellent also, I could have devoured my friends plate.  I would come here again, it stands out in Vegas.

6tOO8abkEYPM8UitBKZ36g.text: I was very impressed by everything I had from the salad to the entree. I passing by and running errands in the SW and stumbled upon this tasty restaurant thanks to other Yelpers. I'm very glad I stopped in. I dined alone the day I went so unfortunately I did not get to try more food items which I saw being served. Everything looked and smelled wonderful. I had the chorizo shrimp, a salad and the truffle mac and cheese. It was absolutely wonderful. I also had the pumpkin cheesecake and that was awesome as well. The portions were plenty so I got to take some food and desert home. I was looking forward to eating it the next day. It was just as good the next day the only downside is I had to share with it with my hubby. Can't wait to go back and bring my friends and family.

CcVn6qmKA22kDYzxmdZilw.text: I would have liked to review DW Bistro but after a 30 min drive we were disappointed to see it was closed.  The YELP page said it was open, not the case!  Update your ecommerce world

sGhNOX2d3RWYfCc142kf8Q.text: I saved my 700th review for something righteously outstanding. We decided to square in on something difficult for us to get to normally for our staycation time and this was the one place I was I really wanted.  The space is modern and vibrant and it was a lovely day so we sat outside. They had a white peach pomegranate ice tea that is a must order. It's fruity and refreshing.   After much back and forth on several attractive sounding dishes and suggestions from our waiter we decide on our lunch. While we waited, he came back with a little amuse bouche of sorts. He wanted us to try some of their very popular curry soup and it was quite nicely spiced and complex. Promising for our food to come.  He brought a few bottles of hot sauces to the table that were favorites and explained each one. A place of my heart - I love things to be more spicy as of late!   Short rib sandwich was a beef dream. The braise on them was done right and it was tender and juicy and the jalapeno bacon was smoky and really nicely crispy contrast and their ciabatta bread was good and held up to the meats. I threw on some Scotch Bonnet hot sauce on this was it elevated it perfectly. Sweet potato fries were really light and crispy, more like chips in that addictive keep dipping in the chipotle mayo on the side and popping it in your mouth sort of way.  The "bowl of the day" was spiced chicken and chorizo bowl with roasted corn and chilies. This was such a hearty portion we could not finish. Lovely spice and I like that the chorizo was crisped up on the edges. This went well with the mango hot sauce on our table and was such a addictive combo. Being Asian I've cooked up just about everything and ordered everything with rice that it's hard to make me think it's the best thing on rice since white on rice. I loved this dish and reminded me of what my carribean creole neighbors mango gumbo fed me as a kid. Gah, nostalgia gets you every time.   Since it was our first time there,  our server got us a small slice of their carrot ginger cake to taste. We were full and didn't think we can take more than a bite, but we had to eat it. It was moist, had a very nice balance of spice and the frosting was not too sweet. The raspberry and mango sauces and fresh berries on the plate were perfect accompaniments. I love carrot cake and haven't had one make me smile in a long time. My little heart is pining for some right now. I want a whole cake - none for anyone else.   Service here was amazing. Our server Lorenzo was so upbeat and friendly and uber attentive to little details. That's what puts this place over the edge for me was all the small things which is such a rarity. Since it was our first time he told us the story of the place and food, took his time running through the menu populars and his personal favorites when we couldn't make a choice. It's rare that a place goes beyond to make your first time special and wanted us a bite of their star curry dish, try some of their banging carrot cake, brought us favorite hot sauces that pair well with what we ordered. It adds a depth of warmth and thoughtfulness that normally is reserved for regulars and even then is lost on many establishments. Something I expect from  ungodly pricey places, but isn't always delivered. Drinks were always topped off and we were checked on in a very present but not overbearing way. Also when we were handling the check, our ice teas were still to the top and he asked if we would like to take them in to-go cups with us and since it was delish of course we did. It was a nice touch. He also showed us their dinner and brunch menus and hoped we enjoyed everything and come see them to try out their other menus.   I have been stingy with 5 stars, and almost never give first visits a 5, but this IS as good as it gets! One of the better dining experiences I've had in this city. Vibrant, exciting food, lovely atmosphere and thoughtful service. I put off going because I never have a reason to be in this part of town, but with a experience this strong this IS the reason to come out of the way here, and come back fast. It may even have to be this weekend.

4PaB-1M4XJtsD2YaCwUHdA.text: Overall, this was a great place for brunch. It's a fun atmosphere and the service was great. I'm giving it 4/5 stars simply because it was pretty expensive for Sunday brunch not on the strip. The food was good and the bottomless mimosas were strong, but they are also cheaper elsewhere.   What we ordered: Jerk chicken and waffles, challah French toast, Jamaican Mule, and bottomless mimosas. The portions were very large and good in comparison to the prices. The jerk chicken was pretty spicy, which the waitress did tell me before ordering. We both really enjoyed our food. Overall: 4.5/5 Atmosphere and service: It was loud, but I really liked that. It gave it a really fun party atmosphere almost. It's certainly not a place to go and have a quiet Sunday morning conversation. The service staff was also great. We were told the wait was going to be about 20 minutes and it was only like 5. We also got our food incredibly fast, but the manager came by and told us to stay as long as we wanted, no rush sort of thing which was nice. Overall: 5/5 Would I go back: Yes, the menu had enough options that you could go back and not eat the same thing twice and during the week they have other options. Would I recommend this to friends: Yes, it was a fun place to eat. Although I will say, that this is probably not the place for a family to go for Sunday breakfast. But that's just my personal opinion. DW Bistro was really good and you should definitely give it a try if you're in the neighborhood :)!

pZkExg5nRpRW2W5iqLHFQA.text: My favorite place to go out for dates, social encounters ;) , and business meetings. This place has good food, and NOT ONCE have I had a bad service experience.  You can always count on seeing beautiful people in this trendy / cheap cheque hangout.

rfq0pZhtn5keq7Tdrv-XXA.text: Great Variety of food on the menu. I had the pesto torte for a starter it was really good, the whole table loved it. For my entree I chose the Pan-Seared Salmon, it was served with vegetables and  beurre blanc over rice rice. The salmon was cooked perfectly. Very Clean Restaurant and Great Service, but its a bit on the pricey side.

2BkraaJG6-E5oicdgj8MGg.text: Try this place for the first time today, it was very good, with very good flavor. I had the turkey panini, with roasted red peppers and sweet potato fries. I will definitely be eating here again, and the prices are reasonable also.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey panini, with sweet potato fries.

L5DEVYryv6MtglSwD66xmQ.text: If I'm anything, I'm a bulldog, according to my boyfriend. So when new restaurants open up, I sniff them out and attack! (bulldogs get a bad rap!! LOL) This review is looooong overdue. I found DW Bistro pretty much when it first opened. Roughly a year and a half ago I want  to guess. When my boyfriend and I first started going we could always be seated, the owners always found the time to speak to us and the food was phenom from the get go!   Fast forward a year and a half....forget being seated...this place has BLOWN UP!!! And while I'm so happy for them....I'm so not happy for me!! The weekends are always slammed....be prepared to wait!! Have one of their specialty bloody mary's and relax! Now...the owners will still come around and speak to everyone it seems, no matter how busy it gets! One of them is usually at the door, full of smiles and hospitality, while another is usually on the floor helping out and checking up on customers. Either way, I am so pleased with the boom in their business that has not changed!! I always feel so welcomed and at home because of these two men! You rock!!!   Onto the service...overall excellent!!! When it first opened there was a waitress or two that weren't exactly.....ummmm.....on top of their game! But as of today, the service we get each time is pretty incredible  It seems, like the owners, the staff really take pride in the restaurant, the food and the experience we have there. It's rare! There is one waiter that my boyfriend and I have had a few times and unfortunately I haven't gotten his name (well....I have but have forgotten it cuz I'm terrible with names). I do know he used to be a busboy I believe and now is a waiter. He is so accommodating, on top of service and so friendly!!   The best part....FOOD! Still rockin'!! Everything I've had has been good!! The pastry basket is a good way to start. Of course if it's just two of you either be very interested in alot of yummy carbs or in taking some home. The blueberry scones are my very favorite. Served with a nice homemade preserve, they melt in your mouth.  One of my favorite Latin breakfast dishes is chilaquilles.  I first had it years ago when an ex-boyfriends mom would make it for me and it was so good! It's very hard to find a restaurant that serves real chilaquilles. A lot serve what I call breakfast nachos, which are not chilaquilles. But DW does it right!! The tortillas are not crunchy, the chicken is moist and seasoned to perfection, the sauce on top is just the right spice and I always order with egg whites versus the sunny side up egg. Chicken and waffles, burger, eggs benedict, chicken flautas, the pork anything...gosh I could go on and on.  It's all amazing!!! And I feel like I've tried most of it! (moo..haha)    Bottom line: this place is 1) worth the drive if it is a drive for ya and 2) worth the wait if it's a busy Saturday or Sunday!!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW&#39;s delish Bloody Mary

e0y7LKUGwUDSxsJJNU14Jg.text: I have been here three times now and every single visit has been amazing! I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to give it a shot. It's very modern looking inside the restaurant and has a very fun vibe to it. The wait staff is very attentive and knowledgable. So looking at the menu, they have a very unique list of dishes. The first visit I ordered the New Mexican green chili cheese burger. Now when it comes to any type of chili, ESPECIALLY New Mexican chili I am super picky. All my family is from Albuquerque, and my grandfather actually grows his own red and green chili, so I know authentic New Mexican chili. DW Bistro did not disappoint and had the real deal. I was in heaven! Getting to eat good green chili is something I look forward everytime I go visit my family, and now I have a place to go to while I'm not over there. I ordered my burger rare because most places over cook their meat. DW on the other hand made it True rare, which not to their fault, was a little too rare lol. The burger was nothing short of amazing though.  I've also tried their flautas, enchiladas (special of the day at the time), and the Jamacian chicken curry on couscous.  Now let's talk drinks. I'm not a fan of bloody marys, but due to the fact that they add two strips of bacon and a whole pickle as garnishment, I might order it next time. I usually stick to the Jamacian mojito, and boy do they make it strong. They also have a wide assortment of beers from the Caribbean.  I keep hearing about their brunch on Sundays, but going anytime is a good time. My only negative comment about this place is the ginger candy they give you with the bill. Yuck! Lol

RhfMZWkm0RATX0ye-BFwZg.text: *****Great Cuisine *****Great Specialty Beverages *****Great Brunch *****Great Service *****Great Staff *****Great Environment *****Great Pricing *****Great "off strip" Restaurant  DW BISTRO Hits it out of the ballpark with FIVE STARS all the way!

L35WYAPRkSUCUQoWtf0OgA.text: I love this place. The food is a mix of New Mexico style with Jamaican. The place is very cute. The owner is really down to earth and friendly.

76DtycJLaWPVV9E-LC2Dkw.text: DW Bistro has quickly become one of our favorite local restaurants.  We have been multiple times and frequently bring our friends.  The look of the restaurant is ultra-modern and chic.  Everything on their menu is delicious with a Jamaican/New Mexican spin.  The Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Waffles are my absolute favorite.  Their specials are always worth trying since their cooks invent fantastic dishes daily.  This would be a 5-star experience if it weren't for the inconsistent service.  There are 3 waitresses here who all seem somewhat scatter brained.  They're all very friendly ladies, but when it's busy, you can guarantee that you will be forgotten for a while.  There are also inconsistencies with a couple of menu items (the bowl of fruit doesn't actually come with fresh cream or fresh mint and the New Mexican Bowl comes at varying levels of spiciness).

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Chicken and Waffles

MbDBTbbxRyOCu0tsZOewdQ.text: I could almost call this a nice gem, in the suburbs. I came here for lunch, on a Wednesday afternoon, with a friend. Prior to coming here, I had read some reviews saying how they sometimes get so packed, that even at 1pm, there is a fairly long wait. Upon arrival, i was actually getting a little scared considering i had to park on the south end of the parking lot and walk over.   LUCKILY ! Nope, no wait time XD super lucky i was told by my friend. I called her my lucky charm :P haha   Decor is very different. "Clean" and bright, yet simple. Bright colors with live vegetation (live flowers and containers filled with fruit) and decor. Different lighting and textures. It was quite nice on the eyes. Really different from what you'd usually see in a traditional restaurant.   This restaurant is based on the traditional Jamaican/Caribbean flavors with New Mexican cuisine. I don't know much about New Mexican cuisine but what i remembered of Caribbean is their huge use of spice (flavors) and SPICE (HEAT!)   A lot of reviews had talked about like the New Mexican Style slow-cooked pork, or chicken and waffles (not traditional chicken but JERK chicken!), or other things.   We were seated in the side room (to the right upon entry).   Super nice waitress and briefly described how their items are on the spicier side but can be changed, if preferred. HECK NO!  bring it on spice XD ! haha  My friend and I ordered two things, and shared off each other's plates. She had ordered the New Mexican Style slow-cooked pork, whereas I had ordered the Jamaican curry chicken.   I was actually amazed by the portion size. I am not a small eater, i couldn't even finish half. Ended up having to box up BOTH orders because BOTH were only half eaten. AND we shared ! LOL   BOTH were served in a bowl (obviously since it was under the "DW House Bowls" section) but the best thing... BOTH WERE PIPING HOT ! YES !   New Mexican-style slow cooked pork (simmered in New Mexican red chile with two over-easy eggs served over rice) - $12  VERY heavy and hearty dish. Comes with two? three? small tortillas on the side. This is how i described it to my friend. "It is a dish where is good on a nice cold night, sitting next to a fire, with a book". Heavy and hearty to keep you warm through the cold night. Good idea right? Perfectly cooked over-easy eggs on top, spilling its rich ooey gooey goodness over the slow-cooked simmered pork in red chile. Spice level, mild? There IS a bit of spice in it. Would prefer a bit more but it wasn't bad as it was. The meat was tender and pulled apart fairly easily. The included small tortillas allow you to make these small burrito wraps yourself. Another thing i told my friend... "if only we had some like corn salsa, sour cream, shredded cheese.. this would be a YUMMY burrito !" haha =X   Jamaican curry chicken (sauteed seasonal vegetables; served over rice or couscous) - $12   In comparison to the slow cooked pork dish, this dish is light and bright. Light curry flavor, with little to no spice, but refreshing from the sauteed seasonal veggies that give it a bright flavor amongst the curry taste. It's a pretty good combination. Veggies were like cubed zucchini, green beans, two different types of mushrooms, etc  The chicken is a little overcooked, so a little tough (considering it was white meat as well). Still pretty good though. I later regretted asking for rice over couscous. I wonder how it would have been with couscous. Very curious now.   Overall. Pretty good experience. $12 for a bowl i cant even finish? Pretty good ! Flavors are good. Would like to try other things next time.   Little additional uhm... thing.. haha (lack of vocab coming to my head at the moment)... the boxes they give you to pack leftovers... THEY ARE STURDY AND MICROWAVABLE ! (super chinese but most likely reusable) XD

PE1U81WoDIs0-iWK4SESlg.text: I love this place for brunch! It's upscale brunching but laid back atmosphere. I always have a good time visiting. The bottomless mimosas is a little on the expensive side compared to other restaurants. The owners are always mingling around helping serve food, drinks, pick up dishes, whatever it may be and they are the sweetest. The New Mexican Omelette is typically my go to. The meat is sooo delicious and it's not too heavy of a meal.

llknb8Uhps1ELbfZI4VIow.text: Went here for brunch today with a friend.  By the time we were seated they were only serving single mimosas, which is a rip off considering that endless mimosas are only ten dollars more.  That was disappointing.... I ordered the chiliquiles which were good and just the right size. Friend ordered the sopapillas.  We will be back..hopefully early enough to enjoy the full brunch experience equipped with endless mimosas.

e5OVB7AQRED5eBciUad_uA.text: Went for Brunch, and it was nothing but amazing. Loved the atmosphere and all the staff were great! Had the chilaquiles and the jerk chicken and waffles. Couldn't decide which one was better! Perfect brunch/hangover food that hit the spot. Luis was our waiter and he was friendly, quick, & a great guy. He even got us to try their carrot cake after we were stuffed and it was to die for. Definitely will be making this a regular stop when we are in town!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S9jGmI2G_1_jA_mOpLBL4g.text: Ok, I honestly feel terrible about writing bad reviews about establishments with great customer service, but hopefully my constructive criticism will be utilized in a way to make this place soo much Greater than what it is, so here it goes....  The good. Our waiter  named Vital, was super kind and informative he is a True Ace by far!  The Bad. It took forever to find the place because there were no proper signs leading to the actual store front , which made our initial impression extremely frustrating.  The Ugly. Moving from NY to Vegas we are constantly looking for great eats. I am Philipino and My husband is Jamaican and we specifically choose this restaurant because it said they specialized in carribean cuisine.   Hubby ordered the coconut cury chicken bowl, it was so white-washed , forgive me for lack of a better term, but it was a True disappoint to Jamaican culture. They should have atleast advertised it as "Jamaican STYLE" curry chicken so it would at least soften the blow a little a bit lol...the portions were off, such tiny pieces of chicken and large amounts of zucchini and rice, it was just terrible, chicken was not the star of that dish at all!    I ordered their Mexican Pork Bowl, this dish was one step away from being considered dog food. I never had dog food but I could imagine this being the equivalent to a spicy puppy chow. The sauce was completely overwhelming and the pork was soaked in it I thought it was a bowl of spaghetti sauce at first glance! The overwhelmingness of the sauce took away from any flavor that the pork even had. Please take this dish off the menu immediately before someone gets sick!....and to add insult to injury they served it with 2 flour tortillas in a cute little fancy basket and it wasn't even homemade tortillas!!! they plated a Walmart brand tortilla in a fancy basket and bam! 16 bucks in the garbage! Smh   I am an excellent chef at home and often cater small events, if there's one thing I know, i know good food when i taste it, But this restaurant was a disgrace. I will not recommend this place to anyone until they revise the quality of their menu items. And one more word advice to the chef and owner, stick to one style of cuisine and master it! JAMIACAN n Mexican Food is not a good combination!!!  If you need good Jamaican food ideas or recipes please reach out to me, Oxtail is a fan favorite and I make it the best! LOL   In closing I'd like to exit on a positive note, I conveyed my thoughts and concerns to my server Vital, and he was extremely receptive towards the criticism, he was a great listener, and was even thoughtful enough to bring out a complementary piece of cake to make up for the food. Its when you come across workers like that, that actually take the time out to pay attention to their customers, you know your establishment still has a fighting chance. GOOD LUCK  BW Bistro, hope you take my review into consideration going forward....i wanna see you win!  ;)

YaQIZSExGTtEKz3SITnIwA.text: This review is only for their Sunday brunch. I'll have to add a review for lunch and dinner after a few more trips.   Ok, let me start by saying UNLIMITED MIMOSAS! You can't go wrong with that. You can opt for just champagne, but I don't like looking like an alcoholic at 10 am on a Sunday. But who I am kidding when I drink 8 or 9 regular mimosas?   The food during brunch is excellent!! Always ask your server for their specials, which is what I end up ordering. One of the specials I ordered was the special eggs benedict, which consisited of a potato cake instead of a muffin and topped with their green chilis. SO FREAKING GOOD! My only complaint is that it just didn't seem like enough food for $16. Maybe give me a bigger side of potatoes or add another benny. Who knows, maybe I'm just being a fatty, but the others at my table who ordered the benny seemed to have the same consensus. Their BLT is also amazing. Thick cut peppery bacon served on Texas toast and served with sweet potato fries. Next time I think I'm going to have to try the vegetable curry. I had a small bite of it and it was excellent.   Service here is spot on. Our server MARCO (I'm sorry for calling you Cesar, I blame the mimosas and Vanessa) is outstanding. Always refilling our drinks, making sure we have everything we need, and lastly having the patience to handle our rowdy group. Hats off to you sir!  Tip: come early! The wait for Sunday brunch can be horrendous. I've always been lucky and have never waited more than 20 minutes.

yhFn2mxRvylnzZqAt6vzKw.text: This is far from where I live but I come to this part of town every once in a while since there are some good eats here. I must say I was pretty disappointed with this place. Not worth the drive for me.  There was a 35-40 minute wait at 1pm and they don't take reservations. What? This place must be good...no! We got seated at the patio and it was a beautiful day to be outside.  Since I was warned about the jerk chicken and waffles by other Yelpers, I thought about getting the tomato and goat cheese omelet but that seemed boring and I could get that somewhere else. So, I told our server I wanted to try the New Mexico-style slow cooked pork omelet but he stopped me from getting it when I told him I don't like spicy food. I ended up getting the DW Nicoise and somebody else got the New Mexico pork omelet. Both dishes came with a side of fruit.  DW Nicoise: Pan-seared fresh tuna, greens, mangoes, Haricot vert, olives, fingerling potatoes, hard-boiled egg with mango and Dijon champagne vinaigrette. The tuna was great and so was the dressing. But I've had this salad elsewhere and it was better. This was just ok. 3/5  New Mexico-Style Slow Cooked Pork Omelet:  Pork in NM chile and jack cheese with rice and egg on top. A bit spicy but tolerable. The pork was tender. I'm glad I didn't get this. Not my favorite taste. I appreciate our server's warning. 2/5  I don't think I'll come back. The menu either has items that are too safe and items that are exciting but not good. The service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexico-style Slow Cooked Pork Omelet
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Nicoise

qxDsB9OJ0R5fgi2J5xQCcw.text: Very limited food options; the one thing I ordered was way too salty and unsatisfing.

E2fuHv3Bamc4JwGs_AGK1A.text: I came here for a family friend's birthday party last week and wow I was impressed...I've never had Caribbean food before and I'm glad that this was the place I started off with. Their braised short ribs and chicken flautas were soooooooo good. You don't even need a knife to eat the ribs because it just melts onto the forks. The flautas had the perfect balance of savory flavors and had a slightly pleasant kick to them. Everyone who served us that night was super friendly and hospitable. It almost felt like I was having dinner at a friend's house because of how cozy it was... I can't wait to come back and try their brunch.

aW5Ztc9OpJFrfPBEbUbZOQ.text: I was here yesterday and today !!  This place is awesome from service to tasty food especially brunch !!! Great atmosphere really professional service and I have nothing better to say ! I just love this place ! Anytime I'm in Vegas SW area I'll stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken&amp;waffle Jamaican style wow !!!!

oe_-0gRvxOybGlDnFZvxwA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. We have celebrated many milestones here as well as Many weekend brunches. Everything is delicious and I love the atmosphere.

99CNhyFLwBRSZyIQiObhsw.text: No exaggeration, but DW Bistro was probably the best meal (dinner)/bistro I've had! I had the hatch chile Mac & cheese, jerk fried calamari, DW turkey sliders, short rib smothered sweet potato fries, & Jamaican chicken curry. And I would recommend every single one of those dishes. The owner is so awesome, so friendly, and very welcoming. I will definitely come back for more... and more!!! I can't say enough good things about this place!

T2vCzy0WLYR836RpfzJbDQ.text: My friend and I went here for Sunday brunch. The Jamaican fusion items sounded delicious as did the bloody's. When we arrived it was extremely loud and packed inside. We got on a wait for about 10 minutes. We ended up asking for a table outside on the patio due to how loud it was inside and the wait increased to about 20 minutes which I was ok with.  We waited due to how loud it was indoors. You couldn't hear the person you were with unless you were yelling. The host kept us very up to date on the status of our table which was great. I mean it's not their fault they have a loud establishment, just means it has a lot of business! Unfortunately there was nothing but trap and club bangers being played on the patio. When I go to brunch I expect a nice, relaxing environment. the music was so awful that it made it hard to even enjoy myself. The patio was loud as well, which would have been okay if the music wasn't so terrible.  The endless mimosas were amazing, they never let me reach the bottom of my glass. The Bloody Mary was spicy and delicious as well. The omelette I ordered was tasty as well. Overall if it wasn't for the music and young, loud crowd I would come back. Unfortunately due to these variables I would never come back and never tell anyone else to brunch here. It felt like a place you'd go to after you roll out of bed in the same outfit you went to the club in and call it a day. Definitely not somewhere id ever want to be again.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa with the ginger mint they gave us.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican style omelette with fresh corn, New Mexican green chile, and jack cheeses.

4FtYqt7exrcvfcWDEb6RVQ.text: Great food!!! I like the menu offerings and they were able to leave the cheese off the dish since I have a dairy allergy...  the red chili sauce that does have a little heat..  Some restaurants only offer a more tomato type sauce.. This one seemed more New Mexico chili authentic.  and the pork was cooked just right.  Yum!  But, I was sad that it was so loud in there that it was hard to hear the person across the table from me.

W1x8Z4T4JsFuRtB6VjrxJA.text: Walked in on a Monday morning had a reservation for 10, and we had all of the inside of the restaurant to ourselves. Everyone was dining outside/on the patio. The design and elegance of the restaurant is pretty top notch. Everything was polished and clean. The food was literally phenomenal. The chef even came to our table to make sure everything was perfect, such a gentleman. His cooking skills are on point and theres a lot of jamaican influence which I'm sure is his background. Either way he does it extremely well. The flats are delicious and I would recommend to start off with those or the Turkey sliders to start. Don't get me started on the sweet potato fries. THEY WERE KILLER! Had to order another basket of them. The only thing I must say is that the bar was out of a lot of basic spirits or did not carry them at all. Needs a little bit of an upgrade in that department. I'll still give a 5 star because the food was just truly amazing.   PS: Thank you so much for the complimentary desserts. They were spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Flautas! A must have for starters!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Negroni w/ an ice sphere
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Special of the day. Chicken Bow Tie Pasta

atP1c-dfgI7uGg6a-cV1dw.text: Great food!! Love their food!!! Took my mom for her birthday and she loved it!! I always get the Chile rojo with eggs over and it's different yeah delicious!!

kkhrNOjWObEAoYL03r6PWw.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  I came to DW Bistro for their infamous brunch.  The restaurant is far from the strip, but it is one of those Vegas greats that should be worth the visit if you want to venture out of the hotel.    On a Sunday at about 1:00pm, the place was packed.  Bottomless mimosas and great food with varieties from breakfast to lunch.   To begin, the wait staff are all tiop notch.  They are friendly and will help you with anything if you ask.  I had the egg sandwich which was cooked fantastically with awesome bread.  I also added some sausage to the sandwich which was also great.  The brunch was very affordable and their wine and beer list was pretty solid for the area.  The brunch seems like the best way to go for DW, but I'll be back to try regular menu in the future.  They do brunch on both Saturday and Sunday, and the waiters said anytime after about 11:00am gets super busy.  So I would recommend the brunch but try to shoot for early or late if you don't want to wait.

UgIInnztd1yscOLY9JxjQQ.text: I honestly have never had a bad experience here! I've been going for years. I worked near by the older location and our office would have our meetings at DW with other offices from around town. No matter where they were coming from, everyone was always excited about our lunch meetings there.  This new location is amazing. Still had the OG vibe to it with a hint a chic-y new neighborhood. The staff is always so sweet and amazing. I would always request Marco though I haven't seen him at this new location :( Where are you Marco!!?   I love the selection. A little something for everyone. I'm a spicy gal so I'm always making sure I have my meals jerk style. The Grilled Jerk Chicken sandwich with an extra side of their chipotle mayo is heaven sent!!! My food has always been fresh and always consistent with flavoring and such.  Their staff is very pleasant as well. I can't wait to introduce more folks to this place so everyone can experience this spot with all of us who already love it!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rtvccE8PNSg5Biat81L_3g.text: I tried DW Bistro when it was at it's old location further down on Fort Apache. At the time, I didn't care too much for the food. The food wasn't flavorful to me. It had spice, but no flavor - does that even make sense?  But I decided to give it another try because everyone keeps raving about this place! And I'm glad I did. The new location is a bit odd, like it is a part of a condo complex. But there is a great outdoor area to sit and catch up with friends.   Today we started with the pastry basket. I'm a sucker for blueberries. The pastries seemed freshly made, and those blueberry scones ARE SO GOOD. Hot right out of the oven! The food takes awhile to come out as well. So it was good we were able to munch on something before everything came out.   We also tried the New Mexico pork, and it was fantastic! Very good flavor and very good portion. My husband and I enjoyed it a lot. Everyone seemed happy with their food too. Even though I didn't try any one elses dish.

08rZMOGMsoUdaZ6NSYcKvg.text: DW Bistro is going to be one of my favorite places for brunch.  We came in here on Father's Day and it was SO BUSY! Luckily we were able to grab three seats right away at the bar to get started on our bottomless mimosas while we waited for a table. The bartenders were so busy but very nice. They kept our champagne glasses constantly filled. We were originally told 60 min, but we were called within 30, which was fortunate since we were drinking those mimosas extra fast on empty stomachs.  Once we were seated, they kept the mimosas coming. We never had to wait. The service is impeccable!  I can't remember what my friends ordered (maybe I was that drunk?), but I ordered the eggs benedict.  The only problem was that there were options which I thought were add-ons, but they were actually "instead of" options.  So I ordered sausage, thinking I'd get sausage on the side, but when my eggs benedict came, they had replaced my ham with the sausage. The sausage did not go at all with the benedict and were actually my least favorite part of the meal.  Everything else was delicious. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the hollandaise was subtle and buttery, and the muffins were toasted and fluffy.    I can't wait to go back and try other things. I really like the ambiance of the restaurant. It's so bright and cheery. The servers are constantly running around but are all super nice.  My friend asked how much a bottle of their hot sauce cost, and he gave her one on the house.  Such a nice unexpected gesture. Overall, we had a great time and really enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict! Bomb
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry basket! Chocolate croissants were so amazing!

PYH6y4V7RhxxBz_oZBtThw.text: Had a great time. I came for a special event and the appetizers were delicious.  I'll be back for dinner ;)

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qrZLqZWSygUyyH5piA-OVg.text: Huge portion sizes for very reasonable prices !  The flautas were so good and fresh.  They split our burger for us and served on two complete plates so we could both enjoy.  The New Mexican Pork Bowl was huge, enough for two.  The meat was tender and the flavors were excellent. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SevzuZK1vD0lYP99H0IDgg.text: Worst experience. If you wanna pay a premium for mediocre food and terrible service this is your place! We went to DW bistro and waited over an hour for French toast and chocolate chip pancakes. I had to ask several times just to get water. It took them 30-35 minutes to get a water refill. Our meals did not come out all together and the server was extremely forgetful. Our orders were messed up and honestly not that good. The food was sitting in grease. Their syrup had burnt food particles in it and was the consistency of water. After we asked to speak with a manager, the hostesses said they just would relay the message. If I ask to speak with a manager that means I want to speak with a manager. It was impersonal and just the cherry to top the terrible brunch.

_SJ8HVPE04ynbM87Z96Hbg.text: I've been coming here for years. I've had bday events here and special occasions at this location as well as the previous. Always been a fan. Today something odd happened. I ordered one of my regular dishes which is the Jamaican curry bowl and it was totally off. I sent it back and felt horrible! The waiter Juan took it away and got me something else. I was on a time limit so he made sure to get it quickly. Thanks Juan! This proves that Dw stands behind their food and their service is great! I will remain a loyal customer and will continue to come back. Thanks guys.

F311sJHpnKAaQL4uOWaXWw.text: Our server was uninterested in serving us. Did not earn the 20% gratuity that was automatically added to the ticket without my permission. The server tried to leave repeatedly while I was trying to ask him questions about the menu. They recently changed the menu completely, sure, I can live with that.   Furthermore I will add that our fried chicken did not come with gravy as we were accustomed to in the past.   No longer a mystery why the place was somewhat empty on a Friday night.

y6dJmFSdnVDa6HbuZzTjPg.text: So good! The service was great, a bald gentleman with glasses took care of us (forgot his name) he  was so nice. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles. Boyfriend had the New Mexican pork bowl.

RKCsJEM0Qr4gKHysBkd6Pg.text: Sunday Brunch is the best!! Good food, good service, good music, good vibes. I love coming here on Sunday to brunch :)

tPgXh8E2yhslv4dfgYKEaQ.text: The ambiance and customer service is great. The food is flavorful, tasty and not too overdone. We ordered the oxtail and curry chicken. Great selection of appetizers too. It's a bit out from the strip but worth the trip. We usually spend between $70-$119 but definitely worth it. The food doesn't disappoint.

LDjbz2rTLpVkgRSskpeeUA.text: What do I know about Jamaican Cuisine?...not much, but I love Jamaican chicken curry bowl at DW Bistro.  Setting is casual and upbeat. During lunchtime it gets loud inside with the high ceiling, so when weather is good, I prefer sit out patio. My familiar and pleasant server is Alfonso who has been there since DW was the new kid on the block...he is good or he loves what he does.   DW Bistro has a rather simple menu for lunch...everything looks good but I always order Jamaican Chicken Curry bowl with jasmine rice.  Of course, I have to add some Jamaican Hot Sauce, but the flavor and presentation itself is always attractive to me with lots of fresh vegetables, colorful flowers, and with white chicken meat.  I can cool down my tongue with either with a glass of pomogratne ice tea or accentuate the spiciness with a selection from their wine list.   I was told many times that their Sunday Brunch is a must, but as of writing this, I haven't had the opportunity to check it out for myself...so before it gets too cold for me to sit outside I must pay a visit to DW Bistro.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Turkey Panini
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C2cfDM9sDrzh_7wRJWV5TQ.text: I was visiting a friend, and wondered about the brunch scene.  Coming from DC, the bar is already set pretty high. so what did Vegas have to offer for this?  In my research, I discovered this place.  Jamaican and Mexican food are two of my top favorite types of food... and to find a place that is a delicate balance of BOTH?  I had to take advantage of my few days in town.  I called ahead to see about reservations, but they only do that for larger parties.  So, we showed up and had to add our name to the list to get seated.... the waiting area was full, so we just had to stand around.  As we were waiting, I saw that some people had mimosas even though they weren't sat yet.  So I walked to the bar conveniently located next to the entrance we came in.  It's not that big, but I have seen smaller ones.  We asked the bartender if we could order our bottomless mimosas while waiting, and she kindly obliged!  While indulging, we got seated rather quickly... we were told it'd be 20-30 minutes, but it was barely 15.    As we sat, it was almost time for mimosa refills.  The bottomless service was spot-on... we never had an empty glass for more than 2 minutes (if it even got empty, they would just come and refill too).  For food, I decided to order the jerk fried chicken & waffles & my friend got the DW breakfast sandwich.  Everything from the jerk flavor to the texture of the waffles to the compliment of the syrup made me very happy.  My friend spoke highly of his sandwich, and I did try a bit of the potatoes that it came with and enjoyed.    I wish there was a bottomless food option to go with the bottomless mimosas.  There are just so many delicious looking entrees to try.  Next time, I hope to get the omelet that has jerk pork in it.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of sauces
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch menu

Uk-VzsV2RwxynXdkCV6Ugg.text: Nice brunch spot with outdoor seating . About 15min drive from the strip , food was good but they don't have an extensive brunch menu. They do have the option for unlmtd mimosas :)

urMsH9aA3l5SnXBO23m5pw.text: Very Chill vibe. But it is a little pricey. But the combinations of some of their flavor pairings are amazing! The sliders are very good but I love the Brunch menu. Mimosas are bottomless if that is your thing ;-) Very busy all the time, but the servers were always attentive! Foodies will love this spot!  They do have a full bar away from the dining area with TVs if that is your thing as well.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vI9llOZqGYSVmvDXfOECIA.text: More than the food, I think Sarah's glasses are beautiful. LMFAO

SQkJzEdfhlRjxG4CV7PIow.text: I came here for brunch, lured here by the fried jerk chicken and waffles, and was somewhat disappointed. The jerk chicken was just sliced skinless chicken breast, apparently prepared with a mild jerk seasoning rub (mostly allspice) and then breaded and fried. The chicken was served on top of waffles with a side of allspice-flavored syrup.  The waffles and the chicken were OK, but definitely not 5 star worthy.  It seemed that many other diners at the restaurant were nursing their hangovers with bottomless mimosas and other cocktails (The bloody marys looked pretty good). If your hangover is caused by alcohol withdrawal, then perhaps the bottomless mimosas here would be the cure.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried jerk chicken and waffles

gfqAPqpLIg7O35ZMz_L0dA.text: I've lived here for three years. I frequent Nohea Nails and Cuppa but not DW! What a pleasant surprise. I had brunch with my brunch buddies. The menu is great! There are several drink options and the service is excellent.  It is bright and upscale. It is great for Any group size and yes children are definitely welcomed. The DJ was excellent. The music is not too loud. It is very easy to have a conversation with your party. I also noticed there a small bar area when you first walk in. I'll definitely be back for dinner.

qNk6lPqCEGOl__kCEH2YWw.text: As a breast cancer survivor and this being Breast Cancer Awareness month, I was  appalled that, when asked, this restaurant refused to display an American Cancer Awareness poster. This would  have cost them nothing.  When there are so many affected by this awful disease where is the heart?  The caring? The empathy?  They will not get my business and I will share this story with everyone.

dIFBO3h8VklhuAa9Xc7N5Q.text: I really enjoyed this place. The decor is great. The ambience is nice. The people are nice. It's not fine dining but you get the feel of a business casual place.  Their menu looked pretty good. A lot of the food they have has some kind of kick to it. It all looked flavorful.  I got their Jamaican burger. It had a Jamaican kick. It was a bit messy to eat but it was worth it. It was really good. It had a lot of juice and the flavors just kept flowing. I would definitely recommend eating it with a fork and a knife haha.  I would come back here again and try other things in their menu. It looked good.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Xf4trUwj2yxj2JvROvf2Q.text: Had breakfast/brunch with my girlfriend today and we keep catching ourselves talking about how good it was hours later. First thing I want to mention is how great the service was. The front desk girl was very nice. The manager went above and beyond and was super friendly. Our server was excellent at his job and obviously a valued employee. The whole experience made for a great break from looking at houses. The FOOD though....delicious. I had the pork in red sauce omelette (forget the actual name of it) and a Bloody Mary, while my girlfriend had the goat cheese and tomato omelette and a drink recommended by the manager. It will hard for either of us to try something different next time we come back because they tasted AMAZING. I logged into yelp for the first time in years and had to reset my password just to leave this review. Overall a great experience.

CeNImLg2XuS85GBqTLvfoQ.text: It's very trendy restaurant. There are so long waiting listings always. The food choices are very unique. I'll definitely try to eat the other things.

SjhMCGpQHPE7nHFJWjpTZw.text: Great local brunch spot - lively atmosphere, great music and food. The only reason I give four stars is because the service is sometimes lacking. Three times we have gone and have experienced missing items or special requests to the order not adhered to. Overall, I would recommend DW Bistro for Sunday brunch.

MUUDJKoXVF-hzInsY61nJA.text: Love the location in Gramercy Park.  Bartender, decor, view all fantastic!  The Rose was nice & Bloody Mary, yummy and spicy w/ a crunchy bacon garnish.  Smelled delish also!    I wish they'd add the rice bowl special to the menu.  I've only had it once at the old place and it hasn't been back when I'm in.  I love the Jerk Chicken sandwich, which is in a wrap.  And I have had that many times, along w/ most of the menu items, including the salmon, yum!  I haven't been back in awhile because a few times my salad had wilted greens, but the tuna was good.  The taquitos had a fantastic presentation, but were ok.  Today's special was Jerk Chicken on Brioche.  I do love the Jerk Chicken, but not enough to get it every time.  One day I'll come in for the brunch and try something different.  Wish that with they move they'd add the rice bowl or a new spicy dish.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful decor.
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

1KTqrwIKqmqnCCI2qWPwbg.text: The food and the service are amazing. Bryce the owner is in house a lot and is great.  We do happy hour at DW all the time, but I am looking forward to trying their brunch, I hear it is amazing.

BOMgPOtSeEolXgvZrQfa7w.text: Ok so I LOVE DW bistro for brunch. Would definitely return. Wonderful mix of sweet and savory.  Mimosas available.   Lunch menu has casual fare- Curry bowls - salads - wraps - small plates  Curry was too spicy for my taste buds.  Ahi tuna also too spicy on salad.   If you love hot and spicy food this is the place for you. If you can't handle the heat perhaps shy away from this place.  I'm not saying the food is bad-just too much heat for my personal preference.

p31K2QjpYCkx1i7bsMz70Q.text: We tried out this restaurant for Sunday brunch. We sat outside because the weather was nice. Our group of three ordered the Jerk Fried Chicken and Waffles, the New Mexican Pork Bowl, and the Jerk Pork Hash.  All orders were delish. The jerk dishes were not traditional Caribbean, but it being a Jamaican-Mexican fusion restaurant I wasn't expecting traditional authentic.  Critiques: The jerk pork is like a slow cooked pork but surprisingly dry.  The chicken for the waffles are cuts of chicken breast. The breading is actually thicker than the chicken itself.   The meals were plentiful. None of us finished our plates and had to get take away containers. The waiter and the kitchen accommodate a gluten free request and a another food preference.    I would like to come back for lunch or dinner!

K5ruh432GYbHHb9NR0TUtw.text: Usually I'm not a fan of going out for breakfast/brunch and I know this sounds a bit pretentious, but I can just do better at home... with that said, DW Bistro is not to be missed. I've been here numerous times now and need to put my 2 cents in. Server Mark is attentive, friendly and efficient. Bartender Thomas, "oh u got jokes!?" Love this guy! And of course Bryce, nothing happens without him. My favorite aspect about him, "I don't do it half ass". Everything out of his kitchen has been fire. If I want to enjoy my Sunday and start if off right, I come here.

82LOL7OeHX23wmRuyZ9pYg.text: DW Bistro is a cute spot for brunch or lunch at The Gramercy.   They relocated about a year ago, which has a nicer ambiance. I had brunch on a Sunday once and it was an overall great experience. They have a lot of plates you can share and get your money's worth. Especially for bottomless mimosas!  As I went again recently, I went to for a client work lunch and it was around 1:30. It wasn't as busy, but our server didn't pay attention as much the whole time and was too occupied with another table and giving them the best service possible. We had to check on a few items multiple times since he barely came around and I had to ask for water again since he didn't come to refill the table after the first pour towards the end of my meal.   We ordered appetizers, multiple drinks, and each had our own entree. I personally had the jerk ahi salad without the jerk. It was great, but i wish i had the dressing on the side. Overall, great place and great food. I would just suggest that every table should have the best server experience especially for people who have never been. Towards the end our client just went to our server and handed her card without waiting for him to bring the bill over.

Vm7YD4uX0AxckJSsbyxE6w.text: Went here for lunch for the first time and wasn't super impressed with the food, but the ambiance was great.  The restaurant was clean and fresh with a modern twist.  Had the Chicken Curry Bowl and though the food came out piping hot and the service was excellent, the Curry sauce lacked flavor.  Being a huge Thai and Chinese food connoisseur, I expect that when you eat Curry, it's like a circus hitting your taste buds!  I will definitely go back to try other items on the menu because there were definitely other items that looked phenomenal.  Don't let the review discourage you, check it out for yourself.  Can't judge the place too much on a one lunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Curry Bowl.  Hot and fresh and super hearty but lacked in the curry department!

VJJrGI7I3bHs38_vLKa2rw.text: Nice restaurant, and the bowls are huge. The Jamaican chicken curry bowl was bug enough to give me two more meals, and was very flavorful and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican chicken curry

_tMqKhFRD7cQrD6lovtkLw.text: New location and super cute! Very trendy & hipster.   The menu is a little different from what I remember but that was ok by me because it allowed me to try it all   I have a few new favorites...plaintains! Delicious, soft and sweet! Chorizo and shrimp, get extra crustini because the sauce is so flavorful you won't want to waste it. Sweet potato fries is loaded with extra goodness! My son pretty much ate the whole plate and wanted another order.   For dinner I enjoyed the shrimp linguini. Large pieces of shrimp with a full flavored mix of spices. I also shared the braised short ribs and wow they just fell off the bone. Super soft and served with mashed potato.   Vidal (sp?) was a great server. He was prompt, attentive and touched our table just enough times for us to never feel like he was missing.   Another trip to DW a success!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded sweet potato fries

kk8CIXJdSJwt8KebqHQI4g.text: Slight change in venue but the food is still amazing. The pull pork is my favorite. The cocktail menu is awesome. If it isn't 45 mins away, I would eat here everyday.

d15htT4Q2tPnMx-ivx9vBQ.text: Food very good but very small portions. Service excellent but prices don't match the casual restaurant design.

ElI9FbqJ5sTzOgdc6nk-gA.text: OMGOOOODNESS I FOUND AN AMAZING JAMACIAN FUSION HEAVEN HERE ! Amazing music, good atmosphere and the best part the FOOD! I ordered the Jamaican chicken curry with an egg on top and it was freakin delicious. Great flavor, just enuf spice to excite and warm you from the inside out but not so strong were your mouth is on fire and can't eat. We also ordered the chicken Flatous and they were so good we ordered another. They do have a kids menu. My husband ordered the New Mexico chili cheese burger and he devoured it.   This place is now on our top eats in vegas

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J3RTNkwzqwobpEZvHwFB2Q.text: I went back with a friend and ordered the same thing the jerk chicken with waffles. The server brought it out and it was dry so I advised the waiter and they promptly took it back. Probably about 10 minutes or so they returned with our our order and this time they were juicy and the seasoning was superb. I didn't mind the wait since we did have bottomless mimosas. the mimosas were tasty yet strong and bottomless lol. A DJ played 80s music it was an 80s themed Sunday brunch day and so all the servers were dressed in neon colors and leotards and just an overall fun experience. I love the decor & the ambience is welcoming yet unique

UvlF_TR3QffDMMbcmF3Dlw.text: I can't say enough great things about DW Bistro!  This place has such great energy... and the food is amazing!  My fave is the cob salad (as crazy as that sounds).  I bring my mom there for mothers day brunch every year... and my pups bring me there too for Mothers Day Brunch, love their pet friendly patio.  GREAT restaurant, great staff, amazing food and great bar.  Love. Love. Love!

WJSEt-1owZ_BIudJ5Ufz1w.text: DW is my neighborhood go to & a place I'm typically recommending for brunch. Its all around good energy that offers an endless amount of menu options. Service is always perfect, making sure everyone has a full glass of the endless mimosas they offer.   This was the first time that I ever experienced a dish I wasn't so impressed with. I always contemplate is a BLT suppose to be warm or cold? Ill go with warm especially when I add a fried egg on it. This time, that was not the case. The bread itself they used, brioche was soggy, my fried egg was fully cooked through and definitely did not classify as the over medium egg I ordered. This sandwich does come with shredded lettuce which I don't really care for. I find that majority of it ends up on the plate.   Maybe it was a one off situation. I won't knock them off my list just yet.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Michelada
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT w/ an added egg

35iI_1ia9G_YWdQSVVzI5w.text: Great place to have lunch catching up with friends. My friend and I sat outside on their patio to enjoy the beautiful weather. We had one mimosa each and shared the turkey sliders (4 per order) that came with sweet potato fries and the couscous salad. Both were very tasty and we definitely want to come back and try more items.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What True love looks like when food has arrived
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cous Cous Salad
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey sliders

jjPF3JBpXlMSjsLvLHnX9Q.text: I've been here for brunch multiple times and it's delicious!!! I've only been here once outside of brunch and I was not a fan of the food. I only recommend brunch and bottomless mimosas.

gWZ91kAcHFrTiIgINfc8Uw.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in here one night for dinner and after seeing all the awesome reviews we were excited to check it out but unfortunately was just A-OK and nothing to rave about for us. I ordered the salmon and it wasn't cooked all the way, the middle was close to raw and my boyfriend the chicken and waffles which was dry. We also didn't experience very welcoming/friendly staff so overall a bland experience for us.

_JKyNx3sYa53dKCOnCt4Pw.text: What happened to this place?  I've been visiting DW for years ...even had a 40th birthday celebration there - but they've slowly continued removing items from the menu that have been standards since day one; the last of them apparently was finally removed.  The carrot cake used to be something i'd brag to friends about as "absolutely must try, it's the best I've ever had ANYWHERE" ...it was a really unique take on carrot cake complete with amazing shaved white chocolate curls stuck into the icing. after years of enjoying it, they've now skimped the recipe down to an odd round thing, and removed the standout part..the shaved white chocolate curls (but left the price at $10 as punishment i can only imagine? less good stuff, same premium pricing).  Pasta dishes? these were ah-mazing....especially the chicken bowtie pasta....guess it'd been too popular over the years because it recently was deleted along with the other pasta options.  i understand that things change in business, but that's what the daily specials are for....leave the dishes on the menu that made you famous and built up a loyal following - imagine if McDonald's decided they wanted to freshen up the menu by deleting the Big Mac, absurd right? that's exactly the point.

9xQqNjJBlIkzrUQYQqfgQw.text: Sadly, it's been awhile since I've dined at DW Bistro, and since they've opened their doors at The Grammercy I felt it necessary to come here for lunch to rejoice! Dalton is always a pleasure to speak with. His staff greets you as though you were family walking in. The new restaurant is spacious, the decor and ambience is fresh and contemporary.   For lunch I ordered their colorful DW Cobb Salad which delivers a healthy and hearty punch to carry you through the rest of your day (grilled jerk chicken, jalapeno bacon, avocado, mango, perfectly boiled eggs and tangy Jamaican spiced dressing atop crisp romaine lettuce)! The first bite took my back to the nostalgia of what delicious foods they have been serving up all these years. I'm  destined to return for more.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW Cobb Salad
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wEvRdutwMq47R1VXLr9lZA.text: Went there for lunch today, and it was my first time after hearing from many people how great it is. I was with a group if 8 people and we had called ahead. The place was busy, just like every good spot in West Las Vegas during lunch hour. It took 10 minutes before our server came to take our order. It took an additional 45 minutes to get our food. Our server took our initial drink order when we sat down and then we didn't see her again until our food came. I saw her attending to all of her other tables during this time. In the meantime, I walked over to the bar in order to get another drink.  Due to the lack of service, we were all ready to give a less than stellar tip. When our bill arrived, there was an automatic gratuity of 20% applied. We were livid. No wonder she ignored us. She was already guaranteed to get her tip.  I will never go back there or recommend this place to anyone.

S6NoIRGNFHS9AWeL0r8HhQ.text: Our bill for my husband and I came out to $70.00 for two and we didn't even order alochol. I guess we could had for the price. It was our 30th birthday and they couldn't sing happy birthday to him! We had a big party of 7 adults with 5 children. Everything on the menu was basically sold out. How can you be out of devil eggs but put 2 eggs on jerk chicken with bread so hard that it could had broken our tooth. This was all of us first visit here and what a disappioment it was!

nSb-btBiGGlRhpPvTKKpZw.text: DW is a great place. Been going there for years. Great fusion grub in a wonderful atmosphere. Bryce is great

1z_U3uFBVBoYbb4GLXxI8g.text: I used to go to the old location quite a bit. The new location is bigger and they def needed the room....it's that popular. The food is great, the ambiance is great, and the staff is wonderful. One of the owners remembered me even though it's been at least a year since I've been there.   My sister and brother-in-law were in town so we went for brunch there. I got the curry bowl. Yum. My BIL got the chicken and waffles...pretty sure he fell in love w that chicken. My sister got the chilequiles and loved them. My friend got the breakfast sandwich and she said it was great. We ordered the pastry basket for the table...not vegan  but I did sneak a bite of a scone and it was delish. The jam served w it was so yummy and fresh. Finally...[drum roll]...bottomless mimosas.  Everything was great.   Overall this place is great and considering I live a hop skip n a jump away I have no excuse for not eating there way more often. Yum

q1P1YYgXeQS4upFQUgjmVQ.text: This place is overrated with all the foods are on sweet side.  Place is nice decorating with little modern fell. But our server was very cocky and Rude.  6 people automatically add 20% tips.  Price was highly according to what they served  you.  Never come back again!!! Don't waste your$$$.

5yn4epWfSzEh4kkv3njbLg.text: I love the food here. The portions are enormous but the quality and consistency are totally on point. I visited this place twice so far and tried a couple of dishes. The vegetable curry bowl is perfect and so is the green chili burger. It can be a little loud inside so I tend to ask to sit outside on the patio instead.   I heard brunch is great here so I plan to come back for that another time.

u8MlRqg4E-sNFP7FYOmr4Q.text: I came here for an office lunch. I was a little sad that they didn't have a lot of options.. But the food I ate was absolutely amazing. I ordered the salmon and a side of sweet potato fries. The salmon was the best cooked salmon I have ever had in my life.. And I am not exaggerating. One of my co-workers ordered the turkey burger and that was amazing as well. So juicy and melted in your mouth. The couscous salad is really good too.  I definitely recommend this place. The ambiance is great and the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon plate.

CFQooi9snP-ExwKvWmPOag.text: This place is amazing!  Mom daughter date so we just tried a little of everything...definitely will be going back!  Quick little tip though...Get there 15 minutes before opens at 11 weekdays and your lunch will be pretty quiet...Fills up fast and noisy inside.  We sat outside and it was great!   BTW...The staff is so attentive and nice!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranate tea!  Yum and bottomless refills!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DW&#39;s Signature salad with mango dressing on the side!
Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my...Heaven on plate!

66MRT0Y7qy7h0zBRLx45Tg.text: This place was a bit confusing to find. Ironically my friend and I ran into 4 other people who were searching for DW Bistro well in the Gramercy LOL.  My friend and I  had what the waiter recommended, a bacon burger with tomatoes, special sauce and my personal favorite a sunny-side up egg (other assortments came on the burger but I can't remember). It was one of the best burgers I've had in a while! It came with sweet potatoes fries which I'm not a huge fan of, but they were good. I would recommend this place to anyone.

0w7uuEtgyh_DT18yM5f3aA.text: Easily five stars. We were a party of 9 (including two preschoolers and a baby) on an early Sat. night. Service was great: friendly front of house and efficient waitstaff. Decor and vibes are exceptional, thoughtfully executed and beautiful down to the last detail.  As great as the extras are: the food is the True star. It's just amazing, guys. Every single person at our table was stunned by their meals. Two of us tried the Jamaican jerk turkey burger (amazing, nuanced flavor; perfect blend of spices), another two tried fried chicken (decadent corn bread, fresh greens and flavorful, juicy chicken with that amazing jerk spice blend); we also had fish and chips (curry tartar sauce, marry me) and a couple kids dishes (easily the best fried chicken tenders we've had, and a bowl of chicken pasta with Parmesan my nephew loved). They brought out a gorgeous, moist slice of insanely good carrot cake for my sister's birthday, too. Just, everything was perfect and brilliant. Flavors are so, so spot on here. Their kitchen team are geniuses. We will be back.

9WuQDlIGQhw2H1cR4t03Xw.text: UPDATED REVIEW  I brought my parents here after having a great experience at brunch... Unfortunately, we did not have the same great experience. As soon as we sat down, the couple next to us warned us about the service and told us their food was not good. We wrote them off because we'd had nothing but good experiences here... Should have listened!   I ordered the same thing as what prompted my initial rave review (red chile bowl) and it was TERRIBLE... Over-peppered to the point where I couldn't even eat it. Everyone else's meals were marginal at best for the prices. It's one thing to pay a pretty penny if the food is good... But if you don't even want to package the leftovers to take home, I'm saying "NOPE."   I will note that I'm writing this review quite late... The time we had the poor experience was before they moved to their new location, so I'm not sure if the quality has improved. (I'm not in a rush to return to find out, though!)

IpkLxLPtJXgsuzmTimsSbw.text: This was one of our favorite restaurants over the past few years, however it appears success has gone their heads.    Went for dinner on Saturday night around 7:45 pm. We were worried the wait would be long as this place has always been very busy around this time . When we arrived only four tables were being used and no one the bar. Odd.   We both ordered the fried chicken which is a favorite of ours. Food took quite a bit longer than expected to arrive but we didn't mind much about that. Besides noticing this plate no longer come with mashed potatoes the chicken was over cooked  and when cut into very large pieces of breaking would fall off.  Not at all worth $22. If you're going to charge premium prices make sure to continue to offer a premium product.   *Service has diminished  *portion size diminished *food not prepared accurately  =bye bye DW Bistro

pdbv051vIuAG4CqZyPiEXA.text: Came here with a couple of my friends for our best friends birthday and I was highly disappointed with the wait time. The star was taken away due to the fact that the wait was way longer then they estimated. They had told us 30 minutes when we arrived and the wait ended up being over an hour. There is not enough space for all the campers with bottomless mimosas.   This was our first time here and the food was absolutely delicious! The chiliquiles were really amazing without having a guilty portion size. My friends pulled pork omelet was flavorful and presentable as well.   Our mimosas were 22 a person for bottomless and let me tell you I could barely taste any orange juice! Without a doubt we got our money worth of alcohol. The wait staff was quick with refills and our glasses were never empty!   Lastly I have to bring this up again they need more space for the business!!! I can't imagine going back and waiting that long again especially when great food is easy to come by in las vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of DW Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiliquiles. ... YUMMMMM

VxxsKAw9PEyfec8Q0mpvlQ.text: My impression of this place is 2 strikes, I'm out.   My first visit to DW was when they were located on Ft Apache. I was disappointed with the menu. I didn't find it very appealing. I ended up getting the roasted vegetable omelet. It was what I would expect from a Waffle House.  The service was slow and lackluster. People waiting for tables were lurching over us while we were eating. It was an uncomfortable experience.   My second visit to DW was at the location on Russell in Gramercy.
